original: dge bsnyen khrims thos kyang phyir mi nur zhing mi 'gyur ba dang mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dge 'dun gyi rag lus shing zhal ta byed pa'i dge bsnyen dad pa chen po zhig na gso sbyong gi cho ga dang khrims la sogs pa bstan kyang nyes med🔽do // 'dug na gso sbyong bya /
analyzed: dge bsnyen khrims thos kyang phyir mi nur zhing mi 'gyur ba dang mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dge 'dun gyi rag lus shing zhal ta byed pa'i dge bsnyen dad pa chen po zhig na gso sbyong gi cho ga dang khrims la sogs pa bstan kyang nyes med do // 'dug na gso sbyong bya /
translated: If a layperson hears the precepts but does not shrink from them, is not changed by them, and is not displeased, then it is not a downfall to teach the ceremony of the purificatory fast and the precepts to a layperson who is very faithful, is dependent on the Saṅgha, and is a caretaker.

original: khyim pa zhig gso sbyong gi cho ga la lta 'dod de mi bltar mi rung zhes zer te 'dug na drung na 'dug bzhin du gso sbyong byas kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: khyim pa zhig gso sbyong gi cho ga la lta 'dod de mi bltar mi rung zhes zer te 'dug na drung na 'dug bzhin du gso sbyong byas kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one is in the presence of a layperson who wishes to observe the purificatory fast but is not allowed to look at the ceremony, it is not a downfall to perform the purificatory fast while sitting in the presence of that layperson.

original: ring ba zhig na khyim pa 'dug kyang bshad de /
analyzed: ring ba zhig na khyim pa 'dug kyang bshad de /
translated: If the layperson is at a distance, it is not a downfall to explain the ceremony.

original: bdag na tshabs che ste shi la thug pa dang mi rgod la sogs pas gsad par bshams te 'chi bar 'gyur zhing dge slong grogs la mthol du mi slebs na khyim pa la bdag gi nyes pa ci yod pa tshangs su bya /
analyzed: bdag na tshabs che ste shi la thug pa dang mi rgod la sogs pas gsad par bshams te 'chi bar 'gyur zhing dge slong grogs la mthol du mi slebs na khyim pa la bdag gi nyes pa ci yod pa tshangs su bya /
translated: If one is very ill, or if one is about to die, or if one is about to be killed by brigands, and so forth, and one is unable to reach a fellow monk to whom one could confess one’s faults, it is not a downfall to confess one’s faults to a layperson.

original: de la cho ga bsnyad /
analyzed: de la cho ga bsnyad /
translated: One should explain the ceremony to that person.

original: mi rgod la sogs pa mi srun pa zhig gis khrims la ma bstan na gsad do rdeg go zhes zer na khrims bstan kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mi rgod la sogs pa mi srun pa zhig gis khrims la ma bstan na gsad do rdeg go zhes zer na khrims bstan kyang nyes med /
translated: If a savage, such as a robber, is not taught the law, he will say, “I will kill or beat you.” But if he is taught the law, he is not guilty.

original: rgyal po la yang bsnyad /
analyzed: rgyal po la yang bsnyad /
translated: If the king is informed,

original: rgyal po khrims 'dri na bstan kyang nyes med /
analyzed: rgyal po khrims 'dri na bstan kyang nyes med /

original: mtha' la phan chad mi skye ba ma yin so sor thar pa'i gzhi bklags zin te rkyen cig byung ste rked chad du bzhag ste man chad mjug tu phyin par ma bklag kyang gso sbyong du chud do //

translated: If one has not recited the Prātimokṣa in its entirety, it is not that one will not be born in the future. If one has recited the Prātimokṣa but has broken it due to some condition and has not completed the remainder, one is included in the poṣadha.

original: bshad pa dang de tsam pa dang dus dang chad pa bdag de bzhin du ma blangs na 'dir chos ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa dang de tsam pa dang dus dang chad pa bdag de bzhin du ma blangs na 'dir chos ma yin no //
translated: If one has not taken the explanation, the extent, the time, and the penalty in the same way, it is not the Dharma here.

original: rna lam nas 'das na song ba'o //
analyzed: rna lam nas 'das na song ba'o //

analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa'i zhag gcig gi snga nas mal stan bsdu ba @228a * //

original: ni chol zangs yan chad bsdus te gzhag go //
analyzed: ni chol zangs yan chad bsdus te gzhag go //

original: de len pas bsgo //
analyzed: de len pas bsgo //
translated: The monk who is taking it should be mindful.🔽The bedding of a monk who has entered the rainy season retreat should be spread out in the sun on the day before. It is necessary to change it with new bedding. The new bedding should be given to the Sangha.

original: tshul du zhugs pa'i snga de nyi ma la bstan pa nyid 'byung ste gsar gyis brje dgos te gsar dge 'dun gyis gti mug dang rang dbang dang zhe sdang 'jigs pa dang mtho ba sems can dang 'di rnams lta bu dang mi ldan zhing med pa las bsko

translated: The Sangha should not be given bedding that is not complete, that is not free from stains, that is not free from holes, that is not free from being torn, that is not free from being dirty, that is not free from being smelly, that is not free from being stained, that is not free from being torn, that is not free from being old, that is not free from being worn out, that is not free from being torn, that is not free from being torn by mice, that is not free from being torn by insects, that is not free from being torn by moths, that is not free from being torn by fire, that is not free from being torn by water, that is not free from being torn by wind, that is not free from being torn by thieves, that is not free from being torn by enemies, that is not free from being torn by fools, that is not free from being torn by oneself, that is not free from being torn by others, that is not free from being torn by desire, that is not free from being torn by anger, that is not free from being torn by fear, that is not free from being torn by pride, that is not free from being torn by sentient beings, that is not free from being torn by non-sentient beings, that is not free from being torn by all of these.

original: // mi nus na du mas so //
analyzed: // mi nus na du mas so //
translated: If it is not possible, then by many.

original: mal stan rdzi bsko ba gcig gis mi chog cing lag gis mi khyab na gnyis gsum yan chad dus cho ga bar bsko //
analyzed: mal stan rdzi bsko ba gcig gis mi chog cing lag gis mi khyab na gnyis gsum yan chad dus cho ga bar bsko //
translated: It is not sufficient to appoint one person to distribute the bedding. If it is not possible to cover it with one's hand, then two, three or more should be appointed in a timely manner according to the ritual.

original: dus byug pa bsung gis te slob mar gyur pa la gos dkar pos g-yogs la bzhag pa tshul shing ste rgan rims su bzhag la 'di dang 'di'i gnas 'og khrims te gang khyod kyi nang nas ngang ba 'og khrims 'dis gnas 'di rang dbyar tshul du zhugs na
analyzed: dus byug pa bsung gis te slob mar gyur pa la gos dkar pos g-yogs la bzhag pa tshul shing ste rgan rims su bzhag la 'di dang 'di'i gnas 'og khrims te gang khyod kyi nang nas ngang ba 'og khrims 'dis gnas 'di rang dbyar tshul du zhugs na
translated: At the time of the summer retreat, the teacher should be anointed with fragrant ointment, the student should be covered with a white cloth, and the voting stick should be placed in order of seniority. This is the lower rule. Whoever among you abides by this rule should enter the summer retreat.

original: des tshul shing long shig / tshul du 'jug pa'i nyin par tshul shing sbos dang gur kum la sogs pa bsung gis bskus la slo mar bcug la ras dkar pos g-yogs //
analyzed: des tshul shing long shig / tshul du 'jug pa'i nyin par tshul shing sbos dang gur kum la sogs pa bsung gis bskus la slo mar bcug la ras dkar pos g-yogs //
translated: On the day of entering the summer retreat, the voting stick should be wrapped and anointed with fragrant ointment such as saffron, placed in a basket, and covered with white cloth.

original: de'i tshe 'og khrims bsgo ste 'og khrims ni 'dug pa'i 'thab mo mi gleng ba dang ltung ba sde lnga la nongs pa'i dmigs shig yod na'ang mi brgal bar bya ba dang brgal ba zhig yod na'ang tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe rgol cig ces bya ba dang tshul
analyzed: de'i tshe 'og khrims bsgo ste 'og khrims ni 'dug pa'i 'thab mo mi gleng ba dang ltung ba sde lnga la nongs pa'i dmigs shig yod na'ang mi brgal bar bya ba dang brgal ba zhig yod na'ang tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe rgol cig ces bya ba dang tshul
translated: At that time, the lower rule should be explained. The lower rule is not to discuss disputes while sitting, and even if there is an offense in the five classes of downfalls, one should not argue. If there is an argument, one should argue at the time of entering the summer retreat.

original: 'dir 'jug 'dod na tshul shing long shig ci mi 'dod na ma len cig ces bya ba dang nyes pa spyod pa zhig yod na'ang chad pas mi bcad par dam bca' ba la sogs pa'i 'og khrims bsgo //

translated: If there is someone who has committed an offense, make a pledge not to punish them.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul shing 'drim pa'i dge slong ma yin pa gzhan gcig gis dge 'dun tshul du 'jug ste tshul du 'jug par 'tshal lo zhes gsol zhes gsol ba'i sngags bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul shing 'drim pa'i dge slong ma yin pa gzhan gcig gis dge 'dun tshul du 'jug ste tshul du 'jug par 'tshal lo zhes gsol zhes gsol ba'i sngags bya'o //
translated: After that, another nun who is not the distributor of voting tickets should enter the Saṅgha and say, I request the Saṅgha to enter the voting.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul shing 'dri ma pa'i dge slong gis tshul shing 'drim mo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul shing 'dri ma pa'i dge slong gis tshul shing 'drim mo //
translated: After that, the nun who distributes the voting tickets should distribute the voting tickets.

original: tshul shing 'drim pa ni rgan rims nas brim mo //
analyzed: tshul shing 'drim pa ni rgan rims nas brim mo //
translated: The distribution of the voting tickets should be done in order of seniority.

original: tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe las go rims 'di bzhin du bya ste kha cig ni mdo dmigs kyis 'og nas 'chang pa rnams yin /
analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe las go rims 'di bzhin du bya ste kha cig ni mdo dmigs kyis 'og nas 'chang pa rnams yin /
translated: When entering the voting, the duties should be done in this order: Some are to be carried out below according to the observed sūtras.

original: khyed kyi nang na 'gas dbyar gyi nang du dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'thab mo ma skyed gcig / tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe 'og khri mas su bca' ba'i tshig 'di yang bsgo dgos te tshul na 'khod pa zla ba gsum gyi @228b tshe dge 'dun gyi nang
analyzed: khyed kyi nang na 'gas dbyar gyi nang du dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'thab mo ma skyed gcig / tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe 'og khri mas su bca' ba'i tshig 'di yang bsgo dgos te tshul na 'khod pa zla ba gsum gyi @228b tshe dge 'dun gyi nang
translated: And you must say to him: Do not cause a dispute in the midst of the community during the summer.

original: du 'thab mo dang 'khrug lang ma byed cig ces khrims su bca'/
analyzed: du 'thab mo dang 'khrug lang ma byed cig ces khrims su bca'/
translated: When he enters the retreat, he must be told: For the three months of the retreat, do not cause a dispute in the midst of the community.🔽If you know anything, then speak!

original: gang khyed cung zad shes na des na smros shig / mdo ltag ma ltar tshul gyi tshe 'thab mo rgol zhing ma glengs par tshul khrims kyi phyi nas gleng ba zhig yod dam nyes pa brgal ba zhig yod na da gyis shig ces kyang bsgo //
analyzed: gang khyed cung zad shes na des na smros shig / mdo ltag ma ltar tshul gyi tshe 'thab mo rgol zhing ma glengs par tshul khrims kyi phyi nas gleng ba zhig yod dam nyes pa brgal ba zhig yod na da gyis shig ces kyang bsgo //
translated: Is there anyone who, during the retreat, will not quarrel and will not argue, but who will later, after the retreat, bring up a matter or raise a question?

original: gang gis dbyar gyi dbus su dge 'dun la 'thab mo skyed par gyur na de la dge 'dun gyis phyis brtags par dgongs shig ces dge 'dun la bsgo //
analyzed: gang gis dbyar gyi dbus su dge 'dun la 'thab mo skyed par gyur na de la dge 'dun gyis phyis brtags par dgongs shig ces dge 'dun la bsgo //
translated: If someone causes a dispute in the midst of the community during the summer, the community should later investigate it.

original: tshul du zhugs zin nas dge slong la la zhig gis nyes pa zhig byas sam 'thab mo bskyed na'ang chad pas 'phral du mi bcad par tshul nas byung nas spangs shing chad pas bcad cing sbyar bar brtags te gzhag go zhes kyang dge slong kun la bsgo zhing
analyzed: tshul du zhugs zin nas dge slong la la zhig gis nyes pa zhig byas sam 'thab mo bskyed na'ang chad pas 'phral du mi bcad par tshul nas byung nas spangs shing chad pas bcad cing sbyar bar brtags te gzhag go zhes kyang dge slong kun la bsgo zhing
translated: If, after the observance has begun, a monk commits an offense or starts a fight, he is not immediately punished. He is expelled from the observance and his punishment is determined later. This is announced to all the monks.

original: 'og khrims su bca'/
analyzed: 'og khrims su bca'/
translated: This is also written down in the records.

original: len pa dang 'jug pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyis zhu /
analyzed: len pa dang 'jug pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyis zhu /
translated: The monks request the observance to be held.

original: tshul shing ma brim pa'i mdun du tshul zhing 'drim par bskos pa'i dge slong ma yin pa dge slong las pa gcig gis dge 'dun tshul du 'jug cing tshul shing brim mo zhes gsol ba'i sngags bya /
analyzed: tshul shing ma brim pa'i mdun du tshul zhing 'drim par bskos pa'i dge slong ma yin pa dge slong las pa gcig gis dge 'dun tshul du 'jug cing tshul shing brim mo zhes gsol ba'i sngags bya /
translated: In front of the monks who have not yet received the observance sticks, a monk who is not in charge of distributing the observance sticks but who is in charge of the monks’ work requests the saṅgha to enter the observance and distribute the observance sticks.

original: tshul shing brim /
analyzed: tshul shing brim /
translated: The observance sticks are distributed.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar sngags byas zin nas brims nas snga de nyid tshul shing 'drim par bskos pa'i dge slong gis tshul shing brim mo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar sngags byas zin nas brims nas snga de nyid tshul shing 'drim par bskos pa'i dge slong gis tshul shing brim mo //
translated: After the mantra is recited according to the text, the observance sticks are distributed. The monk who is in charge of distributing the observance sticks distributes the observance sticks.

original: thog mar ston pa'i blang /
analyzed: thog mar ston pa'i blang /
translated: First, the teacher receives.

original: tshul shing brim pa ni thog mar sangs rgyas kyi tshul shing gcig gzhag / dgra bcom pa'i tshul shing skal pa gcig gzhag / gzhan gyis stan phyed bor te'o //
analyzed: tshul shing brim pa ni thog mar sangs rgyas kyi tshul shing gcig gzhag / dgra bcom pa'i tshul shing skal pa gcig gzhag / gzhan gyis stan phyed bor te'o //
translated: The others cast their votes by throwing down half of their upper robes.

original: tshul shing 'drim pa la len pa'i tshe na stan las 'phags te gus par blang ngo //🔽slob dpon mkhan pos dge sbyong gi'o //
analyzed: tshul shing 'drim pa la len pa'i tshe na stan las 'phags te gus par blang ngo // slob dpon mkhan pos dge sbyong gi'o //
translated: When the voting tickets are distributed, they should be received respectfully, standing up from one’s seat.🔽The master and the preceptor take the tickets of the ascetics.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul shing ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis blang ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul shing ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis blang ngo //
translated: The tickets of the ascetics are taken by the preceptor and the master.

original: 'khod pa yang 'di bzhin te mtha' nas so //
analyzed: 'khod pa yang 'di bzhin te mtha' nas so //
translated: The seating is also like this, from the end.

original: dge 'dun thams cad la tshul shing brims zin pa'i 'jug tu gtsug lag khang gi srung ma'i lha la tshul shing gcig bsngos te gzhag go //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad la tshul shing brims zin pa'i 'jug tu gtsug lag khang gi srung ma'i lha la tshul shing gcig bsngos te gzhag go //
translated: After all the members of the Sangha have cast their votes, a ticket is dedicated to the deity who protects the monastery and is placed at the end.🔽The tickets are placed slowly.

original: dal gyis gzhag / tshul shing blangs nas slar gzhag pa'i tshe ma khrol bar dal gyis gzhag / bgrangs te gnas 'di na dge slong 'di snyed kyi tshul shing blangs so zhes sbran /
analyzed: dal gyis gzhag / tshul shing blangs nas slar gzhag pa'i tshe ma khrol bar dal gyis gzhag / bgrangs te gnas 'di na dge slong 'di snyed kyi tshul shing blangs so zhes sbran /
translated: When the voting tickets have been distributed and are being placed back, they are placed slowly without any noise. They are counted and announced: “In this place, so many monks have taken the voting tickets.”

original: tshul shing brims te bsdus nas tshul shing bgrangs la mi 'di snyed kyis tshul shing blangs te tshul du @229a * //
analyzed: tshul shing brims te bsdus nas tshul shing bgrangs la mi 'di snyed kyis tshul shing blangs te tshul du @229a * //
translated: Distribute the voting sticks, collect them, count the votes, and announce the results.🔽

original: zhugs so zhes dge 'dun la bsnyad cing smra //
analyzed: zhugs so zhes dge 'dun la bsnyad cing smra //
translated: The voting tickets are distributed, collected, counted, and announced to the community: “So many voting tickets have been taken by those who have entered into the way.”🔽The community is then asked if anyone has any objection to the assignment of the dwelling places.

original: gnas kyi dngos po len du 'jug / tshul du zhugs pa'i 'og tu khang bu so so'i rkyen la sogs pa dge slong rnams so sor khang bu sbyin zhing bgo //
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos po len du 'jug / tshul du zhugs pa'i 'og tu khang bu so so'i rkyen la sogs pa dge slong rnams so sor khang bu sbyin zhing bgo //
translated: After the entry into the way, the dwelling places are assigned to the monks, each one to his cell, etc.

original: tha mar sa dang zung da blangs te mdun du 'dug la /
analyzed: tha mar sa dang zung da blangs te mdun du 'dug la /
translated: At the end, the earth and the water are taken, and the monk sits down in front of the elder.

original: dad pa thog mar bskyed de gnas brtan gyi gtsug lag khang che ge mo zhig ste rnyed pa dang bcas gos dang bcas kyis bzhes shig ces yon tan ci bzhin par ro //
analyzed: dad pa thog mar bskyed de gnas brtan gyi gtsug lag khang che ge mo zhig ste rnyed pa dang bcas gos dang bcas kyis bzhes shig ces yon tan ci bzhin par ro //
translated: Faith is produced first, and the elder is asked to accept such and such a dwelling place, with its acquisitions and its furniture, according to the qualities of the donor.

original: khang bu bgo ba ni khang bu so so'i sgo lcags dang zung nga bsdus te dag 'dun gyi mdun du bsogs pa la sgo lcags 'di ni khang bu 'di'i yin te rkyen mang nyung 'di tsam yod do zhes mig re re nas kun gyi rkyen ci yod pa🔽bshad la / dge slong rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan mi ldan rim bzhin du dbul zhing bsgo'o //
analyzed: khang bu bgo ba ni khang bu so so'i sgo lcags dang zung nga bsdus te dag 'dun gyi mdun du bsogs pa la sgo lcags 'di ni khang bu 'di'i yin te rkyen mang nyung 'di tsam yod do zhes mig re re nas kun gyi rkyen ci yod pa bshad la / dge slong rgan zhing yon tan dang ldan mi ldan rim bzhin du dbul zhing bsgo'o //
translated: The distribution of cells is as follows: the locks and keys of the individual cells are collected and placed in front of the assembly. The locks are distributed to the monks in order of seniority, with the statement, “This lock belongs to this cell. It has so many keys.”🔽The keys are distributed to the monks in order of seniority, with the statement, “This key opens this lock.”

original: lhung bzed bzhin du blangs ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed bzhin du blangs ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The distribution of bowls is as follows: the bowls are distributed to the monks in order of seniority, with the statement, “This bowl belongs to this monk.”🔽If a monk does not want the bowl that was given to him, he should say so. If he does not say so, but returns it after it has been passed to the next monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lhung bzed spang ba ltung bar 'gyur te dge 'dun la brims pa las gral thog ma pas mi 'dod ces byas nas thur du thal ba las lan gsum gyi bar du slar slong na slar byin pa bzhin khang bu mi 'dod ces byas pa las slar blangs na🔽lan du bslangs pa bzhin du nyes byas re re ste lan gsum du bslangs pa'i tha ma la sbyin /
analyzed: lhung bzed spang ba ltung bar 'gyur te dge 'dun la brims pa las gral thog ma pas mi 'dod ces byas nas thur du thal ba las lan gsum gyi bar du slar slong na slar byin pa bzhin khang bu mi 'dod ces byas pa las slar blangs na🔽lan du bslangs pa bzhin du nyes byas re re ste lan gsum du bslangs pa'i tha ma la sbyin /
translated: If he returns it up to the third time, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: ma byin na dge 'dun 'khrug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma byin na dge 'dun 'khrug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: If it is not given, the Saṅgha will be disturbed.

original: bgo bar shes pa la mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don ma yin par song na gral rim du bgo'o //
analyzed: bgo bar shes pa la mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don ma yin par song na gral rim du bgo'o //
translated: If it is known that it is to be distributed, then if it is not for the benefit of the stūpa or the Saṅgha, it is distributed in order of seniority.

original: tshul du 'jug cing khang bu 'god par shes bzhin du rang don la gud du song na dge 'dun gyis kyang kho'i skal ba'i khang bu rim bzhin du ma bzhag par bgos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: tshul du 'jug cing khang bu 'god par shes bzhin du rang don la gud du song na dge 'dun gyis kyang kho'i skal ba'i khang bu rim bzhin du ma bzhag par bgos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If it is known that it is to be used for the rainy season retreat and to build huts, then if it is used for one’s own benefit, it is distributed by the Saṅgha in order of seniority, but there is no fault.

original: khang bu lhag na ni su mi 'dod pa'i khang bu nang pa la skal ba bzhag go //
analyzed: khang bu lhag na ni su mi 'dod pa'i khang bu nang pa la skal ba bzhag go //
translated: If there is a surplus of huts, then the share of the hut of one who does not want it is given to the one who is next in order.

original: dkon mchog gi phyir dge 'dun gyis bskos te btang ba ni khang du rim bzhin du skal ba sbyin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi phyir dge 'dun gyis bskos te btang ba ni khang du rim bzhin du skal ba sbyin no //
translated: If it is given by the Saṅgha for the sake of the Three Jewels, then the share of the hut is given in order of seniority.

original: shing drung dang sngon po dang gsing ma dang sgang la yang ji ltar rgan pa'i rims su bgo //
analyzed: shing drung dang sngon po dang gsing ma dang sgang la yang ji ltar rgan pa'i rims su bgo //
translated: If it is a tree, a green field, or a high place, it is distributed in order of seniority.

original: dge slong lam du zhugs te 'dod pa zhig na nas rgan pa'i rnams la grang na ni dro ba'i sa sbyin /
analyzed: dge slong lam du zhugs te 'dod pa zhig na nas rgan pa'i rnams la grang na ni dro ba'i sa sbyin /
translated: If a monk who has entered the path desires a place, then if it is cold, a warm place is given to the seniors.

original: tsha ba zhig na grib ma dang bsil ba'i sar gzhag go //
analyzed: tsha ba zhig na grib ma dang bsil ba'i sar gzhag go //
translated: If it is hot, place it in the shade or a cool place.

original: khang bus mi chog na gnyis la sogs pa ste mthar na gding ba tsam gyis so //
analyzed: khang bus mi chog na gnyis la sogs pa ste mthar na gding ba tsam gyis so //
translated: If it is not enough, use two or more, or finally just a mat.

original: khang bu bgos te grangs kyis mi chog ste mi mang na khang bu mig gcig la mig gnyis gsum yan chad du @229b shong shong du gzhag go //
analyzed: khang bu bgos te grangs kyis mi chog ste mi mang na khang bu mig gcig la mig gnyis gsum yan chad du @229b shong shong du gzhag go //
translated: If the huts are divided and it is not enough, if there are many people, place two or three eyes in one hut.

original: de ltar byas kyang mi mang ste mi shong na khang bu'i nang du gding ba bkram ste gding ba du shong ba bzhin du mi yang de snyed du 'khod du gzhug go //
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang mi mang ste mi shong na khang bu'i nang du gding ba bkram ste gding ba du shong ba bzhin du mi yang de snyed du 'khod du gzhug go //
translated: If it is still not enough and people cannot fit, spread out the mats inside the hut and let the people sit in as many rows as the mats can hold.

original: lhung bzed dang ril ba spyi blugs dang go 'dun dang so shing gi gnas spags te'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang ril ba spyi blugs dang go 'dun dang so shing gi gnas spags te'o //
translated: Arrange the places for the begging bowls, the water for rinsing the mouth, the tooth cleaners, and the spittoon.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar mi mang ste mi shong ba gding ba'i tshad kyi grangs kyis bgos pa la mi de rnams kyi ril ba dang lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad gzhag pa'i sar gding ba gcig gis mi grangs la ma gtogs par lhag par gzhag / sgo
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar mi mang ste mi shong ba gding ba'i tshad kyi grangs kyis bgos pa la mi de rnams kyi ril ba dang lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad gzhag pa'i sar gding ba gcig gis mi grangs la ma gtogs par lhag par gzhag / sgo
translated: The number of monks who can be accommodated in a monastery is determined by the number of monks who can be seated on the floor without crowding.

original: khang dang skas khang dang khyams dang 'khod pa'i dang khrus khang dag ni mi bgo'o //
analyzed: khang dang skas khang dang khyams dang 'khod pa'i dang khrus khang dag ni mi bgo'o //
translated: The monastery's gatehouse, staircase, courtyard, and bathing area are not to be distributed.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni dge 'dun gyi spyi'i spyod pa yin pas mi ci ltar mang yang mi bgo bar bzhag go //🔽mal stan la mtshan mo ma yin /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni dge 'dun gyi spyi'i spyod pa yin pas mi ci ltar mang yang mi bgo bar bzhag go // mal stan la mtshan mo ma yin /
translated: These are mentioned by name because they are the general property of the community and are not to be distributed, no matter how many monks there are.🔽Beds and seats are not to be distributed at night.

original: mal stan bgo ba ni nyin par 'god kyi mtshan mo mi 'god do //
analyzed: mal stan bgo ba ni nyin par 'god kyi mtshan mo mi 'god do //
translated: Beds and seats are to be distributed during the day, not at night.

original: nad pa gnas pa'i khang bu gzhan la ma yin /
analyzed: nad pa gnas pa'i khang bu gzhan la ma yin /
translated: They are not to be distributed in a separate house where the sick are kept.

original: khang bu bgo ba'i tshe nad pa 'dug na ni rim du bgo zhing skyo bar mi bya bar nad pa gzhi la gzhag ste gzhan rim par bgo'o //
analyzed: khang bu bgo ba'i tshe nad pa 'dug na ni rim du bgo zhing skyo bar mi bya bar nad pa gzhi la gzhag ste gzhan rim par bgo'o //
translated: When distributing houses, if a sick monk is present, the distribution should be postponed until he has recovered.

original: de thob par mi 'gyur na mi sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: de thob par mi 'gyur na mi sbyin par mi bya /
translated: If he cannot obtain it, he should not give it.

original: nad pa 'dug pa'i khang bu de dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa'i rkyen yin gyi nad pas mi mthol ba zhig yin kyang na ba brtsan pas mi spo bar gzhag go //
analyzed: nad pa 'dug pa'i khang bu de dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa'i rkyen yin gyi nad pas mi mthol ba zhig yin kyang na ba brtsan pas mi spo bar gzhag go //
translated: The sick man's hut should be in a place where there are monks with good qualities. Even if the sick man is not cured, he should not be moved because of his illness.

original: de dang g-yog tu las byed du mi gzhug / dge 'dun gyi las kyang dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yog su byed pa mi bsko bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de dang g-yog tu las byed du mi gzhug / dge 'dun gyi las kyang dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yog su byed pa mi bsko bar gzhag go //
translated: He should not be made to work as a servant. He should not be appointed to the duties of the community, nor should he be made to serve the sick.

original: mdze can dge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi spyad /
analyzed: mdze can dge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi spyad /
translated: A leper should not use the community's bedding.

original: dge slong mdze byung ba dge 'dun gyi mal stan dang khang bu la sogs pa la spyod du mi gzhug ste kho nyid la gnyer du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong mdze byung ba dge 'dun gyi mal stan dang khang bu la sogs pa la spyod du mi gzhug ste kho nyid la gnyer du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A monk who has developed leprosy should not be allowed to use the community's bedding, huts, etc., because he will be expelled.

original: mtha' 'khob kyi gtsug lag khang sbyin /
analyzed: mtha' 'khob kyi gtsug lag khang sbyin /
translated: A monastery should be given to the border regions.

original: dge slong mdze can gzhag pa'i gnas ni gtsug lag khang gi mtha' dben pa gar ba gcig tu dge slong gzhan dang mi 'dre bar gzhag go //
analyzed: dge slong mdze can gzhag pa'i gnas ni gtsug lag khang gi mtha' dben pa gar ba gcig tu dge slong gzhan dang mi 'dre bar gzhag go //
translated: The place where a monk with leprosy is to be kept is a secluded place at the edge of the monastery, where he does not mix with other monks.

original: gnas pa dang bcas pa dang gzhan dge 'dun gyi khyams dang bkad sa dang / sgo gang dang phyi khyams dang 'chags dang grib shing gi bar du ma yin /
analyzed: gnas pa dang bcas pa dang gzhan dge 'dun gyi khyams dang bkad sa dang / sgo gang dang phyi khyams dang 'chags dang grib shing gi bar du ma yin /
translated: It is not in the vicinity of the Sangha’s garden, pavilion, door-yard, outer courtyard, open area, or shady trees.

original: dge slong mdze can de dge slong gzhan gnas shing spyod pa'i khang bu dang / spyod pa'i khyams la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste gnas shing spyod du mi @230a * //
analyzed: dge slong mdze can de dge slong gzhan gnas shing spyod pa'i khang bu dang / spyod pa'i khyams la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste gnas shing spyod du mi @230a * //
translated: The leper monk is not allowed to stay or practice in any of the dwellings or practice courtyards, etc., mentioned by name.

original: gzhug go // bshang gci'i gnas su mi gzhug / mdze can de dge 'dun gyi bshang gci'i sar yang mi 'jug /'di la snying rjer g-yog sbyin /
analyzed: gzhug go // bshang gci'i gnas su mi gzhug / mdze can de dge 'dun gyi bshang gci'i sar yang mi 'jug /'di la snying rjer g-yog sbyin /
translated: He is not allowed to stay in the Sangha’s latrine.

original: dge slong mdze can de la snying rje ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyis yon dang zas kyi skal ba dang gos dang khyim pa las g-yog gcig kyang sbyin /
analyzed: dge slong mdze can de la snying rje ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyis yon dang zas kyi skal ba dang gos dang khyim pa las g-yog gcig kyang sbyin /
translated: Out of compassion for the leper monk, the Sangha should give him a share of the offerings, food, clothes, and even a lay servant.

original: dgon pa pa rnams kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas bsko //
analyzed: dgon pa pa rnams kyi lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas bsko //
translated: The Sangha should always appoint a monk to be in charge of the place where the alms bowls and robes of the monks who live in the wilderness are kept.

original: dge slong dgon pa la 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod de gtsug lag khang du rten bca' ba'i phyir lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa gzhag pa'i sa kun gyi spyir khang bu mig gcig bsngo ste gzhag go //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa la 'jigs pa'i rkyen yod de gtsug lag khang du rten bca' ba'i phyir lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa gzhag pa'i sa kun gyi spyir khang bu mig gcig bsngo ste gzhag go //
translated: If there is a reason for a monk to fear a wilderness, he may leave his begging bowl, robes and so forth in the temple in order to rely on it. In general, he should leave them in a single-doored room.🔽If he will only come at the time of entering the rains retreat, he should leave his things and bedding.

original: dbyar tshul du 'jug khar 'ba' zhig 'ong bar 'gyur na dngos po dang mal stan gzhag / tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe gud nas dge slong gzhan gnas der tshul du 'jug tu 'ong ba'i phyir khang bu yod na rkyen dang bcas par sta gon byas la gzhag /
analyzed: dbyar tshul du 'jug khar 'ba' zhig 'ong bar 'gyur na dngos po dang mal stan gzhag / tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe gud nas dge slong gzhan gnas der tshul du 'jug tu 'ong ba'i phyir khang bu yod na rkyen dang bcas par sta gon byas la gzhag /
translated: If there is a room in the place where he enters the rains retreat, he should prepare it with the necessary conditions and leave it for other monks who will come to enter the rains retreat there.

original: tshul gcig pu'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul gcig pu'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not only one who enters the rains retreat who may leave his things there.

original: khang bu yod na dge slong gzhan 'ong ba'i phyir rtag par gzhag go //
analyzed: khang bu yod na dge slong gzhan 'ong ba'i phyir rtag par gzhag go //
translated: If there is a room, he should always leave his things there for other monks who will come.

original: tshul du zhugs pa bas mang du lhags na slar bgo / tshul du zhugs te khang bu dang mal stan bgos zin pa las phyis dge slong mang zhig lhags na tshul du zhugs pa ni mi gcig gi mal stan dang khang bu ni slar bsdus la bgo /
analyzed: tshul du zhugs pa bas mang du lhags na slar bgo / tshul du zhugs te khang bu dang mal stan bgos zin pa las phyis dge slong mang zhig lhags na tshul du zhugs pa ni mi gcig gi mal stan dang khang bu ni slar bsdus la bgo /
translated: If after the distribution of cells and bedding, many more monks arrive, the bedding and cells of those who entered the rite should be redistributed.

original: tshul 'og mar zhugs na ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'og mar zhugs na ma yin no //
translated: But if they entered the rite of a lower class, they should not be redistributed.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas mal stan dang khang bu bgos zin pa las phyis dge slong dag gcig gud nas lhags na du lhags kyang rung ste slar mi bgo'o //
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs nas mal stan dang khang bu bgos zin pa las phyis dge slong dag gcig gud nas lhags na du lhags kyang rung ste slar mi bgo'o //
translated: If after entering the rite of a later class, the bedding and cells have been distributed, if later one or more monks arrive, they should not be redistributed.

original: chog na gnyis la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chog na gnyis la sogs pa'o //
translated: If there is space, two or more may share.

original: mal stan dang khang bu mang la dge slong nyung na khang bu dang mal stan phrugs du yang rung ste ci thob thob tu mang du sbyin no //
analyzed: mal stan dang khang bu mang la dge slong nyung na khang bu dang mal stan phrugs du yang rung ste ci thob thob tu mang du sbyin no //
translated: If there are many bedding and cells but few monks, many may be given to each monk, as much as they can carry.

original: gcig gi phyir mal stan mi blang /
analyzed: gcig gi phyir mal stan mi blang /
translated: Bedding and cells should not be taken for one's own sake.

original: dge 'dun 'ang rung ste gnas der zhag gcig las mi thogs pa zhig na zhag gcig gi phyir mal stan khang bu mi mnod do //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'ang rung ste gnas der zhag gcig las mi thogs pa zhig na zhag gcig gi phyir mal stan khang bu mi mnod do //
translated: If a monk or nun is staying in a certain place, he or she should not reserve a bed or cell for the sake of staying there for more than one day.

original: la la na nod pa yod kyang dge 'dun gyis ma byin yang nyes med /
analyzed: la la na nod pa yod kyang dge 'dun gyis ma byin yang nyes med /
translated: If someone reserves a bed or cell, but the Sangha does not assign it, there is no offense.

original: rnyed pa 'dod par gtsug lag khang ma yin no //🔽yon bdag gis khang pa sbyar ba la khang bu la la ni rkyen dang yo byad mang bar sbyar /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod par gtsug lag khang ma yin no // yon bdag gis khang pa sbyar ba la khang bu la la ni rkyen dang yo byad mang bar sbyar /
translated: But if it is not a temple, there is an offense for desiring gain.

original: la la nyung du sbyar te rkyen mang nyung dang bzang ngan yod pa zhig 'god pa na gnas brtan nam gral mtho bas 'dams te khyer na nyes byas so //
analyzed: la la nyung du sbyar te rkyen mang nyung dang bzang ngan yod pa zhig 'god pa na gnas brtan nam gral mtho bas 'dams te khyer na nyes byas so //
translated: If a benefactor has built a temple and has provided some cells with many amenities and others with few, and if the senior monk or the one who is next in seniority chooses a cell with many amenities, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: @230b dge 'dun gyis gang 'dod pa ngoms shig ces bsgo ba ni nyes med /
analyzed: @230b dge 'dun gyis gang 'dod pa ngoms shig ces bsgo ba ni nyes med /
translated: If the Sangha tells him, “Take whatever you like,” there is no offense.

original: thams cad spyad mi nyung la khang bu mang ste skal ba mang du thob na lhag par mi gzhag gi thabs 'og nas 'byung ba ltar spyad do //
analyzed: thams cad spyad mi nyung la khang bu mang ste skal ba mang du thob na lhag par mi gzhag gi thabs 'og nas 'byung ba ltar spyad do //
translated: If there are many cells but few monks, and if a monk receives many shares, he should not keep them for himself. He should use them in the manner described below.

original: la la la snga dro'i klog pa dang kha ton gyi gnas dang 'chag pa las 'ga' bya /🔽mi gcig la khang bu thob na la lar yi ge klog cing kha thon bya /
analyzed: la la la snga dro'i klog pa dang kha ton gyi gnas dang 'chag pa las 'ga' bya / mi gcig la khang bu thob na la lar yi ge klog cing kha thon bya /
translated: Some are for reading and reciting in the morning, and for walking meditation.🔽If one has a hut, one reads and recites in one, and walks in meditation in another.

original: la lar 'chag pa ste khang bu dang mig re las sna re bya'o //
analyzed: la lar 'chag pa ste khang bu dang mig re las sna re bya'o //
translated: One should use each hut for a different purpose.

original: la lar gung gi dang mtshan mo'o //
analyzed: la lar gung gi dang mtshan mo'o //
translated: Some are for the midday and night.

original: khang bu mang du thob na kha cig gi nang du nyi ma gung gi tshe las spyad /
analyzed: khang bu mang du thob na kha cig gi nang du nyi ma gung gi tshe las spyad /
translated: If one has many huts, one should do one’s work in the middle of the day in one of them,

original: la lar mtshan mo'i spyod pa bya /
analyzed: la lar mtshan mo'i spyod pa bya /
translated: and do one’s evening practice in another.

original: gzhan lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i gnas mtshan mo gzhan yang 'di ltar de la rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan lhung bzed dang chos gos gzhag pa'i gnas mtshan mo gzhan yang 'di ltar de la rigs so //
translated: One should also use different huts for storing one’s begging-bowl and robes.

original: khang bu mang du thob na khang cig gi nang du lhung bzed chos gos gzhag / kha cig gi nang du nyal mal bya ba la sogs pa mig re nas sna re spyad do //
analyzed: khang bu mang du thob na khang cig gi nang du lhung bzed chos gos gzhag / kha cig gi nang du nyal mal bya ba la sogs pa mig re nas sna re spyad do //
translated: If one has many huts, one should store one’s begging-bowl and robes in one of them, and sleep in another.

original: de ltar las sna re spyad pa ni yon tan rnam gnyis yod de gcig tu na bdag la yang yangs shing bde //
analyzed: de ltar las sna re spyad pa ni yon tan rnam gnyis yod de gcig tu na bdag la yang yangs shing bde //
translated: Using each hut for a different purpose has two advantages: one’s possessions are not scattered, and one is not attached to a single place.

original: gcig tu na yon bdag gis yon bskyed cing bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu na yon bdag gis yon bskyed cing bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In one case, the benefactors increase their offerings and their merit.

original: tshul du zhugs pas gnas kyi dngos po gas pa dang gogs pa slar bcos so //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs pas gnas kyi dngos po gas pa dang gogs pa slar bcos so //
translated: When they have entered the proper conduct, they should repair the damage and deterioration of the dwelling.

original: tshul du zhugs nas khang bu dgos pas mi chog gi khang bu'i zhig ral dang gas shing gogs pa la sogs pa bcos shang glan to //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs nas khang bu dgos pas mi chog gi khang bu'i zhig ral dang gas shing gogs pa la sogs pa bcos shang glan to //
translated: Having entered the proper conduct, it is not enough to just have a hut. They should repair the damage, deterioration, cracks, and holes in the hut.

original: tshul du ma zhugs pa'i tshe yang 'di bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: tshul du ma zhugs pa'i tshe yang 'di bzhin bya'o //
translated: Even when they have not entered the proper conduct, they should do it like this.

original: dbyar mo thang la yang dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'i dge slong ma dag gi bcos /
analyzed: dbyar mo thang la yang dbyar tshul du zhugs pa'i dge slong ma dag gi bcos /
translated: Also, during the summer retreat, the nuns who have entered the proper conduct should repair the summer huts.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyang tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe dbyar mo thang zhig ral pa dang gas shing gogs par gyur na dge slong pha gi dang 'dra bar bdag bdag gis gnas la sgo tshe mi bya bar spyis bcos so //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyang tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe dbyar mo thang zhig ral pa dang gas shing gogs par gyur na dge slong pha gi dang 'dra bar bdag bdag gis gnas la sgo tshe mi bya bar spyis bcos so //
translated: When the nuns have entered the proper conduct, if the summer huts become damaged, cracked, and deteriorated, like the monks, they should not wait for others to repair their dwellings. They should repair them themselves.

original: 'thab mo pa 'jug par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dgun dang dpyid du mal stan blang bar bya /
analyzed: 'thab mo pa 'jug par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dgun dang dpyid du mal stan blang bar bya /
translated: In order to prevent quarrels, they should take bedding in the winter and spring.

original: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar dus gsum mal stan dang khang bu slar bsdus shing khong mnyam par bgo / de ltar bya ba ni kho na mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar dus gsum mal stan dang khang bu slar bsdus shing khong mnyam par bgo / de ltar bya ba ni kho na mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is only fair.

original: yang gcig tu gud nas dge slong 'thab mo zhig 'ong na 'thab mo pa de bdag gcig gi nang du mi gzhag pa'i phyir mal stan dang khang pa lhag par mi gzhag par bgo / thams cad bgo / ltag tu sgo khang la sogs pa mi bgo zhes
analyzed: yang gcig tu gud nas dge slong 'thab mo zhig 'ong na 'thab mo pa de bdag gcig gi nang du mi gzhag pa'i phyir mal stan dang khang pa lhag par mi gzhag par bgo / thams cad bgo / ltag tu sgo khang la sogs pa mi bgo zhes
translated: If a monk who is quarrelsome comes later, the bedding and huts should be redistributed and shared equally, without leaving any extra, so that the quarrelsome one is not placed in the same room.

original: byung ba yang ma bgos na 'thab @231a * //
analyzed: byung ba yang ma bgos na 'thab @231a * //
translated: If it is not redistributed, the quarrelsome one will stay and cause trouble.🔽Therefore, all the rooms, corridors and so forth should be redistributed.

original: mo pa 'dug cing then du 'ong gis sgo gang dang khyams la sogs pa kun bgo 'thab 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: mo pa 'dug cing then du 'ong gis sgo gang dang khyams la sogs pa kun bgo 'thab 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The remaining things are to be redistributed and used. The doors, corridors and so forth are to be redistributed individually, so that there is no place for the quarrelsome one to stay.

original: 'di lta ste gtsug lag khang gi 'khor yangs kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gtsug lag khang gi 'khor yangs kyang ngo //
translated: For example, even the surrounding area of the temple.

original: lhag ma thams cad bgos shing bya ba ni sgo gang dang snam phyis la sogs pa kun so sor bgos te 'thab mo pa 'dug pa'i gnas med par bya /
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad bgos shing bya ba ni sgo gang dang snam phyis la sogs pa kun so sor bgos te 'thab mo pa 'dug pa'i gnas med par bya /
translated: All the remaining things are to be redistributed and used. The doors, corridors and so forth are to be redistributed individually, so that there is no place for the quarrelsome one to stay.

original: khyams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: khyams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The courtyard is also like that.🔽The courtyard where the Saṅgha gathers is also for the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun 'du ba'i khyams kyang dge 'dun 'du bas zhes pa yin te mi bgo 'dra mod kyi 'thab mo pa 'ongs par thos na de yang bgo //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'du ba'i khyams kyang dge 'dun 'du bas zhes pa yin te mi bgo 'dra mod kyi 'thab mo pa 'ongs par thos na de yang bgo //
translated: It is similar to the above, but if one hears that a quarrelsome monk has come, then it is shared.🔽After he has left, it is not shared in that way.

original: de song phyin chad de ltar mi 'jug /'thab pa 'ongs pa'i phyir rtag tu smos pa ltar bgos pa las 'thab mo ba slar song ste mi 'ong na spyi la 'dug pa'i khang bu khyams la sogs pa rnams thal byung du bgos te bzhag pa ma yin gyi
analyzed: de song phyin chad de ltar mi 'jug /'thab pa 'ongs pa'i phyir rtag tu smos pa ltar bgos pa las 'thab mo ba slar song ste mi 'ong na spyi la 'dug pa'i khang bu khyams la sogs pa rnams thal byung du bgos te bzhag pa ma yin gyi
translated: It is not the case that the huts, courtyards, and so on, for the general assembly are shared and then left as they are, as if the quarrelsome monk had not come.🔽They are not left as they are but are returned to their original state.

original: slar bkrol te spyil gzhag / rang bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir dgag par mi bya //
analyzed: slar bkrol te spyil gzhag / rang bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir dgag par mi bya //
translated: They are not prohibited from entering.

original: dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa zhig 'ongs nas 'thab mo pa ltar khang bu mi sbyin pa ma yin gyi tshul bzhin du khang bu'i skal ba gzhag go //
analyzed: dge slong yon tan dang ldan pa zhig 'ongs nas 'thab mo pa ltar khang bu mi sbyin pa ma yin gyi tshul bzhin du khang bu'i skal ba gzhag go //
translated: If a monk endowed with good qualities comes, it is not the case that a hut is not given to him like a quarrelsome monk. A share of the huts is properly assigned.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir na ma yin pa 'god pa'i tshe bdag gi gnas su bya'ang rung grogs pa'i gnas su bya'ang rung ste song phod nas 'dug pa'i phyir da nas skal ba nod cing sgo lcags bcug nas mthus mnan pa lta bur mi bya /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir na ma yin pa 'god pa'i tshe bdag gi gnas su bya'ang rung grogs pa'i gnas su bya'ang rung ste song phod nas 'dug pa'i phyir da nas skal ba nod cing sgo lcags bcug nas mthus mnan pa lta bur mi bya /
translated: When one is assigned a cell, one may take it as one's own, whether it is the cell of a teacher or that of a friend, and one may stay there as long as one wishes. One should not, however, act as if one were the owner, locking the door and keeping others out.

original: 'di dus che ge mo zhig nas bdag zhag gcig gam de'i char mchis so //🔽khang bu 'god pa'i skal ba gar bab pa nam 'dug gi bar du thal byung mnod kyi dbyar ni bsel ba 'dir 'dug go //
analyzed: 'di dus che ge mo zhig nas bdag zhag gcig gam de'i char mchis so // khang bu 'god pa'i skal ba gar bab pa nam 'dug gi bar du thal byung mnod kyi dbyar ni bsel ba 'dir 'dug go //
translated: One should not say, I have been here since such and such a time.

original: dgun ni dro ba 'dir 'dug go //🔽zhag lnga zhig 'dir 'dug zhag drug cig 'dir 'dug go zhes zer zhing gnas gcig tu ma bcad par mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgun ni dro ba 'dir 'dug go // zhag lnga zhig 'dir 'dug zhag drug cig 'dir 'dug go zhes zer zhing gnas gcig tu ma bcad par mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not say, I have been here for a day or for a night, or, I have been here for as long as it takes to assign a cell, or, I have been here for as long as I stay, or, I have been here for the summer retreat, or, I have been here for the winter retreat.🔽 One should not say, I have been here for five days, or, I have been here for six days, or, I have been here for as long as it takes to assign a cell, or, I have been here for as long as I stay, or, I have been here for the summer retreat, or, I have been here for the winter retreat.

original: 'dir slob dpon che ge mo zhig gir 'gyur mkhan po yir 'gyur lhan cig tu spyod pa yin 'di nye gnas kyir 'dir gtam zla po la sogs pa yir zhes gtsug lag khang la mi bgo //
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon che ge mo zhig gir 'gyur mkhan po yir 'gyur lhan cig tu spyod pa yin 'di nye gnas kyir 'dir gtam zla po la sogs pa yir zhes gtsug lag khang la mi bgo //
translated: One should not say, I have been here for five days, or, I have been here for six days, or, I have been here for as long as it takes to assign a cell, or, I have been here for as long as I stay, or, I have been here for the summer retreat, or, I have been here for the winter retreat.🔽 One should not say, I have been here for five days, or, I have been here for six days, or, I have been here for as long as it takes to assign a cell, or, I have been here for as long as I stay, or, I have been here for the summer retreat, or, I have been here for the winter retreat.🔽 One should not say, I have been here for five days, or, I have been here for six days, or, I have been here for as long as it takes to assign a cell, or, I have been here for as long as I stay, or, I have been here for the summer retreat, or, I have been here for the

original: khang bu 'god pa'i tshe slob dpon mkhan po dang slob ma dang nye gnas dang mdza' bo dang grogs po la sogs pa gang yang rung ste 'ga' zhig na 'dug ste phyir 'ong bar gyur te de'i phyir bdag gis khang bu'i skal ba snga nas mnos te mi
analyzed: khang bu 'god pa'i tshe slob dpon mkhan po dang slob ma dang nye gnas dang mdza' bo dang grogs po la sogs pa gang yang rung ste 'ga' zhig na 'dug ste phyir 'ong bar gyur te de'i phyir bdag gis khang bu'i skal ba snga nas mnos te mi
translated: When the huts are assigned, if a teacher, preceptor, student, attendant, friend, companion, or anyone else is staying there and will return, one should not assign one's share of the hut to them in advance.

original: gzhag go // de ltar mnos na nyes byas /
analyzed: gzhag go // de ltar mnos na nyes byas /
translated: If one does so, it is a minor infraction.🔽One should not assign it.

original: mi mnod / mdo ltag ma ltar @231b bdag gi skal ba'i khang bu rog gcig gis mnos te bzhag cing 'dug na mnod du mi dbang ba las mnos te ma brtags pa yin pas bdag kyang 'dir mi 'dug go //
analyzed: mi mnod / mdo ltag ma ltar @231b bdag gi skal ba'i khang bu rog gcig gis mnos te bzhag cing 'dug na mnod du mi dbang ba las mnos te ma brtags pa yin pas bdag kyang 'dir mi 'dug go //
translated: If one assigns one's share of the hut to someone else, it is not proper to assign it to someone who is not authorized to do so. Since one has not examined it, one should not stay there either.

original: khar ba'i rub ma pa bya tshang la thabs kyi phyir bsgo //
analyzed: khar ba'i rub ma pa bya tshang la thabs kyi phyir bsgo //
translated: For the sake of a bird's nest, one may cut a tree.

original: dge slong gcig gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas la khar ba bskur te bya tshang 'jig tu gzhug bya tshang ci lta bur gzhig pa ni thabs 'og nas 'chad sgo nga med na gzhig / bya tshang gzhig pa ni sgo nga med na gzhig go //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las byas la khar ba bskur te bya tshang 'jig tu gzhug bya tshang ci lta bur gzhig pa ni thabs 'og nas 'chad sgo nga med na gzhig / bya tshang gzhig pa ni sgo nga med na gzhig go //
translated: If there are no eggs, the nest should be destroyed.

original: dge 'dun gyis ma bsgos bar bya chang bshig pa ni nyes byas pa gong nas 'chad pa yin /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ma bsgos bar bya chang bshig pa ni nyes byas pa gong nas 'chad pa yin /
translated: If the nest is destroyed without the Saṅgha’s permission, it is a minor infraction.

original: phra mo rnams la mi 'phel bar skud pas dkri bung ba dang kha brgyad kyi tshang zhig gtsug lag khang na 'dug na mang du mi 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir skud pas tshang dkris te gzhag na cher mi 'phel zhing gud du 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mo rnams la mi 'phel bar skud pas dkri bung ba dang kha brgyad kyi tshang zhig gtsug lag khang na 'dug na mang du mi 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir skud pas tshang dkris te gzhag na cher mi 'phel zhing gud du 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For small birds, the nest should be bound with string so that it does not grow. If a beehive is in the monastery, it should be bound with string so that it does not grow and so that it moves elsewhere.

original: mal stan la sogs pa sbyin /
analyzed: mal stan la sogs pa sbyin /
translated: Beds and so on should be distributed.

original: mal bgo pa ni dge sbyong yan chad mnyam par bgo //
analyzed: mal bgo pa ni dge sbyong yan chad mnyam par bgo //
translated: Beds should be distributed equally to those who have one year or more of seniority.

original: yod na du mar yang ngo //
analyzed: yod na du mar yang ngo //
translated: If there are many, they should be distributed to each.

original: mal stan grangs du ma yod na phrugs du ma ci thob thob tu bgo //
analyzed: mal stan grangs du ma yod na phrugs du ma ci thob thob tu bgo //
translated: If there are many beds, they should be distributed to each according to seniority.

original: khri chen po yang bgo //
analyzed: khri chen po yang bgo //
translated: And the great thrones.

original: 'dug pa'i khri chen po rgyab rten can dang khri chung du yang bgo'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i khri chen po rgyab rten can dang khri chung du yang bgo'o //
translated: And the great seats with backrests, and the small seats.

original: gding ba yang ngo //
analyzed: gding ba yang ngo //
translated: And the bedding.

original: yon bdag gis re lde dang stan la sogs pa sbyar ba zhig na'ang ci thob pa tsam du bgo //
analyzed: yon bdag gis re lde dang stan la sogs pa sbyar ba zhig na'ang ci thob pa tsam du bgo //
translated: If the owner has provided bamboo spread and cushions, etc., they are to be distributed according to what each monk has received.

original: dge 'dun gyi g-yogs pa'i mal stan mi gtsang ba dang zag pas chud gzon pa'i dge sbyong su la yang mi sbyin /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi g-yogs pa'i mal stan mi gtsang ba dang zag pas chud gzon pa'i dge sbyong su la yang mi sbyin /
translated: One should not give to any monk who is not pure, who is defiled by the impurity of the saṃgha, the saṃgha’s bedding and seats for sleeping.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gding ba shing bal dang srin bal dang bal la sogs pa'i bar tshangs can dge slong 'og rdzing can mi sbyin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gding ba shing bal dang srin bal dang bal la sogs pa'i bar tshangs can dge slong 'og rdzing can mi sbyin no //
translated: One should not give to a monk who is not pure, who is defiled by the impurity of the saṃgha, the saṃgha’s bedding and seats for sleeping, which are made of cotton, silk, wool, etc., and have a border.

original: stan tha mal pa rkyang pa ni bkrur rung ba'i phyir sbyin no//
analyzed: stan tha mal pa rkyang pa ni bkrur rung ba'i phyir sbyin no//
translated: One should give a simple seat that is suitable for washing.

original: dge slong ma la yang ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong ma la yang ma yin /
translated: One should not give to a nun.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dang 'dra bar gding ba bar tshangs can dang dge slong ma'i yang dge sbyong za gu la mi sbyin /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar dang 'dra bar gding ba bar tshangs can dang dge slong ma'i yang dge sbyong za gu la mi sbyin /
translated: One should not give to a nun who is not pure, who is defiled by the impurity of the saṃgha, the saṃgha’s bedding and seats for sleeping, which are made of cotton, silk, wool, etc., and have a border.

original: de der gnas par gyur na gtsug lag khang gi mtha' 'khob tu sbyin /
analyzed: de der gnas par gyur na gtsug lag khang gi mtha' 'khob tu sbyin /
translated: If it is to be used there, it is given to the outskirts of the monastery.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge slong pho mo las za gu 'og rdzing can zhig yod na gtsug lag khang gi mtha' 'khob khang bu ngan pa zhig tu gzhag go //🔽mal stan na lhag ma ngan pa las so //
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge slong pho mo las za gu 'og rdzing can zhig yod na gtsug lag khang gi mtha' 'khob khang bu ngan pa zhig tu gzhag go // mal stan na lhag ma ngan pa las so //
translated: If there are monks or nuns who have a lower rank than the one who died, it is placed in a small house on the outskirts of the monastery.🔽If there are no monks or nuns of lower rank, it is given to the lowest quality bedding.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo 'og rdzing can la mal stan yang ngan pa las sbyin /
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo 'og rdzing can la mal stan yang ngan pa las sbyin /
translated: If there are monks or nuns who have a lower rank than the one who died, it is given to the lowest quality bedding.

original: khyed su la'ang dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding ba med bar ma spyod cig / mal stan @232a * //
analyzed: khyed su la'ang dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding ba med bar ma spyod cig / mal stan @232a * //
translated: You should not use the bedding of the Sangha without a cloth spread over it.🔽Every half month, you should tell the monks, Do not use the bedding of the Sangha without a cloth spread over it and do not use the lowest quality bedding.

original: gyi rub ma pas zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong rnams la gding ba med pa dang tshas ngan par ma bya shig par bsgo shig / brtags pa'i gding ba can ma yin /
analyzed: gyi rub ma pas zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong rnams la gding ba med pa dang tshas ngan par ma bya shig par bsgo shig / brtags pa'i gding ba can ma yin /
translated: You should not be one who uses bedding without examining it.

original: mal stan gyi ru ba ma bas gding ba med par ma bya shig ces bsgo ba la gding ba'i mtshan ma tsam du 'og ska la sogs pa chung dus gding ba'i skyin par bting ste nyal bar mi bya /🔽dri ma can gyi gding ba ma yin no zhes bsgo shig / gding ba dri ma can gyi dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding zhing mi nyal /
analyzed: mal stan gyi ru ba ma bas gding ba med par ma bya shig ces bsgo ba la gding ba'i mtshan ma tsam du 'og ska la sogs pa chung dus gding ba'i skyin par bting ste nyal bar mi bya / dri ma can gyi gding ba ma yin no zhes bsgo shig / gding ba dri ma can gyi dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding zhing mi nyal /
translated: The monk who is the manager of the bedding should not allow the bedding to be without a cover.  If the monk who is the manager of the bedding does not allow the bedding to be without a cover, he should spread a small piece of cloth, such as a loincloth, as a substitute for the cover and then sleep on it.🔽He should not allow the bedding to be dirty.  If the bedding is dirty, the monk who is the manager of the bedding should not sleep on the bedding of the community of monks.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing brtag / mal stan gyi rub ma pas gding ba med pa ma bya shig ces bsgo ba bzhin du mnyan tam ma mnyan par brtag pa'i phyir zla ba phyed phyed cing sgron ma thogs te nyal khar blta /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing brtag / mal stan gyi rub ma pas gding ba med pa ma bya shig ces bsgo ba bzhin du mnyan tam ma mnyan par brtag pa'i phyir zla ba phyed phyed cing sgron ma thogs te nyal khar blta /
translated: He should inspect it every half month.  If the monk who is the manager of the bedding does not allow the bedding to be without a cover, he should listen to the instruction or not listen to the instruction. In order to investigate whether he listened or not, he should hold a lamp and look at the bedding when the monks are going to sleep every half month.

original: dus las 'gal par spyod na phrogs la zhus te gnas pa na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dus las 'gal par spyod na phrogs la zhus te gnas pa na gnas pa'o //
translated: If he uses the bedding at a time that is not allowed, he should be questioned about it. If he is staying in a place, he should stay in that place.

original: mal stan rdzis gding ba med pa dang dri ma can dang brtag pa tsam byed cig ces bsgo ba las zla ba phyed cing byul ba'i tshe bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas na dge slong ngam dge sbyong de'i slob dpon la de ltar byed du ma gzhug shig
analyzed: mal stan rdzis gding ba med pa dang dri ma can dang brtag pa tsam byed cig ces bsgo ba las zla ba phyed cing byul ba'i tshe bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas na dge slong ngam dge sbyong de'i slob dpon la de ltar byed du ma gzhug shig
translated: If, after being told, “Do not use a dirty bed or bedding, or use it only after examining it,” a monk or a renunciant does not act accordingly, then, when the time comes to inspect the bedding every half month, do not allow that monk or renunciant to use the bedding.

original: mal stan rdzis bsgo //
analyzed: mal stan rdzis bsgo //
translated: The bedding should be inspected.

original: de ltar bsgo ba nas slob dpon na re nga'i ngag mi nyan gyi ci bder byos shig ces zer na mal stan phrogs la drubs te gzhag gzhan na dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgo ba nas slob dpon na re nga'i ngag mi nyan gyi ci bder byos shig ces zer na mal stan phrogs la drubs te gzhag gzhan na dge 'dun la'o //
translated: If, after being told to inspect the bedding, the preceptor says, “I will not follow your advice. Do as you please,” then the bedding should be taken away and stored.

original: dge slong rgan po gnas brtan du chud pa yan chad gcig gis mal stan bsgo ba bzhin du tshad ma byas na mal stan tshas ngan te zhes bsgo ste /
analyzed: dge slong rgan po gnas brtan du chud pa yan chad gcig gis mal stan bsgo ba bzhin du tshad ma byas na mal stan tshas ngan te zhes bsgo ste /
translated: If a monk who is an elder or a sthavira does not act in accordance with the instructions regarding the bedding, then the bedding should be inspected and the bedding that is not good should be assigned to him.

original: nyan du ma btub na dge 'dun la zhus te slar dbrog / sbyin bdag che ge mo zhig don bsgrub pa che ge mo zhig yul gyi grong che ge mo zhig tu song dge 'dun rnams tshul du 'jug go zhes zhu /
analyzed: nyan du ma btub na dge 'dun la zhus te slar dbrog / sbyin bdag che ge mo zhig don bsgrub pa che ge mo zhig yul gyi grong che ge mo zhig tu song dge 'dun rnams tshul du 'jug go zhes zhu /
translated: “So-and-so, the benefactor, has a matter to attend to and must go to such-and-such a town in the country. The saṅgha should enter into the proper conduct.”

original: tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe ming gis smos pa 'di rnams smos te 'jug go //
analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe ming gis smos pa 'di rnams smos te 'jug go //
translated: When entering into the proper conduct, the names of those mentioned should be mentioned and then the proper conduct should be entered.

original: tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe sbyin bdag gi ming 'di zhes bya ba dang don sgrub cing zhal ta byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba dang yul gtsug lag khang ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gnas su dge 'dun 'di rnams tshul du 'jug go zhes zhag gcig gi sngon
analyzed: tshul du zhugs pa'i tshe sbyin bdag gi ming 'di zhes bya ba dang don sgrub cing zhal ta byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba dang yul gtsug lag khang ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gnas su dge 'dun 'di rnams tshul du 'jug go zhes zhag gcig gi sngon
translated: When entering into the proper conduct, the name of the benefactor is such-and-such, the one who performs the service and attends to the matter is such-and-such, and the saṅgha enters into the proper conduct in the place of the temple named such-and-such.”

original: logs su smos te khong du chud par byas la tshul du 'jug / ma byung ba dang / nyes pa dang ltar ni ma byung na phyis 'byung ngam mi 'byung ngam mi 'byung gtol med par mi bya'i brtags te mi 'byung ba @232b rtogs na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
analyzed: logs su smos te khong du chud par byas la tshul du 'jug / ma byung ba dang / nyes pa dang ltar ni ma byung na phyis 'byung ngam mi 'byung ngam mi 'byung gtol med par mi bya'i brtags te mi 'byung ba @232b rtogs na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
translated: If you have not committed any of these, you should not be indifferent, thinking, “I do not know whether I will commit them in the future or not.” Instead, you should examine yourself and understand that you will not commit them.

original: gsol ba ni the tshom dang / bdag gi tshul khrims las nyes pa zhig byung na the tshom zos pa dang gzhan zhig gis brgal te the tshom sel ba'i mi yod na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
analyzed: gsol ba ni the tshom dang / bdag gi tshul khrims las nyes pa zhig byung na the tshom zos pa dang gzhan zhig gis brgal te the tshom sel ba'i mi yod na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
translated: If you have doubts about your ethical discipline, or if you have committed a downfall, you should not be indifferent, thinking, “I do not know whether I will clear up my doubts or not.” Instead, you should seek out a person who can clear up your doubts.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal kha zas dang sdig sbur dang sems can gyi gnod par byed pa yod dam med brtags te de lta mi bde yang phyis bde bar gyur na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal dang / lus kyi sdug bsngal kha zas dang sdig sbur dang sems can gyi gnod par byed pa yod dam med brtags te de lta mi bde yang phyis bde bar gyur na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
translated: If you are suffering, you should not be indifferent, thinking, “I do not know whether I will be harmed by food, parasites, or living beings.” Instead, you should examine yourself and understand that you are not suffering in this way. If you are suffering, you should understand that this suffering will be beneficial in the future and you should not be indifferent.

original: yid mi bde ba dang / sems 'khrugs shing mi bde bar gyur na'ang tshul du mi 'jug ste ltag ma dang 'dra /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / sems 'khrugs shing mi bde bar gyur na'ang tshul du mi 'jug ste ltag ma dang 'dra /
translated: If you are unhappy or mentally disturbed, do not enter, just as if it were a precipice.

original: bsrung ba dang / bdag gi lus la gnod cing gtse ba zhig byung na pha skyabs dang ra mda' byed pa yod dam med brtags te med na mi 'jug pa la bya /
analyzed: bsrung ba dang / bdag gi lus la gnod cing gtse ba zhig byung na pha skyabs dang ra mda' byed pa yod dam med brtags te med na mi 'jug pa la bya /
translated: If someone comes to harm or injure your body, do not enter unless you have examined whether or not you have a protector or a defender.

original: nad g-yog tu tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las 'gyur bar re ba dang / tshul du zhugs na bdag gi grogs tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nad g-yog byed du btub pa dang / nad g-yog yod dam med brtags te med na tshul du mi 'jug yod na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
analyzed: nad g-yog tu tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las 'gyur bar re ba dang / tshul du zhugs na bdag gi grogs tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nad g-yog byed du btub pa dang / nad g-yog yod dam med brtags te med na tshul du mi 'jug yod na tshul du 'jug pa la bya /
translated: If you are hoping that a fellow practitioner of pure conduct will be your nurse, or if you have entered the practice, do not enter unless you have examined whether or not you have a nurse who is able to help you, a fellow practitioner of pure conduct.

original: gnas dang / bdag tshul du zhugs na gnas khang yod dam med pa dang / yod kyang ngan te nyon mongs par 'gyur na tshul du mi 'jug / yul dang / yul 'khrug cing dgra dang chom po la sogs pa yod dam med brtags te yod na mi 'jug / zas dang /
analyzed: gnas dang / bdag tshul du zhugs na gnas khang yod dam med pa dang / yod kyang ngan te nyon mongs par 'gyur na tshul du mi 'jug / yul dang / yul 'khrug cing dgra dang chom po la sogs pa yod dam med brtags te yod na mi 'jug / zas dang /
translated: If one enters in the manner of a country, one should examine whether or not there are enemies, thieves, and so forth, and if there are, one should not enter.🔽If one enters in the manner of food, one should examine whether or not there is food given to the Saṅgha or to be obtained by begging, and if it is not to be obtained, one should not enter.

original: gnas de na dge 'dun gyi zas sbyin nam sbyin pa dang / bslang du rnyed pa brtags te mi rnyed na tshul du mi 'jug / sman dang / gnas de na sman yod dam med brtags te sman med na mi 'jug / sbyin pa brtags te tshul du 'jug go //
analyzed: gnas de na dge 'dun gyi zas sbyin nam sbyin pa dang / bslang du rnyed pa brtags te mi rnyed na tshul du mi 'jug / sman dang / gnas de na sman yod dam med brtags te sman med na mi 'jug / sbyin pa brtags te tshul du 'jug go //
translated: If one enters in the manner of medicine, one should examine whether or not there is medicine, and if there is not, one should not enter.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams sbyin zhing sbyor ba yod dam med brtags te yod na tshul du 'jug med na mi 'jug / g-yogs par dge slong gi mdun du'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams sbyin zhing sbyor ba yod dam med brtags te yod na tshul du 'jug med na mi 'jug / g-yogs par dge slong gi mdun du'o //
translated: If one enters in the manner of a donor, one should examine whether or not there is a donor who gives by name, and if there is, one should enter in the manner of a donor.🔽If one enters in the manner of a robe, one should examine whether or not there is a robe to be given, and if there is, one should enter in the manner of a robe.

original: tshul du 'jug pa ni khang pa thog med par tshul du mi 'jug sngags byed pa'i tshe dge sbyong ngam dge slong ma la sngags mi bya /
analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa ni khang pa thog med par tshul du mi 'jug sngags byed pa'i tshe dge sbyong ngam dge slong ma la sngags mi bya /
translated: When one is reciting the mantra, one should not recite the mantra in the presence of a fully ordained monk or nun.

original: bdag gcig pu yang sngags mi bya /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu yang sngags mi bya /
translated: One should not recite the mantra alone.

original: dge slong gi gan du sngags byas te khang pa thog yod par 'dug / gtsug lag khang du mar ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong gi gan du sngags byas te khang pa thog yod par 'dug / gtsug lag khang du mar ma yin /
translated: One should recite the mantra in the presence of a fully ordained monk, in a house with a roof, not in a temple.

original: gtsug lag khang bzhi lnga tsam zhig ma tshams 'dab chags su sbrel du rung na mtshams kyi mdor re lde bting la de'i steng du tshul gyis sngags byas ste @233a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang bzhi lnga tsam zhig ma tshams 'dab chags su sbrel du rung na mtshams kyi mdor re lde bting la de'i steng du tshul gyis sngags byas ste @233a * //
translated: If it is suitable to connect four or five temples without a break, one should lay out a mat at the end of the boundary and recite the mantra in a manner on top of that.

original: khang pa kun du gnas par byas na tshul du 'jug par ni 'gyur khang pa de du yod pa bzhin du nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khang pa kun du gnas par byas na tshul du 'jug par ni 'gyur khang pa de du yod pa bzhin du nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes the house a dwelling place, it becomes entering in a manner. As many houses as there are, there are that many faults.

original: gang na dge slong dang sgor ma bcas pa ma yin tshul du 'jug pa na khang pa sgo dang bcas pa la dge slong rogs kyang yod na tshul du 'jug go //
analyzed: gang na dge slong dang sgor ma bcas pa ma yin tshul du 'jug pa na khang pa sgo dang bcas pa la dge slong rogs kyang yod na tshul du 'jug go //
translated: If there is no fully ordained monk at the door, if one enters in a manner, if there is a fully ordained monk as an assistant in a house with a door, one enters in a manner.

original: 'di gnyis gang med kyang rung gcig med par tshul du zhugs na nyes byas so //🔽sbyin bdag dang don sgrub pa dang yul grong dang g-yog yod na brjod //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gang med kyang rung gcig med par tshul du zhugs na nyes byas so // sbyin bdag dang don sgrub pa dang yul grong dang g-yog yod na brjod //
translated: If either of these two is missing, there is an offense for the one who enters the rainy season residence without the other.🔽If there is a donor, a purpose, a place, and a companion, one should speak of them.

original: ltag tu sbyin bdag dang don sgrub pa dang / yul dang gtsug lag khang gi ming brjod /
analyzed: ltag tu sbyin bdag dang don sgrub pa dang / yul dang gtsug lag khang gi ming brjod /
translated: If there is no donor, purpose, place, or companion, one should speak of the name of the donor, the purpose, the place, and the monastery.

original: ma bskos par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs shar bar mi bya /
analyzed: ma bskos par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs shar bar mi bya /
translated: Without being appointed, one should not let the dawn break outside the boundary.

original: tshul du zhugs nas zla ba gsum gyi tshe gnas gzhan gar yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs nas zla ba gsum gyi tshe gnas gzhan gar yang mi 'gro //
translated: Having entered the rainy season residence, for three months one should not go anywhere else.

original: 'gro ba zhig tu gyur na'ang sngags kyis ma btab par song ste skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhig tu gyur na'ang sngags kyis ma btab par song ste skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one becomes one who goes, one should go without reciting the mantra. If the dawn breaks, the rainy season residence is broken.

original: sngags kyis btab na zhag bdun tshun chad 'gror rung ngo //
analyzed: sngags kyis btab na zhag bdun tshun chad 'gror rung ngo //
translated: If one recites the mantra, it is suitable to go for up to seven days.

original: chos kyi don zhag bdun du bsngo //
analyzed: chos kyi don zhag bdun du bsngo //
translated: The purpose of the Dharma is dedicated for seven days.

original: zhag bdun du 'gror gnang ba yang chos kyi don 'og nas 'byung ba rnams lta bu zhig gi phyir 'gro ba ni zhag bdun pa'i sngags rung ngo //
analyzed: zhag bdun du 'gror gnang ba yang chos kyi don 'og nas 'byung ba rnams lta bu zhig gi phyir 'gro ba ni zhag bdun pa'i sngags rung ngo //
translated: The permission to go for seven days is suitable for the seven-day mantra for going for the purposes of the Dharma that will be explained below.

original: chos kyi don ma yin pa kha zas dang rang nyams kyi phyir 'gro ba ni sngags btab kyang tshul zhig go //
analyzed: chos kyi don ma yin pa kha zas dang rang nyams kyi phyir 'gro ba ni sngags btab kyang tshul zhig go //
translated: To go for the sake of food and drink, or for one's own profit, is to break the rule even if one has the proper authorization.

original: 'di lta ste kun dga' ra ba dbul ba dang / yon bdag dad pa zhig gis zhing dang nor rdzas dang grong khyim zhig dbul te spyan 'dren na zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab na tshul gyi tshe 'gror dbang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste kun dga' ra ba dbul ba dang / yon bdag dad pa zhig gis zhing dang nor rdzas dang grong khyim zhig dbul te spyan 'dren na zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab na tshul gyi tshe 'gror dbang /
translated: For example, if one is invited to give a blessing, such as the gift of a monastery, or if a faithful patron invites one to his fields, wealth, or home, one may go if one has the proper authorization, but only after reciting the seven-day mantra.

original: gtsug lag khang slong pa dang / gtsug lag khang gsar zhig bslangs te zhal bsro ba'i tshe spyan 'dren na tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste 'gror dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang slong pa dang / gtsug lag khang gsar zhig bslangs te zhal bsro ba'i tshe spyan 'dren na tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste 'gror dbang ngo //
translated: If one is invited to a new monastery to consecrate it, one may go if one has the proper authorization and has recited the mantra.

original: mal stan sbyin pa dang / yon bdag dang pa zhig gis mal stan dang nor rdzas shig sbyin pa'i phyir spyan 'dren na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab na 'gror rung ngo //
analyzed: mal stan sbyin pa dang / yon bdag dang pa zhig gis mal stan dang nor rdzas shig sbyin pa'i phyir spyan 'dren na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab na 'gror rung ngo //
translated: If one is invited to give a gift of bedding, or if a faithful patron invites one to give a gift of wealth, one may go if one has the proper authorization and has recited the mantra.

original: rtag pa'i bshams pa dang / dge 'dun nam gtsug lag khang du rtag par zan spyor pa'i phyir spyan 'dren cing 'bod na'ang 'gror rung ngo //🔽mchod rten slong ba dang / tse ti dang sku gzugs la sogs pa zhig byas te zhal bsro zhing spyan dbye ba'i phyir spyan drong na 'gror rung /
analyzed: rtag pa'i bshams pa dang / dge 'dun nam gtsug lag khang du rtag par zan spyor pa'i phyir spyan 'dren cing 'bod na'ang 'gror rung ngo // mchod rten slong ba dang / tse ti dang sku gzugs la sogs pa zhig byas te zhal bsro zhing spyan dbye ba'i phyir spyan drong na 'gror rung /
translated: It is suitable to go when invited to a permanent offering or to a regular meal for the sake of the Saṅgha or a temple.🔽It is suitable to go when invited to open the eyes of a stupa, to consecrate a caitya, an image and so on, and to perform the rites of a burnt offering.

original: srog shing tse ti'i srog shing gzugs par 'dod pa dang / rgyal mtshan gzugs pa dang / chos @233b kyi rgyal mtshan nam ba dan shing zhig btsugs pa'i phyir mchod rten la 'dod pa dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / dkon mchog la yon dbul zhing mchod pa'i phyir 'dod pa ni tshul gyi tshe 'gror rung ste mchod pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: srog shing tse ti'i srog shing gzugs par 'dod pa dang / rgyal mtshan gzugs pa dang / chos @233b kyi rgyal mtshan nam ba dan shing zhig btsugs pa'i phyir mchod rten la 'dod pa dang / mchod pa bya ba dang / dkon mchog la yon dbul zhing mchod pa'i phyir 'dod pa ni tshul gyi tshe 'gror rung ste mchod pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba rnams yin no //
translated: It is suitable to go when invited to erect a life-tree of a caitya, to erect a victory banner, to plant a Dharma victory banner or flag, to make offerings to a stupa, and to make offerings and give gifts to the Three Jewels.

original: yung ba dang gur gum dang tsan dan gyis chag chag 'debs pa dang / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bus mchod pa'i las byed pa las bos pa dang / klag pa dang / yi ge kha don dang klog pa zur mi phyin cing mi shes pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang bdag mi shes te klog slob tu 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: yung ba dang gur gum dang tsan dan gyis chag chag 'debs pa dang / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bus mchod pa'i las byed pa las bos pa dang / klag pa dang / yi ge kha don dang klog pa zur mi phyin cing mi shes pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang bdag mi shes te klog slob tu 'gro ba dang /
