translated: Those who are called the 'uncertain ones' because they go to the learned preceptors to ask about their doubts regarding the heavy and light precepts, whether they are broken or not, and so forth.🔽3.

original: the tshom bsal ba dang / khrims lci yang dang zhig ma zhig pa la sogs pa la the tshom khyer ba'i 'bod pa'ang rung ba dag the tshom khyer te mkhan po mkhas pa'i gan du 'drir 'gro ba dang // lta bar zhugs pa spong ba dang /
analyzed: the tshom bsal ba dang / khrims lci yang dang zhig ma zhig pa la sogs pa la the tshom khyer ba'i 'bod pa'ang rung ba dag the tshom khyer te mkhan po mkhas pa'i gan du 'drir 'gro ba dang // lta bar zhugs pa spong ba dang /
translated: Those who are called the 'entered view ones' because they go to the learned preceptors to ask about their doubts regarding the heavy and light precepts, whether they are broken or not, and so forth.

original: dge slong gcig gis gcig sdig pa la lta bar gyur te de'i phyir sdig pa la lta ba de dang dbral bar bya ba'i bos kyang rung bdag rang 'gro yang rung ste song ba dang / rogs gsol zhing 'chags pa dang / dge slong gcig na re nga'i slob ma nyes par spyod cing log par lta ba ste nga'i ngag ni mi nyan na khyod kyis bsgo zhing mi gdams su mi rung gis shol ces bos te 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gcig sdig pa la lta bar gyur te de'i phyir sdig pa la lta ba de dang dbral bar bya ba'i bos kyang rung bdag rang 'gro yang rung ste song ba dang / rogs gsol zhing 'chags pa dang / dge slong gcig na re nga'i slob ma nyes par spyod cing log par lta ba ste nga'i ngag ni mi nyan na khyod kyis bsgo zhing mi gdams su mi rung gis shol ces bos te 'gro ba dang /
translated: One should go to request and confess for a monk who says, “My disciple has faulty conduct and wrong views and does not listen to me. You should instruct him and not refuse.”

original: chad pa la sogs pa bzhi sbyin pa dang / chad pa dang rtsa pa'i chad pa dang mgu ba dang rtsa ba'i mgu ba bzhi las gang yang rung ba byed pa zhig dge 'dun grangs ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa dang / 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: chad pa la sogs pa bzhi sbyin pa dang / chad pa dang rtsa pa'i chad pa dang mgu ba dang rtsa ba'i mgu ba bzhi las gang yang rung ba byed pa zhig dge 'dun grangs ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa dang / 'byung ba dang /
translated: One should go to give any of the four punishments and so on, or to perform any of the four acts of reconciliation and so on.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma byung ba zhig dbyung ba'i las byed de dge 'dun nyi shur mtshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa dang / nad pa'i yid brtan pa dge slong la'o //🔽dge slong nad pa zhig sems 'khrugs shing mi dga' ste tshig pa la mdza' pa'i phyir phrad na dga' zhing yi rang bar 'gyur la ngag nyan pa'i phyir bkug ste 'gro ba dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi phyir sngags kyis btab ste song na tshul zhig
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma byung ba zhig dbyung ba'i las byed de dge 'dun nyi shur mtshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa dang / nad pa'i yid brtan pa dge slong la'o // dge slong nad pa zhig sems 'khrugs shing mi dga' ste tshig pa la mdza' pa'i phyir phrad na dga' zhing yi rang bar 'gyur la ngag nyan pa'i phyir bkug ste 'gro ba dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi phyir sngags kyis btab ste song na tshul zhig
translated: The act of ejecting a monk who has committed a samghatiśeṣa offense is performed for the purpose of a quorum of twenty monks. A monk who is sick is to be trusted.

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a sick monk is disturbed and unhappy, if he is pleased and delighted to meet his friends, and if he is summoned for the purpose of listening to their speech, then if he goes after being empowered with a mantra, he will not break the rule.

original: dge slong ma lci ba'i chos kyis mgu bar byed pa sbyin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma lci ba'i chos kyis mgu bar byed pa sbyin pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, a gift of pleasing a nun who has committed a heavy offense.

original: dge slong ma lci pa'i chos shig shig par 'gyur te mgu bar byed pa'i dge 'dun grangs mi chog pa'i phyir 'bod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gang song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma lci pa'i chos shig shig par 'gyur te mgu bar byed pa'i dge 'dun grangs mi chog pa'i phyir 'bod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gang song yang nyes med do //
translated: If a nun who has committed a heavy offense is to be pleased, then if she is summoned for the purpose of a quorum of the saṅgha, there is no fault if either a monk or a nun goes after being empowered with a mantra.

original: dge slong ma la @234a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma la @234a * //
translated: For a nun,

original: tshangs par spyod pa skyed pa'i sngom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa skyed pa'i sngom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because she has taken the vow to generate pure conduct.

original: dge slob ma tshangs par spyod pa'i gnas sdom pa nod pa'i phyir tshul gyi tshe dge slob ma sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slob ma tshangs par spyod pa'i gnas sdom pa nod pa'i phyir tshul gyi tshe dge slob ma sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
translated: For a probationary nun, because she has taken the vow of the foundation of pure conduct.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo //
translated: For one who is fully ordained,🔽because she has completed the training of a novice.🔽For a novice, because she has completed the training of a layperson.

original: dge sbyong las khrims rdzogs par byed de dge 'dun grangs ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa'ang sngags kyis btab ste song na nyes med do //🔽der dge sbyong yang ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong las khrims rdzogs par byed de dge 'dun grangs ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bod pa'ang sngags kyis btab ste song na nyes med do // der dge sbyong yang ngo //
translated: For a layperson, because he has completed the training of a one-day layperson.🔽For a one-day layperson, because he has completed the training of a householder.

original: khyim pa zhig dge sbyong du rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'bod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: khyim pa zhig dge sbyong du rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'bod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
translated: For a householder, because he has completed the training of a person who has not taken vows.🔽For one who has not taken vows, because he has completed the training of a person who has not taken vows.

original: dge sbyong ma slob pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa dang / dge sbyong ma zhig dge slong ma'i khrims nod pa'i phyir dge slong ma las 'bod na tshul gyi sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med do //🔽mgo dkri ba dang / mi gzhon nu zhig thod bcing ba'i dus la bab ste mi mang po zhig bsdus te bkra shis byed pa'i phyir tshul gyi tshe 'bod na'ang sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma slob pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa dang / dge sbyong ma zhig dge slong ma'i khrims nod pa'i phyir dge slong ma las 'bod na tshul gyi sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med do // mgo dkri ba dang / mi gzhon nu zhig thod bcing ba'i dus la bab ste mi mang po zhig bsdus te bkra shis byed pa'i phyir tshul gyi tshe 'bod na'ang sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med /
translated: There is no offense if a monk is invited to a ceremony to give the vows of a female novice or to a ceremony to give the vows of a female novice to a female novice.🔽There is no offense if a monk is invited to a ceremony to tie the topknot of a young man, to a ceremony to tie the topknot of a young man at the proper time, to a ceremony to tie the topknot of a young man after gathering many people in order to make auspicious connections, or to a ceremony to tie the topknot of a young man after reciting a verse.

original: rdul bkru ba dang / bud med bu byung ba'i 'og tu khrus byas te bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang / phung po 'jog pa dang / bus skra 'dreg 'dreg pa las phud bu 'jog pa'i tshe bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang / ral bu 'bod pa dang /
analyzed: rdul bkru ba dang / bud med bu byung ba'i 'og tu khrus byas te bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang / phung po 'jog pa dang / bus skra 'dreg 'dreg pa las phud bu 'jog pa'i tshe bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod pa dang / ral bu 'bod pa dang /
translated: There is no offense if a monk is invited to a ceremony to wash the dirt from a woman after she has given birth in order to make auspicious connections, to a ceremony to place the topknot of a boy after he has had his head shaved, to a ceremony to make auspicious connections by reciting a verse, to a ceremony to tie the topknot of a young man, or to a ceremony to make auspicious connections by reciting a verse.

original: byis pa'i skra ral bur 'dug 'dug pa las 'dreg pa'i tshe bkra shis kyi phyir 'bod pa dang // rna cha'i skyed pa'i khyim pa dang khyim ma la'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skra ral bur 'dug 'dug pa las 'dreg pa'i tshe bkra shis kyi phyir 'bod pa dang // rna cha'i skyed pa'i khyim pa dang khyim ma la'o //
translated: When a child’s hair is matted and he is to be shaved, one may call out for the sake of auspiciousness.🔽One may call out for the sake of auspiciousness when a householder or a householder’s wife is wearing a new earring.

original: rna cha gcig gsar du thogs te bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod de song ba dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste khyim bdag po'am mo zhig dge slong pho mo gang yang rung tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song na tshul mi 'jig la
analyzed: rna cha gcig gsar du thogs te bkra shis pa'i phyir 'bod de song ba dang ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste khyim bdag po'am mo zhig dge slong pho mo gang yang rung tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song na tshul mi 'jig la
translated: If one goes to a householder or a householder’s wife, any of those mentioned by name, and recites a mantra for the sake of auspiciousness, one’s conduct is not impaired.

original: nyes med do //
analyzed: nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ma gtogs par bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la snga ma yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ma gtogs par bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la snga ma yang ngo //
translated: Except for a serious offense, if one recites a mantra to an unordained person, one commits an earlier offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ste chad pa dang rtsa ba'i chad pa dang / mgu ba dang rtsa ba'i mgu ba 'di bzhi dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'byin ba dang snga ma ma gtogs par lhag nas chos kyi don gyi phyir 'gror rung ngo zhes bya pa man chad tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med do zhes 'byung ba thams cad gang yang rung ste khyim pa🔽zhig gis spyan 'dren zhing 'bod na'ang tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song @234b na nyes med de tshul mi zhig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ste chad pa dang rtsa ba'i chad pa dang / mgu ba dang rtsa ba'i mgu ba 'di bzhi dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'byin ba dang snga ma ma gtogs par lhag nas chos kyi don gyi phyir 'gror rung ngo zhes bya pa man chad tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song yang nyes med do zhes 'byung ba thams cad gang yang rung ste khyim pa zhig gis spyan 'dren zhing 'bod na'ang tshul gyi tshe sngags kyis btab ste song @234b na nyes med de tshul mi zhig go //
translated: All of these are permissible for a layperson to invite and summon a monk to his house.

original: khyim pa la bshad par bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa la bshad par bzod pa'o //
translated: If a layperson explains the doctrine to a monk, the monk should tolerate it.

original: dge slong la khyim pas nyes pa'i dmigs par skur pa btab na /
analyzed: dge slong la khyim pas nyes pa'i dmigs par skur pa btab na /
translated: If a layperson accuses a monk of a downfall, the monk should not retaliate.

original: dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed kha phub pa las phyis khyim pas bzod par gsol zhing spyan 'dren na'ang tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis lhung bzed kha phub pa las phyis khyim pas bzod par gsol zhing spyan 'dren na'ang tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med do //
translated: If the Saṅgha covers the begging bowls, and later householders request forgiveness and invite the Saṅgha, there is no fault in going if one recites the mantra.

original: zas dang sman dang g-yog de dag med la med pas 'tsho mi nus na rgal tshul du zhugs pa las kha zas dang sman dang g-yog la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad med de gud du 'gro dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na 'tsho ba ga la yod par
analyzed: zas dang sman dang g-yog de dag med la med pas 'tsho mi nus na rgal tshul du zhugs pa las kha zas dang sman dang g-yog la sogs pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad med de gud du 'gro dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na 'tsho ba ga la yod par
translated: If one is unable to live without those foods, medicines, or attendants, and if one has entered the renunciate life, how can one live if one must go elsewhere due to the condition of not having the requisites for living, such as food, medicine, or attendants?

original: song yang tshul ni zhig par 'gyur nyes byas ni med do //
analyzed: song yang tshul ni zhig par 'gyur nyes byas ni med do //
translated: If one goes, the renunciate life is destroyed, but there is no fault.

original: dge sbyong dang 'tsho ba dang tshangs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur na yang ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang 'tsho ba dang tshangs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur na yang ngo //
translated: If it would become an obstacle to the life of a renunciate, to livelihood, or to pure conduct, then also not.

original: dge slong grogs thams cad tshul khrims la g-yel te srin bu mi rtog cing chu mi 'tshag pa dang spags pa'i kha zas la sogs pa za ba dang btung ba'i sdig pa spyod de bdag gcig pus ni dge 'dun gyi las kun mi nus kyi bdag gi don
analyzed: dge slong grogs thams cad tshul khrims la g-yel te srin bu mi rtog cing chu mi 'tshag pa dang spags pa'i kha zas la sogs pa za ba dang btung ba'i sdig pa spyod de bdag gcig pus ni dge 'dun gyi las kun mi nus kyi bdag gi don
translated: The monk thought, I alone cannot perform all the duties of the saṅgha. I must do what is beneficial for myself.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dgra bcom pa'i rim pa bzhi la bar du gcod cing sdig par 'gyur ba dang bdag 'tsho ba'i srog la babs pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang rkyen 'di rnams lta bu zhig byung na tshul gyi tshe gud du song na tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dgra bcom pa'i rim pa bzhi la bar du gcod cing sdig par 'gyur ba dang bdag 'tsho ba'i srog la babs pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang rkyen 'di rnams lta bu zhig byung na tshul gyi tshe gud du song na tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med do //
translated: If I were to commit the negative action of obstructing the four stages of the fruits of training in virtue, arhatship, and if my life were to be in danger, if it were to obstruct my pure conduct, then if I were to transgress the ethics in such circumstances, there is no fault, and if I were to transgress the ethics, there is no downfall.

original: mi mthun par sems bskyed pa dang / yul gyi rnams kyis bdag gi sems mi bde zhing sdig pa spong bar 'gyur ba zhig na yul gzhan rnams las sems bde zhing dge bar sems bde bar 'gyur ba zhig yod de tshul gyi tshe song yang tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med do //
analyzed: mi mthun par sems bskyed pa dang / yul gyi rnams kyis bdag gi sems mi bde zhing sdig pa spong bar 'gyur ba zhig na yul gzhan rnams las sems bde zhing dge bar sems bde bar 'gyur ba zhig yod de tshul gyi tshe song yang tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med do //
translated: If one goes to another country because one is unhappy there and wants to give up sin, but is happy and virtuous in another country, there is no offense.

original: sdig pa ngag gis brjod cing dge 'dun gyi dbyen du 'jug na yang ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa ngag gis brjod cing dge 'dun gyi dbyen du 'jug na yang ngo //
translated: If one goes to another country because one speaks of sin and enters into schism in the Sangha, there is an offense.

original: yul gyi rnams las sems 'gyur ba bzhin du kha nas sdig pa smra zhing sdig pa'i grogs byed par 'gyur na yul bde ba gzhan du 'phos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: yul gyi rnams las sems 'gyur ba bzhin du kha nas sdig pa smra zhing sdig pa'i grogs byed par 'gyur na yul bde ba gzhan du 'phos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one goes to another country because one speaks of sin with one's mouth and acts as a sinful friend, there is no offense in going to another country where one is happy.

original: de dag zhi bar gyur na mi 'gro bar mi bya /
analyzed: de dag zhi bar gyur na mi 'gro bar mi bya /
translated: If they are pacified, one should not go.

original: dge slong zhig dbyen la zhugs te bdag gis gros btab na dbyen la mi 'jug par nus pa dang dbyen la zhugs zin pa las slar zlog nus pa tsam gyi tshod ni tshul dral te song na zhig nyes byas ni med do //
analyzed: dge slong zhig dbyen la zhugs te bdag gis gros btab na dbyen la mi 'jug par nus pa dang dbyen la zhugs zin pa las slar zlog nus pa tsam gyi tshod ni tshul dral te song na zhig nyes byas ni med do //
translated: A monk who has entered into a schism has no offense of a partial defeat if he thinks, “If I speak, I will be able to prevent the schism,” or “I will be able to turn back those who have already entered into the schism.”

original: ma song na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma song na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not go, he has an offense of wrong conduct.

original: song na mi rgal bar mi bya /
analyzed: song na mi rgal bar mi bya /
translated: If he goes, he should not cross over.

original: mdo gong ma ltar 'gro ba la zhag bdun gyis slar 'khor ba zhig ste zhag bdun pa'i sngags @235a * //
analyzed: mdo gong ma ltar 'gro ba la zhag bdun gyis slar 'khor ba zhig ste zhag bdun pa'i sngags @235a * //
translated: If he goes as described above, he should return within seven days.

original: btab pa las zhag bdun gyi bar du slar ma bzlog shig dbyen ma btang na zhag bdun las 'das par 'dug kyang tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med /
analyzed: btab pa las zhag bdun gyi bar du slar ma bzlog shig dbyen ma btang na zhag bdun las 'das par 'dug kyang tshul ni zhig nyes byas ni med /
translated: If he does not return within seven days, he has no offense of a partial defeat, but if he does not prevent the schism or does not end the schism, he should not stay beyond seven days.

original: dbyar gyi gnas su gnas par dam bcas pa mi bca' bar mi bya /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gnas su gnas par dam bcas pa mi bca' bar mi bya /
translated: He should not break his vow to stay in the rainy season retreat.

original: yon bdag gcig gis tshul gyi tshe 'tsho ba sbyar te 'dug par 'thams pa'ang rung chos sde snod gsum bshad pa'i phyir gsol te 'tsho ba sbyar nas tshul gyi tshe bzhag pa'ang rung 'dug par khas blangs pa las gud du song na nyes byas so //
analyzed: yon bdag gcig gis tshul gyi tshe 'tsho ba sbyar te 'dug par 'thams pa'ang rung chos sde snod gsum bshad pa'i phyir gsol te 'tsho ba sbyar nas tshul gyi tshe bzhag pa'ang rung 'dug par khas blangs pa las gud du song na nyes byas so //
translated: If one promises to live in a place and then leaves, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas su 'di ldang ba med do //
analyzed: gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas su 'di ldang ba med do //
translated: There is no rising from this in a place of the same poṣadha ceremony.

original: dge 'dun tshul tha dad du mtshams so sor zhugs la gso sbyong gcig tu 'dus shing byed na gtsug lag khang de gnyis sngags kyis ma thebs par zhag tu gnas kyang tshul zhig par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun tshul tha dad du mtshams so sor zhugs la gso sbyong gcig tu 'dus shing byed na gtsug lag khang de gnyis sngags kyis ma thebs par zhag tu gnas kyang tshul zhig par mi 'gyur te nyes med do //
translated: If the saṃgha enters into separate boundaries and performs the poṣadha ceremony together in one place, then even if the two temples remain for a night without being sealed with a mantra, the morality does not disintegrate, and there is no offense.

original: yod na ni rnyed pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yod na ni rnyed pa gcig pa'o //
translated: If there is a single acquisition,

original: gtsug lag khang so sor tha dad du zhugs la gso sbyong ni gcig tu mi byed kyi kha zas lhag par spyir bsres shing za ba ni gtsug lag khang de gnyis lhag ma ltar gnas su mi rung ste sngags ma thebs na tshul zhig go //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang so sor tha dad du zhugs la gso sbyong ni gcig tu mi byed kyi kha zas lhag par spyir bsres shing za ba ni gtsug lag khang de gnyis lhag ma ltar gnas su mi rung ste sngags ma thebs na tshul zhig go //
translated: The monks should not enter the separate temples and perform the poṣadha ceremony in one place, but should eat the food mixed together. If they do not do this, it is not suitable to remain in that temple, just as it is not suitable to remain in a temple where the consecration has not been performed.

original: dbyar gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi dngos po'o //
translated: The rainy season retreat

original: dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'i cho ga bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'i cho ga bshad pa'o /
translated: The ritual for entering the rainy season retreat

original: // / sde lnga char yang tshul du 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: // / sde lnga char yang tshul du 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: All five orders enter the rainy season retreat.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma'ang tshul du 'jug dgos so //
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo dang dge slob ma'ang tshul du 'jug dgos so //
translated: Both monks and nuns, both male and female novices, and female probationers must enter the rainy season retreat.

original: dge sbyong 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong 'ba' zhig ma yin no //
translated: Not only the monks.

original: dge slong dang mkhan po la sogs pa med na dge sbyong 'ba' zhig nyi tshe tshul du 'jug tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dang mkhan po la sogs pa med na dge sbyong 'ba' zhig nyi tshe tshul du 'jug tu mi rung ngo //
translated: If there are no monks or preceptors, etc., it is not suitable for the monks alone to enter the rainy season retreat.

original: tshul du zhugs na tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur na nyes byas grangs med do //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs na tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur na nyes byas grangs med do //
translated: If they enter the rainy season retreat, but it is not considered a rainy season retreat, there is no offense.

original: lor ma lon pa yang ngo //
analyzed: lor ma lon pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one has not completed one year.

original: mkhan po dang gnas brtan med par dge slong lo gcig tu ma lon pa nyi tshe tshul du 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang gnas brtan med par dge slong lo gcig tu ma lon pa nyi tshe tshul du 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who has not been a monk for a full year should not enter the rainy season retreat without a preceptor or a teacher.

original: de dag la tshul du zhugs pa mi 'chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la tshul du zhugs pa mi 'chags pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that he should not enter the rainy season retreat at all.

original: mdo gong ma gnyis ltar bshad pa dge sbyong dang lo ma lon pa tshul du zhugs kyang tshul du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mdo gong ma gnyis ltar bshad pa dge sbyong dang lo ma lon pa tshul du zhugs kyang tshul du ni mi rung ngo //
translated: As explained in the two previous sūtras, a novice or one who has not been a monk for a full year may enter the rainy season retreat, but it is not suitable for them to be the leader of the community.

original: mal stan mi blang mi bya /
analyzed: mal stan mi blang mi bya /
translated: Do not take a bed or seat.

original: dge slong dang lo ma lon pa tshul du zhugs pas gnas brtan med pa'i phyir mal stan mi bgo ba ma yin te bgos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong dang lo ma lon pa tshul du zhugs pas gnas brtan med pa'i phyir mal stan mi bgo ba ma yin te bgos kyang nyes med do //
translated: A monk who has not been a monk for a full year should not distribute the bedding because there is no senior monk, but there is no fault if he distributes it.

original: sdud pa med kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdud pa med kyang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that there should be no collection.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gyi rdzi'am sdud pa dang 'god pa'i mi med par mal stan yod na bdag cag gis bgos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan gyi rdzi'am sdud pa dang 'god pa'i mi med par mal stan yod na bdag cag gis bgos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If there is bedding but no one appointed by the saṅgha to distribute it or to collect it, we may distribute it ourselves.

original: @235b ma bgos par bsdu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @235b ma bgos par bsdu ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it should not be collected without being distributed.

original: dge 'dun gyis mal stan rdzir ma bskos par mal stan thug thub tu phyung ste brnyen por mi btang /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mal stan rdzir ma bskos par mal stan thug thub tu phyung ste brnyen por mi btang /
translated: If the saṅgha has not appointed someone to distribute the bedding, the bedding should not be taken out and stored in a haphazard way.

original: ma byung ba la sogs par sde snod 'chang ba dang 'thab mo byed pa yod dam med pa yang der ma chud pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byung ba la sogs par sde snod 'chang ba dang 'thab mo byed pa yod dam med pa yang der ma chud pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the existence or nonexistence of a holder of the scriptural collection who engages in battle is not included there.🔽If there is grief, doubt and dispute, one does not enter the rite.

original: ltag tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang the tshom skye bar 'gyur pa dang 'thab cing 'khrug pa yod na tshul du mi 'jug go zhes 'byung ba la sde snod gsum shes pa'i mkhan po yod na mya ngan dang the tshom sel cing 'khrug pa zhi bar 'gyur
analyzed: ltag tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang the tshom skye bar 'gyur pa dang 'thab cing 'khrug pa yod na tshul du mi 'jug go zhes 'byung ba la sde snod gsum shes pa'i mkhan po yod na mya ngan dang the tshom sel cing 'khrug pa zhi bar 'gyur
translated: If there is a preceptor who knows the three scriptural collections, then grief and doubt are dispelled and dispute is pacified.

original: ba'i phyir tshul du zhugs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: ba'i phyir tshul du zhugs kyang nyes med do //
translated: Therefore, even if one enters the rite, there is no fault.🔽If one does not know the three scriptural collections, then grief and doubt arise and one is confused.

original: sde snod gsum shes pa med na mya ngan dang the tshom skye zhing 'khrul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phral du bde pa'ang tshul du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: sde snod gsum shes pa med na mya ngan dang the tshom skye zhing 'khrul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phral du bde pa'ang tshul du mi 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, even if it is pleasant at the time, one does not enter the rite.

original: tshul du ma zhugs kyang gnas ma btang na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul du ma zhugs kyang gnas ma btang na gnas pa'o //
translated: But if one does not enter the rite but does not abandon the site, one remains.

original: tshul du 'jug pa'i sngags kyis ma btab cing tshul du ma zhugs kyang tshul zla ba gsum gnas gcig na 'dug cing gud du ma song ste zhag ma lon na tshul du zhugs pa dang 'dra ste yon tan bcu yang 'thob par 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa'i sngags kyis ma btab cing tshul du ma zhugs kyang tshul zla ba gsum gnas gcig na 'dug cing gud du ma song ste zhag ma lon na tshul du zhugs pa dang 'dra ste yon tan bcu yang 'thob par 'gyur te 'og nas 'chad /
translated: Even if one does not enter the rite with the mantra, and does not enter the rite, but stays in one place for three months and does not go elsewhere, even if the days are not complete, it is like entering the rite, and one will obtain the ten qualities explained below.

original: nam mkha' la tshul du zhugs pa ni mi skye'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la tshul du zhugs pa ni mi skye'o //
translated: One does not enter the rite in the sky.

original: rdzu 'phrul can zhig gis nam mkha' la tshul du zhugs te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul can zhig gis nam mkha' la tshul du zhugs te /
translated: One who has miraculous powers enters the rite in the sky,

original: zla ba gsum du gnas pa ni tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gsum du gnas pa ni tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but does not enter the rite for three months.

original: grur ma yin te ma gtogs pa ni sa la brten pa'am bcings sam sa la rten pa brten par bar chad 'byung bar mi shes na'o //
analyzed: grur ma yin te ma gtogs pa ni sa la brten pa'am bcings sam sa la rten pa brten par bar chad 'byung bar mi shes na'o //
translated: One does not enter the rite in a boat, except for those who are on land, bound to the ground, or do not know that obstacles will arise.

original: gru'i nang du tshul du zhugs pa'ang tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gru'i nang du tshul du zhugs pa'ang tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one enters the rite in a boat, one does not enter the rite.

original: grus la brten cing chus 'phags par mi 'gyur ba dang nyag thag shing la btags te mi 'phags pa dang nyin par nyag thag bkrol nas yan man du drangs te nang par skya rengs ma byung bar nyag thag slar brtags pa ni tshul du zhugs kyang tshul zhig
analyzed: grus la brten cing chus 'phags par mi 'gyur ba dang nyag thag shing la btags te mi 'phags pa dang nyin par nyag thag bkrol nas yan man du drangs te nang par skya rengs ma byung bar nyag thag slar brtags pa ni tshul du zhugs kyang tshul zhig
translated: One does not break the vows by relying on a boat or by rising up with the water. One does not break the vows by tying a rope to a tree and rising up with it. One does not break the vows by unfastening the rope during the day and being pulled up and down by the rope, as long as the dawn has not broken.

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not break the vows by entering the vows again.

original: 'jig pa ni da'i lta ba la gnas te chos ma yin pa'i skyabs su song nas skya rengs shar na'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni da'i lta ba la gnas te chos ma yin pa'i skyabs su song nas skya rengs shar na'o //
translated: One breaks the vows by holding that view, by going for refuge to a non-Dharma, and by the dawn breaking.🔽One does not break the vows by having a monk's body and a wrong view, because one has faith in the monk's way of life.

original: dge slong sems mur 'dug gam log par ltas par 'gyur te lus ni dge slong gi tshul du 'dug la sems log pa la dad pa'i phyir log pa la lta ba gzhan mtshams kyi nang du 'jug kyang de dang lhan cig tu de'i gnas su zhag lon te🔽skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong sems mur 'dug gam log par ltas par 'gyur te lus ni dge slong gi tshul du 'dug la sems log pa la dad pa'i phyir log pa la lta ba gzhan mtshams kyi nang du 'jug kyang de dang lhan cig tu de'i gnas su zhag lon te skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur /
translated: One does not break the vows by entering the vows again with another wrong view.

original: the tshom gyis ni ma yin no //🔽tshul du zhugs @236a * //
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni ma yin no //🔽tshul du zhugs @236a * //
translated: One does not break the vows by doubt.🔽One does not break the vows by entering the vows again.

original: la tshul du zhugs sam ma zhugs the tshom za bar gyur na yang tshul zhig bar mi 'gyur te tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la tshul du zhugs sam ma zhugs the tshom za bar gyur na yang tshul zhig bar mi 'gyur te tshul du zhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is in doubt as to whether one has entered the rite or not, one is not in the rite.

original: mtha' gzhan drug tu bsngos pa ni mi ldang ngo //
analyzed: mtha' gzhan drug tu bsngos pa ni mi ldang ngo //
translated: One does not rise from the other six limits.🔽If one is allowed to go by the rite of seven nights, if one goes away for the sake of the Dharma or for life, even though one goes away on the sixth night,

original: tshul gyi zhag bdun gyi sngags gyis btab ste 'gror rung ba yin na zhag drug na tshul nas 'byung ba'i mdun du zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste chos kyi don dang srog la bab pa'i phyir gud du song yang zhag gcig gi skya rengs byung ba na🔽tshul zhig bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul gyi zhag bdun gyi sngags gyis btab ste 'gror rung ba yin na zhag drug na tshul nas 'byung ba'i mdun du zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste chos kyi don dang srog la bab pa'i phyir gud du song yang zhag gcig gi skya rengs byung ba na tshul zhig bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is in the rite at the rising of the dawn of the seventh night.

original: zhig pa ni tshul du zhugs nas dgos pa med par de las ma log gam gnas na'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni tshul du zhugs nas dgos pa med par de las ma log gam gnas na'o //
translated: One is not in the rite if, after entering the rite, one does not return or stay away without a reason.

original: ltag tu chos kyi don la sogs pa'i phyir 'gro na zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste 'gror dbang ngo zhes ming gis smos te bshad pa 'di rnams la chos kyi don la sogs pa pha rol gyi las zin par 'gyur na las zin bar thos bzhin du
analyzed: ltag tu chos kyi don la sogs pa'i phyir 'gro na zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste 'gror dbang ngo zhes ming gis smos te bshad pa 'di rnams la chos kyi don la sogs pa pha rol gyi las zin par 'gyur na las zin bar thos bzhin du
translated: If one hears that the purpose of Dharma has been accomplished, it is permissible to go from the very beginning.

original: gzhi nas song yang rung lam du thos te slar ma log kyang zhag lon te skya rengs byung na tshul zhig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi nas song yang rung lam du thos te slar ma log kyang zhag lon te skya rengs byung na tshul zhig pa'o //
translated: If one hears on the way and does not return, one breaks the rule if the dawn rises after one day has passed.

original: chos kyi don gyi phyir zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste song ba las sngar zin na zhag bdun ma lon gyi bar du mi 'gro'o zhes zer zhing 'dug pa ni tshul zhig pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi phyir zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste song ba las sngar zin na zhag bdun ma lon gyi bar du mi 'gro'o zhes zer zhing 'dug pa ni tshul zhig pa'o //
translated: If one goes for the purpose of Dharma with the seven day rule, but hears that the purpose of Dharma has already been accomplished, one should not go until the seven days have passed.🔽If one stays saying this, one breaks the rule.

original: de'i mtha' ni zhag bdun tshun chad do //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni zhag bdun tshun chad do //
translated: The limit is seven days.

original: chos kyi don gyi phyir 'gror dbang ngo zhes gong du ming gis smos pa rnams kyang zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab na rung gi de las zhag mang ba'am sngags kyis btab kyang mi phan te tshul zhig pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi phyir 'gror dbang ngo zhes gong du ming gis smos pa rnams kyang zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab na rung gi de las zhag mang ba'am sngags kyis btab kyang mi phan te tshul zhig pa'o //
translated: One is allowed to go for the sake of the Dharma.

original: gnang ba ma thob pa de ni mtha'o //🔽gud du 'gro bar dge 'dun las gnang ba thob pa ni chos kyi don gyi phyir na zhag bzhi bcur 'gror gnang ste de ni ma gtogs par zhag bdun 'das te brgyad kyi skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnang ba ma thob pa de ni mtha'o // gud du 'gro bar dge 'dun las gnang ba thob pa ni chos kyi don gyi phyir na zhag bzhi bcur 'gror gnang ste de ni ma gtogs par zhag bdun 'das te brgyad kyi skya rengs byung na tshul zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not allowed to go, one is at the limit.🔽If one is allowed to go by the Saṅgha for the sake of the Dharma, one is allowed to go for forty nights.

original: gzhan yang nub bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nub bzhi bcu'o //
translated: If one stays beyond that, one’s conduct breaks down.

original: ngo mtshar gyi rkyen cig byung na dge 'dun gyis zhag bzhi bcu'i bar du 'gror dbang bar gnang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyi rkyen cig byung na dge 'dun gyis zhag bzhi bcu'i bar du 'gror dbang bar gnang ba sbyin no //
translated: If a special condition arises, the Saṅgha may grant permission to go for up to forty nights.

original: de ltar byin nas phyi ma gnas pa'i tshe zhag mang po yang tshul zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byin nas phyi ma gnas pa'i tshe zhag mang po yang tshul zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is granted such permission, one’s conduct does not break down even if one stays longer.

original: de sbyin rkyen byung te zhag bzhi bcur 'gror gnang ba rigs na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: de sbyin rkyen byung te zhag bzhi bcur 'gror gnang ba rigs na dge 'dun gyis gnang ba sbyin no //
translated: If it is proper to grant him permission to go for forty days, the Saṅgha should grant him permission.

original: ma byin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma byin na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not granted, there is an offense of wrong doing.

original: de las lhag par phyi logs su mi gnas sde lnga char yang 'di bzhin no //
analyzed: de las lhag par phyi logs su mi gnas sde lnga char yang 'di bzhin no //
translated: He should not stay outside for more than that. The same applies to the other four.

original: zhag bzhi bcur dge 'dun gyis gnang ste @236b song las zhag bzhi bcu 'das kyang rung don ni sngar grub kyi zhag bzhi bcu ma lon gyi bar du mi 'gro zhes 'khyam zhing 'dug ba ni zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bzhi bcur dge 'dun gyis gnang ste @236b song las zhag bzhi bcu 'das kyang rung don ni sngar grub kyi zhag bzhi bcu ma lon gyi bar du mi 'gro zhes 'khyam zhing 'dug ba ni zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Saṅgha grants him permission to go for forty days, he may go for more than forty days, but he should not go before the forty days have elapsed. If he stays wandering around, he is suspended.

original: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo dge slob ma lnga char kyang zhag bzhi bcur 'gro ba cho ga mtshungs so //
analyzed: dge slong pho mo dang dge sbyong pho mo dge slob ma lnga char kyang zhag bzhi bcur 'gro ba cho ga mtshungs so //
translated: The procedure for the five—fully ordained monks, fully ordained nuns, and male and female novices—to go for forty days is the same.

original: 'di mtshams kyi nang du skye'o //
analyzed: 'di mtshams kyi nang du skye'o //
translated: He is born within this boundary.

original: zhag bzhi bcu'i sngags mnod pa yang tshul du zhugs pa'i gnas nyid nas nod kyi /
analyzed: zhag bzhi bcu'i sngags mnod pa yang tshul du zhugs pa'i gnas nyid nas nod kyi /
translated: The forty-day leave is taken from the very same place where the probationer is staying.

original: gnas gzhan nas nod na sngags byas par mi chud do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan nas nod na sngags byas par mi chud do //
translated: If he takes it from another place, it is not considered to have been taken.

original: dge slong gi mdun du'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du'o //
translated: It is taken in the presence of a fully ordained monk.

original: zhag bzhi bcu'i sngags mnod pa ni bdag gcig pu ma yin gyi dge slong gcig las mnod do //
analyzed: zhag bzhi bcu'i sngags mnod pa ni bdag gcig pu ma yin gyi dge slong gcig las mnod do //
translated: The taking of the vow for forty days is not for oneself alone, but is taken from one monk.

original: dge sbyong dge slong las mnod do //
analyzed: dge sbyong dge slong las mnod do //
translated: The vow is taken from a monk, not from a novice.

original: ma dogs shig ma chud pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: ma dogs shig ma chud pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Do not fear that it will not be taken.🔽Even if one goes forth with the vow taken for seven days, it will not be broken. Do not fear that it will be broken.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste song yang zhig par mi 'gyur te zhig par 'gyur ba ma dogs shig / mur 'dug tu lta ba dbye ba'i phyir dang / mur 'dug gcig la sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad pa na mur 'dug gi chos 'dor zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos la phyogs par 'gyur ba tsam gyi tshod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste song yang zhig par mi 'gyur te zhig par 'gyur ba ma dogs shig / mur 'dug tu lta ba dbye ba'i phyir dang / mur 'dug gcig la sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad pa na mur 'dug gi chos 'dor zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos la phyogs par 'gyur ba tsam gyi tshod na tshul gyi tshe sngags btab ste song yang nyes med /
translated: In order to divide those who are attached to extremes, and in order that when the Buddha's teachings are explained to those who are attached to one extreme, they will abandon the teachings of that extreme and turn to the Buddha's teachings, one may go forth with the vow taken for a period of time.

original: gnyen la bya ba dang / gnyen la chos bshad pa'i phyir dang na ba'i phyir dang sems dga' ba'i phyir ngo phrad du 'gro ba dang / chud pa dang / bdag kha thon dang klog pa la sogs pa don ma chud cing ma go ba go bar bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang /🔽lhag par chung ba /
analyzed: gnyen la bya ba dang / gnyen la chos bshad pa'i phyir dang na ba'i phyir dang sems dga' ba'i phyir ngo phrad du 'gro ba dang / chud pa dang / bdag kha thon dang klog pa la sogs pa don ma chud cing ma go ba go bar bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / lhag par chung ba /
translated: One goes to understand what one has not understood, what one has not grasped, what one is doubtful about, with regard to recitation, reading, etc.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rim pa lta bu gdon mi za ba dang thob par 'gyur ba'i gdeng yod pa'i phyir mkhan po dang slob dpon la nyan du 'gro ba dang / bdag 'dod pa bsal ba'i don du 'gro ba'i phyir de byas na'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rim pa lta bu gdon mi za ba dang thob par 'gyur ba'i gdeng yod pa'i phyir mkhan po dang slob dpon la nyan du 'gro ba dang / bdag 'dod pa bsal ba'i don du 'gro ba'i phyir de byas na'o //
translated: One goes to the preceptor or the master in order to listen to the Dharma, with the intention of obtaining the certainty which is lacking, like the arhat who goes to the assembly of the elders.🔽One goes to dispel one’s own doubts.🔽One goes to the preceptor who is learned in order to resolve one’s doubts.

original: ltung ba sde lnga las the tshom du gyur pa zhig na the tshom bsal ba'i phyir mkhan po mkhas pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang 'di rnams kyi phyir 'gro ba yang zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste song na nyes med do //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga las the tshom du gyur pa zhig na the tshom bsal ba'i phyir mkhan po mkhas pa'i gan du 'gro ba dang 'di rnams kyi phyir 'gro ba yang zhag bdun gyi sngags kyis btab ste song na nyes med do //
translated: One goes for these reasons, but one must return within seven days. If one does not return, one commits a transgression.

original: tshul du zhugs te 'dug ba spang ba mi bya tshul du zhugs ba zla ba gsum gyi tshe dge slong sde lnga las sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba bskrad pa'i rigs pa yang mi bskrad par chad bas mi bcod🔽par brtags te gzhag go //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs te 'dug ba spang ba mi bya tshul du zhugs ba zla ba gsum gyi tshe dge slong sde lnga las sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba bskrad pa'i rigs pa yang mi bskrad par chad bas mi bcod par brtags te gzhag go //
translated: The Buddha said that they should not be expelled, and that they would not be an obstacle to the three month rainy season retreat.🔽In the same way, one should not accept a vow of silence or a vow of silence and silence.

analyzed: de bzhin du chad ba phre'u dang spro ba yang mi @237a * // blang ngo // phas pham pa ni bskrad do // bzhi la sogs par chud do //
translated: One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.

analyzed: tshul gyi tshe zan sbyar gyis 'dug shig ces khas blangs te song na nyes byas par 'gyur ba bzhin du lhung bzed sbyin no zhes bya ba las ma byin pa dang chos gos sbyin no zhes byas pa las song ba dang chos bshad do zhes khas blang pa
translated: One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.

analyzed: las ma song yang nyes byas so //🔽dbyar gyi dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.🔽One should not accept a vow of silence and silence and silence.

original: // / kha rog pa'i yi dam mi bca'/
analyzed: // / kha rog pa'i yi dam mi bca'/
translated: Do not make a vow of silence.

original: mur 'dug gi dka' thub kha rog par 'dug na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur zhes zer ba lta bu kha rog par 'dug pa'i yi dam mi bca' //
analyzed: mur 'dug gi dka' thub kha rog par 'dug na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur zhes zer ba lta bu kha rog par 'dug pa'i yi dam mi bca' //
translated: If you remain silent in the ascetic practice of silence, you will attain nirvana.

original: 'di la zhugs na grol ba gtsang ma bar na sbom po'i nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhugs na grol ba gtsang ma bar na sbom po'i nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If you enter this, you will be liberated.

original: mdo gong ma ltar mi smra ba yang mur 'dug gi dka' thub kyi mi smra bar byas pa lta bu ni dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo gong ma ltar mi smra ba yang mur 'dug gi dka' thub kyi mi smra bar byas pa lta bu ni dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not speak as in the above sutra, and you do not speak as in the ascetic practice of silence, it will be a serious offense of schism.

original: gyi na mi smra bar 'dug par bsams pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: gyi na mi smra bar 'dug par bsams pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: If you think of remaining silent in a frivolous manner, it is an offense.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pas tshul du zhugs pa las dge 'dun gyis dbyung /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pas tshul du zhugs pa las dge 'dun gyis dbyung /
translated: If you enter the way of life through seeing, hearing, or suspecting, the Saṅgha will expel you.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dge 'dun kun la khyed kyis bdag la ltung ba sde lnga las gang yang rung nyes par mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa zhig yod na rgol cig ces skabs phye ba'i sngags 'di byas te dbyung ngo //🔽dbyar gyi mtha' nyin mo'o ;🔽/ tshul nas gnas pa ni tshul snga ma dbyar zla 'bring po nya la zhugs pa ni ston zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dge 'dun kun la khyed kyis bdag la ltung ba sde lnga las gang yang rung nyes par mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pa zhig yod na rgol cig ces skabs phye ba'i sngags 'di byas te dbyung ngo // dbyar gyi mtha' nyin mo'o ; / tshul nas gnas pa ni tshul snga ma dbyar zla 'bring po nya la zhugs pa ni ston zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga 'byung ngo //
translated: “If you see, hear or suspect that I have committed any of the five classes of downfalls, please tell me.”🔽The last day of the rains retreat is the last day of the fourth month.🔽Those who enter the rains retreat on the first day of the middle month of summer emerge on the fifteenth day of the middle month of autumn.

original: tshul phyi ma dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug la zhugs pa ni ston zla tha chungs tshes bco lnga la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul phyi ma dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug la zhugs pa ni ston zla tha chungs tshes bco lnga la 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who enter the rains retreat on the sixteenth day of the last month of summer emerge on the fifteenth day of the last month of autumn.

original: yul zhu ste phyags pa tshun chad zhag 'di tsam na dge 'dun 'byung bar 'gyur gyis khyed zhugs shig / tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag bcu gcig tsam gyi sngon logs su nye 'khor gyi yul mi dang lha 'phangs la sogs pa la 'di tsam na dge 'dun tshul
analyzed: yul zhu ste phyags pa tshun chad zhag 'di tsam na dge 'dun 'byung bar 'gyur gyis khyed zhugs shig / tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag bcu gcig tsam gyi sngon logs su nye 'khor gyi yul mi dang lha 'phangs la sogs pa la 'di tsam na dge 'dun tshul
translated: The monks will arrive in this country in such and such a number of days. You should prepare.

original: nas 'byung gi gtsug lag khang du 'du shig ces bya /
analyzed: nas 'byung gi gtsug lag khang du 'du shig ces bya /
translated: Before the eleven days of the rainy season retreat have passed, the people of the surrounding areas, the gods, and so forth are informed, In such and such a number of days, the monks will arrive in the country. You should gather in the temple.

original: gtsug lag khang brgyan /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brgyan /
translated: The temple is decorated.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe gtsug lag khang brgyan /
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe gtsug lag khang brgyan /
translated: When the rainy season retreat is over, the temple is decorated.

original: khang bu rtseg ma glan /
analyzed: khang bu rtseg ma glan /
translated: The multistoried building is swept.

original: yul bskor ba'i gzugs kyi khang bu sbyar cing bcos /
analyzed: yul bskor ba'i gzugs kyi khang bu sbyar cing bcos /
translated: The building for the circumambulation of the image is repaired and prepared.

original: dri gtsang khang bri /🔽dri gtsang khang la sogs pa'i ri mo bri mchod rten dag phyi zhing bsang /
analyzed: dri gtsang khang bri / dri gtsang khang la sogs pa'i ri mo bri mchod rten dag phyi zhing bsang /
translated: The temple is swept.🔽The temple and so forth are painted. The stupas are cleaned and purified.

original: sku gzugs dang mchod rten la sogs pa lce ti bkru bshal dang phyag bdar @237b bya ;
analyzed: sku gzugs dang mchod rten la sogs pa lce ti bkru bshal dang phyag bdar @237b bya ;
translated: The images, stupas, and so forth are washed and polished.

original: seng ge'i stan brgyan /
analyzed: seng ge'i stan brgyan /
translated: The lion seats are decorated.

original: kha don klog pa'i seng ge'i stan brgyan /
analyzed: kha don klog pa'i seng ge'i stan brgyan /
translated: The lion seats for the recitation of the scriptures are decorated.

original: de ring nub mo thams cad du chos bstan par 'gyur gyis der khyer ba byin cig ces nas yul zhu /
analyzed: de ring nub mo thams cad du chos bstan par 'gyur gyis der khyer ba byin cig ces nas yul zhu /
translated: Today, in the evening, the Dharma will be taught everywhere. Give it to those who are to be taken there.

original: mdo ltag ma rnams ni zhag lnga drug gam bdun nas bya ba'i cho ga 'di rnams ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i snga de nyin nas sbyar zhing bya'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma rnams ni zhag lnga drug gam bdun nas bya ba'i cho ga 'di rnams ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i snga de nyin nas sbyar zhing bya'o //
translated: The upper and lower parts of the country should be given five, six, or seven days to prepare for this ritual. These rituals should be performed from the previous day in accordance with the Vinaya.

original: do mod mtshan rangs kha thon klog cing chos mnyan gyi dge 'dun kun 'dus shig ces bgos te res kyis kha thon byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: do mod mtshan rangs kha thon klog cing chos mnyan gyi dge 'dun kun 'dus shig ces bgos te res kyis kha thon byed du gzhug go //
translated: Tonight, all night long, recite the scriptures and gather the saṅgha to listen to the Dharma. Having thus instructed, they should be made to recite the scriptures in turn.

original: yul mi la sogs pa bsdus te chos nyan du gzhug / mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa la bskos te tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo thams cad du chos bstan pa sbyin du gzhug / kha thon klog tu gzhug pa ni mdo sde dang 'dul🔽ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa la sogs pa las las res kyis nub mo thog thag tu kha thon tu gzhug go //
analyzed: yul mi la sogs pa bsdus te chos nyan du gzhug / mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa la bskos te tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo thams cad du chos bstan pa sbyin du gzhug / kha thon klog tu gzhug pa ni mdo sde dang 'dul🔽ba dang ma lta bu 'dzin pa la sogs pa las las res kyis nub mo thog thag tu kha thon tu gzhug go //
translated: The people of the country and so forth should be gathered and made to listen to the Dharma. Those who uphold the sūtras, the Vinaya, and the mātṛkā should be appointed to teach the Dharma in the evening of the fourteenth day of every month. They should be made to recite the scriptures. Those who uphold the sūtras, the Vinaya, and the mātṛkā and so forth should be made to recite the scriptures in turn every evening.

original: gzhan du yang de dag las kyi tshun chad du chos gdon mi za ba'i gtam gyis nub mo bzla'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de dag las kyi tshun chad du chos gdon mi za ba'i gtam gyis nub mo bzla'o //
translated: Moreover, on the night of the fourteenth, the monks should recite the Dharma, without fail, until the end of the work.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo ni dge skos 'ba' zhig mi nyal gyi dge slong gzhan res kha don klog cing chos bsnyad pa tsam gyis chog gi gzhan ni gnyis kyis mi thub na nyal kyang nyes med /
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshes bcu bzhi'i nub mo ni dge skos 'ba' zhig mi nyal gyi dge slong gzhan res kha don klog cing chos bsnyad pa tsam gyis chog gi gzhan ni gnyis kyis mi thub na nyal kyang nyes med /
translated: On the night of the fourteenth of the waning fortnight, only the monk in charge of the rules should stay awake. The other monks may recite the scriptures and explain the Dharma, but it is sufficient just to do that. If they cannot do both, it is not a fault to sleep.

original: tshes bcu lnga'i nub mo ni thams cad nyal du mi gnang ste chos bsnyad cing 'chad pa'i rjes la tshul nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshes bcu lnga'i nub mo ni thams cad nyal du mi gnang ste chos bsnyad cing 'chad pa'i rjes la tshul nas 'byung ngo //
translated: On the night of the fifteenth, no one is allowed to sleep. After the Dharma has been explained and taught, the rules are recited.

original: skya rengs byung bas mchod pa tshun chad 'byung ba las so //
analyzed: skya rengs byung bas mchod pa tshun chad 'byung ba las so //
translated: This is done until dawn breaks.

original: tshes bco lnga'i nub mo bcu drug gi skya rengs ma byung tshun chad du tshul nas 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshes bco lnga'i nub mo bcu drug gi skya rengs ma byung tshun chad du tshul nas 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: On the night of the fifteenth, the rules are recited until the dawn of the sixteenth.

original: skya rengs byung na las su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skya rengs byung na las su mi rung ngo //
translated: If dawn breaks, it is not suitable to continue.

original: 'byin pa'i dge slong bsko /
analyzed: 'byin pa'i dge slong bsko /
translated: The monk who expounds the rules is appointed.

original: tshul nas 'byin pa'i dge slong sngags 'debs pa su dad pa las bsgo //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byin pa'i dge slong sngags 'debs pa su dad pa las bsgo //
translated: The monks who are to chant the mantra are to be selected by means of a ballot.

original: gcig gis mi nus na du mas kyang ngo //
analyzed: gcig gis mi nus na du mas kyang ngo //
translated: If one is not able to do it, many can do it.

original: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong gcig gis mi chog na du chog par bsko //
analyzed: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong gcig gis mi chog na du chog par bsko //
translated: If one monk chanting the mantra is not sufficient, many are sufficient.

original: phreng las cha char bgos pa yang rigs so //
analyzed: phreng las cha char bgos pa yang rigs so //
translated: It is also appropriate to divide the rosary into parts.

original: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong mang du bskos nas phreng ba pos re re tshan tshan du bskos pa la sngags gdab po zhes skal skal du bsgo //
analyzed: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong mang du bskos nas phreng ba pos re re tshan tshan du bskos pa la sngags gdab po zhes skal skal du bsgo //
translated: If many monks chanting the mantra are appointed, each of the appointed groups should chant the mantra.

original: de 'jag ma'ang brim mo //
analyzed: de 'jag ma'ang brim mo //
translated: They should also distribute the grass.

original: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong gis sngar dge 'dun la rtsva 'jag ma brim mo //
analyzed: sngags 'debs pa'i dge slong gis sngar dge 'dun la rtsva 'jag ma brim mo //
translated: The monk chanting the mantra should first distribute the grass to the saṅgha.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyis dge 'dun la zhu /
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyis dge 'dun la zhu /
translated: Since it is done by means of a ballot, another should request the saṅgha.

original: @238a * // tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe rtsva 'jag ma rims zin nas dge slong su'ang rung las pa gcig gis dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes zhu ba'i sngags bya /
analyzed: @238a * // tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe rtsva 'jag ma rims zin nas dge slong su'ang rung las pa gcig gis dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes zhu ba'i sngags bya /
translated: When the ballot is finished, after the grass has been distributed, a monk who is appointed should request the saṅgha, “Please come out for the ballot.”

original: dge slong so sor tshul nas 'byung ba'i bar du mdun du 'dug go //
analyzed: dge slong so sor tshul nas 'byung ba'i bar du mdun du 'dug go //
translated: The monks should sit in order, facing the door.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar sngags byas pa'i 'og tu dge slong sngags 'debs pa so so mdun mdun du 'dug la rtsva'i tor to las bzung ste sngags bya'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar sngags byas pa'i 'og tu dge slong sngags 'debs pa so so mdun mdun du 'dug la rtsva'i tor to las bzung ste sngags bya'o //
translated: After the formula has been recited, the monks should sit in order, facing the door, and recite the formula while holding the grass ring.

original: so sor sngags shes na rang rang gis bya ste sngags pa dbang du gzhag go //
analyzed: so sor sngags shes na rang rang gis bya ste sngags pa dbang du gzhag go //
translated: If each monk knows the formula, each should recite it himself. The recitation of the formula is not dependent on a single person.

original: de las 'byung bas smra ba lan gsum du'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung bas smra ba lan gsum du'o //
translated: The announcement is made three times, as it appears in the scriptures.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags bya ba ni lan gsum du bzlas so //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags bya ba ni lan gsum du bzlas so //
translated: The recitation of the formula as it appears in the scriptures is done three times.

original: gnyis ni de tsam du /
analyzed: gnyis ni de tsam du /
translated: The other two are done only once.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste rkyen cig byung na sngags lan gnyis btab pas kyang tshul nas 'byung par gyur to //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste rkyen cig byung na sngags lan gnyis btab pas kyang tshul nas 'byung par gyur to //
translated: If any of these monks mentioned by name should happen to have an emergency, the formula is recited twice and he becomes free from the restrictions of the rite.

original: nad pa nad glo bur cig byung ba dang / myos pa dang sems stor te mi dran par gyur pa dang / mal stan gyur pa /
analyzed: nad pa nad glo bur cig byung ba dang / myos pa dang sems stor te mi dran par gyur pa dang / mal stan gyur pa /
translated: If a monk becomes ill, or if he is suddenly possessed by a spirit, or if he loses his mind and becomes unable to remember things, or if his bed and bedding are changed,

original: mal stan zhig bla gab med pa la lus te char gyis ma rung bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: mal stan zhig bla gab med pa la lus te char gyis ma rung bar gyur pa'am /
translated: If the bedding is left out in the open and is ruined by rain,

original: dus 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: dus 'da' ba'am /
translated: or if the time has passed,

original: skya rengs byung du nye ste sngags rdzogs par byar mi khom pa dang / glo bur du byung bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: skya rengs byung du nye ste sngags rdzogs par byar mi khom pa dang / glo bur du byung bar gyur na'o //
translated: or if the dawn is near and there is no opportunity to complete the mantra, or if it occurs suddenly.

original: chu dang me la sogs pa 'phral du glo bur du rkyen cig byung ba dang 'di rnams gang byung yang rung ste sngags lan gnyis btab kyang rung /
analyzed: chu dang me la sogs pa 'phral du glo bur du rkyen cig byung ba dang 'di rnams gang byung yang rung ste sngags lan gnyis btab kyang rung /
translated: If water, fire, and so on suddenly occur, or if any of these occur, it is sufficient to recite the mantra twice.

original: de tsam gyis gcig go //
analyzed: de tsam gyis gcig go //
translated: That much is one.

original: sngags 'debs pa'i tshe rkyen cig byung ste lan gnyis su zlos su yang ma khom na lan gcig gis kyang tshul nas byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags 'debs pa'i tshe rkyen cig byung ste lan gnyis su zlos su yang ma khom na lan gcig gis kyang tshul nas byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If, while reciting the mantra, one is unable to recite it twice due to an obstacle, it is sufficient to recite it once.

original: phreng zad nas de dag phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: phreng zad nas de dag phan tshun du'o //
translated: If the rosary is exhausted, one should start again from the beginning.

original: dge 'dun kun la sngags kyis btab zin nas mjug tu sngags 'debs pa na nang gcig gi mdun du gcig 'dug ste sngags bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun kun la sngags kyis btab zin nas mjug tu sngags 'debs pa na nang gcig gi mdun du gcig 'dug ste sngags bya'o //
translated: If the mantra has already been recited for the entire Saṅgha, and at the end one is reciting the mantra while sitting in front of each individual, it is sufficient to recite it once.

original: med na gzhan las yang rung /
analyzed: med na gzhan las yang rung /
translated: If there is no one else, it is sufficient to recite it from another.

original: sngags 'debs pa gcig tu zad de 'debs ba'i grogs med na dge slong su yang rung gcig gi drung du 'dug ste 'byung ba'i sngags bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'debs pa gcig tu zad de 'debs ba'i grogs med na dge slong su yang rung gcig gi drung du 'dug ste 'byung ba'i sngags bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to help him, he should sit in the presence of any monk and recite the formula for the arising of the earth.

original: dge 'dun thams cad byung ngo zhes de skad du dge 'dun la bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad byung ngo zhes de skad du dge 'dun la bya'o //
translated: The monk who is reciting the formula should say to the Saṅgha, The entire Saṅgha has arisen.

original: kun sngags btab zin nas las byed pa'i dge slong gcig gis dge 'dun thams cad tshul nas byung bar gyur to zhes dge 'dun gyi nang du smra'o //🔽dge bar byung ngo //
analyzed: kun sngags btab zin nas las byed pa'i dge slong gcig gis dge 'dun thams cad tshul nas byung bar gyur to zhes dge 'dun gyi nang du smra'o // dge bar byung ngo //
translated: When the entire Saṅgha has arisen, a monk who is performing the duties of the Saṅgha should announce to the Saṅgha, “The entire Saṅgha has arisen.”🔽“It has arisen well.”

original: shin tu byung ngo zhes thams cad kyis brjod //
analyzed: shin tu byung ngo zhes thams cad kyis brjod //
translated: “It has arisen very well.”

original: mdo ltag ma ltar @238b dge slong gcig gis brjod ma thag tu dge 'dun thams cad kyis dge bar byung ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar @238b dge slong gcig gis brjod ma thag tu dge 'dun thams cad kyis dge bar byung ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: In accordance with the sūtras, as soon as a single monk has said this, the entire Saṅgha should say, “It has arisen well.”

original: gang ci yang khab yan chad bdag gi dngos po 'byung bar gang gis brtsams te de bzung nas dge 'dun las de thob bo //
analyzed: gang ci yang khab yan chad bdag gi dngos po 'byung bar gang gis brtsams te de bzung nas dge 'dun las de thob bo //
translated: “Whatever is mine, even a pin, has arisen. Having taken that, I obtain it from the Saṅgha.”

original: btsun pa dag gis 'di lta bu gzugs kyi dngos pos dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun 'byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: btsun pa dag gis 'di lta bu gzugs kyi dngos pos dbyar gnas pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun 'byung ngo zhes so //
translated: The monks said, This is the kind of material object that will be for the Saṅgha of monks who are staying for the rainy season.

original: dge 'dun tshul nas byung zin nas dge 'dun la yon 'bul ba'i 'os ci yod kyang rung ste dge 'dun la dngos po 'di 'bul na 'os sam rigs sam zhes smras te kha thon du byed byed pa des 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun tshul nas byung zin nas dge 'dun la yon 'bul ba'i 'os ci yod kyang rung ste dge 'dun la dngos po 'di 'bul na 'os sam rigs sam zhes smras te kha thon du byed byed pa des 'bul lo //
translated: After the Saṅgha has left, if there is a suitable recipient for offerings to the Saṅgha, if you say, Is it suitable or proper to offer this object to the Saṅgha? and then recite it, it is offered.

original: dge slong gzhan gyis kyang yon gyi 'os yod na thams cad kyis dbul lo //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyis kyang yon gyi 'os yod na thams cad kyis dbul lo //
translated: If there is a suitable recipient for offerings among the other monks, everyone should offer it.🔽If you say, Is it suitable or proper to accept this offering and object? and the entire Saṅgha remains silent, it is permitted to accept it. Offer it.

original: yon phul zhing dngos po 'di bzhes pa'i rigs sam 'os sam zhes smras te dge 'dun kun kha rog 'khod na bzhes par gnang ba yin te phul cig / de nas dge sbyong dbyung ngo //
analyzed: yon phul zhing dngos po 'di bzhes pa'i rigs sam 'os sam zhes smras te dge 'dun kun kha rog 'khod na bzhes par gnang ba yin te phul cig / de nas dge sbyong dbyung ngo //
translated: Then the ascetics should be dismissed.

original: dge slong rnams tshul nas byung zin pa'i 'og tu dge sbyong rnams la dbyung ba'i sngags bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams tshul nas byung zin pa'i 'og tu dge sbyong rnams la dbyung ba'i sngags bya'o //
translated: After the monks have left, the dismissal mantra should be recited for the ascetics.

original: de nas dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma'o //
translated: Then for the nuns.

original: dge sbyong tshul nas byung zin nas dge sbyong ma rnams sngags byas te tshul nas dbyung ngo //🔽byung ba bzhin du bsngos te song ba tshun chad de dag dbyung ba dang lhan cig byas na'o //🔽tshul nas byung ba'i khar slebs su re ste zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste gud du song song ba las zhag grangs 'khrul te song song ba'i gnas de na dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung zhing 'khod na thal byung tshul nas 'byung ba de ni nang du zhugs🔽te byung yang tshul nas byung bar chud do //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul nas byung zin nas dge sbyong ma rnams sngags byas te tshul nas dbyung ngo // byung ba bzhin du bsngos te song ba tshun chad de dag dbyung ba dang lhan cig byas na'o // tshul nas byung ba'i khar slebs su re ste zhag bdun pa'i sngags kyis btab ste gud du song song ba las zhag grangs 'khrul te song song ba'i gnas de na dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung zhing 'khod na thal byung tshul nas 'byung ba de ni nang du zhugs te byung yang tshul nas byung bar chud do //
translated: After the monks have left, the nuns should be consecrated and leave.🔽If they leave in the same way, they should leave together.🔽If they leave after the monks, they should leave after the monks have left for seven days.

original: de ltar tshul nas byung ste slar song song ba las bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun tshul nas byung ba yang slebs na de'i nang du na bdag tshul nas 'byung mi dgos so //🔽bud med dang gyur pa ni ma yin /

original: dge slong bud med kyi mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba dang dge slong ma'i mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba'i byung bar mi chud do //
analyzed: dge slong bud med kyi mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba dang dge slong ma'i mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba'i byung bar mi chud do //
translated: A monk does not understand the origination of a rule in the presence of a woman, nor does a nun understand the origination of a rule in the presence of a monk.

original: dge slong ma'ang dge slong ma grogs kyi mdun du tshul nas byung bar mi chud kyi dge slong gi mdun du gnyis kas rtsa las bzung ste sngags bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'ang dge slong ma grogs kyi mdun du tshul nas byung bar mi chud kyi dge slong gi mdun du gnyis kas rtsa las bzung ste sngags bya'o //
translated: A nun does not understand the origination of a rule in the presence of a nun friend, but both understand it in the presence of a monk.

original: gnas par mi nus na gang bskrad pa'i dge slong la bya ste 'dus nas dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par mi nus na gang bskrad pa'i dge slong la bya ste 'dus nas dbyung ba'o //
translated: If one is unable to live there, one should expel the monk who is the cause of the schism.

original: dge slong ma dge slong pha'i mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags byed byed pa @239a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma dge slong pha'i mdun du tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags byed byed pa @239a * //

analyzed: las dge slong de mo mtshan du gyur na tshul nas 'byung bar mi chud de gzhan gcig gi mdun du sngags bya'o //

original: dbyar gyi bar bya bar 'gro na phyung ste'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi bar bya bar 'gro na phyung ste'o //
translated: If one goes to a place where one is able to live, one should expel the monk.

original: dge slong la rkyen cig byung ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag dus su sdod du mi khom na dge 'dun la gsol te tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags byas te song na byung bar chud do //
analyzed: dge slong la rkyen cig byung ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag dus su sdod du mi khom na dge 'dun la gsol te tshul nas 'byung ba'i sngags byas te song na byung bar chud do //
translated: If a condition arises for a fully ordained monk, and he is not free to stay for the number of days specified in the Vinaya, if he requests the Saṅgha and goes after reciting the Vinaya passage, he does not violate the Vinaya.

original: dngos po dang gang zag dang gnyis ka gzhag ste na yang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po dang gang zag dang gnyis ka gzhag ste na yang ngo //
translated: Even if the matter, the person, or both are set aside.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhig byung ba dang spang ba ltung ba 'phral la mthol du mi bde ba ni brtags te bzhag pa yin pas skabs dbye ba la ma gtogs te gzhan nyes par mthong ba dang dogs pa dang thos pa ci yod pa rgol cig ces
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma zhig byung ba dang spang ba ltung ba 'phral la mthol du mi bde ba ni brtags te bzhag pa yin pas skabs dbye ba la ma gtogs te gzhan nyes par mthong ba dang dogs pa dang thos pa ci yod pa rgol cig ces
translated: If a partial defeat of the Saṅgha occurs, and it is not convenient to confess the downfall immediately, it is to be set aside after examination. Therefore, except for the occasion of granting permission, one should say, “Whatever faults you see, suspect, or have heard about, speak out.”

original: bya ste skabs dbye'o //
analyzed: bya ste skabs dbye'o //
translated: Thus permission is granted.

original: 'di la khas blang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la khas blang ngo //
translated: Here, one should agree.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gsol ba la dge 'dun gyis kho'i sems bsrung zhing dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar rung ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gsol ba la dge 'dun gyis kho'i sems bsrung zhing dga' bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar rung ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: In the request according to the latter sūtra, the Saṅgha should say, “It is suitable to do so” in order to protect the mind of that monk and make him happy.

original: bzhag pa yang tha ma ma yin pa las bskos te'o//
analyzed: bzhag pa yang tha ma ma yin pa las bskos te'o//
translated: Also, setting aside is done after appointing someone other than the last one.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe phas pham pa ni ma gtogs te gzhan ltung ba sde lnga las skabs phye ba yin gyis rgol cig ces zer na phas pham pa brtags cing gzhag tu mi gnang ste bskrad do //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe phas pham pa ni ma gtogs te gzhan ltung ba sde lnga las skabs phye ba yin gyis rgol cig ces zer na phas pham pa brtags cing gzhag tu mi gnang ste bskrad do //
translated: When it is a case of a monk who has committed a downfall, if he says, “Let us debate whether you should be expelled or not, except for the case of a defeating offense,” he should not be allowed to remain and be examined for a defeating offense, but should be expelled.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag cag 'di'i phyir ni 'dus shing tshogs pa yin te de lta mod kyi tshe dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang gang zag kyang gzhag par ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag cag 'di'i phyir ni 'dus shing tshogs pa yin te de lta mod kyi tshe dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang gang zag kyang gzhag par ro //
translated: If he says, “Venerables, we have gathered here for this purpose, but let us also discuss the matter of the venerable’s possessions and person,”

original: ltag nas 'byung ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang spang ba'i ltung ba 'phral du mthol du mi bde ste brtags te gzhag pa ma gtogs par gzhan ltung ba sde lnga las rgol cig par skabs 'byed cing 'ong zhing gsol du 'ong ste ltung ba dang lhag ma
analyzed: ltag nas 'byung ba dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang spang ba'i ltung ba 'phral du mthol du mi bde ste brtags te gzhag pa ma gtogs par gzhan ltung ba sde lnga las rgol cig par skabs 'byed cing 'ong zhing gsol du 'ong ste ltung ba dang lhag ma
translated: and if it is a case of a monk who has committed a partial defeat or a downfall that must be confessed to the monastic community, if he says, “Let us debate whether you should be expelled or not, except for the case of a downfall that must be confessed immediately,” he should not be allowed to remain and be examined, but should be expelled.

original: brtag cing dbang 'jug pa lags na dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par bgyir ci gnang zhes zer na dge 'dun gyis kyang deng 'dus pa khyod kyi don dang dbang du bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa ma yin mod kyi khyed nyes pa gzhan la skabs phye zhing dmigs kyis phye
analyzed: brtag cing dbang 'jug pa lags na dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par bgyir ci gnang zhes zer na dge 'dun gyis kyang deng 'dus pa khyod kyi don dang dbang du bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa ma yin mod kyi khyed nyes pa gzhan la skabs phye zhing dmigs kyis phye
translated: If the Saṅgha allows it, the Saṅgha should say, “We are not gathered today for your sake or for the sake of taking control. However, you have opened the door to other faults and you have not immediately confessed them.

original: ba 'phral du mthol du mi bde ste dpang du mkhyen par bya bar gsol /
analyzed: ba 'phral du mthol du mi bde ste dpang du mkhyen par bya bar gsol /
translated: We request to know you as a witness.

original: dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par bya zhing gang zag de tshul nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par bya zhing gang zag de tshul nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The Saṅgha should know you and you should be expelled from the community.”🔽“In order to purify morality, one should perform poṣadha. In order to purify the Dharma, one should be expelled.”

original: de ltar tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ni gso sbyong chos rnam par dag par bya'i phyir ni dbyung ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das gsungs kyis 'on te 'dod na dbyung ngo @239b zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ni gso sbyong chos rnam par dag par bya'i phyir ni dbyung ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das gsungs kyis 'on te 'dod na dbyung ngo @239b zhes so //
