original: mdo ltag ma ltar lhag ma dang ltung ba brtags te dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par byas nas tshul nas dbyung ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na nyes pa yod pa'i mi de nyid ltung ba sde lnga las nyes pa tshangs shing byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir tshul khrims🔽rnam bar dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar lhag ma dang ltung ba brtags te dge 'dun gyis mkhyen par byas nas tshul nas dbyung ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na nyes pa yod pa'i mi de nyid ltung ba sde lnga las nyes pa tshangs shing byang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir tshul khrims rnam bar dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In one way, it is called pure ethics because the person with faults is purified and cleansed of faults from among the five classes of downfalls.

original: gang zag de nyid don du 'gyur ba dang nyes pa brtags te gzhag na dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung ba'i las su rung ba'i phyir chos rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag de nyid don du 'gyur ba dang nyes pa brtags te gzhag na dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung ba'i las su rung ba'i phyir chos rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In another way, it is called pure Dharma because the saṅgha is suitable for the rite of expulsion for the benefit of the person and for the sake of examining faults and then leaving the person.

original: dge 'dun gyi don yang yin pas don 'di rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir dge 'dun gyis shes par gyis la brtag pa rtogs te tshul byung cig ces zhal nas gsungs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi don yang yin pas don 'di rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir dge 'dun gyis shes par gyis la brtag pa rtogs te tshul byung cig ces zhal nas gsungs so //
translated: Since it is also for the benefit of the saṅgha, the Buddha said, “The saṅgha should understand and examine this and expel the person.”

original: gang zag gzhag pa dang don gyir ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gang zag gzhag pa dang don gyir ma yin no zhes so //
translated: It is not for the sake of the person.

original: don gzhag pa dang gang zag kyang ngo //
analyzed: don gzhag pa dang gang zag kyang ngo //
translated: It is for the sake of the person and for the sake of the saṅgha.

original: gzhag par ram mi gzhag pa'i phyir khas blangs pa las bsnyon na khas blangs pa zhig ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhag par ram mi gzhag pa'i phyir khas blangs pa las bsnyon na khas blangs pa zhig ma yin no //
translated: If one denies having committed an offense after having admitted it, one is not guilty of lying, because one has not admitted it.🔽When one is guilty of a pārājika or a saṃghāvaśeṣa, one should not immediately confess it, but should inform the saṃgha and be examined.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dge slong lhag ma dang ltung ba yod de 'phral du mthol du mi bde bar dge 'dun la mkhyen par bya ste brtags te bzhag pa'i 'og tu phyis bsnyon te mthol tshangs dang chad pa byed du mi btub na kho bsnyon te med
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe dge slong lhag ma dang ltung ba yod de 'phral du mthol du mi bde bar dge 'dun la mkhyen par bya ste brtags te bzhag pa'i 'og tu phyis bsnyon te mthol tshangs dang chad pa byed du mi btub na kho bsnyon te med
translated: If, after the offense has been determined, one later denies it and cannot be made to confess it, one should not be made to confess it.

original: cing ma mthong mi shes zer ba mi brtsan gyi thog ma dge 'dun thams cad mkhyen par byas pa brtsan gyis dge 'dun thams cad kyis mthol du gzhug cing mthol tshangs dang chad pa byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: cing ma mthong mi shes zer ba mi brtsan gyi thog ma dge 'dun thams cad mkhyen par byas pa brtsan gyis dge 'dun thams cad kyis mthol du gzhug cing mthol tshangs dang chad pa byed du gzhug go //
translated: One should not rely on the words “I do not see it, I do not know it,” but one should rely on the fact that one has informed the entire saṃgha.

original: ci ltar byed du gzhug pa'i thabs 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: ci ltar byed du gzhug pa'i thabs 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The method of how to do this is explained below.

original: 'di skad kyi tshul du cung zad kyang med cing smra ba ni 'di 'am sngon gyi brdzun no //
analyzed: 'di skad kyi tshul du cung zad kyang med cing smra ba ni 'di 'am sngon gyi brdzun no //
translated: In this way, one should not say anything at all, because this is a lie, either now or in the past.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dge 'dun gyis lhag ma dang spang ba'i ltung ba yod de dge 'dun la brtags te gzhag la /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar dge 'dun gyis lhag ma dang spang ba'i ltung ba yod de dge 'dun la brtags te gzhag la /
translated: The Vinaya is like the back of a mirror, in that it is to be set aside after examining the Saṅgha.🔽This accusation is a single downfall of a fully ordained monk, and a single downfall of lying, and a single downfall of accusation.

original: bsnyon pa 'di dge slong de sngar dge 'dun la brtags te gzhag la phyis bsnyon pa'i brdzun gyis ltung ba gcig dang 'phral du bris pa na bsnyon pa'i ltung ba gcig dang gnyis yod de thog ma rtogs pa'i tshe dge slong su su 'dug 'dug pa kun bsdus
analyzed: bsnyon pa 'di dge slong de sngar dge 'dun la brtags te gzhag la phyis bsnyon pa'i brdzun gyis ltung ba gcig dang 'phral du bris pa na bsnyon pa'i ltung ba gcig dang gnyis yod de thog ma rtogs pa'i tshe dge slong su su 'dug 'dug pa kun bsdus
translated: When the first is understood, all the fully ordained monks who are present are gathered together,

analyzed: te mngon sum du rmas la shags kyis thub par byas la chad pas bcad do //
translated: and they are questioned face to face, and the case is decided by majority vote.

original: chad pa byed du ma btub na bskrad do //
analyzed: chad pa byed du ma btub na bskrad do //
translated: If the case cannot be decided, the monk is expelled.

original: de ste thab mo pa'i dge slong dag 'ong bar tshul du zhugs pa thos nas gso sbyong gnyis sam gsum 'das na dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de ste thab mo pa'i dge slong dag 'ong bar tshul du zhugs pa thos nas gso sbyong gnyis sam gsum 'das na dbyung ngo //
translated: If the fully ordained monks who are disputing have gone away, and if it is heard that they have entered a state of peace, then the monk is expelled after two or three poṣadhas.

analyzed: dge 'dun tshul nas 'byung ba'i dge slong pha ma rungs pa @240a * //
translated: If the fully ordained monks who are expelled from the Saṅgha are wicked,

original: dag cig grogs gcig ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ltung ba sde lnga las rgol cig phar skabs 'byed pa'i rigs kyi de'i khar skur ba btab la bskur te dkrug go zhes zer ba gcig thos na 'byung ba'i zhag dus las zla ba gcig gcig sngar bsdums te
analyzed: dag cig grogs gcig ste tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ltung ba sde lnga las rgol cig phar skabs 'byed pa'i rigs kyi de'i khar skur ba btab la bskur te dkrug go zhes zer ba gcig thos na 'byung ba'i zhag dus las zla ba gcig gcig sngar bsdums te
translated: If one makes peace with the quarreler, the downfalls will arise after one and a half months.

original: 'byung ngo // de ltar bsdums kyang thab mo pa de 'ong zhing slebs par 'gyur na zla ba phyed dang gnyis kyis kyang sngar bsdums te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // de ltar bsdums kyang thab mo pa de 'ong zhing slebs par 'gyur na zla ba phyed dang gnyis kyis kyang sngar bsdums te 'byung ngo //
translated: If one does not make peace, but the quarreler comes and arrives, the downfalls will arise after one month.🔽If one does not make peace, but the quarreler does not come, the downfalls will arise after one month.🔽If one does not make peace, but the quarreler comes quickly, the downfalls will arise after one month.

original: de ltar byas kyang myur du 'ong na tshul zla ba gcig bsrungs bas chog gi zla ba gcig gis bsdums te byung yang tshul du chud de de ltar sngar byung yang bsrung ba ni zla ba gsum thang bzhin du bsrung ngo ;
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang myur du 'ong na tshul zla ba gcig bsrungs bas chog gi zla ba gcig gis bsdums te byung yang tshul du chud de de ltar sngar byung yang bsrung ba ni zla ba gsum thang bzhin du bsrung ngo ;
translated: If one makes peace, but the quarreler comes, the downfalls will arise after three months.

original: / yon tan yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: / yon tan yang 'thob bo //
translated: One will also obtain good qualities.

original: de ltar byas na phyis 'thab mo ba 'ongs su zin kyang skabs mi 'byed pas klan ka mi rnyed do //
analyzed: de ltar byas na phyis 'thab mo ba 'ongs su zin kyang skabs mi 'byed pas klan ka mi rnyed do //
translated: If one acts in this way, then even if the army arrives later, they will not find an opportunity to cause trouble.

original: mi grub na dkyil 'khor lnga'am drug bsngo //🔽mdo ltag ma ltar bslabs bsdums su zhag dus med de tshul nas 'byung kar 'thab mo ba'i dge slong 'ong bar thos na dge 'dun myur du 'dus la /
analyzed: mi grub na dkyil 'khor lnga'am drug bsngo // mdo ltag ma ltar bslabs bsdums su zhag dus med de tshul nas 'byung kar 'thab mo ba'i dge slong 'ong bar thos na dge 'dun myur du 'dus la /
translated: If one cannot do this, then one should consecrate five or six maṇḍalas.🔽There is no fixed number of days for the reconciliation of the Saṅgha as in the case of the Saṅgha of the sūtra.

original: mtshams chen po khrol la mtshams bu chung lnga'am drug 'phral la bcad do //
analyzed: mtshams chen po khrol la mtshams bu chung lnga'am drug 'phral la bcad do //
translated: If one hears that a monk who is fighting is coming, then the Saṅgha should quickly assemble, open the great boundary, and immediately cut the small boundary into five or six parts.

original: mtshams bu chung ci bya ba na 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: mtshams bu chung ci bya ba na 'og nas 'chad /
translated: What should be done with the small boundaries will be explained below.

original: tshig 'jam po dang bsu nas lhung bzed dang chos gos dang bsti stang dang khang bu dang lnga khang dang khang bu brtseg ma bsngo /
analyzed: tshig 'jam po dang bsu nas lhung bzed dang chos gos dang bsti stang dang khang bu dang lnga khang dang khang bu brtseg ma bsngo /
translated: One should consecrate the five things: the alms bowl, the Dharma robes, respect, the hut, and the multi-storied building, with gentle words and welcome.

original: ltag ma ltar mtshams bu chung bcad zin nas 'thab mo pa 'ong ba la bsu zhing tshig 'dzam po la gtam bya zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshul bzhin du blangs pa gnas khang khyams la sogs pa yang bsngo zhing sbyin no //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar mtshams bu chung bcad zin nas 'thab mo pa 'ong ba la bsu zhing tshig 'dzam po la gtam bya zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshul bzhin du blangs pa gnas khang khyams la sogs pa yang bsngo zhing sbyin no //
translated: When the boundary has been established like the back of a tortoise, one should welcome the combatant, speak with him, and properly receive his alms bowl, Dharma robes, and so forth. One should also offer and give his dwelling place, courtyard, and so forth.

original: khrus dang snum thob par bya /
analyzed: khrus dang snum thob par bya /
translated: One should give him a bath and oil.

original: 'thab mo pa 'ongs pa la khrus bya zhing lus mnyed pa la sogs pa bya /
analyzed: 'thab mo pa 'ongs pa la khrus bya zhing lus mnyed pa la sogs pa bya /
translated: When the combatant arrives, one should give him a bath and massage his body.

original: lus bsku ba'i snum dang kha zas kyang sbyin /
analyzed: lus bsku ba'i snum dang kha zas kyang sbyin /
translated: One should also give him oil for anointing his body and food.

original: chos snyan pa sbyin pa bdag gi bsu bar bya /
analyzed: chos snyan pa sbyin pa bdag gi bsu bar bya /
translated: One should give him pleasant Dharma teachings and welcome him.

original: 'thab mo ba 'ongs pa de dang chos bsnyad cing gtam la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: 'thab mo ba 'ongs pa de dang chos bsnyad cing gtam la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: When the combatant arrives, one should speak Dharma with him and engage in conversation.

original: dum zhing mgu ba'i tshul du bya /
analyzed: dum zhing mgu ba'i tshul du bya /
translated: One should do so in a manner that is measured and pleasing.

original: ma grub na bdag cag gi gso sbyong dkyil 'khor du bya /
analyzed: ma grub na bdag cag gi gso sbyong dkyil 'khor du bya /
translated: If he is not accomplished, one should perform the poṣadha in the maṇḍala of us.

original: mdo ltag ma rnams ltar byas te bzhag pa las gud du 'dong dum btub na mdo gsum gyi ltag nas mtshams bu chung bcad de gzhag par bshad pa'i mtshams bu chung bcad de so sor dge slong lnga lnga'am drug drug tu yod pa dong ste 'thab mo pa
analyzed: mdo ltag ma rnams ltar byas te bzhag pa las gud du 'dong dum btub na mdo gsum gyi ltag nas mtshams bu chung bcad de gzhag par bshad pa'i mtshams bu chung bcad de so sor dge slong lnga lnga'am drug drug tu yod pa dong ste 'thab mo pa
translated: If it is not possible to separate the monks into three groups, then the monks should be divided into two groups, and the confession ceremony should be performed in the two groups.

original: las dad pa'ang blangs te gso sbyong bya'o //🔽khyed de @240b ring dbyung ba ma yin nam zhes zer na tshe dang ldan pa sdod cig khyod ni 'ong ba ste don 'di ni gnas pa'o zhes sgo shig / mdo ltag ma ltar gso sbyong byed pa 'thab mo pa na re dus kyis tshul nas dbyung ba
analyzed: las dad pa'ang blangs te gso sbyong bya'o // khyed de @240b ring dbyung ba ma yin nam zhes zer na tshe dang ldan pa sdod cig khyod ni 'ong ba ste don 'di ni gnas pa'o zhes sgo shig / mdo ltag ma ltar gso sbyong byed pa 'thab mo pa na re dus kyis tshul nas dbyung ba
translated: If the monks of the first group have not finished the ceremony when the monks of the second group arrive, the latter should not disturb the former.🔽If the monks of the second group ask, “Are you not taking too long?” the monks of the first group should reply, “Venerables, please wait. You have just arrived. This matter is a long-standing one.”

original: yin na ci'i phyir gso sbyong byed ces 'dri na khyed cig gsar du 'ongs pa yin te rgyus mi shes kyi /
analyzed: yin na ci'i phyir gso sbyong byed ces 'dri na khyed cig gsar du 'ongs pa yin te rgyus mi shes kyi /
translated: If the monks who are fighting say, “We are being expelled because of the time,” and ask, “Why are you performing the poṣadha?” the monks who are performing the poṣadha should reply, “You are new and do not know the circumstances.

original: las ji ltar bya ba dge sbyong gzhi la 'khod pa shes te dri mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: las ji ltar bya ba dge sbyong gzhi la 'khod pa shes te dri mi dgos kyi /
translated: The monks who are settled in the basic training know how to perform the poṣadha. There is no need to ask them.”

original: zas dang khang bu la sogs pa ci 'dod pa nged la nos la rtsi dgos pa la sogs pa long la 'dug shig ces bsgo /
analyzed: zas dang khang bu la sogs pa ci 'dod pa nged la nos la rtsi dgos pa la sogs pa long la 'dug shig ces bsgo /
translated: They should be told, Take from us whatever you want, such as food, houses, and so on. You should stay and take what you need.

original: 'das na dbyung ngo //
analyzed: 'das na dbyung ngo //
translated: If they do not leave, they should be expelled.

original: thabs gong ma rnams ltar byas nas slar 'dong nas slar mi ldog pa tsam gyi tshod na 'dus te tshul nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thabs gong ma rnams ltar byas nas slar 'dong nas slar mi ldog pa tsam gyi tshod na 'dus te tshul nas 'byung ngo //
translated: If they return after having acted according to the above methods, they should be admitted back into the order as soon as it is clear that they will not return to their former ways.

original: thab mo pa dong nas tshul mi 'byung ste tshul yang zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: thab mo pa dong nas tshul mi 'byung ste tshul yang zhig pa yin no //
translated: If they do not return to their former ways, they should be expelled from the order.

original: 'byung ba'i dngos po 'khon pa bshags pa ma byas par mi dbyung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dngos po 'khon pa bshags pa ma byas par mi dbyung ngo //
translated: The expulsion of a monk who has been involved in a dispute is not lifted until he has confessed his offense.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba ni gcig la gcig skabs phye ste rgol du bcug la 'khon bshags te tshul nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba ni gcig la gcig skabs phye ste rgol du bcug la 'khon bshags te tshul nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The expulsion of a monk who has been involved in a dispute is lifted when the monks who expelled him say to him, We give you permission to return to the order.

original: de'i dus ni nyi ma bcu'am zla ba phyed na 'byung ba na'o //🔽'khon bshags shing bzod pa gsol ba ni zhag bcu tsam gyi mdun nas gcig la gcig bzod par gsol zhing mgu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus ni nyi ma bcu'am zla ba phyed na 'byung ba na'o //🔽'khon bshags shing bzod pa gsol ba ni zhag bcu tsam gyi mdun nas gcig la gcig bzod par gsol zhing mgu bar bya'o //
translated: This may happen after ten days or half a month.🔽The monks who have expelled him should say to him, We give you permission to return to the order.

original: bdun nam brgyad do zhes gzhan dag las so //
analyzed: bdun nam brgyad do zhes gzhan dag las so //
translated: Others say seven or eight days.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re zhag bdun nam brgyad kyi snga logs su 'khon bshags kyang nyes med /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re zhag bdun nam brgyad kyi snga logs su 'khon bshags kyang nyes med /
translated: Some Vinaya masters say that if one confesses the dispute seven or eight days before, there is no fault.

original: 'dus par ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus par ma yin no //
translated: But not in the assembly.

original: dge slong bdag dang 'khon yod pa zhig na mi mang po'i khrod du mi bya'i lkog tu kho gcig pu la bzod par gsol lo //
analyzed: dge slong bdag dang 'khon yod pa zhig na mi mang po'i khrod du mi bya'i lkog tu kho gcig pu la bzod par gsol lo //
translated: If a monk has a dispute with another, he should not do it in the midst of many people, but secretly he should request forgiveness from that one alone.

original: 'dus pa'i spyir yang spyi'i bzod pa gsol /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i spyir yang spyi'i bzod pa gsol /
translated: And in the assembly, he should request forgiveness from the assembly.

original: des kyang ma bzod par ma yin no //
analyzed: des kyang ma bzod par ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that he should not forgive.🔽He should request forgiveness from the one with whom he has a dispute, as if he were a friend.

original: 'khon yod pa la mdo ltag ma ltar bzod pa gsol zhing 'og nas dge slong des kyang bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khon yod pa la mdo ltag ma ltar bzod pa gsol zhing 'og nas dge slong des kyang bzod par bya'o //
translated: And from below, that monk should also forgive.

original: mgu ba ma byas kyi bar du tshogs pa thams cad kyis kyang de'i tshe mi bya'o //
analyzed: mgu ba ma byas kyi bar du tshogs pa thams cad kyis kyang de'i tshe mi bya'o //
translated: Until he is satisfied, all the assembly should also not do it at that time.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag bcu'i mdun nas gcig la gcig 'khon bshags shing bzod pa ma gsol na tshul nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i zhag bcu'i mdun nas gcig la gcig 'khon bshags shing bzod pa ma gsol na tshul nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not confess the dispute and request forgiveness from each other before the ten days of the purification ceremony have passed, it will not be purified.

original: bzod pa gsol ba ni gzhon rims kyis rgan rims la gsol gzhon nu la yus yod na rgan pos kyang gzhon nu la gsol /
analyzed: bzod pa gsol ba ni gzhon rims kyis rgan rims la gsol gzhon nu la yus yod na rgan pos kyang gzhon nu la gsol /
translated: Requesting forbearance is that the junior request forbearance from the senior. If the junior has pride, the senior requests forbearance from the junior.

original: khros pas yang ma bzod par ma yin /
analyzed: khros pas yang ma bzod par ma yin /
translated: It is not that one requests forbearance from one who is angry and has not yet been pacified.

original: dge slong gzhan gyis bdag la nyes pa la sogs pa byas te phyis mthol tshang byed cing bzod pa la @241a * //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyis bdag la nyes pa la sogs pa byas te phyis mthol tshang byed cing bzod pa la @241a * //
translated: If another bhikṣu has committed an offense against oneself and so on, and later confesses and requests forbearance, one should grant forbearance.

original: gsol du 'ongs na bzod pa byin cig / ltag tu mdo 'di 'dra ba cig byung ba ni tshul gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: gsol du 'ongs na bzod pa byin cig / ltag tu mdo 'di 'dra ba cig byung ba ni tshul gyi tshe'o //
translated: If a similar sūtra occurs later, it is the time of the rule.

original: 'di ni nam yang rung ste 'dra bar bya ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nam yang rung ste 'dra bar bya ba la bya'o //
translated: This is always suitable, and it should be done in a similar way.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma gnas kyi phyi rol du ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma gnas kyi phyi rol du ma yin /
translated: It is not that a bhikṣu or bhikṣuṇī requests forbearance outside the residence.

original: dge slong mas dge slong pha la bzod pa gsol ba ni gar bab bab tu lam kha la sogs par bzod pa gsol ba ma yin dbyar mo thang du bkug ste bzod pa gsol ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong pha la bzod pa gsol ba ni gar bab bab tu lam kha la sogs par bzod pa gsol ba ma yin dbyar mo thang du bkug ste bzod pa gsol ba ma yin gyi /
translated: When a bhikṣuṇī requests forbearance from a bhikṣu, it is not that she requests forbearance on the road and so on wherever she happens to be. It is not that she requests forbearance by summoning him to the summer retreat.

original: dge slong pha'i gtsug lag khang du song la bzod bar gsol lo //
analyzed: dge slong pha'i gtsug lag khang du song la bzod bar gsol lo //
translated: She should go to the bhikṣu's monastery and request forbearance.

original: rkang pa la yang mi gtugs /
analyzed: rkang pa la yang mi gtugs /
translated: One should not touch the feet.

original: dge slong mas dge slong pha la bzod pa gsol ba ni rkang pa nas bzung la bzod pa mi gsol gyi /
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong pha la bzod pa gsol ba ni rkang pa nas bzung la bzod pa mi gsol gyi /
translated: When a nun requests forgiveness from a monk, she should not hold his feet while requesting forgiveness.

original: 'dom gang tsam du 'dug la dgus te bzod pa bgyir ci gnang zhes gsol lo //
analyzed: 'dom gang tsam du 'dug la dgus te bzod pa bgyir ci gnang zhes gsol lo //
translated: She should stand one cubit away and say, “Please forgive me.”

original: bzod pa bgyi 'tshal te 'gro //
analyzed: bzod pa bgyi 'tshal te 'gro //
translated: “I should request forgiveness,” and go.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gsol te bzod par gnang na gdong dpral ba gtugs te phyag bya /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gsol te bzod par gnang na gdong dpral ba gtugs te phyag bya /
translated: If forgiveness is granted, she should bow her forehead to his feet.

original: 'di 'chags na bsti star med par mi 'gro //
analyzed: 'di 'chags na bsti star med par mi 'gro //
translated: If she confesses this, she should not go without permission.

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar dge slong ma bzod pa gsol du 'ongs na dge slong gis kyang bzod pa gsol du mi gzhug pa'am bdag byol te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar dge slong ma bzod pa gsol du 'ongs na dge slong gis kyang bzod pa gsol du mi gzhug pa'am bdag byol te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: If a nun comes to request forgiveness in the manner of the two sutras, the monk should not make her request forgiveness or go away himself.

original: mi bsgom gsol te gshegs pa la sngon du shes pas so //
analyzed: mi bsgom gsol te gshegs pa la sngon du shes pas so //
translated: If she does not meditate, she should go after requesting permission.

original: dge slong grogs la bzod pa gsol du song song ba las /
analyzed: dge slong grogs la bzod pa gsol du song song ba las /
translated: When a monk goes to request forgiveness from his companions,

original: ma btub na de dang su mtha' ba'i gan du song la /
analyzed: ma btub na de dang su mtha' ba'i gan du song la /
translated: if he is unable to, he should go to someone nearby🔽and say,

original: bzod par byos shig ces gros 'debs su bcug la de nas bzod pa gsol /
analyzed: bzod par byos shig ces gros 'debs su bcug la de nas bzod pa gsol /
translated: Then, one should request forgiveness.

original: ma dad na thabs btsal mi bsgrub par mi bya /
analyzed: ma dad na thabs btsal mi bsgrub par mi bya /
translated: If one is not faithful, one should not fail to practice the means of achieving it.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar thabs bya ste /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar thabs bya ste /
translated: One should practice the means as in the Sutra of the Crest of the Vajra Peak.

original: yang bzod par ma btub na /
analyzed: yang bzod par ma btub na /
translated: If one is still unable to forgive,

original: sngon kho la gnod pa dang nyes pa byas pa ci yod pa brtags te /
analyzed: sngon kho la gnod pa dang nyes pa byas pa ci yod pa brtags te /
translated: one should examine what harm and what offense the other has done to oneself in the past.

original: nyes pa zhig yod na de yang dmigs nas bshags nges bzod par gsol lo //
analyzed: nyes pa zhig yod na de yang dmigs nas bshags nges bzod par gsol lo //
translated: If there is an offense, one should also visualize it and confess it, definitely requesting forgiveness.

original: ring por ma thogs pa'o //
analyzed: ring por ma thogs pa'o //
translated: It is not for a long time.

original: nyes pa byas shing 'khon pa zhig yod na lo'am zla bar gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa byas shing 'khon pa zhig yod na lo'am zla bar gzhag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If there is an offense and a grudge, it is not left for a year or a month.

original: myur du mthol zhing bzod par gsol lo //
analyzed: myur du mthol zhing bzod par gsol lo //
translated: One should quickly confess and request forgiveness.

original: khros ma thag tu ma yin te bsdad /
analyzed: khros ma thag tu ma yin te bsdad /
translated: It is not immediately after one is angry, but one should wait.

original: myur du bzod pa gsol ba yang 'phral du 'khrug pa ma zhib la mi gsol gyi zhi nas gsol lo //
analyzed: myur du bzod pa gsol ba yang 'phral du 'khrug pa ma zhib la mi gsol gyi zhi nas gsol lo //
translated: It is not that one quickly requests forgiveness, but one should request it after the quarrel has subsided.

original: 'chags pa'i tshe mi bzod par mi bya /
analyzed: 'chags pa'i tshe mi bzod par mi bya /
translated: When one confesses, one should not be unforgiving.

original: gcig la gcig 'chags shing bzod pa gsol ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'chags shing bzod pa gsol ba'i tshe /
translated: When one confesses and requests forgiveness from each other,

original: sems las 'khon ma btang zhing /
analyzed: sems las 'khon ma btang zhing /
translated: one should not harbor a grudge in one's mind.🔽 🔽One should not be unforgiving.

original: khas bzod cing 'jam por bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khas bzod cing 'jam por bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not to be endured or tolerated with the body,

original: sems kyis kyang @241b bzod par byas te gsol lo //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang @241b bzod par byas te gsol lo //
translated: but it is to be endured and requested with the mind.

original: phran tshegs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs su chud pa'o //
translated: This is the minor part.

original: dbyung ba'i dngos po rdzogs so /🔽// / drub pa gding /
analyzed: dbyung ba'i dngos po rdzogs so / // / drub pa gding /
translated: The section on the things to be removed is complete.🔽The section on the mat

original: tshul nas byung ba drub gding ste /
analyzed: tshul nas byung ba drub gding ste /
translated: The mat is what comes from the mat-making grass.

original: chos gos smad gsum slob pa'i nang du bting la gzhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos smad gsum slob pa'i nang du bting la gzhag pa la bya'o //
translated: It is to be placed in the inner robe of the three robes, and is to be spread out.

original: ci ltar gsum la de bzhin drubs pa bting na yang yang bza' yang nyes med de sde sder za ba dang ma gtogs par grong du 'jug pa dang / gos slong ba dang lhag ma dang rnyed pa yang spyi'o //
analyzed: ci ltar gsum la de bzhin drubs pa bting na yang yang bza' yang nyes med de sde sder za ba dang ma gtogs par grong du 'jug pa dang / gos slong ba dang lhag ma dang rnyed pa yang spyi'o //
translated: If it is woven in the same way as the three robes, it is to be spread out, and there is no fault in using it again. Except for eating in the row, entering the village, begging for robes, and the remainder and acquisition, it is the same as the three robes.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe zla ba lnga'i bar du 'chad pa dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa dang yang yang dang zas bzang po dang sde zan dang gos gnyen ma yin par slong ba dang dus ma yin par grong du 'gro ba dang / 'di brgyad ni tshul du zhugs pa'i yon tan yin te bsrung mi dgos so //
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe zla ba lnga'i bar du 'chad pa dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa dang yang yang dang zas bzang po dang sde zan dang gos gnyen ma yin par slong ba dang dus ma yin par grong du 'gro ba dang / 'di brgyad ni tshul du zhugs pa'i yon tan yin te bsrung mi dgos so //
translated: These eight are qualities of one who has entered the system, and he does not need to guard them.

original: lhag ma dang rnyed pa dang spyi'o zhes 'byung ba ni mdo 'og ma rnam ltar gyur na yon tan ni mi thob kyi tshul du zhugs pa rnams spyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang rnyed pa dang spyi'o zhes 'byung ba ni mdo 'og ma rnam ltar gyur na yon tan ni mi thob kyi tshul du zhugs pa rnams spyi'o //
translated: The remaining, the acquired, and the general, as stated, are not obtained as qualities if one becomes like the sutras below, but are general for those who have entered the system.

original: nor rdzas dang yon skal las 'thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: nor rdzas dang yon skal las 'thob pa la bya ste /
translated: They are obtained from wealth, possessions, and shares.

original: dmigs dmigs nas 'og nas zhib tu 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs dmigs nas 'og nas zhib tu 'chad pa yin no //
translated: They are explained in detail below.

original: 'di mi skye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di mi skye ba ni /
translated: As for the non-arising of these,

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams yon tan dang rnyed pa'i skal ba thob pa'ang yod /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams yon tan dang rnyed pa'i skal ba thob pa'ang yod /
translated: there are those mentioned by name who obtain the qualities and shares,

original: mi 'thob pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa'ang yod do //
translated: and there are those who do not obtain them.

original: lon ma lon pa dang / tshul du ma zhugs kyi zla ba gsum gyi bar du bsrungs pa dang / dbyar chad pa dang / tshul du zhugs pa las tshul dral te song ba las so //
analyzed: lon ma lon pa dang / tshul du ma zhugs kyi zla ba gsum gyi bar du bsrungs pa dang / dbyar chad pa dang / tshul du zhugs pa las tshul dral te song ba las so //
translated: One who does not obtain the rainy season retreat, one who guards the rainy season retreat for the three months without entering it, one who has completed the rainy season retreat, and one who has entered the rainy season retreat but has violated the rules and left.

original: dbyar phyi ma dang / tshul phyi mar zhugs pa dang / gnas gzhan du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar phyi ma dang / tshul phyi mar zhugs pa dang / gnas gzhan du gnas pa'o //
translated: One who has entered the latter rainy season retreat, one who has entered the latter rainy season retreat, and one who has moved to another dwelling.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan na tshul srung srung ba dang 'di rnams ni rnyed pa'i yon skal las mi dbang ba yang yod /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan na tshul srung srung ba dang 'di rnams ni rnyed pa'i yon skal las mi dbang ba yang yod /
translated: One who guards the rainy season retreat in another monastery is not entitled to a share of the offerings.

original: gang thob gang mi thob ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: gang thob gang mi thob ba ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: Whether one obtains or does not obtain the rainy season retreat will be explained later.

original: gnas gzhan du 'phos pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du 'phos pa la yang ngo //
translated: One who has moved to another dwelling.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa bar du gcod do zhes zer ba la chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa chad pa rnam bdun gyis bcad pa dang / slob pa byin pa dang dge 'dun gyi lhag ma byung ste chad pa yod pa dang 'di rnams ni tshul du zhugs te gding ba drubs kyang yon tan bcu mi thob pa dang yon tan de gang mi thob pa 'og nas 'chad /🔽de thob nas ni log go //🔽snga nas chad pas bcad cing spangs pa ni ma yin gyi gding ba drubs zin nas nyes pa med cing chad pa rnam bdun la sogs @242a * //🔽pas bcad pa ni de nyi tshe nas yon tan bcu mi thob ste med par gyur to //

translated: The monk who is appointed as the protector of the weaving is one who possesses the five qualities and is not motivated by aversion, delusion, fear, or desire for gain. He is skilled, ethical, and has a sense of propriety.

original: mdo ltag ma las gding ba bya ba la bsam pa'i rgyud gsum yod pa dang po gnyis ma bsams na gang zag de la nyes byas te gding bar ni chud do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma las gding ba bya ba la bsam pa'i rgyud gsum yod pa dang po gnyis ma bsams na gang zag de la nyes byas te gding bar ni chud do //
translated: In the latter part of the sūtra, there are three mental continuums for the action of spreading the mat. If the first two are not considered, then the person is at fault for spreading the mat.

original: tha ma dge 'dun gyi gding ba bting zin to snyam ma bsams na gding ba drubs par mi chud do //
analyzed: tha ma dge 'dun gyi gding ba bting zin to snyam ma bsams na gding ba drubs par mi chud do //
translated: If the last one, the thought, I have spread the saṃgha’s mat, is not considered, then the mat is not considered to be woven.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sang kho bo drubs pa gding gi tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag bdag gi chos gos sngags byung shig ces 'dus pa la zhu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sang kho bo drubs pa gding gi tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag bdag gi chos gos sngags byung shig ces 'dus pa la zhu /
translated: The venerable one should say to the assembly, Tomorrow, when I weave the mat, venerable ones, please come to help me weave my Dharma robe.

original: gding ba drub pa'i zhag gcig gis snga logs su chos gos srung pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun thams cad la ngas drubs pa gding gi so so'i chos gos sngags phyung shig ces bsgo //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa'i zhag gcig gis snga logs su chos gos srung pa'i dge slong des dge 'dun thams cad la ngas drubs pa gding gi so so'i chos gos sngags phyung shig ces bsgo //
translated: The monk who is protecting the robe should tell the whole community one day before the day of weaving the mat, “I have woven the mat. Please take out your robes.”

original: 'du bar chud na nan tan bya /🔽gding ba drub pa'i nang par pog spos la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad dang gtsug lag khang brgyan cing phyi bdar bya /
analyzed: 'du bar chud na nan tan bya / gding ba drub pa'i nang par pog spos la sogs pa mchod pa'i yo byad dang gtsug lag khang brgyan cing phyi bdar bya /
translated: If he is able to gather them, he should be diligent.🔽On the morning of weaving the mat, he should prepare offering articles such as incense and so forth, and should decorate and clean the temple.

original: spos dang me tog gi mchod pa dang rab tu zhim po'i bdug pas bdugs te gzhor pa zhabs can gyi steng du bzhag la gcig gi steng du du ma blangs te bla ma 'grengs la gding ba sgrub po //
analyzed: spos dang me tog gi mchod pa dang rab tu zhim po'i bdug pas bdugs te gzhor pa zhabs can gyi steng du bzhag la gcig gi steng du du ma blangs te bla ma 'grengs la gding ba sgrub po //
translated: He should make offerings of incense and flowers and should burn very fragrant incense. He should place the mat on a stand with legs and should take many mats on top of one another. The guru should stand and weave the mat.

original: gding bar drub pa'i chos gos la me tog dang pog spos la sogs pa dri zhim pos bdug cing mchod de slo ma'am gzhong pa zhabs can gyi nang du chos gos sum phrugs su gding ba kun bting ste gcig gi thog tu gcig bzhag la gding ba srung🔽ba'i dge slong gi lag tu khyer te 'grengs la dge 'dun kun la mthar gyis bstan @244a * //
analyzed: gding bar drub pa'i chos gos la me tog dang pog spos la sogs pa dri zhim pos bdug cing mchod de slo ma'am gzhong pa zhabs can gyi nang du chos gos sum phrugs su gding ba kun bting ste gcig gi thog tu gcig bzhag la gding ba srung ba'i dge slong gi lag tu khyer te 'grengs la dge 'dun kun la mthar gyis bstan @244a * //
translated: The robe should be fumigated with fragrant substances such as flowers and incense. The three robes should be spread out in a basket or a flat-bottomed container, one on top of the other.

original: te gding bar rung ngam mi rung mnyes sam ma mnyes zhes bya /
analyzed: te gding bar rung ngam mi rung mnyes sam ma mnyes zhes bya /
translated: The monk who is protecting the spread-out robe should hold it in his hand and stand up. He should show it to the whole saṅgha in turn and ask, “Is this spread-out robe suitable or not? Is it pleasing or not?”

original: zhag gcig la'o //
analyzed: zhag gcig la'o //
translated: For one day.

original: gding ba drub pa ni nyin zhag gcig tshun chad du drub pa las bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa ni nyin zhag gcig tshun chad du drub pa las bya'o //
translated: The spread-out robe should be made within one day.

original: ston zla tha chungs kyi'o //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs kyi'o //
translated: In the last autumn month.

original: nyin zhag gcig tshun chad gding ba ston zla tha chung tshes bcu drug gi nyin zhag gcig tshun chad la bya /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig tshun chad gding ba ston zla tha chung tshes bcu drug gi nyin zhag gcig tshun chad la bya /
translated: The spread-out robe should be made within one day in the last autumn month, on the sixteenth day of the last autumn month.

original: tshig gsum mo //
analyzed: tshig gsum mo //
translated: Three statements.

original: gding ba'i sngags bya ba ni tshig lan gsum du bzlas so //
analyzed: gding ba'i sngags bya ba ni tshig lan gsum du bzlas so //
translated: The mantra for the spread-out robe should be recited three times.

original: tshig gsum du bzlas dgos pa ni mdo 'og ma gnyis ka'i sngags la bya /
analyzed: tshig gsum du bzlas dgos pa ni mdo 'og ma gnyis ka'i sngags la bya /
translated: The necessity of repeating the formula three times applies to the mantras of the two following sutras.

original: gding ngo zhes so //
analyzed: gding ngo zhes so //
translated: The word spread is used.

original: dge 'dun gyi spyir chos gos srung pa'i dge slong gis btsos kyi lag na khyer te bdag gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos drub par bgyi'o zhes lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi spyir chos gos srung pa'i dge slong gis btsos kyi lag na khyer te bdag gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos drub par bgyi'o zhes lan gsum brjod do //
translated: The monk who is in charge of the robes of the community should carry the cloth in his hand and say three times, I will sew the robes of the community.

original: dge slong so so'i mdun du 'dug ste gding ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong so so'i mdun du 'dug ste gding ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: He should sit in front of each monk and say, I will spread it.

original: de nas dge slong chos gos 'drub pa'i dge slong gis chos gos lag na khyer te dge slong so so'i mdun du 'dug la gsol cig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis gding ba bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags lan gsum du bzlas te bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong chos gos 'drub pa'i dge slong gis chos gos lag na khyer te dge slong so so'i mdun du 'dug la gsol cig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis gding ba bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags lan gsum du bzlas te bya'o //
translated: Then the monk who is sewing the robes should carry the robe in his hand and sit in front of each monk and say, Please request the monks to spread the cloth, and so on, repeating the mantra three times.

original: dge bar bting ngo shin tu bting ngo //
analyzed: dge bar bting ngo shin tu bting ngo //
translated: The word spread is used.

original: so so'i mdun du sngags byed pa'i tshe rim gyis dge slong gral na 'dug pa des dge bar bting ngo shin tu bting ngo zhes bya /
analyzed: so so'i mdun du sngags byed pa'i tshe rim gyis dge slong gral na 'dug pa des dge bar bting ngo shin tu bting ngo zhes bya /
translated: When the mantra is being recited in front of each monk, the monk who is sitting in the row should say, It is well spread, it is well spread.

original: gang 'di rnyed pa'i yon tan de dag gi'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'di rnyed pa'i yon tan de dag gi'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The qualities of the acquisition belong to those who have recited the mantra.

original: mi gcig gis sngags zin cing rjes la rnyed pa'i yon tan bdag cag gi'o zhes smra /
analyzed: mi gcig gis sngags zin cing rjes la rnyed pa'i yon tan bdag cag gi'o zhes smra /
translated: One person says: “The qualities of the acquisition that have been recited and obtained later belong to us.”

original: yon tan ni rnam pa bcu thob pa la bya /
analyzed: yon tan ni rnam pa bcu thob pa la bya /
translated: The qualities are the ten qualities that are obtained.

original: rnyed pa ni gding pa drub pa'i zla ba lnga'i tshe yon du rnyed do cog dge 'dun de rnams kyi spyir bsdu ba la bya /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni gding pa drub pa'i zla ba lnga'i tshe yon du rnyed do cog dge 'dun de rnams kyi spyir bsdu ba la bya /
translated: The acquisition is the collection of all the gifts that are obtained during the five months of weaving the cloth, which is gathered together for the community of monks.

original: myong ba bzhin du de'i rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba bzhin du de'i rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Rejoicing is like experiencing.

original: gding ba drub pa'i tshe dge slong la la zhig gnyid log nas dge 'dun gyis bslangs te nyal nyal ba des rjes su yi rang zhing dang ngo zhes smras na dge 'dun gyi las su'ang rung ba kho nyid kyi skal pa'i sngags kyang lan gsum du bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa'i tshe dge slong la la zhig gnyid log nas dge 'dun gyis bslangs te nyal nyal ba des rjes su yi rang zhing dang ngo zhes smras na dge 'dun gyi las su'ang rung ba kho nyid kyi skal pa'i sngags kyang lan gsum du bya'o //
translated: When the cloth is being woven, if a monk falls asleep and the community requests him, if he who is sleeping says, “I rejoice and approve,” it is suitable for the work of the community. He alone should recite the mantra three times.

original: mngon par gyur pas so //
analyzed: mngon par gyur pas so //
translated: Because of the manifest.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gnyid log pa yang dge 'dun gyi gral na log pa la bya'i lkog na bdag gi lkog na gnyid log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gnyid log pa yang dge 'dun gyi gral na log pa la bya'i lkog na bdag gi lkog na gnyid log pa ma yin no //
translated: Sleeping like a corpse means to sleep in the monks' row, not to sleep like a corpse in private.

original: dus dus su bskam /🔽du ba dang rdul gyi khyim du mi gzhag / gding ba drubs zin nas srung ba'i mi des dus dus su chos gos bla re yod pa'i 'og tu ser bu la bar bar bskam bsrad nyi mas ma phog par chos gos @244b bkram la ser bu la brkyang
analyzed: dus dus su bskam / du ba dang rdul gyi khyim du mi gzhag / gding ba drubs zin nas srung ba'i mi des dus dus su chos gos bla re yod pa'i 'og tu ser bu la bar bar bskam bsrad nyi mas ma phog par chos gos @244b bkram la ser bu la brkyang
translated: From time to time, it should be aired.🔽The cloth should not be left in a smoky or dusty place.

original: ste bskam pa la bya /
analyzed: ste bskam pa la bya /
translated: When the cloth has been woven, the guardian should, from time to time, air the cloth by spreading it in the sun, not directly, but in the shade, and by beating it with a stick.

original: sprug gding pa'i chos gos de sprug cing phyi bdar bya /🔽du ba dang rdul can gyi khyim du drubs pa'i chos gos mi gzhag / rgyal po yir ma yin /
analyzed: sprug gding pa'i chos gos de sprug cing phyi bdar bya / du ba dang rdul can gyi khyim du drubs pa'i chos gos mi gzhag / rgyal po yir ma yin /
translated: The cloth should be beaten by beating it and dusting it.🔽The cloth should not be woven in a smoky or dusty place.

original: rgyal po'i khyim du chos gos drubs pa de mi gzhag mi bskur de las mi 'bral /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khyim du chos gos drubs pa de mi gzhag mi bskur de las mi 'bral /
translated: The cloth should not be woven in the king's house, nor should it be sent there, nor should one stay there without reason.

original: gos drubs pa mtshams kyi nang du bzhag la srung ba'i dge slong mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhag tu song la bral bar mi bya /
analyzed: gos drubs pa mtshams kyi nang du bzhag la srung ba'i dge slong mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhag tu song la bral bar mi bya /
translated: The monk who is guarding the robe should stay outside the boundary for one night.

original: byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: byas na nyes byas /
translated: If he does not do this, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: blangs te gzhan du mi 'gro //
analyzed: blangs te gzhan du mi 'gro //
translated: He should take the robe and not go elsewhere.

original: gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos de mtshams kyi phyi rol du khyer la mi 'gro song ste mtshams 'das na drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos de mtshams kyi phyi rol du khyer la mi 'gro song ste mtshams 'das na drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro ;
translated: He should not take the robe that he is sewing and go outside the boundary. If he does, the sewing is considered to have been destroyed.🔽He should not enter a place that is dirty.

original: / mi gtsang ba'i gnas su mi 'jug / gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos khyer te bshang sa dang mi gtsang bar mi bya /
analyzed: / mi gtsang ba'i gnas su mi 'jug / gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos khyer te bshang sa dang mi gtsang bar mi bya /
translated: He should not take the robe that he is sewing to a place where there is excrement or urine.🔽He should not enter a place that is uncovered.

original: bla gab med par mi 'jug / gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos khyer la bla gab med pa'i sar mi 'jug / dbyung ba rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: bla gab med par mi 'jug / gding ba drubs pa'i chos gos khyer la bla gab med pa'i sar mi 'jug / dbyung ba rnam gnyis te /
translated: He should not take the robe that he is sewing to a place that is uncovered.🔽There are two ways of taking out the robe that is being sewn:

original: gding ba drubs nas dbyung ba rnams gnyis te bdag gis phyung ba dang gzhan gyis phyung ba'o //
analyzed: gding ba drubs nas dbyung ba rnams gnyis te bdag gis phyung ba dang gzhan gyis phyung ba'o //
translated: by oneself and by someone else.

original: ci lta bu yin pa 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: ci lta bu yin pa 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The following verse is stated in order to explain what these are.

original: bdag dang bcol bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bcol bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: One should take it out oneself or have someone else do it.

original: bdag gis phyung ba ni gding ba drubs pa las gud du song ste phyung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis phyung ba ni gding ba drubs pa las gud du song ste phyung ba'o //
translated: I have taken it out means that it has gone out from the weaving and has been taken out.

original: gzhan la bcol te phyung ba ni dge 'dun gyis drubs pa tshul bzhin du phyung ba ste 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: gzhan la bcol te phyung ba ni dge 'dun gyis drubs pa tshul bzhin du phyung ba ste 'og nas 'chad /
translated: I have taken it out by entrusting it to another means that it has been taken out by the Saṅgha, in accordance with the rules, as will be explained below.

original: bdag gis 'jug pa ni drub pa dang mtshams gzhan du phyin na'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'jug pa ni drub pa dang mtshams gzhan du phyin na'o //
translated: I have taken it out by myself means that it has been taken out by myself, and the border has been taken to another place.

original: drubs pa bdag gis byung zhes bya ba ni gding ba drubs te gzhag pa'i mtshams de las phyi rol du drubs pa'i chos gos dang bcas te phyung na zhag ma lon kyang drubs pas zhig go //
analyzed: drubs pa bdag gis byung zhes bya ba ni gding ba drubs te gzhag pa'i mtshams de las phyi rol du drubs pa'i chos gos dang bcas te phyung na zhag ma lon kyang drubs pas zhig go //
translated: I have taken out the weaving means that if the robe is taken out together with the robe-cloth that has been woven outside the border of the place where the weaving was laid out, then even if the ten days have not passed, the weaving is considered to have been destroyed.

original: drubs pa zhig kyang 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur gyi zhag bcu 'das te sngags kyis ma thebs na 'chad ba'i spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drubs pa zhig kyang 'bral ba'i spang ba'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur gyi zhag bcu 'das te sngags kyis ma thebs na 'chad ba'i spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the weaving is destroyed, it is not a downfall of abandoning the training that is to be discarded by confession. If the ten days have passed and the border has not been reached, it is a downfall that requires relinquishment and confession.

original: bsngos pa med pa'i mtshams su skya rengs shar na'o //
analyzed: bsngos pa med pa'i mtshams su skya rengs shar na'o //
translated: The dawn has broken means that the dawn has broken in the border where the robe-cloth has not been assigned.

original: mtshams kyi nang na tshul du zhugs shing drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong gcig kyang med par zad par mtshams kyi phyi rol du byung la chos gos nang du lus na drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong du yod kyang drubs ba zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na tshul du zhugs shing drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong gcig kyang med par zad par mtshams kyi phyi rol du byung la chos gos nang du lus na drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong du yod kyang drubs ba zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who has set up a weaving in the vicinity of the boundary, but has not entered the boundary, goes outside the boundary, and his robe remains inside, then the weaving is destroyed, even though there is a monk who has set up a weaving.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong las gcig yod na ni zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i dge slong las gcig yod na ni zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is one monk who has set up a weaving, it is not destroyed.

original: de 'gor gyi nang du bcad na'o //🔽gding ba drubs pa las @245a * //
analyzed: de 'gor gyi nang du bcad na'o // gding ba drubs pa las @245a * //
translated: If he cuts it up inside the boundary.🔽If he goes thinking to destroy the weaving,

original: gzhig tu 'gro bar bsams te song na gding ba drubs pa zhig pa yin te yon tan rnam pa bcu mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gzhig tu 'gro bar bsams te song na gding ba drubs pa zhig pa yin te yon tan rnam pa bcu mi dbang ngo //
translated: then the weaving is destroyed, and he loses the ten qualities.

original: de ltar song ba drubs pa 'jig pa rnam pa drug yod de 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar song ba drubs pa 'jig pa rnam pa drug yod de 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: There are six ways of going that destroy the weaving, which will be explained below.

original: de la 'di'o //
analyzed: de la 'di'o //
translated: Here it is this:

original: mdo ltag ma ltar song ba'i dge slong de nyid 'jig gi dge slong gzhan mi 'jig go //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar song ba'i dge slong de nyid 'jig gi dge slong gzhan mi 'jig go //
translated: If the monk who has set up the weaving goes to the edge of the boundary, only that monk's weaving is destroyed, not another monk's.

original: mtshams 'das nas 'di mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: mtshams 'das nas 'di mi 'grub bo //
translated: If he goes beyond the boundary, it is not accomplished.

original: yon tan lta zhig ma thob kyang rung gi drubs pa la 'byin pa'i tshe slar mi 'khor te thal byung 'gro bar bsams pa ni song ste gtsug lag khang gi mtshams 'das na drubs pa zhig par gyur to //
analyzed: yon tan lta zhig ma thob kyang rung gi drubs pa la 'byin pa'i tshe slar mi 'khor te thal byung 'gro bar bsams pa ni song ste gtsug lag khang gi mtshams 'das na drubs pa zhig par gyur to //
translated: Even if you have not obtained the wool, when you are about to spin it, if you think, “I will not return,” and you leave, it is destroyed.

original: mi ldog pa'i sems kyis 'gro bar na'o //
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i sems kyis 'gro bar na'o //
translated: If you go with the thought of not returning,🔽if you go thinking, “I will not return even if the spinning is destroyed like the edge of a mat,” it is destroyed.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar song ste drubs pa 'jig pa yang slar mi ldog par bsams te song na drubs pa zhig par gyur te drug yod pa'i gcig 'di yin no //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar song ste drubs pa 'jig pa yang slar mi ldog par bsams te song na drubs pa zhig par gyur te drug yod pa'i gcig 'di yin no //
translated: This is one of the six.

original: 'di phyi rol du mtshams skyes na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di phyi rol du mtshams skyes na yang ngo //
translated: If you are outside the boundary,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug 'dug pa las 'bral ba la thal byung 'gro ba'i sems shig skyes te song na zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug 'dug pa las 'bral ba la thal byung 'gro ba'i sems shig skyes te song na zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: if you are sitting outside the boundary and you develop the thought of leaving without returning, and you go, it is destroyed.

original: drug tu brtsi ba la gnyis /
analyzed: drug tu brtsi ba la gnyis /
translated: There are two in the enumeration of six:

original: gos bya'o zhes pa'i bsam pa'i rgyud kyang med na de bzhin no //
analyzed: gos bya'o zhes pa'i bsam pa'i rgyud kyang med na de bzhin no //
translated: If you do not have the thought, “I will make cloth,” it is the same.

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar song ba chos gos sam chos gos kyi rgyu zhig byin kyang rung nyos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar song ba chos gos sam chos gos kyi rgyu zhig byin kyang rung nyos kyang rung ste /
translated: If one goes to the last two sutras, whether one gives or buys a Dharma robe or Dharma robe material,

original: len du 'gro bar bsams pa ni drubs pa bsrung bar bsam kyang rung dral bar bsams kyang rung drubs pa zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len du 'gro bar bsams pa ni drubs pa bsrung bar bsam kyang rung dral bar bsams kyang rung drubs pa zhig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if one thinks to take it, whether one thinks to protect the weaving or to unweave it, the weaving is not destroyed.

original: bya bar yod par las chad na yang ngo //
analyzed: bya bar yod par las chad na yang ngo //
translated: If the action is interrupted, it is the same.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar chos gos kyi phyir song song ba las mtshams kyi phyi rol nas chos gos mi dgos par bsams te gzhan gyi phyi rol song ba ni de ma thag tu dru bas pa zhig go //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar chos gos kyi phyir song song ba las mtshams kyi phyi rol nas chos gos mi dgos par bsams te gzhan gyi phyi rol song ba ni de ma thag tu dru bas pa zhig go //
translated: If one goes for the sake of a Dharma robe, but thinks, “I do not need a Dharma robe outside the boundary,” and goes outside, the weaving is immediately destroyed.

original: slar ldog kyang ngo //
analyzed: slar ldog kyang ngo //
translated: If one returns, it is the same.

original: chos gos kyi phyir song song ste drubs pa dral bar bsams pa las lam nas slar log pa ni slar mtshams su phyin na zhig / gsum du byed na 'ang gnas 'di bzhin bsam pa chad pa brtsams pa stong zin na'o //
analyzed: chos gos kyi phyir song song ste drubs pa dral bar bsams pa las lam nas slar log pa ni slar mtshams su phyin na zhig / gsum du byed na 'ang gnas 'di bzhin bsam pa chad pa brtsams pa stong zin na'o //
translated: If one goes for the sake of a Dharma robe, but thinks to unweave the weaving, and returns on the road, if one returns to the boundary, it is destroyed. If one makes three, the thought of this place is interrupted. If one begins and it is empty, it is the same.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe chos gos kyi phyir song song ba las chos gos ma zin par rgyur thob ste bdag gi lag nas stor na drubs pa zhig ste gcig / chos gos ma byin nam med de don ma grub na'ang zhig ste rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe chos gos kyi phyir song song ba las chos gos ma zin par rgyur thob ste bdag gi lag nas stor na drubs pa zhig ste gcig / chos gos ma byin nam med de don ma grub na'ang zhig ste rnam pa gnyis /
translated: If one goes for cloth, but does not obtain cloth, and the thread breaks, then the robe is lost from one’s hands.🔽If one does not obtain cloth, or if one does not obtain the purpose, then the robe is lost.

original: chos gos zhig tu rnyed de thob nas lus la gyon na'ang drubs @245b pa zhig ste gsum /
analyzed: chos gos zhig tu rnyed de thob nas lus la gyon na'ang drubs @245b pa zhig ste gsum /
translated: If one obtains cloth and sews it, then the robe is lost.

original: 'di gsum de ma thag tu drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gsum de ma thag tu drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: These three are lost immediately.

original: drug tu brtsi ba la gong ma gnyis kyi steng du 'di gsum gyis bsnan te lnga /
analyzed: drug tu brtsi ba la gong ma gnyis kyi steng du 'di gsum gyis bsnan te lnga /
translated: If one counts six, then add these three to the former two, making five.

original: dbyung ba la yid gnyis kyang bcad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyung ba la yid gnyis kyang bcad pa bzhin no //
translated: If one is in doubt about the dispensation, then it is as if it were cut.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe gud du song ste drubs pa dral lam mi dral ba dang chos gos kyi phyir 'gro 'am mi 'gro the tshom za bzhin du song ba ni mtshams 'das ma thag tu drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe gud du song ste drubs pa dral lam mi dral ba dang chos gos kyi phyir 'gro 'am mi 'gro the tshom za bzhin du song ba ni mtshams 'das ma thag tu drubs pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes elsewhere while laying out the robe, and one is in doubt about whether the robe will be sewn or not, or whether one will go for cloth or not, then the robe is lost immediately after one passes the boundary.

original: drubs ba bdag gis phyung ba ni 'di dang drug / las gzhan gyi bya ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: drubs ba bdag gis phyung ba ni 'di dang drug / las gzhan gyi bya ba mi bya'o //
translated: These are the six ways of taking out the robe-cloth that has been sewn.🔽The taking out of the robe-cloth that has been sewn by the Saṅgha is of two kinds: the Saṅgha and the robe-cloth that has been assigned go outside the boundary, and the robe-cloth is put down and the Saṅgha goes outside the boundary completely.

original: dge 'dun drubs pa 'byin pa ni dge 'dun dang chos gos su bcas par mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ba dang chos gos bzhag ste dge 'dun zad par mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ba dang rnam gnyis ni drubs pa phyung bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun drubs pa 'byin pa ni dge 'dun dang chos gos su bcas par mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ba dang chos gos bzhag ste dge 'dun zad par mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ba dang rnam gnyis ni drubs pa phyung bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Although these two are ways of taking out the robe-cloth that has been sewn,

original: dge 'dun la nyes byas su 'gyur bas de ltar mi bya'i mtshams kyi nang du gsol ba dang zhu bas drubs par dbyung ngo//
analyzed: dge 'dun la nyes byas su 'gyur bas de ltar mi bya'i mtshams kyi nang du gsol ba dang zhu bas drubs par dbyung ngo//
translated: since the Saṅgha would incur an offense, this should not be done. The robe-cloth should be taken out by requesting and informing within the boundary.

original: 'di ni gzhan la bcol te drubs pa sgyu ma phyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la bcol te drubs pa sgyu ma phyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “taking out the robe-cloth that has been sewn by another and that is a deception.”

original: dpyid zla ra ba'i dus la'o //
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'i dus la'o //
translated: It is done in the first autumn month.

original: gding ba drubs pa'i dbyung ba ni dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba drubs pa'i dbyung ba ni dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la bya'o //
translated: The taking out of the sitting mat that has been sewn is done on the full moon day of the first autumn month.

original: mdo bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: mdo bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is done according to the sūtras.

original: dpyid zlar ba'i nya ni lo snga ma 'am phyi ma la mi bya'i tshul nas byung ba'i drubs pa zla ba lngar bsrungs ba'i rjes bzhin pa'i dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la bya'o //🔽bcom pa'i phyir na tshun chad du yang ngo //
analyzed: dpyid zlar ba'i nya ni lo snga ma 'am phyi ma la mi bya'i tshul nas byung ba'i drubs pa zla ba lngar bsrungs ba'i rjes bzhin pa'i dpyid zla ra ba'i nya la bya'o // bcom pa'i phyir na tshun chad du yang ngo //
translated: The month of Ashadha is the first month of autumn.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe dge slong kha cig rkun po'am chom po phyung ste gos med pa'i rkyen byung ste drubs pa dus las sngar phyung ste gos dgos pa na nyes med do //
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe dge slong kha cig rkun po'am chom po phyung ste gos med pa'i rkyen byung ste drubs pa dus las sngar phyung ste gos dgos pa na nyes med do //
translated: If, during the period of the summer retreat, a monk is robbed by thieves or by brigands, and is left naked, he may, if he needs robes, take robes before the end of the summer retreat, without incurring the transgression of taking robes before the end of the summer retreat.

original: 'dir ma myong pa ni thos kyi bar du yon tan rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dir ma myong pa ni thos kyi bar du yon tan rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Here, the word “before” means “until the end of the summer retreat.”🔽If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong kha cig gis gding ba drubs pa phyung la dge slong gud du dong ba kha cig gis drubs pa phyung bar ma tshor zhing ma thos na gos sngags kyis ma thebs pa la sogs pa yod na yon tan bcu'i nyes pa thob🔽kyi bar du med do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong kha cig gis gding ba drubs pa phyung la dge slong gud du dong ba kha cig gis drubs pa phyung bar ma tshor zhing ma thos na gos sngags kyis ma thebs pa la sogs pa yod na yon tan bcu'i nyes pa thob kyi bar du med do //
translated: If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.🔽If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.🔽If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.🔽If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.🔽If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about the first monk, also begin to weave robes, then, when the first monk has finished his robe, he may use it without incurring the transgression of using a robe before the end of the summer retreat.

original: rgyun med na'o ;
analyzed: rgyun med na'o ;
translated: If a monk has begun to weave a robe, and other monks, who have not seen or heard about

original: / drubs pa phyung bar thos kyang bdag gi chos gos ma zin te 'tshem pa la sogs pa las rgyun ma chad par byed pa ni zin gyi bar du sngags ma thebs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: / drubs pa phyung bar thos kyang bdag gi chos gos ma zin te 'tshem pa la sogs pa las rgyun ma chad par byed pa ni zin gyi bar du sngags ma thebs kyang nyes med do //
translated: Even though you hear that the time for taking out the cloth has passed, if you are not able to finish the robe because you are continuously sewing it, and so on, until you have finished it, there is no offense if you have not yet applied the mantra.

original: rgyun chad kyi bar du /
analyzed: rgyun chad kyi bar du /
translated: Until the time has passed.

original: drubs pa phyung bar thos nas chos gos kyi rgyu zhig lag tu thob ste stor ba rnyed du re ba @246a * //
analyzed: drubs pa phyung bar thos nas chos gos kyi rgyu zhig lag tu thob ste stor ba rnyed du re ba @246a * //
translated: If you hear that the time for taking out the cloth has passed, but you obtain the cloth for a robe, and you hope to find the lost cloth,

original: las bye brag phye ste ma rnyed pa dang chos gos rnyed nas sngags kyis ma btab pa ni nyes byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las bye brag phye ste ma rnyed pa dang chos gos rnyed nas sngags kyis ma btab pa ni nyes byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: you may use it after having made an announcement. If you do not find the lost cloth, and you obtain a robe, but you have not yet applied the mantra, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma phyung gi bar du thams cad kyis de'i dus kyi bar du mi bgo //
analyzed: ma phyung gi bar du thams cad kyis de'i dus kyi bar du mi bgo //
translated: Until it has been taken out, no one should wear it until that time.

original: tshum po rkun po la sogs pa'i rkyen byung ste gos med phar ma gyur gyi par du gding ba 'byin pa'i dus las sngar gding ba phyung zhing rnyed pa'i yon la sogs pa bgo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshum po rkun po la sogs pa'i rkyen byung ste gos med phar ma gyur gyi par du gding ba 'byin pa'i dus las sngar gding ba phyung zhing rnyed pa'i yon la sogs pa bgo bar mi bya'o //
translated: If thieves and so forth have carried off the cloth, and you have no other cloth, you may take out the mat before the announced time. You may distribute the value of the robe and so forth that you have obtained.

original: drubs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: drubs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The actual taking out of the mat.

original: ci ltar byung nas gding /
analyzed: ci ltar byung nas gding /
translated: How is it spread?

original: drubs pa gding ba'i dus ni rgyal po dang skar mkhan kyis shol bor byas kyang de brtsan par mi bya'i zla grangs dang zhag grangs rim bzhin du brtsis te drub po //
analyzed: drubs pa gding ba'i dus ni rgyal po dang skar mkhan kyis shol bor byas kyang de brtsan par mi bya'i zla grangs dang zhag grangs rim bzhin du brtsis te drub po //
translated: The time for weaving the mat is not to be determined by the king or the astrologer, but by counting the months and days in sequence.

original: tshul du 'jug pa ni skar mkhan gyis shol bor ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: tshul du 'jug pa ni skar mkhan gyis shol bor ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The way to enter is to act like the astrologer who determines the time.

original: gso sbyong dang mi nye ba ma yin /
analyzed: gso sbyong dang mi nye ba ma yin /
translated: It is not to be done too close to the poṣadha.

original: gding ba drubs pa ni tshul nas byung ba nyid gso sbyong byas pa yin pas tshul nas byung nas zhag gcig lon te gding ba drub po //
analyzed: gding ba drubs pa ni tshul nas byung ba nyid gso sbyong byas pa yin pas tshul nas byung nas zhag gcig lon te gding ba drub po //
translated: Since the mat is woven after the poṣadha, the mat is woven after one day has passed since the poṣadha.

original: dge slong 'thab mo pa 'ong par thos nas zhag dus las sngar tshul nas byung ba ni gding ba de'i rjes la mi drubs kyi dus bzhin du ston zla 'bring po tshe bco lnga la gso sbyong yang byas la bcu drug la gding ba drub par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'thab mo pa 'ong par thos nas zhag dus las sngar tshul nas byung ba ni gding ba de'i rjes la mi drubs kyi dus bzhin du ston zla 'bring po tshe bco lnga la gso sbyong yang byas la bcu drug la gding ba drub par bya'o //
translated: If a monk who is quarrelsome is coming, then the poṣadha is performed before the time of the day has passed. The mat is not woven after the poṣadha. The poṣadha is performed on the fifteenth day of the middle autumn month and the mat is woven on the sixteenth day.

original: dbyung ba na yang ngo //
analyzed: dbyung ba na yang ngo //
translated: When it is taken out, it is the same.

original: gding ba dbyung ba yang gso sbyong byas pa'i 'og tu gding ba dbyung ngo //
analyzed: gding ba dbyung ba yang gso sbyong byas pa'i 'og tu gding ba dbyung ngo //
translated: The spreading of the mat is also done after the poṣadha.

original: de nyid kyi nyi ma la'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nyi ma la'o //
translated: It is done on that very day.

original: gso sbyong byas nas gding ba dbyung ba ni dpyid zla ra ba'i tshes bco lnga la snga dro gso sbyong byas la phyi dro gding ba dbyung ngo //
analyzed: gso sbyong byas nas gding ba dbyung ba ni dpyid zla ra ba'i tshes bco lnga la snga dro gso sbyong byas la phyi dro gding ba dbyung ngo //
translated: The spreading of the mat after the poṣadha is done in the afternoon of the fifteenth day of the first month of spring, after the poṣadha in the morning.

original: yang gso sbyong byas na phyung ba bzhin /
analyzed: yang gso sbyong byas na phyung ba bzhin /
translated: If the poṣadha is done again, it is as if the mat is spread again.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe na gso sbyong mi dgos te tshul nas byung ba nyid gso sbyong byas pa yin no //🔽de la tshul nas byung ba dang drubs pa gding ba'i las byas zin pa'i 'og tu gud nas dge slong dag gcig 'ongs te zhag grangs 'khrul gyi gdod bya dgos so zhes zer na dge slong phyis 'ongs pa grangs mang na de brtsan par bya dgos te tshul
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe na gso sbyong mi dgos te tshul nas byung ba nyid gso sbyong byas pa yin no // de la tshul nas byung ba dang drubs pa gding ba'i las byas zin pa'i 'og tu gud nas dge slong dag gcig 'ongs te zhag grangs 'khrul gyi gdod bya dgos so zhes zer na dge slong phyis 'ongs pa grangs mang na de brtsan par bya dgos te tshul
translated: When one leaves the order, there is no need for the poṣadha, because leaving the order is itself the poṣadha.

original: nas 'byung ba dang drubs pa gding ba gdod blas te bya dgos so //
analyzed: nas 'byung ba dang drubs pa gding ba gdod blas te bya dgos so //
translated: In that case, if after the work of spreading the mat that has left the order or been woven is finished, a bhikṣu comes later and says, “It must be done after counting the days,” if the later-arriving bhikṣus are many, they must be followed, and the mat that has left the order or been woven must be done again.

original: bting nas phyed na de tha dad du grub po //
analyzed: bting nas phyed na de tha dad du grub po //
translated: If it is spread out, it is established as a separate object.

original: bting ba drubs zin pa'i 'og tu dge slong kha cig log pa la bstas na yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal ni dbang ste 'og nas kyang 'chad /
analyzed: bting ba drubs zin pa'i 'og tu dge slong kha cig log pa la bstas na yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal ni dbang ste 'og nas kyang 'chad /
translated: If, after the spreading out, some monks look at the wrong things, they are not entitled to the ten qualities and the share of the acquisition, as will be explained below.

original: drubs pa dbyung ba ni dge ba la phyogs pa'i dge slong gos sngar @246b phyung la de'i 'og tu mi dge ba la bltas pa dbyung ngo //
analyzed: drubs pa dbyung ba ni dge ba la phyogs pa'i dge slong gos sngar @246b phyung la de'i 'og tu mi dge ba la bltas pa dbyung ngo //
translated: If, after the weaving, some monks look at the wrong things, the monk who is oriented towards the wholesome should take out the cloth.

original: gcig gis phyung gcig gis ma phyung na phyung bar mi chud do //
analyzed: gcig gis phyung gcig gis ma phyung na phyung bar mi chud do //
translated: If one takes it out and one does not take it out, it is not considered taken out.

original: chos su smra ba de dag gis gding ngo //
analyzed: chos su smra ba de dag gis gding ngo //
translated: Those who speak of the Dharma spread it out.

original: gding ba ma drubs pa'i mdun du dge slong kha cig log pa la bltas nas dge ba la phyogs pa'i dge slong nyi tshes gding ba drub po ;
analyzed: gding ba ma drubs pa'i mdun du dge slong kha cig log pa la bltas nas dge ba la phyogs pa'i dge slong nyi tshes gding ba drub po ;
translated: If, in front of the unwoven cloth, some monks look at the wrong things, the monk who is oriented towards the wholesome should weave the cloth.

original: yon tan dang rnyed pa'i yon skal mi dge ba la phyogs pas mi thob bo /
analyzed: yon tan dang rnyed pa'i yon skal mi dge ba la phyogs pas mi thob bo /
translated: He does not obtain the share of the acquisition of the ten qualities and the acquisition.

original: de byed na'ang gnas de dag gis rnyed pa ni de dag gis rims so //
analyzed: de byed na'ang gnas de dag gis rnyed pa ni de dag gis rims so //
translated: If he does it, the acquisition of those places is in order.

original: mdo ltag ma'i ltag ma la 'chad do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i ltag ma la 'chad do //
translated: The upper edge of the upper robe is the edge of the upper robe.

original: dge bar lta ba mthun zhing gding ba drub pa las de'i 'og tu kha cig mi dge ba la phyogs pa zhig yod na gding ba gcig tu drubs pa'i phyir yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal mi dge ba la phyogs pa'ang dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge bar lta ba mthun zhing gding ba drub pa las de'i 'og tu kha cig mi dge ba la phyogs pa zhig yod na gding ba gcig tu drubs pa'i phyir yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal mi dge ba la phyogs pa'ang dbang ngo //
translated: If one who is in agreement with virtuous views is spinning wool, then later, if one who is not virtuous in mind is present, the one who is virtuous in mind controls the share of the wool and the ten qualities of the spinning.

original: gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun gyi rkyen gtan du phul zhing rgyun du sbyong ba las mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun gyi rkyen gtan du phul zhing rgyun du sbyong ba las mi dbang ngo //
translated: If one offers a temple and the conditions of the Saṅgha permanently and continuously, one controls the share of the wool.

original: spangs pa rang bzhin pa'i gnas su skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa rang bzhin pa'i gnas su skye ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not take birth in a place that is naturally abandoned.🔽If one goes to the place of a fully ordained nun and is punished, one does not obstruct the teachings of the Buddha.

original: dge slong ma'i gnas su thon te chad pas bcad pa dang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la sogs pa ni thal byung bskrad pa ni ma yin gyi mtshams kyi nang mtha' 'khob gcig tu 'khod pa las chad
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gnas su thon te chad pas bcad pa dang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la sogs pa ni thal byung bskrad pa ni ma yin gyi mtshams kyi nang mtha' 'khob gcig tu 'khod pa las chad
translated: The expulsion of the monk is not a sudden expulsion, but is expelled from the inner boundary of the boundary.

original: pa med pa dang chad pas bcad pa de gnyis ka dge 'dun du longs pa zhig ste gding ba so so drubs pa'ang chad pa yod pa rnams kyis yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: pa med pa dang chad pas bcad pa de gnyis ka dge 'dun du longs pa zhig ste gding ba so so drubs pa'ang chad pa yod pa rnams kyis yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: The one who sews his own mat and the one who has been cut off do not obtain the ten qualities and the gain.

original: bsam pa bzhag nas gding ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa bzhag nas gding ba'o //
translated: The mat is sewn after the intention is set aside.

original: gding ba drub pa'i tshe gding ba drub par yang 'dod la yon tan bcu'ang 'dod de dad phar byas nas gding ba drubs pa ni gding ba drubs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa'i tshe gding ba drub par yang 'dod la yon tan bcu'ang 'dod de dad phar byas nas gding ba drubs pa ni gding ba drubs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When sewing the mat, one wishes to sew the mat and also wishes for the ten qualities. After making the offering, if the mat is sewn, one obtains the sewn mat.

original: dad pa byin pa'i dbang gis lhan cig bya ba ltag ma nas byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa byin pa'i dbang gis lhan cig bya ba ltag ma nas byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of the offered faith, the subsequent collective action is performed.

original: gding ba 'drub pa'i tshe dad pa phul na 'dus pa dang 'dra ste las su yang rung yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i skal ba'ang dbang ngo //
analyzed: gding ba 'drub pa'i tshe dad pa phul na 'dus pa dang 'dra ste las su yang rung yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i skal ba'ang dbang ngo //
translated: When sewing the mat, if faith is offered, it is like a gathering. It is suitable for work, and one controls the ten qualities and the share of gain.

original: de las 'phral na phyung ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'phral na phyung ba'o //
translated: If it is taken out immediately, it is taken out.

original: gding ba drub pa'i tshe na yon tan bcu'ang ci rung gis mi dgos //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa'i tshe na yon tan bcu'ang ci rung gis mi dgos //
translated: When sewing the mat, the ten qualities are not necessary.

original: gding ba drub pa'ang mi dgos snyam du sems shing gdod drub pa ni gang zag de nyid drubs par mi chud de drubs pa phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gding ba drub pa'ang mi dgos snyam du sems shing gdod drub pa ni gang zag de nyid drubs par mi chud de drubs pa phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he thinks, “I don’t need to weave a mat,” and then does not weave one, he is not considered to have woven it.

original: de bas na dad pa ma byin pa nyal lam bsam gtan du zhugs shing 'dug na gding ba'am dbyung ba @247a * //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa ma byin pa nyal lam bsam gtan du zhugs shing 'dug na gding ba'am dbyung ba @247a * //
translated: Therefore, if he does not give his consent to the weaving of a mat, and then lies down or sits in meditation, he should not be given a mat.

original: mi skye ste brnyan tshun chad du'o //
analyzed: mi skye ste brnyan tshun chad du'o //
translated: If he is given one, he should be made to give it back.🔽If he does not give his consent to the weaving of a mat, and then sits in meditation or falls asleep, he should be reminded of the proper order of practice.🔽If he then gives his consent to the weaving of a mat, he is considered to have received a mat.
