original: gding ba 'drub pa la dad pa ma byin par bsam gtan du zhugs sam gnyid log pa las sngags byed pa'i go rims su babs te bslang ba dang gding ba drub pa la dad pa ni gding ba drubs pa thob bo //
analyzed: gding ba 'drub pa la dad pa ma byin par bsam gtan du zhugs sam gnyid log pa las sngags byed pa'i go rims su babs te bslang ba dang gding ba drub pa la dad pa ni gding ba drubs pa thob bo //
translated: If he does not give his consent to the weaving of a mat, but then gives it after he has sat in meditation or fallen asleep, he is considered to have received a mat.

original: gding ba drub pa dang yon tan ci dgos zhes ma dad pa'i sems skyes nas drubs pa bdag gis byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gding ba drub pa dang yon tan ci dgos zhes ma dad pa'i sems skyes nas drubs pa bdag gis byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: If he gives his consent to the weaving of a mat, but then thinks, “What is the use of a mat?” he is considered to have withdrawn his consent.

original: drubs par mi chud do //
analyzed: drubs par mi chud do //
translated: He is not considered to have received a mat.

original: gnas pa bzhin du mtshams gcig tu gding ste gnas gzhan du gnas na'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bzhin du mtshams gcig tu gding ste gnas gzhan du gnas na'o //
translated: If he is staying in one monastery zone, but is staying in another monastery zone,

original: mtshams chen po dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad kyis bskor ba'i nang gtsug lag khang so sor 'dug pa mang mo zhig yod de gding ba 'drub ba'i tshe gtsug lag khang de kun gyi gding ba gtsug lag khang gcig tu drubs na drubs par chud de nyes
analyzed: mtshams chen po dpag tshad phyed dang gsum tshun chad kyis bskor ba'i nang gtsug lag khang so sor 'dug pa mang mo zhig yod de gding ba 'drub ba'i tshe gtsug lag khang de kun gyi gding ba gtsug lag khang gcig tu drubs na drubs par chud de nyes
translated: If one weaves the mat in one temple, it is woven in all the temples.

original: med do // gding ba'i tshe gnas de bzhin no //
analyzed: med do // gding ba'i tshe gnas de bzhin no //
translated: There is no fault if one weaves the mat in the same place.

original: gtsug lag khang mang mo zhig so son 'dug la so so'i mtshams bcad pa med kyang rung yod kyang rung gding ba 'drub pa'i tshe mtshams bkrol te spyi'i mtshams gcig tu bcad la drubs pa'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang mang mo zhig so son 'dug la so so'i mtshams bcad pa med kyang rung yod kyang rung gding ba 'drub pa'i tshe mtshams bkrol te spyi'i mtshams gcig tu bcad la drubs pa'ang nyes med do //
translated: If there are many temples that are not separate and have no separate boundaries, it is also not a fault if one weaves the mat in one temple, having released the boundary and established a single boundary for all.

original: gang du bting nas mtshams byas kyang gnas so //
analyzed: gang du bting nas mtshams byas kyang gnas so //
translated: If one performs the rite of boundary within the temple where the mat is woven, it is also a suitable place.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang nas gtsug lag khang so sor 'dug pa zhig gding ba gcig tu drubs pa'i 'og tu spyi'i mtshams chen po bkrol te mtshams bu chung so sor bcad na 'ang yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal med par ma gyur te kun gyis thob
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang nas gtsug lag khang so sor 'dug pa zhig gding ba gcig tu drubs pa'i 'og tu spyi'i mtshams chen po bkrol te mtshams bu chung so sor bcad na 'ang yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal med par ma gyur te kun gyis thob
translated: If the monks of a single boundary sit in separate temples, but the large boundary is released in the lower part of the mat that is woven as a single mat, and the small boundaries are released in each part, then the ten qualities and the share of the robes are not lost and all obtain them.

original: bo // mtshams so sor de bzhin du dbyung ba ni sos so //
analyzed: bo // mtshams so sor de bzhin du dbyung ba ni sos so //
translated: The boundaries are released in the same way.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gding ba so sor drubs pa'i 'og tu mtshams bu chung so sor bcad pa drubs 'byin pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re drubs pa'i chos gos de mtshams bu chung so so'i steng du khyer la drubs dbyung ngo zhes zer ba
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gding ba so sor drubs pa'i 'og tu mtshams bu chung so sor bcad pa drubs 'byin pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re drubs pa'i chos gos de mtshams bu chung so so'i steng du khyer la drubs dbyung ngo zhes zer ba
translated: If the mat is woven in separate parts like the upper and lower edges of a sutra, and the small boundaries are released in each part, some who uphold the Vinaya say that the robe woven in that way should be carried over the small boundaries and released.

original: kha cig ni kun 'dus te gang du drubs pa'i gnas der gding ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni kun 'dus te gang du drubs pa'i gnas der gding ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that all should gather and weave it in the place where it was woven.

original: byed na phyogs so sor ro //
analyzed: byed na phyogs so sor ro //
translated: If it is woven, it is woven in each direction.

original: tshul yang gcig tu zhugs drubs pa yang gcig tu bting ba las gcig log par bltas te dge ba la phyogs pa dang so sor gyur na'ang yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal yod do //
analyzed: tshul yang gcig tu zhugs drubs pa yang gcig tu bting ba las gcig log par bltas te dge ba la phyogs pa dang so sor gyur na'ang yon tan bcu dang rnyed pa'i yon skal yod do //
translated: If one side is turned in the opposite direction, or if the sides are separated, then the ten qualities and the share of the robe-material are lost.

original: ma bting bas bting ba phyung na yang ma phyung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bting bas bting ba phyung na yang ma phyung ba ma yin no //
translated: If the mat is not spread, but is removed, it is not removed.🔽If the mat is spread on top of the given mat, and the monks who are the basis of the mat go elsewhere, and then other monks come and remove the mat, it is suitable for work.

original: drubs pa byin pa'i khar dge @247b slong gzhi la 'khod ba gud du dong ba'i 'og tu drug pa bting ba'i dge slong la ma gtogs pa'i dge slong dag cig gud nas 'ongs te drubs pa phyung na'ang las su rung ste dge slong bzhi pa kun kyang drubs🔽pa byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drubs pa byin pa'i khar dge @247b slong gzhi la 'khod ba gud du dong ba'i 'og tu drug pa bting ba'i dge slong la ma gtogs pa'i dge slong dag cig gud nas 'ongs te drubs pa phyung na'ang las su rung ste dge slong bzhi pa kun kyang drubs pa byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All four monks are considered to have removed the mat.

original: mi skye ba dag gis ni khams bskang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba dag gis ni khams bskang ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who are not born in that place do not complete the element.

original: ma bting bas phyung na'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bting bas phyung na'ang ma yin no //
translated: If the mat is not spread, it is not removed.

original: drub pa gding ba'i tshe na dge 'dun du longs pas 'drub la drubs pa 'byin pa'i tshe na dge slong kha cig shi'am khrims phul lam gud du dong ste dge 'dun du ma longs na dge slong gud nas bkug la dge 'dun du longs par byas la drub🔽par dbyung ngo ;
analyzed: drub pa gding ba'i tshe na dge 'dun du longs pas 'drub la drubs pa 'byin pa'i tshe na dge slong kha cig shi'am khrims phul lam gud du dong ste dge 'dun du ma longs na dge slong gud nas bkug la dge 'dun du longs par byas la drub par dbyung ngo ;
translated: When the patch is sewn, it is sewn by the assembly of monks. When the sewn patch is to be taken out, if some monks have died, have returned their vows, or have gone elsewhere, and the assembly is not complete, then a monk should be summoned from elsewhere, and the assembly should be made complete and the patch should be taken out.

original: / nyes med pa ni bting ba drubs nas sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs te mngon sum du 'dug pas yang ngo //
analyzed: / nyes med pa ni bting ba drubs nas sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs te mngon sum du 'dug pas yang ngo //
translated: The faultless means that if the patch is sewn and the robe is not yet joined, then one may enter the village, etc., and it is again permissible to be in the presence of the nuns.

original: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe yon tan bcu thob pa la ltag ya gir brgyad smos zin te /
analyzed: drubs pa bting ba'i tshe yon tan bcu thob pa la ltag ya gir brgyad smos zin te /
translated: When the sewn patch is spread, ten qualities are obtained. Eight of these have already been mentioned above.

original: grong du chos gos chen po med par 'gro ba dang / khyim pa'i drung du chos gos chen po med par 'gro ba dang 'di gnyis kyis bsnan te bcur brtsi'o //
analyzed: grong du chos gos chen po med par 'gro ba dang / khyim pa'i drung du chos gos chen po med par 'gro ba dang 'di gnyis kyis bsnan te bcur brtsi'o //
translated: Two more are added to these: going to the village without the large outer robe and going to the house of a layperson without the large outer robe. These are counted as ten.

original: drubs pa'i dngos po ste dris par chud pa'o //
analyzed: drubs pa'i dngos po ste dris par chud pa'o //
translated: The sewn patch is the thing that is sewn and is included in the question.

original: drubs pa'i dngos po rdzogs so /
analyzed: drubs pa'i dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: The actual sewn patch is complete.

original: // / mtshon gyis ma btab par gos mi spyad chos gos gsum dang yo byad bcu gsum dang gos lhag ma la sogs ba ni gos zhes bya ste khab dang gri la sogs pa'i mtshon gyis ma bcad cing ma dras par mi bgo mi spyad do //
analyzed: // / mtshon gyis ma btab par gos mi spyad chos gos gsum dang yo byad bcu gsum dang gos lhag ma la sogs ba ni gos zhes bya ste khab dang gri la sogs pa'i mtshon gyis ma bcad cing ma dras par mi bgo mi spyad do //
translated: One should not use cloth that has not been cut with a knife.  Cloth refers to the three robes and the thirteen articles, as well as extra cloth, etc. One should not cut or use them without cutting them with a knife, such as a needle or a knife.

original: dras shing btsems pa'i chos gos bsngo /
analyzed: dras shing btsems pa'i chos gos bsngo /
translated: One should dedicate the robes that have been cut and sewn.

original: chos gos chen po dang gding ba ni mtshon gyis ma bcad na bsngo ba mi 'chags te ji ltar dra zhing btsem pa 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: chos gos chen po dang gding ba ni mtshon gyis ma bcad na bsngo ba mi 'chags te ji ltar dra zhing btsem pa 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The great robe and the sitting mat are not dedicated if they are not cut with a knife. How they are cut and sewn will be explained below.

original: dum bur dras pa lhag ma dang mnyam par ste dbu ma las gzhan pa de dang der gtags pa'i 'dab ma'i ngos dang mtha' skor yang ngo //
analyzed: dum bur dras pa lhag ma dang mnyam par ste dbu ma las gzhan pa de dang der gtags pa'i 'dab ma'i ngos dang mtha' skor yang ngo //
translated: The remaining pieces are cut into equal parts, other than the middle part, and the sides and edges of those pieces are also cut.

original: chos gos dras shing btsem pa'i thabs ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: chos gos dras shing btsem pa'i thabs ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The method of cutting and sewing the robes should be done like this.

original: mdor na chos gos nyid la bltas na brda phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na chos gos nyid la bltas na brda phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, if one looks at the robes themselves, one will understand the signs.

original: nang du gnas pa dang bla gab dang sbyar ma yang ngo //
analyzed: nang du gnas pa dang bla gab dang sbyar ma yang ngo //
translated: It is also the inner lining and the upper and lower garments.

original: chos gos snam bu lnga pa dang bdun pa gnyis ni mtshon gyis ma bcad kyang rung chos gos chen po ni ma bcad na mi rung ste sngags mi 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos snam bu lnga pa dang bdun pa gnyis ni mtshon gyis ma bcad kyang rung chos gos chen po ni ma bcad na mi rung ste sngags mi 'chags so //
translated: The two robes of five and seven patches are suitable even if not cut, but the large robe is not suitable if not cut, because the mantra is not recited.

original: gnyis ni sngags ni 'chags te nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni sngags ni 'chags te nyes byas so //
translated: The two robes of nine and twenty-five patches are suitable if cut, but if not cut, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bar tshangs can dang rdul gzan yang ngo //
analyzed: bar tshangs can dang rdul gzan yang ngo //
translated: The dustcloth and the upper robe are also like this.

original: mdo ltag ma'i nang @248a * //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i nang @248a * //
translated: The three robes are explained in the sūtras

original: nas chos gos gsum bshad ba ni dge slong dbang ba yin de'i steng du rdul gzan dang bar tshangs can gnyis kyis bsnan te lnga ni dge slong ma'i chos gos su dbang ngo //🔽gang de'i rnam pas dge slong ma'i'o //
analyzed: nas chos gos gsum bshad ba ni dge slong dbang ba yin de'i steng du rdul gzan dang bar tshangs can gnyis kyis bsnan te lnga ni dge slong ma'i chos gos su dbang ngo // gang de'i rnam pas dge slong ma'i'o //
translated: as belonging to fully ordained monks. In addition to those, the dustcloth and the upper robe are added, making five robes that are suitable for fully ordained nuns.

original: dge slong pha'i chos gos gsum bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas kyang dra zhing btsem mo //
analyzed: dge slong pha'i chos gos gsum bshad pa bzhin du dge slong mas kyang dra zhing btsem mo //
translated: The fully ordained monk’s three robes are cut and sewn.

original: bar tshangs can dang rdul gzan ni ma dras kyang rung /
analyzed: bar tshangs can dang rdul gzan ni ma dras kyang rung /
translated: The dustcloth and the upper robe are suitable even if not cut.

original: brnyas pa byung ba yod na yang ngo //
analyzed: brnyas pa byung ba yod na yang ngo //
translated: If there is a need, they are also cut.

original: chos gos med dam rkun pos khyer bar gyur na gzhan las brnyas te bdag gis sngags kyis btab na'ang rung ngo //
analyzed: chos gos med dam rkun pos khyer bar gyur na gzhan las brnyas te bdag gis sngags kyis btab na'ang rung ngo //
translated: If one is without robes or they are stolen, one may borrow from another, and it is also suitable to recite the mantra.

original: skya rengs 'byung bar 'di dag dang bral bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: skya rengs 'byung bar 'di dag dang bral bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be separated from these until dawn.

original: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig na skya rengs ma byung tshun chad du gzhan la brnyas te sngags kyis thobs shig / sngags kyang ma thebs te skya rengs byung na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig na skya rengs ma byung tshun chad du gzhan la brnyas te sngags kyis thobs shig / sngags kyang ma thebs te skya rengs byung na nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one’s robes are stolen or burned, one should borrow from another until dawn, and recite the mantra. If one does not recite the mantra, one commits a minor offense at dawn.

original: gzhan ma 'byor na ma bcos pa la bsngos kyang skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma 'byor na ma bcos pa la bsngos kyang skye'o //
translated: If one does not have the means to obtain another, one may dedicate a robe that has not been made.

original: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig pa'i rkyen byung ste chos gos med cing ma rnyed na ma dras shing ma drubs pa la sngags btab kyang 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig pa'i rkyen byung ste chos gos med cing ma rnyed na ma dras shing ma drubs pa la sngags btab kyang 'chags so //
translated: If one’s robes are stolen or burned, and one is without robes or unable to obtain them, one may confess the offense by reciting the mantra over a cloth that has not been cut or sewn.

original: ma dras kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma dras kyang ngo //
translated: Even if it has not been cut,

original: rkyen byung ste chos gos ma rnyed na gsum char snam bur byas shing ma dras pa la sngags btab kyang 'chags so //
analyzed: rkyen byung ste chos gos ma rnyed na gsum char snam bur byas shing ma dras pa la sngags btab kyang 'chags so //
translated: if one is without robes or unable to obtain them, one may confess the offense by reciting the mantra over a cloth that has not been cut, even if it is not the three robes.

original: 'on te 'grub na bres pa 'di sbyin /
analyzed: 'on te 'grub na bres pa 'di sbyin /
translated: But if it is not possible, then this rule is given.

original: chos gos rkyen byung ste ma rnyed na tshul bu gud nas steng du glan pa'ang sngags 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos rkyen byung ste ma rnyed na tshul bu gud nas steng du glan pa'ang sngags 'chags so //
translated: If the robe is lost due to circumstances, then one should recite the confession mantra while sewing a patch onto the robe.

original: khyim pa'i rnam pa yang ngo //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rnam pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also like the householder's form.

original: chos gos rkyen byung nas mi rnyed par gyur te mi rnyed na khyim pa'i gos shig la sngags btab na 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos rkyen byung nas mi rnyed par gyur te mi rnyed na khyim pa'i gos shig la sngags btab na 'chags so //
translated: If the robe is lost due to circumstances and cannot be found, then if one recites the mantra over a householder's cloth, it is confessed.

original: phying pa dang la ba dang be'u ras dang snam bu sbom po dang srab mo ma dras par bre ba byin te btsems na yang ngo //
analyzed: phying pa dang la ba dang be'u ras dang snam bu sbom po dang srab mo ma dras par bre ba byin te btsems na yang ngo //
translated: If one gives a piece of felt, a blanket, a piece of calf skin, a thick or thin cloth, and sews it without cutting it, it is also so.

original: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig pa'i rkyen cig byung ste ma rnyed na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la snam bu gud nas byos te btsems te sngags btab na'ang 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos rkun pos khyer ram mes tshig pa'i rkyen cig byung ste ma rnyed na ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la snam bu gud nas byos te btsems te sngags btab na'ang 'chags so //
translated: If one loses the robe due to circumstances such as it being stolen or burned by fire, then if one sews a separate cloth onto these mentioned by name and recites the mantra, it is confessed.

original: mal stan mi gtsang pas reg bar gyur na de ma thag tu bkru'o //
analyzed: mal stan mi gtsang pas reg bar gyur na de ma thag tu bkru'o //
translated: If the bedding becomes defiled, one should wash it immediately.

original: mal stan dge 'dun gyi'am rung gang zag gi yang rung bshang gci la sogs pa mi gtsang bas reg na mod la bkru ma bkrus na nyes byas /🔽g-yogs ma'i yin pa'i khri dang khri'u la de'i ma yin pa'i gding ba dang 'dug pa'i bar du bgo ba'i nang du ma @248b yin par dge 'dun gyi de dag mi spyad /
analyzed: mal stan dge 'dun gyi'am rung gang zag gi yang rung bshang gci la sogs pa mi gtsang bas reg na mod la bkru ma bkrus na nyes byas / g-yogs ma'i yin pa'i khri dang khri'u la de'i ma yin pa'i gding ba dang 'dug pa'i bar du bgo ba'i nang du ma @248b yin par dge 'dun gyi de dag mi spyad /
translated: If one sits on a bed belonging to the community or to an individual, and it is defiled by feces, urine, etc., one commits a fault.🔽If one uses a bed or a bench belonging to the community that is covered with a sheet, but not with a cover, one commits a fault.🔽If one uses a bed or a bench belonging to the community that is not covered with a sheet or a cover, one commits an offense.

original: dge 'dun gyi khri dang khri'u shal rtsub pa rtsub cing tsha ba'i phyir ma smos kyang gding ba byed par 'gyur bas de ni ma gtegs kyi dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding ba'am 'dab mas ma g-yogs par mthang gis reg pa bting zhing spyad na nyes byas🔽/ bris pa rab tu ma zhig pa thams cad la yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi khri dang khri'u shal rtsub pa rtsub cing tsha ba'i phyir ma smos kyang gding ba byed par 'gyur bas de ni ma gtegs kyi dge 'dun gyi mal stan la gding ba'am 'dab mas ma g-yogs par mthang gis reg pa bting zhing spyad na nyes byas / bris pa rab tu ma zhig pa thams cad la yang ngo //
translated: One commits an offense for using any bed or bench that is not completely ruined.

original: stan dang gos ri mo can khra bor 'dug ba la ri mo med par ma gyur tam gzhan gyis ma g-yogs par spyad na nyes byas /
analyzed: stan dang gos ri mo can khra bor 'dug ba la ri mo med par ma gyur tam gzhan gyis ma g-yogs par spyad na nyes byas /
translated: If one uses a multicolored or striped cushion or robe without a plain-colored side facing out or without covering it with something else, one commits an offense.

original: brtags par gyur pa'am dri ma can gyis ma yin /
analyzed: brtags par gyur pa'am dri ma can gyis ma yin /
translated: It is not one that is imaginary or stained.

original: gding ba mtshan ma tsam du chung dus byas pa dang dri ma dang snum can la sogs pas gding ba byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: gding ba mtshan ma tsam du chung dus byas pa dang dri ma dang snum can la sogs pas gding ba byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one makes a mat with a small sign, or with stains, oil, and so on, it is a minor fault.

original: gding ba bcang /
analyzed: gding ba bcang /
translated: One must keep a mat.

original: gding ba bcang kyang nyes med /🔽stug na rim gcig kyang rigs so //
analyzed: gding ba bcang kyang nyes med / stug na rim gcig kyang rigs so //
translated: Even if one keeps a mat, there is no fault.🔽If it is thick, one may do it in one layer.

original: gding ba stug po la byas na gcig rim du byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: gding ba stug po la byas na gcig rim du byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: If the mat is thick, it is suitable to do it in one layer.

original: srab na nyis rim du bya'o //
analyzed: srab na nyis rim du bya'o //
translated: If it is thin, one should do it in two layers.🔽If the mat is thin, one should do it in two layers.

original: gding bsrab mo zhig na nyis rim du byos shig ri mo dang nye ba'i ri mo ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gding bsrab mo zhig na nyis rim du byos shig ri mo dang nye ba'i ri mo ma brtags pa'o //
translated: One should not examine the lines and the small lines.

original: za bu dang phrug stan dang ri mo can la gding ba byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: za bu dang phrug stan dang ri mo can la gding ba byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one makes a mat with a fringe, a cushion, or a design, it is a minor fault.

original: gding ba la 'dab ma'i ngos bya /
analyzed: gding ba la 'dab ma'i ngos bya /
translated: One should make the mat with the side of the leaf.

original: gding ba la tshal bu byas na gding bar mi chud de nyes byas /
analyzed: gding ba la tshal bu byas na gding bar mi chud de nyes byas /
translated: If one makes the mat with pieces, it does not count as a mat, and it is a minor fault.

original: 'og tu sum cha'i steng du'o //
analyzed: 'og tu sum cha'i steng du'o //
translated: Below, one third; above, one third.

original: tshal bu bya ba ni chur gsum cha sum gnyis su bcad de srubs gdod /
analyzed: tshal bu bya ba ni chur gsum cha sum gnyis su bcad de srubs gdod /
translated: As for making it with pieces, one should cut it into three parts, and then sew it together.

original: dum bu gcig pa la mi bsngo //
analyzed: dum bu gcig pa la mi bsngo //
translated: It is not dedicated to one who has only one piece.

original: gding ba srubs ma btod par thang pa la byas na sngags mi 'chags /
analyzed: gding ba srubs ma btod par thang pa la byas na sngags mi 'chags /
translated: If one makes a mat without holes, one does not break the mantra.

original: g-yan pa dgab de yod pas bcangs /
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab de yod pas bcangs /
translated: One should carry a blanket to cover the itch, because there is an itch.

original: g-yan pa yod pas g-yan pa dgab pa bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: g-yan pa yod pas g-yan pa dgab pa bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: Even if one carries a blanket to cover the itch, there is no fault.

original: nyi ma lnga drug cing 'di bkru'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lnga drug cing 'di bkru'o //
translated: One should wash this every five or six days.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa'i ras nyi ma lnga drug cing bkru'o //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa'i ras nyi ma lnga drug cing bkru'o //
translated: One should wash the cloth to cover the itch every five or six days.

original: brtags pa ni srin bal gyi dang shan ka dang gsho ma ka'i yang ngo //
analyzed: brtags pa ni srin bal gyi dang shan ka dang gsho ma ka'i yang ngo //
translated: The examined ones are those of cotton, silk, and linen.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni dge slong gis gos su brtags kyang nyes med /🔽rgyu spun med pa dang gso ma'i ma yin /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni dge slong gis gos su brtags kyang nyes med / rgyu spun med pa dang gso ma'i ma yin /
translated: These mentioned by name are not faulty if a monk uses them as robes.🔽They are not made of animal hair or silk.

original: gso ma'i ras dang mtho ris kyi gos ni ma brtags pa ste mi spyad do //
analyzed: gso ma'i ras dang mtho ris kyi gos ni ma brtags pa ste mi spyad do //
translated: Silk cloth and heavenly cloth are not examined, that is, they are not used.

original: skra'i dang sgren mo 'am 'ug pa'i sgro zhes yi dam bcas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: skra'i dang sgren mo 'am 'ug pa'i sgro zhes yi dam bcas pa yang ngo //
translated: They are also the vow of the hair, the naked, or the owl feather.

original: skra'i gos gyon pa dang sgren mor 'dug pa dang sgro las gos byas pa dang 'di rnams gyon cing byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: skra'i gos gyon pa dang sgren mor 'dug pa dang sgro las gos byas pa dang 'di rnams gyon cing byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one wears hair cloth, goes naked, or makes a garment from feathers, and acts in these ways, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di sbom pa'o //🔽lhag ma gsum ltar byed cing mur 'dug gi dka' @249a * //
analyzed: 'di sbom pa'o // lhag ma gsum ltar byed cing mur 'dug gi dka' @249a * //
translated: This is a serious offense.

original: thub spyod na sbom /
analyzed: thub spyod na sbom /
translated: If one acts like the remaining three, and practices the austerities of the naked ascetics, it is a serious offense.

original: 'di las gzhan spyod pa yang ngo //🔽skra'i gos gyon pa dang gcer bur 'dug pa dang bya sgro'i gos byas pa la mur 'dug gi dka' thub spyod pa la ni mi sems kyi 'da' skad cig tsam byas pa ni nyes byas /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan spyod pa yang ngo // skra'i gos gyon pa dang gcer bur 'dug pa dang bya sgro'i gos byas pa la mur 'dug gi dka' thub spyod pa la ni mi sems kyi 'da' skad cig tsam byas pa ni nyes byas /
translated: If one practices something other than this, it is also that.🔽If one does not think, “I will practice the austerities of the naked ascetics,” but wears hair cloth, goes naked, or makes a garment from feathers, and acts in these ways for just a moment, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skra btog pa dang / bdag gi skra lag gis 'bal ba dang / 'dab ma'i snam bu dang / shing lo'i 'dab ma las gos byas pa dang / ri dvags kyi pags pa dang / pags pa'o cog las gos byas te gyon pa dang / bla dang 'og tu bcas pa /
analyzed: skra btog pa dang / bdag gi skra lag gis 'bal ba dang / 'dab ma'i snam bu dang / shing lo'i 'dab ma las gos byas pa dang / ri dvags kyi pags pa dang / pags pa'o cog las gos byas te gyon pa dang / bla dang 'og tu bcas pa /
translated: Cutting one’s hair, rubbing one’s hair with one’s hand, a cloth of leaves, a garment made from tree leaves, a garment made from the skin of any animal, or a garment made from leather, with or without lining,

original: gos 'og tu gcig gyon steng du gcig gyon pa chog bar sems pa dang / di ri ta dang / thod kar dang 'gro ba'i gos gyon pa dang / yan lag spu can dang / lag 'brag dang zhu lpug ge lta bu sbu'u can dang /
analyzed: gos 'og tu gcig gyon steng du gcig gyon pa chog bar sems pa dang / di ri ta dang / thod kar dang 'gro ba'i gos gyon pa dang / yan lag spu can dang / lag 'brag dang zhu lpug ge lta bu sbu'u can dang /
translated: Pure Abodes, or with the colors of the gods of the desire realm, such as🔽the color of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.🔽It is a minor infraction to wear clothes that are dyed with the colors of🔽the non-Buddhists, that is, with red, yellow, or blue, or with a mixture of🔽colors, or with the colors of the gods, such as the color of the gods of the🔽Pure Abodes, or with the colors of the gods of the desire realm, such as🔽the color of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.🔽It is a minor infraction to wear clothes that are dyed with the colors of

original: thams cad sngon pos bgo ba dang / gos thams cad sngon por gyon pa dang de bzhin ser po'am dmar po 'ba' zhig la byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: thams cad sngon pos bgo ba dang / gos thams cad sngon por gyon pa dang de bzhin ser po'am dmar po 'ba' zhig la byas na nyes byas so //
translated: the non-Buddhists, that is, with red, yellow, or blue, or with a mixture of🔽colors, or with the colors of the gods, such as the color of the gods of the🔽Pure Abodes, or with the colors of the gods of the desire realm, such as🔽the color of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.🔽It is a minor infraction to wear clothes that are dyed with the colors of

original: kha tshar ring po dang kha tshar blas pa dang ral ga dang gtsug tor dang mgo dkris pa dang rnga mo'i gos dang phyar ba dang mur 'dug gi rgyal mtshan dang yang ngo //
analyzed: kha tshar ring po dang kha tshar blas pa dang ral ga dang gtsug tor dang mgo dkris pa dang rnga mo'i gos dang phyar ba dang mur 'dug gi rgyal mtshan dang yang ngo //
translated: the non-Buddhists, that is, with red, yellow, or blue, or with a mixture of🔽colors, or with the colors of the gods, such as the color of the gods of the🔽Pure Abodes, or with the colors of the gods of the desire realm, such as🔽the color of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams mur 'dug dka' thub bya ba'i sems yod na'ang sbom po'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams mur 'dug dka' thub bya ba'i sems yod na'ang sbom po'o //
translated: It is a minor infraction to wear clothes that are dyed with the colors of🔽the non-Buddhists, that is, with red, yellow, or blue, or with a mixture of🔽colors, or with the colors of the gods, such as the color of the gods of the🔽Pure Abodes, or with the colors of the gods of the desire realm, such as🔽the color of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.🔽It is a minor infraction to wear clothes that are dyed with the colors of

original: dka' thub bya ba'i sems med par bgos na nyes byas /
analyzed: dka' thub bya ba'i sems med par bgos na nyes byas /
translated: the non-Buddhists, that is,

original: su la sa'i 'dab mar cog pa dang me mar gyi ras tsam yang mnyam par bgo'o //
analyzed: su la sa'i 'dab mar cog pa dang me mar gyi ras tsam yang mnyam par bgo'o //
translated: One should distribute equally even a single leaf of paper or a wick of a butter lamp.

original: yon bdag gis yon phul na zar ma'i 'dab ma tsam mam me mar gyi ras tsam yin na de mnyam par bgo / la ba dang de lta na ni btsongs te'o //
analyzed: yon bdag gis yon phul na zar ma'i 'dab ma tsam mam me mar gyi ras tsam yin na de mnyam par bgo / la ba dang de lta na ni btsongs te'o //
translated: If a patron offers a gift, even if it is a single leaf of paper or a wick of a butter lamp, it should be distributed equally.

original: la ba la sogs pa zhig phul ba ni btsongs te rin bgo'o //
analyzed: la ba la sogs pa zhig phul ba ni btsongs te rin bgo'o //
translated: If a robe or the like is offered, it should be sold and the price distributed.

original: dras te ma yin no //
analyzed: dras te ma yin no //
translated: It should not be cut up.🔽If a robe is cut up, it is no longer suitable as a robe, so it should be sold and the price distributed.

original: la ba dras na rdzas su mi rung ba'i phyir btsongs te bgo / rnyed pa bgo bar bya ba rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: la ba dras na rdzas su mi rung ba'i phyir btsongs te bgo / rnyed pa bgo bar bya ba rnam lnga ste /
translated: There are five ways of distributing the offerings.

original: yon zhig rnyed na bgo ba la thabs rnam lnga yod de 'og nas 'chad /🔽de ring rnyed pa bgos de la khyed 'du bar gyis shig ces dge 'dun la brjod /
analyzed: yon zhig rnyed na bgo ba la thabs rnam lnga yod de 'og nas 'chad / de ring rnyed pa bgos de la khyed 'du bar gyis shig ces dge 'dun la brjod /
translated: If an offering is received, there are five methods for distributing it, as will be explained below.🔽“Today the offerings are to be distributed. Please come and join us.”🔽“Today the offerings are to be distributed. Please come and join us.”🔽“Today the offerings are to be distributed. Please come and join us.”

original: gtsug lag khang sbyong gis de ring spyi'i yon bgos gshegs shig ces bgos /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang sbyong gis de ring spyi'i yon bgos gshegs shig ces bgos /
translated: “Today the offerings are to be distributed. Please come and join us.”

original: rnam pa gcig gand'i brdungs pa dang gand'i brdungs pa la bgo ba dang / tshul shing brim pa dang / zad par tshul shing brims te tshul shing la bgrangs pa dang / bgrang ba yang ngo //🔽grangs nyid du khas bgrangs te @249b bgo ba dang / so so'i skal ba brim pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gand'i brdungs pa dang gand'i brdungs pa la bgo ba dang / tshul shing brim pa dang / zad par tshul shing brims te tshul shing la bgrangs pa dang / bgrang ba yang ngo // grangs nyid du khas bgrangs te @249b bgo ba dang / so so'i skal ba brim pa yang ngo //
translated: The first is the method of distribution by striking the gavel once, the method of distribution by striking the gavel twice, the method of distribution of voting tickets, the method of distribution of voting tickets and counting the votes, and the method of counting the votes.🔽The second is the method of distribution by counting the number of monks, the method of distribution by counting the number of monks and assigning them to groups, and the method of distributing individual shares.

original: gong du ming gis smos pa ltar bgrangs nas bgrang du yod pa dang nor du sbyar te skal ba so sor mnyam par bgo / byed pa'i tshe mtha' tshun chad 'ongs na'ang dbang ngo //
analyzed: gong du ming gis smos pa ltar bgrangs nas bgrang du yod pa dang nor du sbyar te skal ba so sor mnyam par bgo / byed pa'i tshe mtha' tshun chad 'ongs na'ang dbang ngo //
translated: Having counted the number of monks as mentioned above, if there are more monks who arrive after the counting, they should be given a share.

original: yon lhag ma rnam lnga ltar 'god pa'i tshe dge slong zhig gud nas 'ongs na skal ba dbang ngo //
analyzed: yon lhag ma rnam lnga ltar 'god pa'i tshe dge slong zhig gud nas 'ongs na skal ba dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk arrives after the five remaining offerings have been arranged, he should be given a share.

original: dge slong sum gnyis tsam nor lag tu thob lhag ma 'god cing 'khod pa la dge slong gcig gud nas 'ongs na thams cad slar bsdus te bgo zin nas ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong sum gnyis tsam nor lag tu thob lhag ma 'god cing 'khod pa la dge slong gcig gud nas 'ongs na thams cad slar bsdus te bgo zin nas ma yin no //
translated: If two or three monks arrive after the remaining offerings have been arranged and the shares distributed, they should be given a share. If only one monk arrives, all the offerings should be given to him.

original: nor bgos zin pa'i 'og tu 'ongs pa'i skal ba mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: nor bgos zin pa'i 'og tu 'ongs pa'i skal ba mi 'thob bo //
translated: The monk who arrives after the distribution of the goods does not receive a share.

original: rnyed ba chung yang 'di bzhin no //
analyzed: rnyed ba chung yang 'di bzhin no //
translated: Even if the goods are small, it is the same.

original: yon chung du zhig rnyed kyang dge slong phyis 'ongs pa dbang ngo //
analyzed: yon chung du zhig rnyed kyang dge slong phyis 'ongs pa dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk arrives after the distribution of the goods, he receives a share even if the goods are small.

original: thob pa byed par gtogs pa song yang mi'i rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa byed par gtogs pa song yang mi'i rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not right that the share of a monk who has gone away should be given to another.

original: yon bdag gis rtag tu dge slong so sor thang bcad de 'bul ba las dge slong tshul bsrungs pa zhig gud du song bar gyur na'ang de'i skal ba thang bzhin du dbang ngo //
analyzed: yon bdag gis rtag tu dge slong so sor thang bcad de 'bul ba las dge slong tshul bsrungs pa zhig gud du song bar gyur na'ang de'i skal ba thang bzhin du dbang ngo //
translated: The patron should always give to each monk his share. If a monk who has observed the rules is absent, his share should be given to another monk.

original: de bas na 'gro na longs shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro na longs shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If you are going away, take your share.”

original: mdo ltag ma ltar skal ba dbang ba las gud du 'gro na'ang bdag mi 'dod de dge 'dun la phul kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar skal ba dbang ba las gud du 'gro na'ang bdag mi 'dod de dge 'dun la phul kyang nyes med /
translated: If a monk who has received his share goes away, he should not give his share to another monk. If he gives it to the Saṃgha, there is no fault.

original: 'dod na'ang mkhan po dang grogs po la len par bcol te zhog shig / dam bcas pa las ma blangs na'ang sbyin du gzhug / mdo ltag ma ltar nor len du bcol ba las khas blangs pa las phyis ma blangs na skal ba ci dbang ba'am skyin pa
analyzed: 'dod na'ang mkhan po dang grogs po la len par bcol te zhog shig / dam bcas pa las ma blangs na'ang sbyin du gzhug / mdo ltag ma ltar nor len du bcol ba las khas blangs pa las phyis ma blangs na skal ba ci dbang ba'am skyin pa
translated: According to the latter part of the sutra, if you entrust your wealth to someone and he accepts it, but later does not return it, you should take back what is rightfully yours or its price.

original: de la dbab bo //
analyzed: de la dbab bo //
translated: You should take it back from him.

original: dong tse lnga yan chad thob pa chung du las so //
analyzed: dong tse lnga yan chad thob pa chung du las so //
translated: If you receive less than five coins, you should not take it.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar skyin pa blang pa ni pa na lnga yan chad kyi rin ni blang gi lnga las nyung ba man chad kyi rin ni mi cog go //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar skyin pa blang pa ni pa na lnga yan chad kyi rin ni blang gi lnga las nyung ba man chad kyi rin ni mi cog go //
translated: According to the latter part of the sutra, if you receive the price of something worth more than five coins, you should take it, but if you receive the price of something worth less than five coins, you should not take it.

original: ma smras par mi blang /🔽dge slong grogs kyis long shig ma smras par mi blang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis blang /
analyzed: ma smras par mi blang / dge slong grogs kyis long shig ma smras par mi blang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis blang /
translated: You should not take it without being asked.🔽You should take it if a fellow monk asks you to. You should not take it if you are not asked. You should take it if your preceptor or teacher asks you to.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis ni slob ma'i yon skal long shig ces ma bsgo'ang blang /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis ni slob ma'i yon skal long shig ces ma bsgo'ang blang /
translated: You should take it if your preceptor or teacher asks you to take the share of a disciple.

original: snying gcugs pa'i gnas kyi phyir kyang ngo //
analyzed: snying gcugs pa'i gnas kyi phyir kyang ngo //
translated: You should take it if you are close to him.

original: grogs po mdza' bo dang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi ni skal pa long shig par ma bsgo bar blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: grogs po mdza' bo dang mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi ni skal pa long shig par ma bsgo bar blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: But if one takes the portion of a friend, a relative, a preceptor, or a teacher, without being authorized, there is no fault.

original: bdag gi phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no //🔽mkhan po'ang rung slob ma'ang rung mi dge ba dang log pa la bltas @250a * //
analyzed: bdag gi phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no // mkhan po'ang rung slob ma'ang rung mi dge ba dang log pa la bltas @250a * //
translated: It is not a case of taking what is not given.🔽A preceptor, a teacher, a friend, a relative, cannot give to a monk the idea of taking what is not given.

original: pa'i skal ba mi mnod do //
analyzed: pa'i skal ba mi mnod do //
translated: A preceptor or a teacher cannot give the idea of immorality or of false doctrine to a disciple.

original: mal stan kyang de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mal stan kyang de bzhin du'o //
translated: The same for a bed.

original: mkhan po slob dpon gyi mal stan ma bsgo bar blangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mkhan po slob dpon gyi mal stan ma bsgo bar blangs kyang nyes med /
translated: One can sleep in the bed of a preceptor or a teacher without asking permission.

original: slob dpon dang mdza' bo'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon dang mdza' bo'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same for a friend.

original: zas kyang ngo //
analyzed: zas kyang ngo //
translated: The same for food.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mdza' bo'i zan skal mnod kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mdza' bo'i zan skal mnod kyang nyes med do //
translated: One can eat the food intended for a preceptor or a teacher, or a friend, without asking permission.

original: gzhan gyi phyir len na pha rol po chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir len na pha rol po chud par bya'o //
translated: But if one takes it for oneself, one must pay for it.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mdza' bo'i yon skal dang mal cha dang zas nod pa'i tshe gzhan la shes par dpang btsugs te mnod do //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mdza' bo'i yon skal dang mal cha dang zas nod pa'i tshe gzhan la shes par dpang btsugs te mnod do //
translated: One must ask permission to use the bed, food, etc. , belonging to a preceptor, a teacher, or a friend, if these goods are placed at the disposal of the Community or of a certain person.

original: mi 'thob pa las gtogs zhes ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa las gtogs zhes ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that one does not obtain it from that which is not obtained.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du ma gtogs shing zan skal mi thob par 'thob po zhes zer zhing mnod na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du ma gtogs shing zan skal mi thob par 'thob po zhes zer zhing mnod na nyes byas /
translated: If one says, “I will not be included in the saṅgha and I will not obtain a share of the food,” and one is made to take it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: za ba'i tshe sbom po /
analyzed: za ba'i tshe sbom po /
translated: If one eats it, it is a serious violation.

original: dris pa rin thang tshang la rku sems dang ldan na pham mo //
analyzed: dris pa rin thang tshang la rku sems dang ldan na pham mo //
translated: If one is asked and one has the intention to steal the full value, one commits a pārājika.

original: rigs pa ni gcig pa la 'thob pa rab tu mang yang ma btsud pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni gcig pa la 'thob pa rab tu mang yang ma btsud pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that one obtains it many times in one caste, because one is not included.

original: gtsug lag khang gcig na dge slong gcig pu 'dug pa las yon bdag dad pas yon mang zhig phul na dge slong gcig pu des khyer yang nyes med /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcig na dge slong gcig pu 'dug pa las yon bdag dad pas yon mang zhig phul na dge slong gcig pu des khyer yang nyes med /
translated: If a single monk is staying in a single temple, and a faithful patron offers him much wealth, it is not a fault if the single monk takes it.

original: mi rigs pa ni chos ma yin pa'i skyabs su ltung ste bye ba dge 'dun gyis 'thob pa las so //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni chos ma yin pa'i skyabs su ltung ste bye ba dge 'dun gyis 'thob pa las so //
translated: It is unreasonable to fall into the refuge of that which is not the Dharma, because one obtains it from the saṅgha.

original: dge slong sems log pa la bltas shing phyogs te /
analyzed: dge slong sems log pa la bltas shing phyogs te /
translated: If a monk looks at a wrong mind and turns away,

original: tshul dge ba 'dra bar bsrung zhing 'dug pa ni dge 'dun gyi yon las mi 'thob po //
analyzed: tshul dge ba 'dra bar bsrung zhing 'dug pa ni dge 'dun gyi yon las mi 'thob po //
translated: and if he stays protecting the virtue of his conduct as if it were a treasure, he does not obtain the wealth of the saṅgha.

original: ring du gnas na de'i tshe gnas thob la'o //
analyzed: ring du gnas na de'i tshe gnas thob la'o //
translated: If he lives a long time, he obtains the inheritance when he has reached the age of majority.

original: dge slong tshul du zhugs pa ni tshul dral kyang zhag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga phan chad cig lon na yon skal 'thob po //
analyzed: dge slong tshul du zhugs pa ni tshul dral kyang zhag bzhi bcu rtsa lnga phan chad cig lon na yon skal 'thob po //
translated: The monk who has entered into the rite, even if he breaks the rule, obtains the inheritance if he has lived more than forty-five days in the rite.

original: dri'am log gam shi yang ngo //
analyzed: dri'am log gam shi yang ngo //
translated: Even if he is dead, or has renounced the rule, or has become a layman.

original: tshul du zhugs pa la khrims phul yang rung khrims phul pa las slar byig gshur zhugs kyang rung shi ste nor skal byin cig ces khas chems bzhag kyang rung ste tshul zhag bzhi bcu lnga bsrungs na skal ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: tshul du zhugs pa la khrims phul yang rung khrims phul pa las slar byig gshur zhugs kyang rung shi ste nor skal byin cig ces khas chems bzhag kyang rung ste tshul zhag bzhi bcu lnga bsrungs na skal ba 'thob bo //
translated: The monk who has entered into the rite, even if he has renounced the rule, even if he has returned to the world, even if he is dead, obtains the inheritance if he has lived more than forty-five days in the rite, if he has made a will.

original: 'thab pa ji ltar bsngos pa'i tshul bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa ji ltar bsngos pa'i tshul bzhin du'o //
translated: The inheritance is given according to the will.

original: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun la sogs pa ming gis so sor bsngos te phul na bsngos pa bzhin du gzhi gzhan du mi spyod do //
analyzed: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang dang dge 'dun la sogs pa ming gis so sor bsngos te phul na bsngos pa bzhin du gzhi gzhan du mi spyod do //
translated: If the donor has given a vihara, a robe, etc. to a particular monk, the inheritance will not be given to the community.

original: 'thob pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'thob pa yang ngo //
translated: The inheritance is given to the community.

original: dge 'dun grangs las ma gtogs par gud nas 'ongs pa zhig yod na gsol thang dang zan thang bcad de phul ba las khong thog tu dad pa byin na'ang nyes med /
analyzed: dge 'dun grangs las ma gtogs par gud nas 'ongs pa zhig yod na gsol thang dang zan thang bcad de phul ba las khong thog tu dad pa byin na'ang nyes med /
translated: If there is a Saṅgha that has come from somewhere else, other than the number of Saṅgha, it is permissible to offer it without cutting the food and drink, and there is no fault in offering it to them.

original: slong ba'i grong bsgos @250b kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: slong ba'i grong bsgos @250b kyang nyes med do //
translated: Also, there is no fault in assigning a begging town.

original: rgyas par 'grub pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyas par 'grub pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also established extensively.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang na dge 'dun mang zhing gnas pa las kha cig chos log pa la phyogs pas gong sde gnyis su bcad de so sor bsod snyoms dang yon len par bsngos pa las chos ma yin pa la phyogs pa'i grong nas spyir yon 'bul du 'ongs
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang na dge 'dun mang zhing gnas pa las kha cig chos log pa la phyogs pas gong sde gnyis su bcad de so sor bsod snyoms dang yon len par bsngos pa las chos ma yin pa la phyogs pa'i grong nas spyir yon 'bul du 'ongs
translated: In one boundary, there are many Saṅgha and abodes. Some are inclined towards wrong Dharma, so the upper two are divided into two and assigned to receive alms and offerings separately. From a town inclined towards non-Dharma, offerings are generally brought to give.

original: nas chos ma yin pa la phyogs dbang chos la phyogs pa'ang de dang 'dra /
analyzed: nas chos ma yin pa la phyogs dbang chos la phyogs pa'ang de dang 'dra /
translated: If inclined towards non-Dharma, the powerful one inclined towards Dharma is also like that.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir chad pa las kyi mtshams kyis gcod do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir chad pa las kyi mtshams kyis gcod do //
translated: For the sake of the Saṅgha, the boundary of punishment is set.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gcig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gcig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, here it is the same and so on.

original: gtsug lag khang gcig gi nang na dge slong mang zhig gnas gnas ba las gzhan thams cad gtsug lag khang btang ste yan man du 'dong pa'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun spyir yon zhig phul na gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong de🔽su yod pa dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcig gi nang na dge slong mang zhig gnas gnas ba las gzhan thams cad gtsug lag khang btang ste yan man du 'dong pa'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun spyir yon zhig phul na gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong de su yod pa dbang ngo //
translated: In one temple many monks reside. If all the others leave the temple and go elsewhere, the property of the Sangha in general is given to the monk who remains in that temple.

original: chos kyi rnyed pa de'i smra ba dag gi skal ba yang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa de'i smra ba dag gi skal ba yang ngo //
translated: The property of the Dharma is given to the one who is able to recite it.

original: dharma la yon zhig phul na dharma klog klog pa'i dge slong dbang ngo //
analyzed: dharma la yon zhig phul na dharma klog klog pa'i dge slong dbang ngo //
translated: If a gift is given to the Dharma, it is given to the monk who recites the Dharma.

original: 'di'i mtha' ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mtha' ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The limit of this is the ability to recite one verse from the Buddha's own speech.

original: ltag ma ltar dharma klog klog pa'i yon dbang ba'i dge slong ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi kha thon du klog cing 'dzin nus pas kyang dharma la phul ba'i yon blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar dharma klog klog pa'i yon dbang ba'i dge slong ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi kha thon du klog cing 'dzin nus pas kyang dharma la phul ba'i yon blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: The monk who is able to recite the Dharma and is given the property of the Dharma is also faultless in accepting the property given to the Dharma, even if he is able to recite and memorize one verse from the Buddha's own speech.

original: shi ba'i yo byad la mi rigs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa dang gzhan 'god pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad la mi rigs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa dang gzhan 'god pa'o //
translated: It is not proper for those of different gender or those who are not monks to receive the property of the deceased.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang gi dge 'dun las dge slong gcig shi na de'i yo byad dang nor mtshams tha dad pa'i dge slong ma dang de ba datt'i sde lta bu dang de rnams ni mi dbang gi mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun nyi tshe dbang ngo //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang gi dge 'dun las dge slong gcig shi na de'i yo byad dang nor mtshams tha dad pa'i dge slong ma dang de ba datt'i sde lta bu dang de rnams ni mi dbang gi mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun nyi tshe dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk dies within the boundary of a saṃgha, the property and wealth of that monk belongs to the saṃgha of that boundary.

original: spangs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: spangs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of those who have been expelled.

original: ltag ma'i ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor las mtshams gcig gi nang nas dge slong 'ga' zhig bskrad na des kyang shi ba'i nor la mi dbang ngo //🔽mi 'khor kyang ngo //
analyzed: ltag ma'i ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor las mtshams gcig gi nang nas dge slong 'ga' zhig bskrad na des kyang shi ba'i nor la mi dbang ngo // mi 'khor kyang ngo //
translated: If a monk dies and some monks are expelled from the boundary, those expelled do not have a share of the property of the deceased.🔽Those who are not monks do not have a share.🔽Those who have not changed their gender do not have a share.

original: mtshan ma las sems ma log kyang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma las sems ma log kyang ngo //
translated: Those who have not changed their minds do not have a share.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang na dge slong gnyis sam gsum zhig 'khod 'khod pa las kun shi ste med na dge slong gcig cig lus shing bsnams kun gyi nor ma shi dge slong ma shi ba gcig pu de dbang ngo //🔽zad par shin gtsug lag khang de'i nye 'khor na dge @251a * //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang na dge slong gnyis sam gsum zhig 'khod 'khod pa las kun shi ste med na dge slong gcig cig lus shing bsnams kun gyi nor ma shi dge slong ma shi ba gcig pu de dbang ngo // zad par shin gtsug lag khang de'i nye 'khor na dge @251a * //
translated: If there is no monk in the middle region, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the east.

original: slong spangs pa 'ba' zhig 'dug pa de'i yid la snga ma'i mtshan ma btang na dbang ngo //
analyzed: slong spangs pa 'ba' zhig 'dug pa de'i yid la snga ma'i mtshan ma btang na dbang ngo //
translated: If there is no monk in the east, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the south.🔽If there is no monk in the south, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the west.🔽If there is no monk in the west, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the north.🔽If there is no monk in the north, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the south.🔽If there is no monk in the south, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the east.🔽If there is no monk in the east, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the middle country.

original: mtshan ma ma btang na de'i nye 'khor na'ang dge slong ma su yod pa dbang ngo //🔽de'i blang ba yod pa la ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma btang na de'i nye 'khor na'ang dge slong ma su yod pa dbang ngo // de'i blang ba yod pa la ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no monk in the middle country, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the north.🔽If there is no monk in the north, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the west.🔽If there is no monk in the west, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the south.🔽If there is no monk in the south, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the east.🔽If there is no monk in the east, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the middle country.🔽If there is no monk in the middle country, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the north.

original: spangs pa'i dge slong zhig shi na de'i yo byad dang nor ni dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: spangs pa'i dge slong zhig shi na de'i yo byad dang nor ni dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: If there is no monk in the north, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the west.🔽If there is no monk in the west, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the south.🔽If there is no monk in the south, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the east.🔽If there is no monk in the east, the goods belong to the monks of the region of the middle country.

original: dge 'dun de'i nang na chad pa gzhan zhig yod na des ni mi 'thob bo //🔽bye ba dang ni tha dad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun de'i nang na chad pa gzhan zhig yod na des ni mi 'thob bo //🔽bye ba dang ni tha dad do //
translated: If there is no monk in the middle country, the goods belong to the

original: dge 'dun zhig la dge mi dge sde gnyis su bcad de'i nang nas 'ga' zhig dge ba la phyogs pa las shin dge ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhig la dge mi dge sde gnyis su bcad de'i nang nas 'ga' zhig dge ba la phyogs pa las shin dge ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: The Sangha is the master of the property of a monk who has died, after dividing it into two parts, the wholesome and the unwholesome, and taking the wholesome part.

original: mi dge ba shi na mi dge ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: mi dge ba shi na mi dge ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: If an unwholesome monk dies, the unwholesome Sangha is the master.

original: rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan mi dbang ngo //
translated: The Sangha of fully ordained monks is the master of the property of a fully ordained monk, not others such as those who are not fully ordained or those who are fully ordained but who are not celibate practitioners.

original: dge slong gi rab tu byung ba'i nang nas 'ga' zhig shi na de'i nor dang yo byad mur 'dug dang rgyal po ma gtogs te dge slong gi dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi rab tu byung ba'i nang nas 'ga' zhig shi na de'i nor dang yo byad mur 'dug dang rgyal po ma gtogs te dge slong gi dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: If a fully ordained monk dies, the Sangha of fully ordained monks is the master of his property and belongings, except for those who are present and the king.

original: gsol bas bsngos te thob pa la ma yin no //🔽dge slong shi ba'i nor la dge 'dun gyi gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyi sngags kyis rtog pa las dge slong 'ga' zhig mtshams kyi phyi rol du song na mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gsol bas bsngos te thob pa la ma yin no // dge slong shi ba'i nor la dge 'dun gyi gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyi sngags kyis rtog pa las dge slong 'ga' zhig mtshams kyi phyi rol du song na mi dbang ngo //
translated: It is not the case that the Sangha is the master of property that has been dedicated by request.🔽With regard to the property of a deceased monk, the Sangha is the master of that property which has been dedicated by the recitation of the three refuges and the four seals.🔽If a monk has gone outside the boundaries, he is not the master of the property of a deceased monk, even if he is present at the time of the recitation of the three refuges and the four seals.

original: dge 'dun gyi las shig la song na brtag pa ma slebs kyang dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi las shig la song na brtag pa ma slebs kyang dbang ngo //
translated: If he has gone to perform a Sangha action, he is the master of the property of a deceased monk, even if he is not present at the time of the recitation of the three refuges and the four seals.

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las dge slong 'gron pos kyang dbang ngo //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las dge slong 'gron pos kyang dbang ngo //
translated: The monk who is a traveler has the power to request and to ask for the ordination.

original: thog ma dang tha ma yang ngo //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma yang ngo //
translated: The first and the last.

original: thog ma dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni mdo 'og nas 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni mdo 'og nas 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The first and the last are explained in the following Sutra.

original: de las 'ga' tsam dge 'dun las rgan po dang gsar bu byin na'o zhes der gsungs so //
analyzed: de las 'ga' tsam dge 'dun las rgan po dang gsar bu byin na'o zhes der gsungs so //
translated: In this Sutra, it is said that the property of a dead monk is to be given to two persons: one who is the most venerable in the monastery, and one who is the last comer.🔽If the property of a dead monk is given to these two persons, or to one of them, or to a third person, then the property is said to be divided.🔽The property of a dead monk is to be given to the Sangha.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nor las gnas brtan gcig dang tse lu tha ma na 'dug pa gcig dang gnyis la sman tam nor chung shas yan chad ci'ang rung ste sna re zhig byin na mtshams des chod pas na phyi nas 'ong ba mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nor las gnas brtan gcig dang tse lu tha ma na 'dug pa gcig dang gnyis la sman tam nor chung shas yan chad ci'ang rung ste sna re zhig byin na mtshams des chod pas na phyi nas 'ong ba mi dbang ngo //
translated: If the property is given to one person, or to two persons, or to three persons, or to the Sangha, then the property is said to be divided.

original: gang nas bsngo ba yod pa de'i mtshams kyi nang du bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: gang nas bsngo ba yod pa de'i mtshams kyi nang du bsngos pa'o //
translated: If the property is given to the Sangha, then the property is to be divided.

original: dge slong gcig cig gi nor gtsug lag khang gzhan zhig na gtams te bzhag pa las dge slong de shi bar gyur na dge slong de gnas gnas pa'i dge slong mi dbang gi nor gang na gzhag gzhag pa'i dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis
analyzed: dge slong gcig cig gi nor gtsug lag khang gzhan zhig na gtams te bzhag pa las dge slong de shi bar gyur na dge slong de gnas gnas pa'i dge slong mi dbang gi nor gang na gzhag gzhag pa'i dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis
translated: If the property of a single monk is deposited in another monastery and that monk dies, the property belongs to the saṅgha of the place where it is deposited.

original: brtags na gos 'dug 'dug pa'i dge 'dun de rnams dbang ngo //
analyzed: brtags na gos 'dug 'dug pa'i dge 'dun de rnams dbang ngo //
translated: If the saṅgha of the place where it is deposited investigates through the rite of proposal and proclamation, the saṅgha that finds the property has dominion over it.

original: 'di shi ba'i @251b gnas su zhes pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di shi ba'i @251b gnas su zhes pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is the place of death.

original: ltag ma ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor dge 'dun grogs po na re nor bzhag pa'i mtshams mi brtsan gyi dge slong nyid nged kyi mtshams su shi ba yin gyis nor nged dbang gis byin cig ces zer zhing len du mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor dge 'dun grogs po na re nor bzhag pa'i mtshams mi brtsan gyi dge slong nyid nged kyi mtshams su shi ba yin gyis nor nged dbang gis byin cig ces zer zhing len du mi dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk dies in a place other than his own, his companions may say, “We are not concerned with the boundary where the property was deposited. The monk died within our boundary. Give us the property.” But they do not have dominion over it.

original: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa lus la chags pa'am gzhan yang ji snyed du chud pa de gtogs so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa lus la chags pa'am gzhan yang ji snyed du chud pa de gtogs so //
translated: The property belongs to the saṅgha of the place where it is deposited.

original: gtsug lag khang du ma zhig gi bar na dge slong gcig shin gtsug lag khang dang nye ba'i dge 'dun dge slong shi ba de'i nor dbang ngo //🔽nye ring med na lus gang ni mgo gang logs su lta ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du ma zhig gi bar na dge slong gcig shin gtsug lag khang dang nye ba'i dge 'dun dge slong shi ba de'i nor dbang ngo // nye ring med na lus gang ni mgo gang logs su lta ba'i dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: In the case of a monk who dies in a monastery, the property belongs to the saṅgha of the monastery.🔽If there is no partiality, the property belongs to the saṅgha of the region where the head is.

original: lus dang bral bar 'dug pa'i nor ni ro nas gtsug lag khang gi phyogs na 'dug pa'i dge 'dun de dbang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang bral bar 'dug pa'i nor ni ro nas gtsug lag khang gi phyogs na 'dug pa'i dge 'dun de dbang ngo //
translated: If the body is separated from the head, the property belongs to the saṅgha of the region where the body is.

original: gtams pa la na de'i yo byad gang na'ang rung ste der chud do //
analyzed: gtams pa la na de'i yo byad gang na'ang rung ste der chud do //
translated: If the property is entrusted to someone, it belongs to the saṅgha of the region where it is entrusted.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams pa zhig yod na khyim pa de dang gang gi dge 'dun dang phrad cing zin pa de'i dge slong dbang ba la'ang bya /
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams pa zhig yod na khyim pa de dang gang gi dge 'dun dang phrad cing zin pa de'i dge slong dbang ba la'ang bya /
translated: If the property of a deceased monk is entrusted to a layperson, it belongs to the saṅgha of the layperson and the saṅgha with whom it is entrusted.

original: khyim pa de dang dge 'dun du nye ba'i dge 'dun dbang pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: khyim pa de dang dge 'dun du nye ba'i dge 'dun dbang pa la'ang bya /
translated: It also belongs to the saṅgha of the region near the layperson.

original: gtams pas dngos po gzhan du gzhag pa bsngo'o //
analyzed: gtams pas dngos po gzhan du gzhag pa bsngo'o //
translated: If the entrusted property is placed elsewhere, it belongs to the saṅgha of that place.

original: dge slong shi ba'i rdzas khyim pa la gtams pa las khyim pa de lha khang du 'ongs kyang rung bkug kyang rung ste mngon sum du 'phrad de bsgom na nor bgo ba'i sngag byas pa yin te dge 'dun gzhan mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i rdzas khyim pa la gtams pa las khyim pa de lha khang du 'ongs kyang rung bkug kyang rung ste mngon sum du 'phrad de bsgom na nor bgo ba'i sngag byas pa yin te dge 'dun gzhan mi dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk dies and his property is entrusted to a layperson, then if that layperson comes to the temple or is summoned, and if the property is contemplated in the presence of the layperson, then the property is to be divided.

original: bskur ba las byin pas ma spangs na de'i yin no //
analyzed: bskur ba las byin pas ma spangs na de'i yin no //
translated: If the property is sent to another place, then the property belongs to the monks of that place.

original: dge slong gcig la nor zhig bskur ba las nor 'ongs te mi 'dod ces ma byas par dge slong de shi na nor de shi ba'i phyogs kyi dge 'dun dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gcig la nor zhig bskur ba las nor 'ongs te mi 'dod ces ma byas par dge slong de shi na nor de shi ba'i phyogs kyi dge 'dun dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk sends property to another monk and the recipient monk does not say that he does not want it, then if the sender dies, the property belongs to the Sangha of the place where the sender died.

original: spangs na bskur ba'i'o //
analyzed: spangs na bskur ba'i'o //
translated: If the recipient monk rejects it, then the property belongs to the Sangha of the place where it was sent.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar nor bskur te 'ongs pa las mi 'dod ces bya ba'i 'og tu shi na thog ma bskur bskur ba'i dge slong de dbang ngo //🔽des spangs kyang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar nor bskur te 'ongs pa las mi 'dod ces bya ba'i 'og tu shi na thog ma bskur bskur ba'i dge slong de dbang ngo //🔽des spangs kyang ngo //
translated: If the recipient monk says that he does not want it, then if the sender dies, the property belongs to the Sangha of the place where the sender died.🔽If the recipient monk rejects it, then the property belongs to the Sangha of the place where it was sent.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar mi 'dod ces byas te slar bskur ba las thog ma bskur bskur ba'i dge slong de'ang mi 'dod ces zer na de brtsan te dge slong de dbang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar mi 'dod ces byas te slar bskur ba las thog ma bskur bskur ba'i dge slong de'ang mi 'dod ces zer na de brtsan te dge slong de dbang ngo //
translated: If he says, I do not want it like the one on the top of the head, and sends it back, and if the monk who sent it first says, I do not want it, then it should be given to the monk who sent it first.

original: phyi rol la mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes te gcig pos bsngos te mi skye'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes te gcig pos bsngos te mi skye'o //
translated: If he thinks that the outside is inside the boundary, and dedicates it alone, it does not arise.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nor la 'god pa la mtshams kyi nang de dge slong kun la dad pa ma dris shing ma bsdus par dge slong kha cig gis khyad par bgo ba'i sngags byas pa @252a * //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nor la 'god pa la mtshams kyi nang de dge slong kun la dad pa ma dris shing ma bsdus par dge slong kha cig gis khyad par bgo ba'i sngags byas pa @252a * //
translated: Regarding the distribution of the property of a dead monk, if all the monks inside the boundary have not been asked and gathered, and some monks make the declaration of distribution,

original: dang mtshams kyi phyi rol tu bgo ba'i sngags byas par mi chud de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dang mtshams kyi phyi rol tu bgo ba'i sngags byas par mi chud de mi rung ngo //
translated: and if the declaration of distribution is made outside the boundary, it is not valid.

original: dbyung ba dang nan tan dang chos gos bstan pa dang sbyin pa'i gshegs pa ma byas par mi bsngo'o //
analyzed: dbyung ba dang nan tan dang chos gos bstan pa dang sbyin pa'i gshegs pa ma byas par mi bsngo'o //
translated: It should not be dedicated without performing the expulsion, the earnest practice, the teaching of the Dharma robes, and the going for alms.

original: dge slong shi ba'i ro sgor ma phyung ngam ma bsregs sam ma sbas sam chur ma bskur ba'i shi ba'i nor mi bgo / shi ba'i ro sbas zin nas bgo ba'i sngags byas te gdod shi ba'i nor bgo'o //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i ro sgor ma phyung ngam ma bsregs sam ma sbas sam chur ma bskur ba'i shi ba'i nor mi bgo / shi ba'i ro sbas zin nas bgo ba'i sngags byas te gdod shi ba'i nor bgo'o //
translated: The property of a dead monk is not to be divided if his body has not been taken out of the monastery, or if it has not been burned, or if it has not been buried, or if it has not been thrown in the water.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gnas kyi khyim du na khyim bdag gang gis byin pa dbang ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gnas kyi khyim du na khyim bdag gang gis byin pa dbang ngo //
translated: If a monk dies in a layman’s house, the bowl and robes are to be given to the layman who provided them.🔽If a monk dies in a layman’s house, and the layman takes the bowl and robes and brings them to the monastery, then any monk he meets may take possession of them.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim pa la gtams pa las dge slong shi ste khyim pa des khyer te 'ongs na dge slong su dang 'phrad pa blangs te khyer yang nyes med do //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim pa la gtams pa las dge slong shi ste khyim pa des khyer te 'ongs na dge slong su dang 'phrad pa blangs te khyer yang nyes med do //
translated: If a monk hears that the bowl and robes have been entrusted to a layman, and he takes possession of them, there is no offense.🔽But only if the monk is a relative.🔽If a monk dies in a layman’s house, the bowl and robes are not to be given to the layman who provided them.🔽If a monk dies in a layman’s house, and the layman takes the bowl and robes and brings them to the monastery, then any monk he meets may take possession of them.

original: gtams shing 'dug pa thos na bdag gis blangs te khyer yang nyes med do //
analyzed: gtams shing 'dug pa thos na bdag gis blangs te khyer yang nyes med do //
translated: If a monk hears that the bowl and robes have been entrusted to a layman, and he takes possession of them, there is no offense.

original: de ste rigs na'o //
analyzed: de ste rigs na'o //
translated: But only if the monk is a relative.🔽If a monk dies in a layman’s house, the bowl and robes are not to be given to the layman who provided them.🔽If a monk dies in a layman’s house, and the layman takes the bowl and robes and brings them to the monastery, then any monk he meets may take possession of them.🔽If a monk hears that the bowl and robes have been entrusted to a layman, and he takes possession of them, there is no offense.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar khyer kyang nyes med pa ni dge slong ma dang chad pa yod pa'i dge slong ni mi dbang ste blang bar mi rigs so //🔽phongs te des so //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar khyer kyang nyes med pa ni dge slong ma dang chad pa yod pa'i dge slong ni mi dbang ste blang bar mi rigs so //🔽phongs te des so //
translated: But only if the monk is a relative.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar blangs kyang nyes med pa ni dge slong phongs shing mi bdog pas blangs shing khyer yang nyes med do //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar blangs kyang nyes med pa ni dge slong phongs shing mi bdog pas blangs shing khyer yang nyes med do //
translated: There is no fault if one takes it like a turban on one’s head, because a monk who is poor and has no possessions takes it and carries it away.

original: mi ster ba la blangs pas so //
analyzed: mi ster ba la blangs pas so //
translated: There is no fault if one takes it from one who does not give it.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams shing 'dug pa las dge slong phongs pas blangs te byin na ni nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams shing 'dug pa las dge slong phongs pas blangs te byin na ni nyes med do //
translated: If the property of a dead monk is entrusted to a layperson and a poor monk takes it and is given it, there is no fault.

original: mi ster bzhin du mthus blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: mi ster bzhin du mthus blangs na nyes byas /
translated: If one takes it by force from one who does not give it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rim gyis na thog ma'i'o //
analyzed: rim gyis na thog ma'i'o //
translated: If it is taken gradually, it is the first.

original: shi ba'i nor gtams shing 'dug pa len du dbang ba dge slong ma zhig len du 'ongs te kha 'dom na kha gang snga ba dbang ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i nor gtams shing 'dug pa len du dbang ba dge slong ma zhig len du 'ongs te kha 'dom na kha gang snga ba dbang ngo //
translated: If the property of a dead monk is entrusted to a nun who comes to take it, whoever is first in line is entitled to it.

original: med dam ma bsngos par bor na song ba'i'o //
analyzed: med dam ma bsngos par bor na song ba'i'o //
translated: If it is lost and not entrusted to anyone, it is the first.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams shing 'dug pa khyim pas bor zhing 'dug pa la dge slong gis mthong na bdag phongs na bdag gis khyer cig ma phongs na ma len cig / dge 'dun spyir dbul bar bsams te blangs pa ni nyes med do
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nor khyim pa la gtams shing 'dug pa khyim pas bor zhing 'dug pa la dge slong gis mthong na bdag phongs na bdag gis khyer cig ma phongs na ma len cig / dge 'dun spyir dbul bar bsams te blangs pa ni nyes med do
translated: If he takes it with the intention of offering it to the saṅgha in general, there is no fault.

original: // de bzhin rims su'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin rims su'o //
translated: The same applies to contagious diseases.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor la dge slong phongs pa mang zhing 'dod de len na gang mgyogs pa dbang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong shi ba'i nor la dge slong phongs pa mang zhing 'dod de len na gang mgyogs pa dbang ngo //
translated: If many monks who are poor and desire the property of a dead monk take it, the one who is fastest gets it.

original: nor chags par gyur na de la btang ba shi ba'i yo byad las de'i tshad du sbyin /
analyzed: nor chags par gyur na de la btang ba shi ba'i yo byad las de'i tshad du sbyin /
translated: If the property is not divided, it should be given to the one who is entrusted with it.🔽If the dead monk had a debt to another, whatever is owed should be given from the property of the dead monk.

original: dge slong shi ba de la gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa zhig yod na shi ba'i nor las ci chags pa byin @252b la lhag ma las bgo / bgos kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba de la gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa zhig yod na shi ba'i nor las ci chags pa byin @252b la lhag ma las bgo / bgos kyang ngo //
translated: If the dead monk had a debt to the saṅgha, it should be given from the share of the dead monk.

original: shi ba'i nor bgos zin pa'i 'og tu shi ba la bu lon chags te ded du 'ongs na yang bgos pa kun slar bsdus te ci chags pa sbyin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i nor bgos zin pa'i 'og tu shi ba la bu lon chags te ded du 'ongs na yang bgos pa kun slar bsdus te ci chags pa sbyin no //
translated: If someone comes to claim a debt from a dead person after the division of property has been made, all the property that has been divided must be gathered together again and the debt paid.

original: gang de dang lhan cig tu 'thams pa de la sbyin na ma blang /
analyzed: gang de dang lhan cig tu 'thams pa de la sbyin na ma blang /
translated: If it is said that the debt is owed by someone who was in the company of the dead person, it should not be accepted.

original: dge slong shi ba de dang khyim pa zhig tu 'thams te khyim pa'i nor ni sngar blangs kyi rin ma byin pa zhig yod na'ang 'thams pa'i tshig bzhin du rin bcal zhing sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba de dang khyim pa zhig tu 'thams te khyim pa'i nor ni sngar blangs kyi rin ma byin pa zhig yod na'ang 'thams pa'i tshig bzhin du rin bcal zhing sbyin no //
translated: If a dead monk was in the company of a layperson and the layperson has property that was not paid for, the price should be paid according to the word of the person who was in the company of the dead monk.

original: rin bcal du med na'ang kho'i nor dngos slar sbyin no //
analyzed: rin bcal du med na'ang kho'i nor dngos slar sbyin no //
translated: If the price cannot be determined, the property should be returned.

original: des ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case.

original: dge slong shi ba da las shig byed du bcug ste slas sbyin par byas pa zhig yod na'ang shi ba dang 'thams pa bzhin du gla sbyin nor dngos kyang blang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba da las shig byed du bcug ste slas sbyin par byas pa zhig yod na'ang shi ba dang 'thams pa bzhin du gla sbyin nor dngos kyang blang ngo //
translated: If a dead monk had someone do work and did not pay wages, the wages should be paid according to the word of the person who was in the company of the dead monk. The property should also be taken.

original: 'di tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la chags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la chags par mi 'gyur /
translated: This will not cause attachment to those who practice pure conduct.

original: dge slong shi ba la gzhan gyi bu lon zhig chags te shi ba'i nor kun bcal kyang ma 'khor ba ni ma 'khor du zad tshangs par byin kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba la gzhan gyi bu lon zhig chags te shi ba'i nor kun bcal kyang ma 'khor ba ni ma 'khor du zad tshangs par byin kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a monk dies and he has a debt to another, even if all of his property is used up and there is nothing left to repay the debt, there is no fault in giving it to the Sangha.🔽If he has taken a loan from the Three Jewels, then whatever is found should be compared to the new loan and divided.
