original: dkon mchog gi blangs te yod na de ji rnyed pa de rnyed las sar pa las bsnyams te bgo / dge slong shi ba de la gzhan zhig gis zong phog ste las byed du bcug pa las ma byas sam rkyen chad du lus na yang shi ba'i nor
analyzed: dkon mchog gi blangs te yod na de ji rnyed pa de rnyed las sar pa las bsnyams te bgo / dge slong shi ba de la gzhan zhig gis zong phog ste las byed du bcug pa las ma byas sam rkyen chad du lus na yang shi ba'i nor
translated: If a monk dies and someone else has given him goods to work with, but he has not worked with them or has left them unfinished, then the goods should be divided.🔽The remainder should be divided after the necessary expenses have been set aside.

original: las ci chog pa spangs te gzhag pa la lhag ma bgo / nad pa'i g-yog dang bcas na de 'thob pa'i yo byad drug la mi bsngo //
analyzed: las ci chog pa spangs te gzhag pa la lhag ma bgo / nad pa'i g-yog dang bcas na de 'thob pa'i yo byad drug la mi bsngo //
translated: If he has a nurse, the nurse does not receive a share of the six necessary articles.

original: dge slong shi ba'i nad g-yog byed byed pa ni shi ba'i nor bgo ba'i skal ba la ma gtogs par chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed dang chu tshags dang gding pa drug dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba'i nad g-yog byed byed pa ni shi ba'i nor bgo ba'i skal ba la ma gtogs par chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed dang chu tshags dang gding pa drug dbang ngo //
translated: The nurse of a dying monk, apart from his share of the deceased's property, has the right to the three robes, the begging bowl, the water filter, and the sitting mat.

original: rab dang 'bring dang mtha' mar bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rab dang 'bring dang mtha' mar bcas pa'o //
translated: There are three types: superior, middling, and inferior.

original: dge slong shi ba de la chos gos dang lhung bzed dang gding ba mang po zhig yod na thams cad bzang po las mi dbang ste bzang ngan spel la pham rgyal med par drug sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba de la chos gos dang lhung bzed dang gding ba mang po zhig yod na thams cad bzang po las mi dbang ste bzang ngan spel la pham rgyal med par drug sbyin no //
translated: If the dead monk had many Dharma robes, begging bowls, and sitting mats, all of them should be distributed.

original: du ma na de'i spyi'o //
analyzed: du ma na de'i spyi'o //
translated: If there are many, they should be distributed in common.

original: nad g-yog mang po zhig yod na'ang grangs mang du lhag par mi dbang gi drug las spyir bgo'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog mang po zhig yod na'ang grangs mang du lhag par mi dbang gi drug las spyir bgo'o //
translated: If there are many attendants, they should not be given in excess of the number, but should be distributed in common from the six.

original: nad pa shi nas de'i phyir song na sbyin /
analyzed: nad pa shi nas de'i phyir song na sbyin /
translated: If the patient dies, the attendants should go for the distribution.

original: nad pa shi ba'i tshe nad g-yog rang don la mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'phyan du song na yo byad drug dang shi ba'i nor skal la mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa shi ba'i tshe nad g-yog rang don la mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'phyan du song na yo byad drug dang shi ba'i nor skal la mi dbang ngo //
translated: If the patient dies and the attendants go outside the boundary for their own purposes, they should not be given the six necessities or a share of the deceased’s property.

original: nad pa'i don la song ba ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa'i don la song ba ni dbang ngo //
translated: Those who went for the sake of the patient should be given.

original: 'di la shi ba'i nor mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di la shi ba'i nor mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right to give the deceased’s property to those who did not care for the patient.

original: de nad g-yog dge slong ma dang dge @253a * //
analyzed: de nad g-yog dge slong ma dang dge @253a * //
translated: Here, a nun who was the patient’s attendant and a monk who was under probation were given the deceased’s property.

original: slong chad pa bcad pa zhig byed byed pa ni yo byad drug las mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: slong chad pa bcad pa zhig byed byed pa ni yo byad drug las mi dbang ngo //
translated: They should not be given from the six necessities.

original: gzhan tshul du zhugs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan tshul du zhugs pa la ma yin no //
translated: It is not so for others who are suitable.

original: dge slong gtsug lag khang gzhan du tshul du zhugs pa zhig gis nad g-yog byas na'ang yo byad drug dang shi ba'i nor skal dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gtsug lag khang gzhan du tshul du zhugs pa zhig gis nad g-yog byas na'ang yo byad drug dang shi ba'i nor skal dbang ngo //
translated: If a fully ordained monk enters another temple and nurses the sick, he should receive the six articles and the inheritance of the deceased.

original: 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad la'ang rigs so //
analyzed: 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad la'ang rigs so //
translated: This is appropriate for all who have received full ordination.

original: nad g-yog dge slong zhig byed byed na'ang shi ba'i nor skal la thang dge slong gi thang bzhin du dbang /
analyzed: nad g-yog dge slong zhig byed byed na'ang shi ba'i nor skal la thang dge slong gi thang bzhin du dbang /
translated: If a fully ordained monk nurses the sick, he should receive the inheritance of the deceased, just as the fully ordained monks should.

original: yo byad drug kyang dbang ngo //
analyzed: yo byad drug kyang dbang ngo //
translated: He should also receive the six articles.

original: nad pas byin cig ces smras pa la phrin ji ltar smras pa ltar bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas byin cig ces smras pa la phrin ji ltar smras pa ltar bya'o //
translated: If the sick person says, “Give it,” the messenger should do as he says.

original: dge slong shi ba des kha chems bzhag ste nor byin cig ces smras pa zhig yod pa las nad g-yog la sogs pas ma byin na nor 'god pa'i tshe smras la kha chems bzhin du so sor sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong shi ba des kha chems bzhag ste nor byin cig ces smras pa zhig yod pa las nad g-yog la sogs pas ma byin na nor 'god pa'i tshe smras la kha chems bzhin du so sor sbyin no //
translated: If a fully ordained monk dies and leaves a will, “Give this wealth,” and the nurse and so on do not give it, when the wealth is distributed, they should give it according to the will.

original: dbang med pa ni shi ba na 'di la shi ba dag gi nor sgrubs shig ce na'o //
analyzed: dbang med pa ni shi ba na 'di la shi ba dag gi nor sgrubs shig ce na'o //
translated: If the nurse is powerless, when the deceased dies, he should say, “Obtain the inheritance of the deceased.”

original: nad pa'i kha chems la nga shi na mi 'di nor 'di tsam zhig byin cig ces zer ba ni kha chems mi btsan te spyir bgo'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i kha chems la nga shi na mi 'di nor 'di tsam zhig byin cig ces zer ba ni kha chems mi btsan te spyir bgo'o //
translated: If a dying man says, “When I die, give this much wealth to this person,” that is not a valid will, for it is generally distributed.

original: kha chems ltag nas byung ba ni ma shi'ang sbyin bar chad pa la bya /
analyzed: kha chems ltag nas byung ba ni ma shi'ang sbyin bar chad pa la bya /
translated: If a will is written after death, it is invalid, even if one is alive.

original: 'di ni shi na gdod byin gyi ma shi na mi sbyin par byas pa la bya /
analyzed: 'di ni shi na gdod byin gyi ma shi na mi sbyin par byas pa la bya /
translated: This refers to the case of someone who says, “When I die, give this, but if I do not die, do not give it.”

original: dbang ba ni khyim pa'i'o //
analyzed: dbang ba ni khyim pa'i'o //
translated: “Under one’s control” refers to a lay person.

original: khyim pa zhig shi ba'i nor dge 'dun dang dge slong la phul cig ces kha chems gzhag pa ni blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: khyim pa zhig shi ba'i nor dge 'dun dang dge slong la phul cig ces kha chems gzhag pa ni blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a lay person who is dying says, “Give this wealth to the Saṅgha or a monk,” it is permissible to accept it.

original: phul nas khyim pa shi na khye'u dang chung ma ni ci bder bya /
analyzed: phul nas khyim pa shi na khye'u dang chung ma ni ci bder bya /
translated: If a lay person dies after giving, the son and wife should do whatever is comfortable.

original: khyim pas nad pa'i kha chems kyis skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa mi phul ba ni bkol du btang ngo //
analyzed: khyim pas nad pa'i kha chems kyis skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa mi phul ba ni bkol du btang ngo //
translated: If a lay person does not give a man, a woman, and so on, because of the dying man’s will, he is considered to have given them.

original: ba lang dang rta dang rnga mo dang bong bu dang dre'u dang go cha dag rgyal po la phul /
analyzed: ba lang dang rta dang rnga mo dang bong bu dang dre'u dang go cha dag rgyal po la phul /
translated: Cows, horses, camels, donkeys, mules, and armor are given to the king.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams yon du zhul ba ni rgyal po la sbyin no //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams yon du zhul ba ni rgyal po la sbyin no //
translated: The gifts mentioned here are to be given to the king.

original: mtshon cha ni mi sbyin no //
analyzed: mtshon cha ni mi sbyin no //
translated: But weapons are not to be given.

original: gsum la dbyig dang gser dang gzhan dang byas pa dang ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum la dbyig dang gser dang gzhan dang byas pa dang ma byas pa'o //
translated: The three are gold, silver, and other things, both made and unmade.

original: rin po che dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: rin po che dag kyang ngo //
translated: And also jewels.

original: dbyig dang gser dang dngul la sogs pa rin po che phul ba ni sum cha gcig sangs rgyas la dbul /
analyzed: dbyig dang gser dang dngul la sogs pa rin po che phul ba ni sum cha gcig sangs rgyas la dbul /
translated: When one offers gold, silver, jewels, etc., one third is to be given to the Buddha,

original: sum cha gcig chos la dbul /
analyzed: sum cha gcig chos la dbul /
translated: one third to the Dharma,

original: sum cha gcig dge 'dun la dbul lo //
analyzed: sum cha gcig dge 'dun la dbul lo //
translated: and one third to the Sangha.

original: rgyal po ma byin na pham par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po ma byin na pham par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not give to the king, one will be defeated.

original: 'on te gzhan yod dam de'i cha las lhag kyang ngam de ste ma yin kyang de bzhin du sangs rgyas la ni mu tig dag go//
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yod dam de'i cha las lhag kyang ngam de ste ma yin kyang de bzhin du sangs rgyas la ni mu tig dag go//
translated: But if there is another, or if there is more than that, or if there is not, in the same way, for the Buddha, pearls.

original: @253b khyim pas nor phul ba de la nor gzhan dang mu tig 'dres sam mu tig 'ba' zhig yod kyang rung ste rin thang brtsis te mu tig rnams ni sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
analyzed: @253b khyim pas nor phul ba de la nor gzhan dang mu tig 'dres sam mu tig 'ba' zhig yod kyang rung ste rin thang brtsis te mu tig rnams ni sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
translated: When a householder offers wealth, whether other wealth is mixed in with the pearls or there are only pearls, after calculating the value, the pearls are to be given to the Buddha.

original: ma phul na sbom por kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma phul na sbom por kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not offer it, he commits a serious offense.

original: tshon chen po yang ngo //
analyzed: tshon chen po yang ngo //
translated: Also, the eight precious things.

original: tshon chen po brgyad du gtogs pa zhig phul na'ang dge slong gis spyad du mi rung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
analyzed: tshon chen po brgyad du gtogs pa zhig phul na'ang dge slong gis spyad du mi rung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
translated: If he is offered any of the eight precious things, the monk should offer it to the Buddha because it is not suitable for him to use.🔽If the Buddha is offered pearls and precious things, they should be mixed, ground, and used to paint and plaster the Buddha’s temple.

original: btags te dri gtsang khang skyang nul byug / sangs rgyas la mu tig dang tshon chen po phul na bsres te btags la sangs rgyas kyi dri gtsang khang gi ri mo dang skyang nul du byug / de las gzhan sangs rgyas kyi ni gzugs dang dri gtsang khang🔽dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bsgo //
analyzed: btags te dri gtsang khang skyang nul byug / sangs rgyas la mu tig dang tshon chen po phul na bsres te btags la sangs rgyas kyi dri gtsang khang gi ri mo dang skyang nul du byug / de las gzhan sangs rgyas kyi ni gzugs dang dri gtsang khang dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bsgo //
translated: Other than that, the Buddha’s image, temple, and stūpa should be decorated with precious things.🔽Precious jewels and so forth should be used to make ornaments for the Buddha’s image or to sell and build images and stūpas.

original: nor bu rin po che la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs kyi rgyan nam btsongs la gzugs dang mchod rten du brtsig / chos kyi ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bri ba dang seng ge'i khri'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs kyi rgyan nam btsongs la gzugs dang mchod rten du brtsig / chos kyi ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bri ba dang seng ge'i khri'o //
translated: The Dharma should be used to write the Buddha’s words and make lion thrones.

original: chos kyi skal bar phul ba rnams ni chos kyi yi ge bri ba dang yi ge klag pa'i khri la sogs pa bya /
analyzed: chos kyi skal bar phul ba rnams ni chos kyi yi ge bri ba dang yi ge klag pa'i khri la sogs pa bya /
translated: Those who offer them as a share of the Dharma should be given a copy of the Dharma, a seat for reading the scriptures and so on.

original: theg pa ni gzugs la'o //
analyzed: theg pa ni gzugs la'o //
translated: The vehicle is for the form of the Buddha.

original: khyogs dang shing rta la sogs pa phul ba'i yul bskor ba'i gzugs bzhag pa'i phyir sku gzugs la dbul lo //
analyzed: khyogs dang shing rta la sogs pa phul ba'i yul bskor ba'i gzugs bzhag pa'i phyir sku gzugs la dbul lo //
translated: Since the object of offering a palanquin, chariot and so on is to circumambulate, it is offered to an image of the Buddha.

original: rgyal mtshan la de'i 'od ma dang yu ba dag de la rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan la de'i 'od ma dang yu ba dag de la rigs pa'o //
translated: The banner is appropriate for the bamboo and shaft of the Buddha's image.

original: shing ring bo dang 'od ma phul ba ni 'phen shing dang rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba bya'o //
analyzed: shing ring bo dang 'od ma phul ba ni 'phen shing dang rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba bya'o //
translated: The long wood and bamboo offered are for the flagpole and shaft of the banner.

original: gzhan dang lag cha dag ni dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang lag cha dag ni dge 'dun la'o //
translated: Other implements are offered to the Saṅgha.

original: shing thung du dang lag cha la sogs pa ni dge 'dun la dbul te spyi ltar spyad pa'i thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: shing thung du dang lag cha la sogs pa ni dge 'dun la dbul te spyi ltar spyad pa'i thabs ni 'og nas 'chad /
translated: Short wood and implements are offered to the Saṅgha. The method of using them in common is explained below.

original: 'khar gsil dang khab dang mtshon du byas te de dag brim lcags sam /

original: bshang gci byed pa dang sa phyag pa la sogs pa'i las byed par chos gos snam bdun pa gyon te mi spyad /🔽'di la mi nyal /
analyzed: bshang gci byed pa dang sa phyag pa la sogs pa'i las byed par chos gos snam bdun pa gyon te mi spyad / 'di la mi nyal /
translated: Do not defecate, urinate, or spit while wearing the seven-piece lower robe.🔽Do not sleep while wearing the seven-piece lower robe.

original: chos gos snam bdun pa'i 'og tu yang mi gding gyon bzhin du yang mi nyal /
analyzed: chos gos snam bdun pa'i 'og tu yang mi gding gyon bzhin du yang mi nyal /

original: bsod snyoms len pa spyod pa dang mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba dang dge 'dun la 'du ba dang chos mnyan pa'i cha mnod pa myong ba las gzhan byed pa la sbyar mas ma yin /

translated: Do not engage in any activity other than receiving alms, circumambulating a stupa, attending a gathering of the saṅgha, listening to the teachings, or eating.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams byed par chos gos chen po bgo ba'i las gzhan byed par mi bgo /'di rnams la grong bar du ma gyon na nyes med do //

original: 'di'i steng du 'dug gam 'dug tu mi gzhug chos gos chen po 'di'i steng du bdag kyang mi 'dug gzhan kyang mi gzhag /'di @257a * //🔽la mi gnad /

original: mchan khung g-yas pa'i thad kar dugs kyis ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dugs gzan gud nas glan /
analyzed: mchan khung g-yas pa'i thad kar dugs kyis ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dugs gzan gud nas glan /
translated: Since the armpit area is soiled, a sweat-cloth is attached to the right side.

original: khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo //
translated: It is one cubit and four fingers in height.

original: rdul gzan gud nas glan pa'i tshad ni zheng du mtho gang chur khru phyed dang ngo //
analyzed: rdul gzan gud nas glan pa'i tshad ni zheng du mtho gang chur khru phyed dang ngo //
translated: The sweat-cloth is attached to the right side of the upper robe. Its size is one cubit and four fingers in width and one cubit and two fingers in height.

original: ngos gnyis su nan bus mnan /
analyzed: ngos gnyis su nan bus mnan /
translated: It is pressed down on both sides.

original: rdul gzan glan pa'i dus su nan bus mnan /
analyzed: rdul gzan glan pa'i dus su nan bus mnan /
translated: When the sweat-cloth is attached, it is pressed down on both sides.

original: dus dus su 'di bkru /
analyzed: dus dus su 'di bkru /
translated: From time to time it is washed.

original: rdul gzan glan pa de dus dus su bkru /
analyzed: rdul gzan glan pa de dus dus su bkru /
translated: The sweat-cloth is washed from time to time.

original: btso ba yang ngo //
analyzed: btso ba yang ngo //
translated: It is also boiled.

original: rdul gzan de bkrus nas btso //🔽glang btsag gis de de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rdul gzan de bkrus nas btso // glang btsag gis de de bzhin du'o //
translated: After washing the sweat-cloth, it is boiled.🔽It is also boiled in cow dung.

original: btso ba ni glang btsag gis btsos kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: btso ba ni glang btsag gis btsos kyang rung ngo //
translated: It is also boiled in cow dung.

original: gdong phyis bcang /
analyzed: gdong phyis bcang /
translated: One should carry a face-cloth.

original: gdong phyis bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: gdong phyis bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to carry a face-cloth.

original: lus zag na lus la phyi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: lus zag na lus la phyi ba yang ngo //
translated: If the body is soiled, one should also carry a body-cloth.

original: dge slong sdig po che dugs dang rdul che ba lus kyi phyi ba bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dge slong sdig po che dugs dang rdul che ba lus kyi phyi ba bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault for a monk with a lot of bad karma and sweat to carry a body-cloth.

original: chos gos de'i nang du de bgo'o //
analyzed: chos gos de'i nang du de bgo'o //
translated: One should wear it inside the Dharma robes.

original: rdul che ba dang shu ba dang rang khrag yod na chos gos kyi 'og tu rnag gzan bgo / chags na gro'i chu'am tshig pa chu dang bsres te byugs la dal bu dal bus dgog / rnag gzan dang lus su 'byar na nas kyi phye dang so phag
analyzed: rdul che ba dang shu ba dang rang khrag yod na chos gos kyi 'og tu rnag gzan bgo / chags na gro'i chu'am tshig pa chu dang bsres te byugs la dal bu dal bus dgog / rnag gzan dang lus su 'byar na nas kyi phye dang so phag
translated: If the poultice sticks to the body, wash it with a mixture of water and flour of roasted barley and brick powder.

original: btags pa'i phye chu dang sbyar te bkrus la dal bus dgog go //
analyzed: btags pa'i phye chu dang sbyar te bkrus la dal bus dgog go //
translated: Wash it with a mixture of water and flour of roasted barley and brick powder.

original: rnag dang khrag la rnag gzan 'byar na dgog pa'i thabs gong ma ltar bya /
analyzed: rnag dang khrag la rnag gzan 'byar na dgog pa'i thabs gong ma ltar bya /
translated: If the poultice sticks to the pus and blood, use the above method to stop it.

original: dus dus su gding bkru bskam btso /
analyzed: dus dus su gding bkru bskam btso /
translated: From time to time, wash, dry and boil the bedding.🔽If it is itchy, it is good to apply a decoction of cow's urine.

original: de glang btsag gis na dge / rnag gzan bco ba na shu ba la phan pa'i phyir glang btsag gis bskus na dge / gar bab bab tu gos mi gzhag / gos lhag ma la sogs @257b pa gar bab bab tu mi gzhag gi bltab cing nan tan
analyzed: de glang btsag gis na dge / rnag gzan bco ba na shu ba la phan pa'i phyir glang btsag gis bskus na dge / gar bab bab tu gos mi gzhag / gos lhag ma la sogs @257b pa gar bab bab tu mi gzhag gi bltab cing nan tan
translated: If the poultice is removed, it is good to apply a decoction of cow's urine to benefit the boil.🔽Do not leave the robe wherever it may be, but roll it up and take care of it.

original: bya / de'i phyir gdang bca'/
analyzed: bya / de'i phyir gdang bca'/
translated: For that reason, make a rack.

original: gos dgal ba'i phyir gdang bca'/
analyzed: gos dgal ba'i phyir gdang bca'/
translated: Make a rack to dry the robe.

original: lung bu yang de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung bu yang de'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, a bag is for that purpose.

original: gdang shing gzhug pa'i gnas rtsig pa la bu gu gtod de shing sbu bu can gzhug / gtsug lag khang byed pa na'o //
analyzed: gdang shing gzhug pa'i gnas rtsig pa la bu gu gtod de shing sbu bu can gzhug / gtsug lag khang byed pa na'o //
translated: The holes for the pegs are to be made in the wall.

original: gdang shing bu gu gdod pa thog ma gtsug lag khang brtsig pa nas bya /🔽bu gu mi bya /
analyzed: gdang shing bu gu gdod pa thog ma gtsug lag khang brtsig pa nas bya / bu gu mi bya /
translated: The holes for the pegs are to be made at the beginning of the construction of the monastery.🔽One should not make holes.

original: gdang shing gis 'phral bu gu mi gdod /
analyzed: gdang shing gis 'phral bu gu mi gdod /
translated: One should not make holes in the wooden frame.

original: gtsug lag khang ni dpe ste khang bu yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni dpe ste khang bu yang de bzhin no //
translated: The monastery is the example. The small house is the same.

original: gdang shing gi bya ba dang bu gu mi brko gtsug lag khang bzhin du gang zag gi khyim bu yang mi brko zhing thog ma nas gdod /
analyzed: gdang shing gi bya ba dang bu gu mi brko gtsug lag khang bzhin du gang zag gi khyim bu yang mi brko zhing thog ma nas gdod /
translated: Just as the monastery is not dug out, the small house of the person is not dug out.

original: lcug ma dang thag bus 'di 'grub bo //
analyzed: lcug ma dang thag bus 'di 'grub bo //
translated: It is made with bamboo and rope.

original: gdang shing gi skyin par lcug ma'am thag bu btags kyang rung ngo //🔽tshang thur gyis gos blangs na dge'o //
analyzed: gdang shing gi skyin par lcug ma'am thag bu btags kyang rung ngo // tshang thur gyis gos blangs na dge'o //
translated: It is also suitable to attach bamboo or rope as a substitute for the wooden frame.🔽It is virtuous to take the robe with a needle case.

original: chos gos kyi snod tshang thur gyi nang du bcug na dge /'di bya /
analyzed: chos gos kyi snod tshang thur gyi nang du bcug na dge /'di bya /
translated: It is virtuous to put the robe container in the needle case.

original: tshang thur byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: tshang thur byas kyang nyes med /
translated: Even if one makes a needle case, there is no fault.

original: gsum mdang phyed dang dor sbyar te btsem /
analyzed: gsum mdang phyed dang dor sbyar te btsem /
translated: One should sew the robe at midnight, with the three robes and the waistband.

original: tshang thur gyi tshad ni chur khru gsum zheng khru phyed dang do bya /
analyzed: tshang thur gyi tshad ni chur khru gsum zheng khru phyed dang do bya /
translated: The size of the water strainer is three cubits in height and half a cubit in width.

original: kha dbus su gdod /
analyzed: kha dbus su gdod /
translated: The mouth is at the center.

original: sgrog bu sbyin /🔽tshang thur gyi kha mi bya ba'i phyir sgrog bu bya srad bus so //
analyzed: sgrog bu sbyin / tshang thur gyi kha mi bya ba'i phyir sgrog bu bya srad bus so //
translated: The ring is attached.🔽In order to prevent the mouth of the water strainer from being torn, the ring is made of string.

original: sgrog pa'i rgyu srad bu las bya /
analyzed: sgrog pa'i rgyu srad bu las bya /
translated: The string used for the ring is made of wool.

original: gzhan gyis bcing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bcing /
translated: It is tied by another person.

original: tshang thur gyi kha gcad pa'i phyir sgro gu gcig gi mig tu gcig bcug ste lu gu rgyud du btsem /
analyzed: tshang thur gyi kha gcad pa'i phyir sgro gu gcig gi mig tu gcig bcug ste lu gu rgyud du btsem /
translated: In order to close the mouth of the water strainer, one string is inserted into the eye of another string and they are woven together.

original: bcad pa ni steng du bca'/
analyzed: bcad pa ni steng du bca'/
translated: The closed end is placed on top.

original: chos gos rtag tu dbyung /
analyzed: chos gos rtag tu dbyung /
translated: The Dharma robe is always worn.

original: dgos na tshang thur gyi kha logs su gzhug / sang 'gro na bla ma la gsol te gnang na 'gro //
analyzed: dgos na tshang thur gyi kha logs su gzhug / sang 'gro na bla ma la gsol te gnang na 'gro //
translated: If necessary, it is placed inside the mouth of the water strainer. If one is going away, one requests permission from the guru and if given, one goes.

original: dge slong gnas bca' ba zhig gud du 'gro na gnas brtan la sang 'gro'o zhes zhu /
analyzed: dge slong gnas bca' ba zhig gud du 'gro na gnas brtan la sang 'gro'o zhes zhu /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who has taken up residence is going away, he should inform the most senior monk that he is going away the next day.

original: gnas mi bca' ba zhig na'ang grogs la 'gro'o zhes shes par bya /
analyzed: gnas mi bca' ba zhig na'ang grogs la 'gro'o zhes shes par bya /
translated: Even if one is not taking up residence, one should inform one's companions that one is going away.

original: bdag gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te 'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas su chag chag la sogs pa byas te 'o //
translated: One should return to one's own residence and do things like sprinkling water on the ground.

original: dge slong gud du 'gro na bdag 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas phyag dar dang chag chag la sogs pa byas te 'gro /🔽lam du 'gro bas chos kyi gtam mam bsrings pa'i mi smra bas so //
analyzed: dge slong gud du 'gro na bdag 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas phyag dar dang chag chag la sogs pa byas te 'gro / lam du 'gro bas chos kyi gtam mam bsrings pa'i mi smra bas so //
translated: When a monk goes elsewhere, he should leave his dwelling clean, having swept it, sprinkled it with water, and so forth.🔽When he goes on the road, he should either speak Dharma or remain silent.

original: lam du zhugs nas 'gro ba'i tshe gtam cal col mi smra ba'i chos kyi gtam mam chos kyi don la bsam /
analyzed: lam du zhugs nas 'gro ba'i tshe gtam cal col mi smra ba'i chos kyi gtam mam chos kyi don la bsam /
translated: When he has set out on the road, he should not speak idle chatter, but speak Dharma or reflect on its meaning.

original: ngal bso ba'i gnas nas zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa @258a * //
analyzed: ngal bso ba'i gnas nas zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa @258a * //
translated: When he stops to rest, he should recite verses from the scriptures.

original: bklags te'o // lam na ngal bso ba las langs pa'i tshe zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bklags te 'gro //🔽chu bcu ba na yang ngo //🔽chu bcu ba'i tshe 'ang zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad /
analyzed: bklags te'o // lam na ngal bso ba las langs pa'i tshe zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bklags te 'gro // chu bcu ba na yang ngo // chu bcu ba'i tshe 'ang zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad /
translated: When he has risen from his rest and is traveling again, he should recite verses from the scriptures.

original: de'i chu gang gi ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chu gang gi ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: When he draws water, he should also do this.🔽When he draws water, he should recite verses from the scriptures.

original: chu bcu ba'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bklags pa ni khron pa'am yur ba 'dren 'dren pa'i mi de nyid kyi phyir bsngo //
analyzed: chu bcu ba'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bklags pa ni khron pa'am yur ba 'dren 'dren pa'i mi de nyid kyi phyir bsngo //
translated: He should dedicate the merit to the person who dug the well or to the person who is drawing the water.

original: 'bab chu'i rgyal po la bsngo //
analyzed: 'bab chu'i rgyal po la bsngo //
translated: and to the king of the streams.

original: gzhan lha la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan lha la yang ngo //
translated: And to other gods.

original: chu'i lha la tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags /
analyzed: chu'i lha la tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags /
translated: One verse is recited to the water god.

original: gnas su gsum rgyud do //
analyzed: gnas su gsum rgyud do //
translated: One should recite the three verses in the place.

original: lam du zhag lon na nang par gsum rgyud bklags te 'gro /
analyzed: lam du zhag lon na nang par gsum rgyud bklags te 'gro /
translated: If one spends the night on the road, one should recite the three verses in the morning and go.

original: dgon pa pa'i bcang /
analyzed: dgon pa pa'i bcang /
translated: The carrying of the water-strainer by those in the wilderness.

original: dgon pa bas chu bcu ba'i srad bu bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dgon pa bas chu bcu ba'i srad bu bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is also permissible for those in the wilderness to carry the string for the water-strainer.

original: de'i tshad ni khru brgya lnga bcu nas brgya yan chad do //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni khru brgya lnga bcu nas brgya yan chad do //
translated: The measure of that is from one hundred and fifty cubits to one hundred cubits.

original: chu bcu ba'i thag bu'i tshad ni khru brgya lnga bcu man chad brgya yan chad du bya'o //
analyzed: chu bcu ba'i thag bu'i tshad ni khru brgya lnga bcu man chad brgya yan chad du bya'o //
translated: The measure of the string for the water-strainer should be from one hundred and fifty cubits down to one hundred cubits.

original: yul gyi rnams las so zhes gzhan las so //
analyzed: yul gyi rnams las so zhes gzhan las so //
translated: From the rules of the country, from others.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re chu bcu ba'i thag bu khron pa ring thung tshad bzhin du bcangs pas chog go zhes kyang bshad /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re chu bcu ba'i thag bu khron pa ring thung tshad bzhin du bcangs pas chog go zhes kyang bshad /
translated: Some Vinaya holders say that it is sufficient to carry the string for the water-strainer like the measure of a well, long or short.

original: khron pa ma yin pa'i chu dkon na 'di med par yul rgyu ba mi spyad /
analyzed: khron pa ma yin pa'i chu dkon na 'di med par yul rgyu ba mi spyad /
translated: If there is no well and water is scarce, one should not travel in that country without this.

original: 'bab chu med de khron pa 'ba' zhig yod na thag bu bcad dgos kyi khron pa med kyi 'bab chu yod pa'i yul du ni thag bu bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: 'bab chu med de khron pa 'ba' zhig yod na thag bu bcad dgos kyi khron pa med kyi 'bab chu yod pa'i yul du ni thag bu bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If there is no running water and only a well, you must carry a rope. But if there is running water and no well, there is no fault in not carrying a rope.

original: lam pas chos gos sprugs la khrus byas pa'am rkang lag bkru ba dang chu blangs nas /
analyzed: lam pas chos gos sprugs la khrus byas pa'am rkang lag bkru ba dang chu blangs nas /
translated: When the path is muddy, you should shake out your robes and wash them.

original: lam du zhugs te song song ba las gtsug lag khang zhig tu 'gro na chos gos la sogs pa sprugs lus kyi dri ma yod na khrus byas la khrus ma nus na'ang yan lag lnga bkrus te mandal bya ba'i chu dag blangs te btags la lham phyi ste
analyzed: lam du zhugs te song song ba las gtsug lag khang zhig tu 'gro na chos gos la sogs pa sprugs lus kyi dri ma yod na khrus byas la khrus ma nus na'ang yan lag lnga bkrus te mandal bya ba'i chu dag blangs te btags la lham phyi ste
translated: When you have entered the path and are walking, if you are going to a temple, shake out your robes and so forth. If you have body odor, wash it off. If you are unable to wash, wash your five limbs and take some water for cleaning.

original: lham la rdul med par chus phyis te /
analyzed: lham la rdul med par chus phyis te /
translated: Wipe your shoes with water so that they are free of dust.

original: chos gos gsum bgo ste /
analyzed: chos gos gsum bgo ste /
translated: Put on your three Dharma robes.

original: gtsug lag khang du 'gro ba'i tshe chos gos gsum bgo ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du 'gro ba'i tshe chos gos gsum bgo ste /
translated: When you are going to a temple, put on your three Dharma robes.

original: zhi ba'i spyod yul gyis gtsug lag khang du 'jug / mgo sgyur dang lag brgyangs mi bya bar gtsug lag khang du 'gro /
analyzed: zhi ba'i spyod yul gyis gtsug lag khang du 'jug / mgo sgyur dang lag brgyangs mi bya bar gtsug lag khang du 'gro /
translated: Enter the temple with a peaceful demeanor.

original: rgan po bzhi la phyag 'tshal te 'greng /
analyzed: rgan po bzhi la phyag 'tshal te 'greng /
translated: He should stand up and pay homage to the four elders.

original: gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas lo grangs ma dris kyi bar du dge slong pa'i dge 'dun du langs pa la phyag byas te 'greng la bsdad /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du 'ongs nas lo grangs ma dris kyi bar du dge slong pa'i dge 'dun du langs pa la phyag byas te 'greng la bsdad /
translated: Having come to the temple, he should stand up and pay homage to the assembly of monks until they ask his age.

original: gsang ba'i phyogs su sgra bskyungs te mdzes shing @258b rab tu bsdam pa'i spyod pas so //
analyzed: gsang ba'i phyogs su sgra bskyungs te mdzes shing @258b rab tu bsdam pa'i spyod pas so //
translated: He should remain silent and behave beautifully and well-controlled in the private quarters.

original: 'grengs te 'dug pa ni kun gyis mthong zhing gsal ba'i phyogs su sgra bskyungs la mdzes shing tshul bsdams te gtogs 'dod dang shes 'dod mi bya bar 'dug go //
analyzed: 'grengs te 'dug pa ni kun gyis mthong zhing gsal ba'i phyogs su sgra bskyungs la mdzes shing tshul bsdams te gtogs 'dod dang shes 'dod mi bya bar 'dug go //
translated: He should stand and remain silent and behave beautifully and controlled in the public quarters, without wanting to talk or know.

original: rgyus dang bcas pas ngal bso //
analyzed: rgyus dang bcas pas ngal bso //
translated: He should rest when he is tired, together with the reason.

original: mi shes par ngal mi bso /
analyzed: mi shes par ngal mi bso /
translated: He should not rest when he is not tired.

original: gud nas dge slong zhig 'ongs na 'dug pas mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i rgyus shes shing ngo shes na ngal sor gzhug / rgyus dang ngo mi shes na ngal sor mi gzhug / mu gcig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gud nas dge slong zhig 'ongs na 'dug pas mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa'i rgyus shes shing ngo shes na ngal sor gzhug / rgyus dang ngo mi shes na ngal sor mi gzhug / mu gcig pa yang ngo //
translated: If another monk comes, he should let him rest if he knows and recognizes the reason, such as the abbot, teacher, and so on. He should not let him rest if he does not know and recognize the reason. This is the first alternative.

original: mur 'dug ngo shes shing g-yo mi byed pa zhig 'ongs na'ang ngal sor gzhug / sgo gcad /
analyzed: mur 'dug ngo shes shing g-yo mi byed pa zhig 'ongs na'ang ngal sor gzhug / sgo gcad /
translated: If a monk who is known to be a resident of the monastery comes, let him rest.🔽The door should be closed.

original: slong na mi sbyin /
analyzed: slong na mi sbyin /
translated: If he asks for something, do not give it to him.

original: dge slong ngo mi shes pa zhig gud nas 'ongs pa zhig yod na thug thub byed pa'i phyi sgo chod cig ces gdams /
analyzed: dge slong ngo mi shes pa zhig gud nas 'ongs pa zhig yod na thug thub byed pa'i phyi sgo chod cig ces gdams /
translated: If a monk who is not known to be a resident of the monastery comes from somewhere else, let him be given a meal.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa kha su'ang srid kyis da na re byin cig ces zer zhing 'ongs na'ang ma sbyin cig ces bsgo //
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa kha su'ang srid kyis da na re byin cig ces zer zhing 'ongs na'ang ma sbyin cig ces bsgo //
translated: If someone comes and says, “Now give it,” do not give it.

original: blangs nas zo cig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: blangs nas zo cig ces bsgo nas /
translated: If he says, “Take it and eat it,”

original: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong de rdzas dag las thug thub tu spyod na ma spyod par zhog shig ces bsgo //
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong de rdzas dag las thug thub tu spyod na ma spyod par zhog shig ces bsgo //
translated: and if the monk who came from somewhere else uses the goods for a meal, let him be given the goods.

original: khas blangs te yal bar btang nas stor na /
analyzed: khas blangs te yal bar btang nas stor na /
translated: If he accepts it and then loses it,🔽let him be made to pay for it.

original: grogs la sgo chod cig rdzas dag slong na ma sbyin cig ces gtams te bzhag nas khas blangs pa las stor bar gyur na dge slong khas len pa la skyin pa dbab po //
analyzed: grogs la sgo chod cig rdzas dag slong na ma sbyin cig ces gtams te bzhag nas khas blangs pa las stor bar gyur na dge slong khas len pa la skyin pa dbab po //
translated: If he accepts it and then loses it, the monk who accepted it must pay for it.

original: yid brtan pa'i gnas brtan 'di dag gi grogs po zhes pa la sogs pa bstan nas sbyin du gzhug / tshig lhag ma skad du grogs la gtams te gud nas 'ongs pa thug thub byed cing rku yang srid kyis sgo chod cig / rdzas dag len du ma
analyzed: yid brtan pa'i gnas brtan 'di dag gi grogs po zhes pa la sogs pa bstan nas sbyin du gzhug / tshig lhag ma skad du grogs la gtams te gud nas 'ongs pa thug thub byed cing rku yang srid kyis sgo chod cig / rdzas dag len du ma
translated: The elder, who is a reliable person, says, These are my friends. and so on, and then sends him off.🔽The remaining words are: I have entrusted it to my friends. Since it is possible that they will meet and steal it, lock the door.

original: gzhug cig ces bsgo ba las grogs de na re mi 'di'i rgyus pas shes te thug thub la sogs pa mi byed kyi yid rton cig ces zer te /
analyzed: gzhug cig ces bsgo ba las grogs de na re mi 'di'i rgyus pas shes te thug thub la sogs pa mi byed kyi yid rton cig ces zer te /
translated: Do not let anyone take the goods. The friend says, I know this man. I will not meet him and so on. Trust me.

original: bdag gud du song ba'i 'og tu rdzas shig stor na dge slong grogs de la skyin pa dbab po //
analyzed: bdag gud du song ba'i 'og tu rdzas shig stor na dge slong grogs de la skyin pa dbab po //
translated: If something is lost after I have gone away, I will make you pay, O monk, my friend.

original: mngon rtags kyi gnas gzhan gyis mi rig pa'i bye brag gi thabs kyis so //
analyzed: mngon rtags kyi gnas gzhan gyis mi rig pa'i bye brag gi thabs kyis so //
translated: The sign is the special method of not being recognized by others.

original: dge slong gud nas 'ongs shing rgyus mi shes pa bdag gi grogs pos nor 'di byin gyis long zhig ces zer zhing dan rtags kyi tshig khyer zhing len du 'ongs na bdag dang gnyis su 'khod pa'i dan rtags shig khyer te 'ongs na ni byin kyang nyes med🔽/ gzhan zhig dang gsum @259a * //
analyzed: dge slong gud nas 'ongs shing rgyus mi shes pa bdag gi grogs pos nor 'di byin gyis long zhig ces zer zhing dan rtags kyi tshig khyer zhing len du 'ongs na bdag dang gnyis su 'khod pa'i dan rtags shig khyer te 'ongs na ni byin kyang nyes med / gzhan zhig dang gsum @259a * //
translated: If a monk who has come from elsewhere, whom you do not know, says, “My friend gave me this money. Please take it,” and he brings a written statement, you may accept it if he brings a statement signed by both of you.

original: 'khod pa'i dan rtags shig khyer te 'ongs pa ni mi sbyin no //
analyzed: 'khod pa'i dan rtags shig khyer te 'ongs pa ni mi sbyin no //
translated: You should not accept it if he brings a statement signed by him and someone else.

original: byin pa las lhung na yang ngo //
analyzed: byin pa las lhung na yang ngo //
translated: If you give it to him, there is no fault.🔽If the object is lost while in your possession, you must pay for it.

original: rdzas shig phar byin pa las zin tam zhes ma dris par bar du lhung ste chag na skyin pa bdag la 'bab po //🔽de ste ma bzung bar gtams na'o //
analyzed: rdzas shig phar byin pa las zin tam zhes ma dris par bar du lhung ste chag na skyin pa bdag la 'bab po // de ste ma bzung bar gtams na'o //
translated: If you give the object to someone and he asks, “Is it finished?” and you reply, “It is finished,” but it is lost before he takes possession of it, you must pay for it.

original: rdzas phar byin te zin tam zhes dris pa las zin to zhes zer ba'i 'og tu shor te chag na skyin pa pha rol po la 'bab po //
analyzed: rdzas phar byin te zin tam zhes dris pa las zin to zhes zer ba'i 'og tu shor te chag na skyin pa pha rol po la 'bab po //
translated: If you give the object to someone and he asks, “Is it finished?” and you reply, “It is finished,” but it is lost after he takes possession of it, he must pay for it.

original: 'di la bag med par ma gyur tam zhes 'dri ba la bya /
analyzed: 'di la bag med par ma gyur tam zhes 'dri ba la bya /
translated: This refers to the question, “Has he been careless?”

original: snod spyad dam rdzas mi gzhan gyi lag tu spyin na zin tam ma zin ces dris la sbyin ma dris par byin te btang na nyes byas /
analyzed: snod spyad dam rdzas mi gzhan gyi lag tu spyin na zin tam ma zin ces dris la sbyin ma dris par byin te btang na nyes byas /
translated: If you give a vessel or substance to someone else’s hand, you should ask, “Is it finished?” or “Is it not finished?” and give it after asking. If you give it without asking, you commit an offense.

original: brnyas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma rung bar gyur na bkru ba la sogs pas sems mi rangs na rin sbyin /
analyzed: brnyas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma rung bar gyur na bkru ba la sogs pas sems mi rangs na rin sbyin /
translated: If it is spoiled by being stepped on and so forth, if you are not pleased with washing it and so forth, you should give its value.

original: nor zhig brnyas te spyod spyod pa las slar byin na ngan skyugs kyis reg gam kha dog la sogs pa nyams te /
analyzed: nor zhig brnyas te spyod spyod pa las slar byin na ngan skyugs kyis reg gam kha dog la sogs pa nyams te /
translated: If you have used it with contempt and so forth, and then give it back, if it is not desired because it has been defiled by vomit and so forth, or its color and so forth has been damaged,

original: ma 'dod na bcos shing byi dor byas la sbyin no //
analyzed: ma 'dod na bcos shing byi dor byas la sbyin no //
translated: you should give it after repairing it and cleaning it.

original: bcos te byin kyang ma 'dod na nor de ci ri ba rin du byas te sbyin no //
analyzed: bcos te byin kyang ma 'dod na nor de ci ri ba rin du byas te sbyin no //
translated: If it is not desired even after you have repaired it and given it, you should give its value, whatever it is worth.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos blangs /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos blangs /
translated: Accepting alms bowls and robes.

original: dge slong ngo shes pa yon tan dang ldan pa zhig 'ongs na bsu zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos bdag gis blang /
analyzed: dge slong ngo shes pa yon tan dang ldan pa zhig 'ongs na bsu zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos bdag gis blang /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is known to you and who possesses good qualities comes, you should welcome him and take his alms bowl and robes.

original: stan gding / bsu nas stan bting ste gzhag / rkang pa bkru bar spyan drangs /
analyzed: stan gding / bsu nas stan bting ste gzhag / rkang pa bkru bar spyan drangs /
translated: You should offer him a seat, and after welcoming him, you should set out the seat and place his bowl and robes on it. You should invite him to wash his feet.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong rkang ba bkru zhing mdongs gsol bya /
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong rkang ba bkru zhing mdongs gsol bya /
translated: The newly arrived monk should wash his feet and put on his lower robe.

original: chus so // mi skom mam zhes dris la chu blugs /
analyzed: chus so // mi skom mam zhes dris la chu blugs /
translated: If he is thirsty, the other should ask, Do you want water? and give him some.

original: phyag bya / lo grangs dris te rgan na phyag bya /
analyzed: phyag bya / lo grangs dris te rgan na phyag bya /
translated: He should bow to the elder monk and ask his age.

original: bde bar spyad dam zhes dri /
analyzed: bde bar spyad dam zhes dri /
translated: He should ask, Did you have a comfortable journey?

original: lam na nyon mongs pa med dam zhes nad dri ci nus par mgu bar bya /
analyzed: lam na nyon mongs pa med dam zhes nad dri ci nus par mgu bar bya /
translated: He should ask, Were you not troubled on the road? and please him as much as possible.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa la lus mnye ba dad mar gyis bsku ba la sogs pas mgu bar bya /🔽mal stan tshul bzhin du byin /
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa la lus mnye ba dad mar gyis bsku ba la sogs pas mgu bar bya / mal stan tshul bzhin du byin /
translated: He should please the newly arrived monk by massaging his body, anointing him with oil, and so forth.🔽He should give him a bed in the proper manner.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa rim pa ji tsam du chud pa bzhin mal stan yang sbyin /
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa rim pa ji tsam du chud pa bzhin mal stan yang sbyin /
translated: He should give him a bed in accordance with his seniority.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi gan du 'gro /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi gan du 'gro /
translated: He should go to the elder monk of the saṅgha.

original: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong de gnas brtan gyi gan du song la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong de gnas brtan gyi gan du song la phyag bya'o //
translated: The newly arrived monk should go to the elder monk and bow to him.

original: des de la gnas long shig ces bsgo /
analyzed: des de la gnas long shig ces bsgo /
translated: The elder monk should tell him, Please give me your dwelling place.

original: gnas brtan gyis kyang pha rol po 'ongs pa gnas btsal dgos pa zhig na gnas brtan gyis yon tan ldan pa 'di la gnas chos shig ces bsgo /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis kyang pha rol po 'ongs pa gnas btsal dgos pa zhig na gnas brtan gyis yon tan ldan pa 'di la gnas chos shig ces bsgo /
translated: The elder monk should say, “This is a place where those who come must seek lodging. This one who has good qualities should be given a place to stay.”

original: de ste rgan na mal stan 'di la byin gcig ces bsgo /
analyzed: de ste rgan na mal stan 'di la byin gcig ces bsgo /
translated: If the elder monk is old, he should say, “Give him my bed.”

original: gud nas 'ongs pa gnas bca' mi dgos pa zhig @259b na'ang mal stan tshul bzhin byin cig ces bsgo //
analyzed: gud nas 'ongs pa gnas bca' mi dgos pa zhig @259b na'ang mal stan tshul bzhin byin cig ces bsgo //
translated: If the newcomer is not one who needs to find lodging, the elder monk should say, “Give him a bed properly.”

original: ma brtags par mal stan mi brnya gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong gis kyang gzhi la mal stan yod dam med dam ma brtags par mal stan mi brnya yod na gdod brnya /
analyzed: ma brtags par mal stan mi brnya gud nas 'ongs pa'i dge slong gis kyang gzhi la mal stan yod dam med dam ma brtags par mal stan mi brnya yod na gdod brnya /
translated: Without examining the bed, the elder monk should not give it to the newcomer. The newcomer monk should not take the bed without examining it to see whether it is occupied. If it is occupied, he should take another one.

original: chos gos kyi tha ma ma rung bar gyur na mtha' bskor ba'i thabs /
analyzed: chos gos kyi tha ma ma rung bar gyur na mtha' bskor ba'i thabs /
translated: The method of mending the hem of the robe

original: chos gos kyi tha ma zegs sam ma rung bar gyur na mtha' bskor gyis glan /
analyzed: chos gos kyi tha ma zegs sam ma rung bar gyur na mtha' bskor gyis glan /
translated: If the hem of the robe is torn or worn, it should be mended by sewing a patch on it.

original: de smyung kham gyis sbyar /
analyzed: de smyung kham gyis sbyar /
translated: The patch should be sewn on with a running stitch.

original: mtha' bskor gyis sbyar ba ni btso zhing bkru ba la bde ba'i phyir skabs su gzungs gdab pa tsam du btsem /🔽ro'i gos 'chad na blag ba med pa dang shing gi steng du zhag bdun brgyad dam lnga drug tu'ang gzhan las de bkrus nas kun dge slong dur khrod pa'i ro'i rdzas kyi bdag po yod dam med brtags la med na blangs te shing ngam rtsig pa'i khar zhag
analyzed: mtha' bskor gyis sbyar ba ni btso zhing bkru ba la bde ba'i phyir skabs su gzungs gdab pa tsam du btsem / ro'i gos 'chad na blag ba med pa dang shing gi steng du zhag bdun brgyad dam lnga drug tu'ang gzhan las de bkrus nas kun dge slong dur khrod pa'i ro'i rdzas kyi bdag po yod dam med brtags la med na blangs te shing ngam rtsig pa'i khar zhag
translated: It is sewn in sections so that it can be easily washed and boiled.🔽If the corpse's clothes are torn, one should not add patches, but should wash them and leave them for seven or eight days or five or six days on a tree or wall.

original: bdun nam brgyad du gzhag la ro'i dri mi zhim pa med par gyur na bkrus te gos su bya'o //
analyzed: bdun nam brgyad du gzhag la ro'i dri mi zhim pa med par gyur na bkrus te gos su bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to whom the corpse's property belongs, the monk who lives in the charnel ground should take it. If the corpse's clothes are not yet free of a bad smell, they should be washed and worn.

original: dur khrod pa ma yin par ro'i rdzas blangs pa ni len du mi dbang ste blangs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dur khrod pa ma yin par ro'i rdzas blangs pa ni len du mi dbang ste blangs na nyes byas so //
translated: If one who is not a charnel ground dweller takes the corpse's property, one is not allowed to take it. If one does, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gtsug lag khang dang grong du 'jug par spyan drangs pa las bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes smra ba ni ma btang bar spyod cig ce na bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes nas spyad /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang grong du 'jug par spyan drangs pa las bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes smra ba ni ma btang bar spyod cig ce na bdag dur khrod pa'o zhes nas spyad /
translated: If one is invited to enter a monastery or a village, if one says, “I am a charnel ground dweller,” one should not stay. If one does, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong dur khrod pa gtsug lag khang dang khyim du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: dge slong dur khrod pa gtsug lag khang dang khyim du mi 'gro'o //
translated: A monk who lives in a charnel ground does not go to a monastery or to a house.

original: 'gro na'ang sgo na bsdad do //
analyzed: 'gro na'ang sgo na bsdad do //
translated: If he goes, he stays at the door.🔽If he is invited to stay and is called inside, he should say, ‘I am a charnel ground monk.’

original: bsdad pa las spyan 'dren cing 'bod pa na'ang dur khrod pa yin no zhes smros shig / de skad smras pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa btsun pa khrod btsog pa med nang du bzhud stan la bzhugs zhes zer na nang du song zhing stan la 'dug kyang
analyzed: bsdad pa las spyan 'dren cing 'bod pa na'ang dur khrod pa yin no zhes smros shig / de skad smras pa dang yon tan dang ldan pa btsun pa khrod btsog pa med nang du bzhud stan la bzhugs zhes zer na nang du song zhing stan la 'dug kyang
translated: If he is told, ‘There is no danger from filth. Come inside and sit on a seat,’ he may go inside and sit on the seat.

original: nyes med do //
analyzed: nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense.

original: de skad mi zer bar nang du 'gro zhing stan la 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: de skad mi zer bar nang du 'gro zhing stan la 'dug par mi bya /
translated: He should not go inside and sit on the seat without saying this.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi spyad /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi spyad /
translated: He should not use the saṅgha’s bedding.

original: dur khrod pa'i dge 'dun gyi stan la gzhag cing spyod du bcug na'ang mi spyad /
analyzed: dur khrod pa'i dge 'dun gyi stan la gzhag cing spyod du bcug na'ang mi spyad /
translated: He should not use the bedding of a charnel ground monk even if he is told to do so.

original: mchod rten las 'dom gyis mtha' spang /
analyzed: mchod rten las 'dom gyis mtha' spang /
translated: He should not go within an arm’s reach of a stūpa.

original: dge slong dur khrod pas mchod rten la ma reg cing 'dom gang tsam nas bskor /
analyzed: dge slong dur khrod pas mchod rten la ma reg cing 'dom gang tsam nas bskor /
translated: A monk who lives in a charnel ground should not touch a stūpa. He should circumambulate keeping a distance of an arm’s reach.

original: sbrang yab bcang /
analyzed: sbrang yab bcang /
translated: He should carry a fly whisk.

original: sbrang ma za na dge slong gis sbrang yab bcangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sbrang ma za na dge slong gis sbrang yab bcangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one eats honey, there is no fault for a monk to carry a fly whisk.

original: bal dang shan dang shing bal dang ras ma dang lo ma lhab lhub pa'o //
analyzed: bal dang shan dang shing bal dang ras ma dang lo ma lhab lhub pa'o //
translated: Silk, wool, cotton, cloth, and leaves are the adornments.

original: sbrang yab btsang ba'i rgyu bal las skud par bkal ba @260a * //
analyzed: sbrang yab btsang ba'i rgyu bal las skud par bkal ba @260a * //
translated: The cause of a pure fly whisk is spun thread from silk.

original: dang shing gi lo ma g-yag rnga 'dra ba dang shing bal las skud par bkal ba dang ras dang snam bu'i ras ma dang shing gi lo ma shad shad por 'dug pa dang / 'di rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: dang shing gi lo ma g-yag rnga 'dra ba dang shing bal las skud par bkal ba dang ras dang snam bu'i ras ma dang shing gi lo ma shad shad por 'dug pa dang / 'di rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: It is made from the leaves of a tree that resemble yak tails, spun thread from cotton, cloth, and cloth from cloth. It is made from the leaves of a tree that resemble a woven pattern, and these are used.

original: ba lang dang rta dang ba lang gi spu'i ma yin /
analyzed: ba lang dang rta dang ba lang gi spu'i ma yin /
translated: It is not made from the hair of cows, horses, or cows.

original: sbrang yab rta dang g-yag rnga la sogs pa spu byas pa'i sbrang yab mi bya /
analyzed: sbrang yab rta dang g-yag rnga la sogs pa spu byas pa'i sbrang yab mi bya /
translated: A fly whisk is not made from the hair of horses, yak tails, and so on.

original: gang zag gis yu ba thams cad tshon rtsis ma yin /
analyzed: gang zag gis yu ba thams cad tshon rtsis ma yin /
translated: The handle of the fly whisk is not painted with all colors by a person.

original: sbrang yab dang seg cang gi yu ba ri mo can mi bya /
analyzed: sbrang yab dang seg cang gi yu ba ri mo can mi bya /
translated: The handle of the fly whisk and the handle of the fly-whisk case are not decorated with designs.

original: ri mo med kyang kha dog 'tsher ba la'ang mi bya /
analyzed: ri mo med kyang kha dog 'tsher ba la'ang mi bya /
translated: Even if there are no designs, it is also not made from shiny colors.

original: ri mo dang ri mo nyes pas ma yin /
analyzed: ri mo dang ri mo nyes pas ma yin /
translated: It is not made from designs and bad designs.

original: ci'ang rung ste ri mo can gyi rdzas mi spyad /
analyzed: ci'ang rung ste ri mo can gyi rdzas mi spyad /
translated: One should not use any substance that has a picture on it.

original: sbrang bu'i khang bu yang ngo //🔽sbrang ma zan ras kyi khang bu dbub /🔽steng bu ras bting ste'o //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i khang bu yang ngo // sbrang ma zan ras kyi khang bu dbub / steng bu ras bting ste'o //
translated: Even a beehive.🔽A beehive is made of cloth.🔽The upper part is covered with cloth.

original: khang bu'i steng du ras gding /
analyzed: khang bu'i steng du ras gding /
translated: The upper part of the beehive is covered with cloth.

original: rgyug pa la bcings te'o //
analyzed: rgyug pa la bcings te'o //
translated: It is tied to a rope.

original: khang bu'i ras rgyug pa la bcing /
analyzed: khang bu'i ras rgyug pa la bcing /
translated: The cloth of the beehive is tied to a rope.

original: khru bzhi dang gnyis so //
analyzed: khru bzhi dang gnyis so //
translated: It is four cubits long.

original: ras khang gi tshad ni zheng khru bzhir bya /
analyzed: ras khang gi tshad ni zheng khru bzhir bya /
translated: The size of the cloth house is four cubits wide.

original: chongs shig / be'u ras @260b dang sngas gru bzhi yang ngo //
analyzed: chongs shig / be'u ras @260b dang sngas gru bzhi yang ngo //
translated: A piece of cloth and a square pillow are also so.

original: be'u ras dang sngas bar tshangs can gang zag gis bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: be'u ras dang sngas bar tshangs can gang zag gis bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a person with a hole in his garment or a square pillow keeps them, there is no fault.

original: bu dang chung ma rnyed na sbyin bdag gi dbang gis nan tan bya /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma rnyed na sbyin bdag gi dbang gis nan tan bya /
translated: If one finds a son or wife, one should insist by the power of the donor.

original: yon bdag bsod nams 'dod pa'i phyir bu dang chung ma dge 'dun la yon du phul na khos ci ltar bsdos te phul ba bzhin du nan tan du spyad /
analyzed: yon bdag bsod nams 'dod pa'i phyir bu dang chung ma dge 'dun la yon du phul na khos ci ltar bsdos te phul ba bzhin du nan tan du spyad /
translated: If the donor offers a son or wife to the Saṅgha out of desire for merit, one should insist on using them as much as he has offered.

original: de ste slu bar gyur na de ci cam du 'dod pa'i rin gyis so //
analyzed: de ste slu bar gyur na de ci cam du 'dod pa'i rin gyis so //
translated: If he deceives, then he should be given the price of what he desires.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar bu dang chung ma phul ba las slar slu zhes zer na dge 'dun gyis rin thang mi bcad kyi kho bo kha thabs bzhin du slu sbyin /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar bu dang chung ma phul ba las slar slu zhes zer na dge 'dun gyis rin thang mi bcad kyi kho bo kha thabs bzhin du slu sbyin /
translated: If he says, I will offer a son or wife as in the Sutra of the Head, but I will deceive later, the Saṅgha should not determine the price, but should deceive him as much as he has said.

original: yang phul yang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: yang phul yang brtags pa'o //
translated: Again, it is an examination of what is offered.

original: yon du phul zin pa las bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir slar ma bslus kyang lan du mar bslus shing 'bul lo zhes zer zhing 'bul na'ang mi rung ba med do //
analyzed: yon du phul zin pa las bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir slar ma bslus kyang lan du mar bslus shing 'bul lo zhes zer zhing 'bul na'ang mi rung ba med do //
translated: But if he says, “I have already offered it as a gift, but it is not yet meritorious. I will offer it again and again until I am deceived,” and then offers it, there is no fault.

original: de ste shing phul ba'i rgyan dus mchod kyi tshe brgyan pa'i phyir gzhag / bza' shing dang grib shing la dge 'dun 'du zhing spyod pa'i phyir brgyan pa rgyan du phul na'ang phyis 'du ba'i tshe brgyan pa'i phyir gzhan du mi spyad do //
analyzed: de ste shing phul ba'i rgyan dus mchod kyi tshe brgyan pa'i phyir gzhag / bza' shing dang grib shing la dge 'dun 'du zhing spyod pa'i phyir brgyan pa rgyan du phul na'ang phyis 'du ba'i tshe brgyan pa'i phyir gzhan du mi spyad do //
translated: If he offers a tree, he should keep it for the purpose of decorating the shrine at the time of the annual observance. If he offers a fruit tree or a shade tree for the purpose of decorating the assembly quarters, it should not be used elsewhere, but should be kept for the purpose of decorating the assembly quarters.

original: de steng khang bu brtsig pa la ni 'bri ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de steng khang bu brtsig pa la ni 'bri ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he offers it for the purpose of building an upper story, it is for the purpose of painting.

original: khang bu'i rgyan dang rtsig pa'i ri mo bri ba'i phyir bsngos te phul na'ang gzhan du mi spyad pa de nyid du spyad do //
analyzed: khang bu'i rgyan dang rtsig pa'i ri mo bri ba'i phyir bsngos te phul na'ang gzhan du mi spyad pa de nyid du spyad do //
translated: If he dedicates and offers it for the purpose of decorating the assembly quarters and painting the walls, it should be used for that purpose and not elsewhere.

original: de ste ma yin te ka ba na las sar bar ro ;
analyzed: de ste ma yin te ka ba na las sar bar ro ;
translated: If he does not, it is for the purpose of the foundation.

original: / ka ba la bsngos te phul na'ang ka ba'i ri mo dang rnying pa brje ba'i phyir spyad do //
analyzed: / ka ba la bsngos te phul na'ang ka ba'i ri mo dang rnying pa brje ba'i phyir spyad do //
translated: If he dedicates and offers it for the purpose of a pillar, it should be used for the purpose of painting the pillar and replacing the old paint.

original: sa la 'o //
analyzed: sa la 'o //
translated: On the ground.

original: sa la bsngos te phul na'ang gzhan du mi spyad de 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: sa la bsngos te phul na'ang gzhan du mi spyad de 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Even if one has dedicated to the ground and offered, one should not use it elsewhere. This will be explained below.

original: me'i gnas su na 'bud pa bya /
analyzed: me'i gnas su na 'bud pa bya /
translated: In the place of fire, one should offer fuel.

original: me bud pa'i phyir phul na shing dang me mar la sogs par spyad do //
analyzed: me bud pa'i phyir phul na shing dang me mar la sogs par spyad do //
translated: If one offers fuel for the fire, one should use it as wood, fire, lamps, and so on.

original: snum 'thob pa yang ngo //
analyzed: snum 'thob pa yang ngo //
translated: One should also obtain oil.

original: me bud pa'i phyir phul ba las mi dgos sam lhag na khur ba la sogs par yang bya'o //
analyzed: me bud pa'i phyir phul ba las mi dgos sam lhag na khur ba la sogs par yang bya'o //
translated: If one does not need or has more than necessary from offering fuel for the fire, one should also make it into cakes and so on.

original: lus bsku bar yang bya /
analyzed: lus bsku bar yang bya /
translated: One should also anoint the body.

original: nad pa'i gnas su brtags par sman dang yo byad do //
analyzed: nad pa'i gnas su brtags par sman dang yo byad do //
translated: In the place of the sick, one should examine medicine and supplies.

original: nad pa rnams la bsngos te phul na'ang rtsi sman du sbyar te sbyin no //
analyzed: nad pa rnams la bsngos te phul na'ang rtsi sman du sbyar te sbyin no //
translated: Even if one has dedicated and offered to the sick, one should apply it as medicinal ointment and give it.

original: zas kyi gnas su zas bya'o //
analyzed: zas kyi gnas su zas bya'o //
translated: In the place of food, one should make food.

original: tshang mang gi gnas su phul ba'i rnams ni zas su bya zhing spyad do //
analyzed: tshang mang gi gnas su phul ba'i rnams ni zas su bya zhing spyad do //
translated: The offerings made in the place of the kitchen should be made into food and used.

original: skom gyir skom gyi gnas su'o //
analyzed: skom gyir skom gyi gnas su'o //
translated: In the place of drink, one should drink.

original: grung tshad du phul ba'i rnams ni skom du btung zhing spyad do //
analyzed: grung tshad du phul ba'i rnams ni skom du btung zhing spyad do //
translated: The offerings made in the place of alcohol should be drunk as a drink and used.

original: bsro gang gi gnas su bsro gang ngo //
analyzed: bsro gang gi gnas su bsro gang ngo //
translated: In the place of hot water, one should have hot water.

original: bsro gang du phul ba'i rnams ni bsro gang me bud pa la sogs pa sman dpyad du spyad @261a * //
analyzed: bsro gang du phul ba'i rnams ni bsro gang me bud pa la sogs pa sman dpyad du spyad @261a * //
translated: The offerings made for the hot water are used for the hot water, the fire, the fuel, and so forth as medicine and treatment.

original: do ; / snum 'thob pa yang ngo //
analyzed: do ; / snum 'thob pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, the oil obtained is the same.

original: gong ma ltar bsro gang la yon phul ba me 'bud par mi dgos na dge 'dun gyi snum dang kha zas bsod pa'i rgyur bya /
analyzed: gong ma ltar bsro gang la yon phul ba me 'bud par mi dgos na dge 'dun gyi snum dang kha zas bsod pa'i rgyur bya /
translated: If the offerings made for the hot water as above do not need to be used for the fire, they should be used as the oil and good food of the Saṅgha.

original: snum 'thob pa'i gnas su zlum por yo byad kyi gnas so //
analyzed: snum 'thob pa'i gnas su zlum por yo byad kyi gnas so //
translated: The place where the oil is obtained is the round place for the articles.

original: dgun me 'bud pa'i khyim khang zlum du yon phul ba ni shing dang lus dang rkang pa bsku ba'i snum du bya /
analyzed: dgun me 'bud pa'i khyim khang zlum du yon phul ba ni shing dang lus dang rkang pa bsku ba'i snum du bya /
translated: The offerings made for the house where the fire is lit in winter should be used as the oil for anointing the wood, body, and feet.

original: dbyar yon du phul te me 'bud mi dgos na lus la byug pa dang bshos kyi rgyur bya /
analyzed: dbyar yon du phul te me 'bud mi dgos na lus la byug pa dang bshos kyi rgyur bya /
translated: If the offerings made for the summer do not need to be used for the fire, they should be used for anointing the body and as food.

original: skyes pa'i rabs bri ba yang ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs bri ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, the stories of the previous births should be written.

original: dge 'dun gyi bkad sar yon phul te bkad pa'i yo byad du spyad cing dgos pa spyad kyang lhag yod na sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang bdud btul ba la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud bri /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bkad sar yon phul te bkad pa'i yo byad du spyad cing dgos pa spyad kyang lhag yod na sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang bdud btul ba la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud bri /
translated: If the offerings made at the Saṅgha's feast are used as the feast articles and used for the necessary purposes, but there is a remainder, the stories of the Buddha's appearance in the world, his taming of Māra, and so forth should be written.

original: phyi khyams dang 'chags dang sgo phugs dang khyams su bgo / phyi rol gyi khyams dang sgo phugs dang 'chags sa la sogs pa la bsngos te phul ba ni dge 'dun spyi'i bgo /
analyzed: phyi khyams dang 'chags dang sgo phugs dang khyams su bgo / phyi rol gyi khyams dang sgo phugs dang 'chags sa la sogs pa la bsngos te phul ba ni dge 'dun spyi'i bgo /
translated: The courtyard, the door, the door-ledge, the assembly hall, etc., outside are to be shared by the general community.

original: dbus kyang ngo //
analyzed: dbus kyang ngo //
translated: The center is also so.

original: gtsug lag khang gi dbus kyi mthongs su phul ba yang spyir bgo / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyir 'di gzhag go zhes kyang gzhan las so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi dbus kyi mthongs su phul ba yang spyir bgo / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyir 'di gzhag go zhes kyang gzhan las so //
translated: That which is offered in the center of the temple is also to be shared by the general community.

original: sgo phugs dang dbus kyi mthongs su phul ba la sogs pa 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bsngos te zhog shig ces kyang bshad do //
analyzed: sgo phugs dang dbus kyi mthongs su phul ba la sogs pa 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun la bsngos te zhog shig ces kyang bshad do //
translated: Some Vinaya masters say that that which is offered at the door-ledge, in the center, etc., is to be shared by the general community of the four directions.

original: dkon mchog gi phyir slong ba ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi phyir slong ba ni brtags pa'o //
translated: That which is offered for the sake of the Three Jewels is to be examined.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi phyir slong ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi phyir slong ba ni nyes med do //
translated: That which is offered for the sake of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha is without fault.

original: brjod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brjod pa yang ngo //
translated: That which is offered for the sake of the Sangha is also so.

original: dkon mchog gsum po la yon bdag yon 'bul ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po la yon bdag yon 'bul ba'i tshe /
translated: When a patron offers a gift to the Three Jewels,

original: yon bdag sems bskyed pa'i phyi stod tra bskyed kyang nyes med /
analyzed: yon bdag sems bskyed pa'i phyi stod tra bskyed kyang nyes med /
translated: Even if the patron generates the thought of awakening in the morning, there is no fault in generating it again in the afternoon.

original: blangs te'o // stong tra bya ba ni sngar mi bya'i len pa'i tshe bya /
analyzed: blangs te'o // stong tra bya ba ni sngar mi bya'i len pa'i tshe bya /
translated: The so-called “morning” is not the time before, but the time of receiving.

original: mthong ba'i phyir 'khor lo bya /
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir 'khor lo bya /
translated: The “wheel” is turned for the sake of seeing.

original: stod tra bya ba ni dga' bar bya ba'i phyir kun gyis mthong bar sa mthon por 'dug ste bya'o //
analyzed: stod tra bya ba ni dga' bar bya ba'i phyir kun gyis mthong bar sa mthon por 'dug ste bya'o //
translated: The so-called “morning” is done by everyone sitting in a high place for the sake of rejoicing.

original: tsha'am rlung ngam char pa'i gnod pas mi reg pa'i phyir khang bu brtsegs pa sgo bzhi pa bya /
analyzed: tsha'am rlung ngam char pa'i gnod pas mi reg pa'i phyir khang bu brtsegs pa sgo bzhi pa bya /
translated: The “four-doored mansion” is built for the sake of not being touched by the harm of frost, wind, or rain.🔽The so-called “reading the morning prayer in a high place” is done by building a wooden house on a chariot with four doors and reading from inside it.

original: stod tra klog pas mthon por bya ba ni shing rta'i steng du khang bu shing khang phub la sgo bzhir btod de de'i nang nas bklag / mchod pa zin nas 'khor lo dbyung /
analyzed: stod tra klog pas mthon por bya ba ni shing rta'i steng du khang bu shing khang phub la sgo bzhir btod de de'i nang nas bklag / mchod pa zin nas 'khor lo dbyung /
translated: When the worship is finished, the wheel is cast away.

original: stod tra'i kha don la sogs pa zin nas khang bu so sor bshig ste sbas la gzhag / snod du @261b sbed pas 'thob pa sba /
analyzed: stod tra'i kha don la sogs pa zin nas khang bu so sor bshig ste sbas la gzhag / snod du @261b sbed pas 'thob pa sba /
translated: After the recitation of the morning prayer is finished, the individual mansions are destroyed and hidden away.

original: stod tra klog pas khang bu nas byed pa'i tshe yon phal cher phul na de rnams bsdu zhing brtul ba sdud pa'i dge slong ni gzhan gcig bsko //
analyzed: stod tra klog pas khang bu nas byed pa'i tshe yon phal cher phul na de rnams bsdu zhing brtul ba sdud pa'i dge slong ni gzhan gcig bsko //
translated: When the recitation of the scriptures is done in the upper residence, if the patron has offered most of the gifts, the monk who collects and distributes the gifts should be appointed by another.

original: ston pa mchod pa ni gnyis su ma dgos par sbyin par dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ston pa mchod pa ni gnyis su ma dgos par sbyin par dge slong ma'i dge 'dun ma gtogs so //
translated: The worship of the Teacher is not necessary for both, except for the community of nuns.

original: ltag ma ltar stod tra byed cing mchod pa'i tshe na yon bdag gis dge slong pho mo'i spyir phul ba ni bgo / dge slong 'ba' zhig la bsngos te phul ba ni dge slong ma mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar stod tra byed cing mchod pa'i tshe na yon bdag gis dge slong pho mo'i spyir phul ba ni bgo / dge slong 'ba' zhig la bsngos te phul ba ni dge slong ma mi dbang ngo //
translated: When the recitation of the scriptures is done like the upper residence and worship is performed, the patron should distribute the gifts to the general community of monks and nuns. The gifts dedicated to the monks alone should not be given to the nuns.

original: 'dir gcig pa las 'khor lo so sor btsugs pa na sbom por nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gcig pa las 'khor lo so sor btsugs pa na sbom por nyes pa'o //
translated: Here, in the case of the wheel being set up separately, it is a grave offense.

original: ltag ma ltar dge slong gis 'khor lo'i gnod pa dang brjed par bya ba dang yon bdag gis yon mang du phul te dge slong mas yon skal blangs te ma ster ba dang bsdu la nan das de'i nyin mo dge slong gis mchod pa 'dra ba cig phyung
analyzed: ltag ma ltar dge slong gis 'khor lo'i gnod pa dang brjed par bya ba dang yon bdag gis yon mang du phul te dge slong mas yon skal blangs te ma ster ba dang bsdu la nan das de'i nyin mo dge slong gis mchod pa 'dra ba cig phyung
translated: Like the upper residence, when the wheel is damaged by the monk, forgotten by the monk, or the patron has offered many gifts and the nun takes the share of the gifts and does not give it, or when the collector insists, on that day the monk should perform a worship similar to the worship of the Teacher.

original: ste yon tan thob pa las dge slong la snyoms pa ltar gyur te de ltar byed na dge slong ma dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur /
analyzed: ste yon tan thob pa las dge slong la snyoms pa ltar gyur te de ltar byed na dge slong ma dbyen gyi sbom por 'gyur /
translated: If one acts in that way, one becomes guilty of a serious offense of schism in the order of nuns.

original: snod 'gyed pas bgo / stod tra byas pa'i phyir yon phul ba'i rnams so sor bgo ba ni yon phul ba sdud par bskos pa'i dge slong des bya'o //
analyzed: snod 'gyed pas bgo / stod tra byas pa'i phyir yon phul ba'i rnams so sor bgo ba ni yon phul ba sdud par bskos pa'i dge slong des bya'o //
translated: The distribution of the gifts is done by the monk who has been appointed to collect the gifts.

original: 'di bsko'o // stod tra klog pa'i tshe yon 'bul ba sdud pa dang so sor 'god pa'i dge slong gcig bsko //
analyzed: 'di bsko'o // stod tra klog pa'i tshe yon 'bul ba sdud pa dang so sor 'god pa'i dge slong gcig bsko //
translated: When the sutra is recited, one monk is appointed to collect the gifts and to distribute them.

original: btsong ba'i rigs pa btsong g-yu dang rta lta bu zhig phul te bgor mi bde ba ni btsongs te rin bgo //🔽dge 'dun gnas par ro //
analyzed: btsong ba'i rigs pa btsong g-yu dang rta lta bu zhig phul te bgor mi bde ba ni btsongs te rin bgo // dge 'dun gnas par ro //
translated: If it is difficult to distribute the gifts of goods that are to be sold, such as turquoise and horses, they are sold and the price is distributed.

original: btsong ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du rin thang dris te gang gis rin cher btab pa de la btsong bskyed /
analyzed: btsong ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang du rin thang dris te gang gis rin cher btab pa de la btsong bskyed /
translated: The distribution of the gifts is done by the monk who has been appointed to collect the gifts.🔽The goods are sold in the midst of the community, and they are sold to the one who offers the highest price.

original: dge 'dun la mthar gyis dris te gang gis cher btab pa la btsong /
analyzed: dge 'dun la mthar gyis dris te gang gis cher btab pa la btsong /
translated: The goods are sold to the one who offers the highest price after asking the community in order.

original: des 'di la gdug par gtogs pa'i nan tan bya /
analyzed: des 'di la gdug par gtogs pa'i nan tan bya /
translated: One should apply oneself to the practice of the precepts in this matter.

original: nor 'god par bskos pa'i dge slong des nor 'god cing dge 'dun 'du ba'i sar chag phyag dar la sogs pa bya /
analyzed: nor 'god par bskos pa'i dge slong des nor 'god cing dge 'dun 'du ba'i sar chag phyag dar la sogs pa bya /
translated: The monk who has been appointed to value the goods should value the goods and sweep the place where the Saṅgha will gather.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis rin bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis rin bya /
translated: The most senior monk of the Saṅgha should value the price.

original: nor rin gcod pa'i phyir dge 'dun la ston pa'i tshe thog mar gnas brtan gyis rin thang gcad do //
analyzed: nor rin gcod pa'i phyir dge 'dun la ston pa'i tshe thog mar gnas brtan gyis rin thang gcad do //
translated: When the Saṅgha is shown the goods in order to value the price, the most senior monk should first value the price.

original: ran par ro //
analyzed: ran par ro //
translated: He should value it at a fair price.

original: gnas brtan gyis nor rin thang bcad pa na srang gcig ri ba zho drug ri ba tsam du gdab po //🔽de'i phyir de la mi bstabs gnas brtan gyis rin bcad pa las cher @262a * //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis nor rin thang bcad pa na srang gcig ri ba zho drug ri ba tsam du gdab po // de'i phyir de la mi bstabs gnas brtan gyis rin bcad pa las cher @262a * //
translated: When the most senior monk values the price of the goods, he should set the price at a value that is one-sixth of the price of a measure of barley.🔽Therefore, do not offer more than that.

original: 'bebs pa gzhan ma byung na gnas brtan mi nyor mi gnod bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'bebs pa gzhan ma byung na gnas brtan mi nyor mi gnod bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: If no one else offers a higher price than the price set by the most senior monk, then the most senior monk should not be criticized.🔽If the price is not increased, then the goods should be sold.🔽If the price set by the most senior monk is higher than the price offered by the buyer, then the goods should be sold at the price set by the most senior monk.

original: chad par bya ste slar 'phel bar mi 'gyur na dbyung nor btsong ba ni rin 'debs pa'i phyir brtan pa las rin gang gis cher btab pa de las bzlas te dris kyang gzhan cher 'debs pa med na de nyid la nyor gzhug go //
analyzed: chad par bya ste slar 'phel bar mi 'gyur na dbyung nor btsong ba ni rin 'debs pa'i phyir brtan pa las rin gang gis cher btab pa de las bzlas te dris kyang gzhan cher 'debs pa med na de nyid la nyor gzhug go //
translated: If, when questioned, no one else offers a higher price, then the goods should be sold to the one who offered the price set by the most senior monk.

original: mi btsong mi spel /
analyzed: mi btsong mi spel /
translated: One should not sell or exchange human beings.
