original: bdag nyor mi 'dod pa las rin bskyed pa'i phyir rin thang cher mi gdab /
analyzed: bdag nyor mi 'dod pa las rin bskyed pa'i phyir rin thang cher mi gdab /
translated: One should not set a high price for something that is not desired as a purchase.

original: bud med la ma yin /🔽bud med ni spyad brim zhing rin thang mi gcad /
analyzed: bud med la ma yin / bud med ni spyad brim zhing rin thang mi gcad /
translated: One should not do so with a woman.🔽One should not sell or exchange a woman.

original: rin ma blangs par mi spyad /
analyzed: rin ma blangs par mi spyad /
translated: One should not use something without having paid for it.

original: dge 'dun las nor nyo bar blangs pa las rin ma phul gyi bar du spyad par mi bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun las nor nyo bar blangs pa las rin ma phul gyi bar du spyad par mi bya /
translated: One should not use something that one has borrowed from the Saṅgha for the purpose of buying something until one has paid for it.

original: bcos par yang ngo //
analyzed: bcos par yang ngo //
translated: One should not do so with something that is repaired.

original: dge 'dun la nor nyo ba'i phyir blangs pa las rin ma phul gyi bar du mi spyad /
analyzed: dge 'dun la nor nyo ba'i phyir blangs pa las rin ma phul gyi bar du mi spyad /
translated: One should not use something that one has borrowed from the Saṅgha for the purpose of buying something until one has paid for it.

original: kha dog bsgyur ba'am bcos legs mi bya /
analyzed: kha dog bsgyur ba'am bcos legs mi bya /
translated: One should not dye it or make it look nice.

original: len pa mang na du la sogs pa'i sder bgo / yon bdag gis yon mang mo zhig phul te 'god na bgo sla ba'i phyir dge slong yod pa las bcu phung du bcad de so sor bcu sder byin la 'god du gzhug sder byin pa las ma bgos
analyzed: len pa mang na du la sogs pa'i sder bgo / yon bdag gis yon mang mo zhig phul te 'god na bgo sla ba'i phyir dge slong yod pa las bcu phung du bcad de so sor bcu sder byin la 'god du gzhug sder byin pa las ma bgos
translated: If many people give a lot of money to the Saṅgha for the purpose of buying something, in order to make it easy to divide, the Saṅgha should divide the money into ten parts and give each part to ten monks and have them divide it.

original: par 'ga' zhig shi na de'i tshe cha sder gtogs so //
analyzed: par 'ga' zhig shi na de'i tshe cha sder gtogs so //
translated: If someone dies before the money is divided, his share belongs to the Saṅgha.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar bcu zhig bgo gcig tu nor skal byin pa la bcu sde de'i nang nas 'ga' zhig shi na de'i skal ba bcu sde der gtogs pa'i rnams kyis bgos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar bcu zhig bgo gcig tu nor skal byin pa la bcu sde de'i nang nas 'ga' zhig shi na de'i skal ba bcu sde der gtogs pa'i rnams kyis bgos kyang nyes med /
translated: If one of the ten shares the inheritance as if it were the top of a mountain, and if some of the ten die, it is not a fault to divide their shares among the remaining ten.

original: rigs pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la gos stong phrag brgya dang khang pha brtsegs ma lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung ba tshul khrims dang ldan pa la gos stong phrag brgya dang khang pha brtsegs ma lnga brgya'o //
translated: The reasoning is that one who has gone forth with the intention of attaining nirvana and who possesses ethical discipline may use a hundred thousand robes and five hundred palaces.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dad cing mos te rab tu byung ba'i dge slong yon tan dang tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni gos bzang po sna grangs stong phrag brgya dang zas zhim bzang pa ro sna brgya dang khang ba brtsegs ma lnga brgya la sogs pa
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dad cing mos te rab tu byung ba'i dge slong yon tan dang tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni gos bzang po sna grangs stong phrag brgya dang zas zhim bzang pa ro sna brgya dang khang ba brtsegs ma lnga brgya la sogs pa
translated: A monk who has gone forth with faith and interest in order to attain nirvana and who possesses good qualities and ethical discipline may use whatever is good and abundant, such as a hundred thousand fine robes, a hundred flavors of delicious food, five hundred palaces,

original: bzang po dang mang po ci spyad kyang rung ste yon tan dang ldan pas zhu bar 'gyur bas spyod du dbang ste brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po dang mang po ci spyad kyang rung ste yon tan dang ldan pas zhu bar 'gyur bas spyod du dbang ste brtags pa'o //
translated: and so on. Since he is endowed with good qualities, he is able to use them. This is the analysis.

original: dge 'dun gyi nor kyang ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nor kyang ro //
translated: Also, the wealth of the Saṅgha.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar yon tan dang ldan pas ni dge 'dun gyi nor dang zas la spyad kyang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar yon tan dang ldan pas ni dge 'dun gyi nor dang zas la spyad kyang brtags pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with good qualities like the one described in the sūtra is examined even if he uses the wealth and food of the Saṅgha.

original: mi slob pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to one who is not a learner.

original: mya ngan las 'das par sems bskyed cing tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni dgra bcom pa man chad gang @262b zag rim pa bdun gyis nor las spyad kyang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par sems bskyed cing tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni dgra bcom pa man chad gang @262b zag rim pa bdun gyis nor las spyad kyang brtags pa'o //
translated: One who generates the mind of enlightenment and possesses ethical discipline is examined even if he uses the wealth of the seven types of persons from arhat down.

original: ma rabs kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma rabs kyang ngo //
translated: Also, one who is vulgar.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar spyad kyang brtags pa ni gang zag ma rabs yin kyang tshul khrims dang ldan zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar sems bskyed pa ni spyod par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar spyad kyang brtags pa ni gang zag ma rabs yin kyang tshul khrims dang ldan zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar sems bskyed pa ni spyod par brtags pa'o //
translated: One who is vulgar is examined even if he uses the wealth of the Saṅgha, but one who is endowed with ethical discipline and generates the mind of enlightenment is examined even if he uses the wealth of the Saṅgha.

original: tshul khrims log pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims log pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Not from the reversal of ethical discipline.

original: dge 'dun gyi zas dang gos kyi shas kyi skal ba la phas pham pa bzhi byung ba ni mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zas dang gos kyi shas kyi skal ba la phas pham pa bzhi byung ba ni mi dbang ngo //
translated: One who has committed the four defeats in regard to the share of food and clothing of the Saṅgha is not a candidate.

original: phas pham pa bzhi'i tshul khrims phra mo nyams kyang shas kyi skal ba ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi'i tshul khrims phra mo nyams kyang shas kyi skal ba ni dbang ngo //
translated: If one violates even a minor rule of the four defeats, one loses the share of offerings.

original: phas pham pa dang khyim pa dge 'dun la 'khor zhing yon phul ba ni dge 'dun gyis za zhing spyod du bcug pa ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: phas pham pa dang khyim pa dge 'dun la 'khor zhing yon phul ba ni dge 'dun gyis za zhing spyod du bcug pa ni dbang ngo //
translated: If one is a layperson who has been expelled from the community and offered gifts to the community, one loses the right to eat and use the gifts of the community.

original: bu lon du 'gyur ba ni le lo can gyi blangs te btso ba'o //
analyzed: bu lon du 'gyur ba ni le lo can gyi blangs te btso ba'o //
translated: One becomes indebted to the community if one accepts the offerings of the community out of laziness and then sells them.

original: tshul khrims ma nyams su zin kyang le lo che zhing dge ba spyod pa'i shas chung na yon bdag gi nor rdzas la spyad pa mi zhu ste bu lon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma nyams su zin kyang le lo che zhing dge ba spyod pa'i shas chung na yon bdag gi nor rdzas la spyad pa mi zhu ste bu lon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one’s discipline is not impaired, if one is very lazy and has little virtue, one will not be able to request the use of the benefactors’ wealth and will become indebted.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa las rigs pa ni mtshams gcig pa'i gang zag gi gtsug lag khang na sde pa de'i rnyed pa la spyod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa las rigs pa ni mtshams gcig pa'i gang zag gi gtsug lag khang na sde pa de'i rnyed pa la spyod pa yang ngo //
translated: One is entitled to the offerings of the community if one is a person who is within the same boundary and who uses the offerings of that school in the temple of that school.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni dge 'dun gyi zan skal yang zos la yon bdag gzhan zhig gis zan khyer te 'ongs te byin na yang zos kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pas ni dge 'dun gyi zan skal yang zos la yon bdag gzhan zhig gis zan khyer te 'ongs te byin na yang zos kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one has pure discipline, one may eat the share of food of the community and also eat the food brought by another benefactor.

original: gcig zos na gcig bsags su ni mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gcig zos na gcig bsags su ni mi dbang ngo //
translated: If one is eaten, it is not permissible to accumulate another.

original: khang bu bsngos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: khang bu bsngos pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, a dedicated hut.

original: yon bdag gis khang bu'i rkyen du khang bu de na su 'dug pa lo gcig cing rtag tu gser lta bu 'bul ba zhig yod na'ang de'ang blangs la dge 'dun spyi'i yon skal blangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: yon bdag gis khang bu'i rkyen du khang bu de na su 'dug pa lo gcig cing rtag tu gser lta bu 'bul ba zhig yod na'ang de'ang blangs la dge 'dun spyi'i yon skal blangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a patron has a hut that is always offered to whoever is staying in the hut, even if it is offered for a year, it is permissible to take it. If one takes a share of the offerings for the general saṅgha, there is no fault.

original: 'di la res kyis bsgo //
analyzed: 'di la res kyis bsgo //
translated: In this case, it is taken in turn.

original: khang bu'i rkyen rtag tu srang grangs 'bul ba zhig yod na khang bu de rtag tu dge slong gcig yu mi gzhag gi res kyis dge 'dun kun 'khod do //
analyzed: khang bu'i rkyen rtag tu srang grangs 'bul ba zhig yod na khang bu de rtag tu dge slong gcig yu mi gzhag gi res kyis dge 'dun kun 'khod do //
translated: If there is always an offering of a certain amount of coins for the sake of the hut, then that hut is not to be left to a single monk. It is taken in turn by the entire saṅgha.

original: dge slong gcig gis mngan rnogs su theg ste rku sems dang ldan na pham /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis mngan rnogs su theg ste rku sems dang ldan na pham /
translated: If a single monk is left in charge, and he has the intention to steal, then he is defeated.

original: lhung bzed dang / lhung bzed chung du dang phur bu dang bum pa dang kyo ba tang dang gri dang khab dang sen reg dang gzar ba dang sol ba bsdu ba dang sta re dang sla nga dang kha phyis dang / lcags kyi snod bgo / yon bdag gis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dge 'dun la phul na dge 'dun so sor bgo / sa'i snod dag tu lhung bzed chung @263a * //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / lhung bzed chung du dang phur bu dang bum pa dang kyo ba tang dang gri dang khab dang sen reg dang gzar ba dang sol ba bsdu ba dang sta re dang sla nga dang kha phyis dang / lcags kyi snod bgo / yon bdag gis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dge 'dun la phul na dge 'dun so sor bgo / sa'i snod dag tu lhung bzed chung @263a * //
translated: If these are offered to the Saṅgha by name, they are distributed to individual monks.

original: ngu dang bum bu dang blugs ma dang chab stong dang ril ba spyi blugs dang chu snod dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: ngu dang bum bu dang blugs ma dang chab stong dang ril ba spyi blugs dang chu snod dag kyang ngo //
translated: Small begging bowls, water pots, ladles, water filters, water strainers, and water vessels are placed in earthen vessels.🔽If these are offered to the Saṅgha by name, they are distributed to individual monks.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig yon bdag gis phul na'ang dge 'dun so sor bgo / rin po che'i khri la sogs pa mthar lcags kyang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig yon bdag gis phul na'ang dge 'dun so sor bgo / rin po che'i khri la sogs pa mthar lcags kyang ngo //
translated: Iron beds and so on up to jeweled beds are distributed to individual monks.

original: rin po che'i khri man chad lcags kyi khri yan chad gcig phul na btsongs la rin la bgo / brje /
analyzed: rin po che'i khri man chad lcags kyi khri yan chad gcig phul na btsongs la rin la bgo / brje /
translated: If a jeweled bed or an iron bed is offered, it is sold and the price is distributed.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar khri yon du phul ba rin du brjes la bgo / shing gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar khri yon du phul ba rin du brjes la bgo / shing gi ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so if it is made of wood.🔽If one gives a large wooden bed, it should not be divided but remain for the community.

original: shing gi khri che sra shig phul na mi bgo bar spyi la gzhag / tshon sna lnga las gzhan dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: shing gi khri che sra shig phul na mi bgo bar spyi la gzhag / tshon sna lnga las gzhan dag kyang ngo //
translated: Also, other than the five colors.

original: tshon chen po sna bdun phul na mtshal dang li gru dang nu med gsum ni bgo'i gzhan sna lnga'i ri mo bri ba'i phyir bzhag go //
analyzed: tshon chen po sna bdun phul na mtshal dang li gru dang nu med gsum ni bgo'i gzhan sna lnga'i ri mo bri ba'i phyir bzhag go //
translated: If one gives the seven precious substances, the three—vermilion, realgar, and mica—should be divided. The other five should be set aside for drawing pictures.

original: ma bcos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ma bcos pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, unprocessed.

original: tshon chen po sna bdun las btsos pa zhig na mi bgo / ma bcos pa ni bgo / bcos pa btsor rung ba ni bgo //
analyzed: tshon chen po sna bdun las btsos pa zhig na mi bgo / ma bcos pa ni bgo / bcos pa btsor rung ba ni bgo //
translated: If one gives the seven precious substances that have been processed, they should not be divided. Unprocessed should be divided. Processed that is suitable for processing should be divided.

original: btsos pa'i khu ba dge 'dun gyi gos btsor rung ba yod na phyir gzhag go //
analyzed: btsos pa'i khu ba dge 'dun gyi gos btsor rung ba yod na phyir gzhag go //
translated: If there is a dye that is suitable for processing the saṃgha’s robes, it should be set aside.

original: gzhan dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: The other is for the saṃgha.

original: ltag ma ltar spyi'i btso bar bzhag pa ni dge 'dun gyi spyi'i phyir bzhag go //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar spyi'i btso bar bzhag pa ni dge 'dun gyi spyi'i phyir bzhag go //
translated: Like a cushion, it is set aside for the community’s general use.

original: mi btso // ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig yon phul ba ni bgo zhing btso bar mi bya /
analyzed: mi btso // ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu zhig yon phul ba ni bgo zhing btso bar mi bya /
translated: One should not sell or barter the offerings of the Sangha, such as the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:

original: kun dga' dang / skyed shing dang ldum ra phul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / gtsug lag khang gi khang pa phul ba dang / de'i dngos po dang / gtsug lag khang gi 'khor gyi sa dang / mal stan dag go //
analyzed: kun dga' dang / skyed shing dang ldum ra phul ba dang / gtsug lag khang dang / gtsug lag khang gi khang pa phul ba dang / de'i dngos po dang / gtsug lag khang gi 'khor gyi sa dang / mal stan dag go //
translated: a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.

original: khri dang khri'u dang mal stan dang 'di rnams bgo bar mi bya /
analyzed: khri dang khri'u dang mal stan dang 'di rnams bgo bar mi bya /
translated: One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.

original: dbang du mi bya /
analyzed: dbang du mi bya /
translated: One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyir bzhag pa las bu lon chags pa la sogs pa'i gta' 'og tu mi bzhag / mi bsngo ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar ming gis smos pa 'di rnams spyir bzhag pa las bu lon chags pa la sogs pa'i gta' 'og tu mi bzhag / mi bsngo ba yang ngo //
translated: One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a pillow.

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa spyir bzhag pa las dge slong gang zag bdag gi nor du mi bsngo mi bskur ba dag la zas dang gos bstan par bya /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa spyir bzhag pa las dge slong gang zag bdag gi nor du mi bsngo mi bskur ba dag la zas dang gos bstan par bya /
translated: One should not sell or barter the following:🔽a monastery, a monastery building, its contents, the land surrounding the monastery, and the bedding.🔽One should not sell or barter the following:

original: ma dag la gos dang zas las sbyin /
analyzed: ma dag la gos dang zas las sbyin /
translated: a bed, a bench, a mattress

original: de ste gos dang lhung bzed lhag ba med na bslang /
analyzed: de ste gos dang lhung bzed lhag ba med na bslang /
translated: If you have no extra robes or begging bowl, you should beg for them.

original: pha ma la sbyin du chos gos dang lhung bzed tsam las mi bdog na gzhan las bslangs te byin kyang nyes med /
analyzed: pha ma la sbyin du chos gos dang lhung bzed tsam las mi bdog na gzhan las bslangs te byin kyang nyes med /
translated: If you have only the three robes and begging bowl, it is not a downfall to give these to your parents if they have no clothes or begging bowl.🔽If you cannot get them, you should give half of the food you have obtained.

original: ma grub na zas thob pa de las phyed sbyin pham la sbyin par bslang du'ang ma rnyed na bdag gi zas dang gos kyi @263b skal ba ci thob pa las phyed pha ma la sbyin par bya /
analyzed: ma grub na zas thob pa de las phyed sbyin pham la sbyin par bslang du'ang ma rnyed na bdag gi zas dang gos kyi @263b skal ba ci thob pa las phyed pha ma la sbyin par bya /
translated: If you cannot get any food at all, you should give half of your own food and clothing.

original: phra mo la sogs par chud pa ste gos kyi dngos po'o /
analyzed: phra mo la sogs par chud pa ste gos kyi dngos po'o /
translated: The “fine points” are the material of the robe.

original: // / bye brag dbye bar shes pa'i phyir gos la gdab gos la mtshan ma mngon par gdab /
analyzed: // / bye brag dbye bar shes pa'i phyir gos la gdab gos la mtshan ma mngon par gdab /
translated: To make the different types of robes known, the Buddha prescribed the following:🔽The robe should be marked with a patch,

original: sangs rgyas dang nan da 'dra zhing bong mnyam ste ngo mi shes par gyur te sangs rgyas su 'dzin pa'i phyir bcas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang nan da 'dra zhing bong mnyam ste ngo mi shes par gyur te sangs rgyas su 'dzin pa'i phyir bcas /
translated: so that you will not be mistaken for a Buddha.

original: de la gdab pa sbyin snag tsha'i thig le zhes so //
analyzed: de la gdab pa sbyin snag tsha'i thig le zhes so //
translated: The patch is called a “drop of ink.”

original: gos ngo mi shes shing nor gyis dogs pa'i phyir snag tsha'i thig le chos gos kyi grvar snag tsha'i thig le gdab /
analyzed: gos ngo mi shes shing nor gyis dogs pa'i phyir snag tsha'i thig le chos gos kyi grvar snag tsha'i thig le gdab /
translated: Because he does not know the material of the robe and is afraid of wealth, he should put a drop of ink on the edge of the Dharma robe.

original: spyad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: spyad pa yang ngo //
translated: The practice is also like that.

original: chos gos skam la lci ste thag bu la mi 'chags te thag bus mtha' la brgyus te srad bu la gdags /
analyzed: chos gos skam la lci ste thag bu la mi 'chags te thag bus mtha' la brgyus te srad bu la gdags /
translated: The Dharma robe is heavy when dry, so it does not hang down. It is strung on a string at the edge and placed on a string.

original: tshar tshar gyi kha chag bya /
analyzed: tshar tshar gyi kha chag bya /
translated: The edge of the robe should be sewn.

original: ras kha tshar bcad la chag bya ste bgo zhing spyad do //
analyzed: ras kha tshar bcad la chag bya ste bgo zhing spyad do //
translated: The edge of the cloth should be cut and sewn, and then worn and used.

original: sbyar ma ma yin pa dag zhig gcad par ma chad do //
analyzed: sbyar ma ma yin pa dag zhig gcad par ma chad do //
translated: If it is not a sewn robe, it should not be cut.

original: chos gos chen po ma gtogs par snam bu bdun pa dang lnga pa gnyis ni snam bur ma dras shing ma btsems pa la bsngos kyang 'chags so //
analyzed: chos gos chen po ma gtogs par snam bu bdun pa dang lnga pa gnyis ni snam bur ma dras shing ma btsems pa la bsngos kyang 'chags so //
translated: Except for the large Dharma robe, both the seven-piece and five-piece robes are allowed to be worn without being cut and sewn.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen med na ma bcad par grong dang khyim du 'jug pa dang 'dug pa ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen med na ma bcad par grong dang khyim du 'jug pa dang 'dug pa ma yin /
translated: If there are no such conditions, one should not enter a village or house without cutting it.

original: char pa la sogs pa bab pa'i rkyen ma byung bar grong khyer du chos gos chen po med par 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: char pa la sogs pa bab pa'i rkyen ma byung bar grong khyer du chos gos chen po med par 'dug par mi bya /
translated: Without the condition of rain falling, etc., one should not stay in a village without a large Dharma robe.

original: de bzhin du mur 'dug gi gnas su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mur 'dug gi gnas su'o //
translated: Likewise, in the case of a place with thorns.

original: chos gos chen po med par mur 'dug gi gnas su mi 'gro //
analyzed: chos gos chen po med par mur 'dug gi gnas su mi 'gro //
translated: One should not go to a place with thorns without a large robe.

original: yod na 'dug par ma yin /
analyzed: yod na 'dug par ma yin /
translated: If one has one, one should not stay there.

original: rkyen byung yang chos gos chen po med par mur 'dug dang bcas pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'am 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: rkyen byung yang chos gos chen po med par mur 'dug dang bcas pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'am 'dug par mi bya /
translated: Even if the conditions arise, one should not go to or stay in a place with thorns without a large robe.

original: spu can chos gos gsum du mi bsngo /
analyzed: spu can chos gos gsum du mi bsngo /
translated: One should not dedicate a woolen cloth to the three robes.

original: la ba dang be'u ras la sogs pa spu can la chos gos gsum gyi rgyus mi bsngo //
analyzed: la ba dang be'u ras la sogs pa spu can la chos gos gsum gyi rgyus mi bsngo //
translated: One should not dedicate a woolen cloth such as a blanket or a cloth of calf skin to the three robes.

original: de bgos te mchod ston du mi spyad /
analyzed: de bgos te mchod ston du mi spyad /
translated: One should not wear it to a feast offering.

original: zan za ba dang mchod ston byed pa'i tshe la ba dang pags pa la sogs pa spu can mi bgo / srab mo ni bdag gir bya /
analyzed: zan za ba dang mchod ston byed pa'i tshe la ba dang pags pa la sogs pa spu can mi bgo / srab mo ni bdag gir bya /
translated: When eating or at a feast offering, one should not wear a woolen cloth, leather, or the like.🔽One may use a thin cloth as one wishes.

original: sde ras sam ras srab mo ni chos gos su bsngor mi rung gi gos lhag par spyad cing bgos kyang nyes med srab mo ni rgyu 'og nas 'byung /
analyzed: sde ras sam ras srab mo ni chos gos su bsngor mi rung gi gos lhag par spyad cing bgos kyang nyes med srab mo ni rgyu 'og nas 'byung /
translated: A thin cloth or a thin cotton cloth is not suitable to be dedicated to the three robes, but it is permissible to use it as an extra cloth.

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhi ste bal gyi dang zar ma'i dang du gu la'i dang shing bal gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa bzhi ste bal gyi dang zar ma'i dang du gu la'i dang shing bal gyi'o //
translated: It is of four types: woolen, linen, cotton, and silk.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gos lhag tu bsngos shing spyad kyang nyes med de seng ras dang srab mor byas pa la bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gos lhag tu bsngos shing spyad kyang nyes med de seng ras dang srab mor byas pa la bya /
translated: It is said that if you give these items to a monk and use them, there is no fault, provided they are made of thin or coarse material.🔽

original: gzhan yang snam bu'i @264a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang snam bu'i @264a * //
translated: Although these mentioned by name are dedicated to and used as extra cloth, there is no fault, because they are made of thin cotton or thin cloth.

original: rnam pa yang ba spu thung ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa yang ba spu thung ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Also, the type of cloth that is light, with short nap, and so on.

original: gzhan snam bu la spu thung dur byas pa'i rnams ni chos gos su mi rung gi gos lhag gi sngags kyis btab pa la spyad do //
analyzed: gzhan snam bu la spu thung dur byas pa'i rnams ni chos gos su mi rung gi gos lhag gi sngags kyis btab pa la spyad do //
translated: Other than that, the cloth made with short nap is not suitable as Dharma robes, but is used with the mantra of extra cloth.

original: ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: ba la yang ngo //
translated: Also, wool.

original: la ba yang gos lhag gi sngags kyis btab ste spyad kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: la ba yang gos lhag gi sngags kyis btab ste spyad kyang rung ngo //
translated: Also, a blanket is suitable to be used with the mantra of extra cloth.

original: 'tsho las gzhan du na de'i phyir log tu bgo bar mi spyad /
analyzed: 'tsho las gzhan du na de'i phyir log tu bgo bar mi spyad /
translated: Other than that, it is not suitable to wear it in reverse.

original: phrug dang be'u ras la sogs pa lus la rtsub cing g-ya' dang shig za na bzlog ste bgos kyang nyes med de /
analyzed: phrug dang be'u ras la sogs pa lus la rtsub cing g-ya' dang shig za na bzlog ste bgos kyang nyes med de /
translated: If the cloth is rough on the body, and causes itching and lice, it is suitable to wear it in reverse.

original: de bgos te mi bcag / mdo ltag ma ltar shig za ba la sogs pa'i rkyen byung yang bcag pa'i tshe bzlog te mi bgo / bsrings pa'i la ba dang me tog can gyi snam bu dang dre'u rngog khra khra bo gang zag gis bdag gir byas te
analyzed: de bgos te mi bcag / mdo ltag ma ltar shig za ba la sogs pa'i rkyen byung yang bcag pa'i tshe bzlog te mi bgo / bsrings pa'i la ba dang me tog can gyi snam bu dang dre'u rngog khra khra bo gang zag gis bdag gir byas te
translated: Do not cut it up and distribute it.🔽Even if conditions arise, such as a louse infestation, that require cutting it up, do not distribute it after cutting it up.🔽Do not use a blanket that has been stretched out, a flower-patterned cloth, or a multicolored mule pack that has been appropriated by an individual.

original: mi spyad / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dge slong gang zag gis spyad cing bcang bar mi bya /
analyzed: mi spyad / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams dge slong gang zag gis spyad cing bcang bar mi bya /
translated: Do not use or keep any of the items mentioned by name.

original: 'chags sar dre'u rngog bting na khas blangs /
analyzed: 'chags sar dre'u rngog bting na khas blangs /
translated: If a monk uses a mule pack on the walking path, he must confess this.

original: khyim pa bsod nams 'dod pas 'chags sar dri'u rngog bting na de'i steng du bcag kyang nyes med /
analyzed: khyim pa bsod nams 'dod pas 'chags sar dri'u rngog bting na de'i steng du bcag kyang nyes med /
translated: If a layperson who wishes to create merit uses a mule pack on the walking path, there is no fault in using it.🔽Do not always use the same one.🔽Do not always use the same mule pack on the walking path.

original: rtag tu rgyun gcig tu mi bcag / dre'u rngog de'i steng du 'chags pa'i rgyun gcig tu mi bcag / nus na bcos /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun gcig tu mi bcag / dre'u rngog de'i steng du 'chags pa'i rgyun gcig tu mi bcag / nus na bcos /
translated: If you are able, repair it.

original: dre'u rngog de rdol lam ral na bcos /🔽btsem pa gzhung bu glan pa sbyin /
analyzed: dre'u rngog de rdol lam ral na bcos / btsem pa gzhung bu glan pa sbyin /
translated: If the mule pack has a hole or a tear, repair it.🔽If it is torn, sew it and apply a patch.

original: dre'u rngog ral na gzhung bu gzhug cing glan /
analyzed: dre'u rngog ral na gzhung bu gzhug cing glan /
translated: If the mule pack is torn, insert a patch and sew it.

original: mi nus na ba lang gi lci ba dang 'ji bas sbyar te 'chag par byug / dre'u rngog rnyings te 'drub cing btsem du mi rung na 'ji ba dang lci ba bsres te 'chag sa'i skyang nul du byas kyang rung 'chag sar dre'u rngog bting la de'i steng
analyzed: mi nus na ba lang gi lci ba dang 'ji bas sbyar te 'chag par byug / dre'u rngog rnyings te 'drub cing btsem du mi rung na 'ji ba dang lci ba bsres te 'chag sa'i skyang nul du byas kyang rung 'chag sar dre'u rngog bting la de'i steng
translated: If the donkey's load is old and worn and unfit to be patched and sewn, it is suitable to mix clay and dung and apply it to the floor.

original: du 'ji bas g-yogs la bcags na yon bdag la bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir spyad du rung /
analyzed: du 'ji bas g-yogs la bcags na yon bdag la bsod nams su 'gyur ba'i phyir spyad du rung /
translated: If one treads on the donkey's load spread on the floor and covered with clay, it is suitable to use it because it becomes merit for the benefactor.

original: de bzhin du bcangs te sbyin bdag la brten te'o //🔽dge slong gi gos su ma btags pa dre'u rngog dang khra bo la sogs pa ni sbyin bdag khyim pa la bsngos te bcangs kyang nyes med do //🔽sham thabs nang logs ma dang rdul zan dang 'theb bcang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcangs te sbyin bdag la brten te'o // dge slong gi gos su ma btags pa dre'u rngog dang khra bo la sogs pa ni sbyin bdag khyim pa la bsngos te bcangs kyang nyes med do // sham thabs nang logs ma dang rdul zan dang 'theb bcang /
translated: In the same way, one may tread on it and rely on the benefactor.🔽A donkey's load and a multicolored load and so on that are not designated as a monk's robe are dedicated to the benefactor, the layperson, and it is faultless to wear them.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis 'theb re re bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽yo byad kyis kyang ngo //🔽sman zong du zas sam gos bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis 'theb re re bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽yo byad kyis kyang ngo //🔽sman zong du zas sam gos bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: The inner robe, the lower robe, the upper robe, the chest covering, the shoulder covering, the head covering, the foot covering, the hand covering, the knee covering, the elbow covering, the hip covering, the waist covering, the arm covering, the leg covering, the neck covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly covering, the back covering, the front covering, the side covering, the belly

original: 'di ni dkar po'am kha tshar dang bcas kyang ma nyes so //
analyzed: 'di ni dkar po'am kha tshar dang bcas kyang ma nyes so //
translated: This is not a fault if it is white or has fringes.

original: sman zong gi rdzas @264b bcang ba ni ras dkar po dang kha tshar ma bcad kyang nyes med /
analyzed: sman zong gi rdzas @264b bcang ba ni ras dkar po dang kha tshar ma bcad kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to keep medicine in a white container or one without fringes.

original: rin gyi tshad ni srang 'ga' tsam ci rin par bcang /
analyzed: rin gyi tshad ni srang 'ga' tsam ci rin par bcang /
translated: The measure of the value is that it should be kept as something of little value, a few ounces.

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ma yin /🔽dge 'dun spyi'i gos lhag na kha tshar ma bcad dam kha dog ma bsgyur bar bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ma yin / dge 'dun spyi'i gos lhag na kha tshar ma bcad dam kha dog ma bsgyur bar bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault to keep it in a container belonging to the saṅgha.🔽If there is an extra robe belonging to the saṅgha, it is not a fault to keep it without fringes or without changing the color.

original: gnad ba'i gos der bsngos te bcangs /
analyzed: gnad ba'i gos der bsngos te bcangs /
translated: It is not a fault to keep it after dedicating it to a tailor.

original: yo byad bcu gsum 'chang du gnang ba ni bdag 'chang ba'i sngags kyis bsngos la bcang /
analyzed: yo byad bcu gsum 'chang du gnang ba ni bdag 'chang ba'i sngags kyis bsngos la bcang /
translated: The permission to keep the thirteen articles is that they are to be kept after dedicating them with the mantra of the keeper.

original: gzhan brtags te du ma'ang bcang /
analyzed: gzhan brtags te du ma'ang bcang /
translated: It is not a fault to keep more than that after examining them.

original: yo byad bcu gsum la ma gtogs par gos lhag cing 'chang na lhag pa'i sngags kyis brtags te bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: yo byad bcu gsum la ma gtogs par gos lhag cing 'chang na lhag pa'i sngags kyis brtags te bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to keep an extra robe that is not included in the thirteen articles after examining it with the mantra of the extra robe.

original: sems mi brtan pa la mi brtag / gos lhag ma brtag pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon kla klo can tshul khrims la dam zhing kla klo med cing brtan pa la brtag / rab tu ma rdzogs pa la ma yin /
analyzed: sems mi brtan pa la mi brtag / gos lhag ma brtag pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon kla klo can tshul khrims la dam zhing kla klo med cing brtan pa la brtag / rab tu ma rdzogs pa la ma yin /
translated: Do not examine a person whose mind is unstable.🔽As for examining the cloth, do not examine a preceptor or an instructor who is a barbarian, or who is not strict about moral discipline, or who is not a barbarian but is unstable.🔽Do not examine a person who is not fully ordained.

original: gos brtag pa'i sngags bya ba ni khyim pa dang dge slong la mi brtag go //
analyzed: gos brtag pa'i sngags bya ba ni khyim pa dang dge slong la mi brtag go //
translated: Do not examine a householder or a fully ordained monk.

original: mngon sum du ma yin /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma yin /
translated: Do not do it in the presence of others.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon la gos brtag pa yang mthong zhing shes pa dang thos par mi bya'i lkog tu grogs gcig gi gam du brtag / mthong ba dang thos par sngags btab na nyes byas /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon la gos brtag pa yang mthong zhing shes pa dang thos par mi bya'i lkog tu grogs gcig gi gam du brtag / mthong ba dang thos par sngags btab na nyes byas /
translated: Do not examine the preceptor or instructor in the presence of others, or let them see or hear it. Examine it in private, in the presence of a single companion. If you do the examination in the presence of others, or let them hear it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Do not examine a person who is in another country.

original: yul gzhan du 'dug pa la brtags na mi 'jig / mkhan po'am slob dpon nam gos su brtags pa'i mi de gud na 'dug gam yul gzhan du song na'ang zhig par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'dug pa la brtags na mi 'jig / mkhan po'am slob dpon nam gos su brtags pa'i mi de gud na 'dug gam yul gzhan du song na'ang zhig par mi 'gyur /
translated: If the person who is the preceptor, instructor, or the cloth is in another country or has gone to another country, the examination is not broken.

original: zhig pa ni 'phos na'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni 'phos na'o //
translated: The examination is broken if the person moves.

original: gos brtags pa'i mi de shi'am khrims phul na brtags pa'i sngags med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos brtags pa'i mi de shi'am khrims phul na brtags pa'i sngags med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person who is examining the robe dies or is expelled, the spell is broken.🔽If one knows,

original: shes na'o // khrim phul lam shi bar ma shes kyi bar du sngags 'chags so //
analyzed: shes na'o // khrim phul lam shi bar ma shes kyi bar du sngags 'chags so //
translated: the spell is broken until one knows that the person has been expelled or has died.

original: 'di'i bdag po ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag po ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The owner of this spell is the examiner.

original: gos sngags kyis 'debs pa'i tshe pha rol gyi yin par bsams shing brtags mod kyi bdag spyod cing 'chang du dbang ngo //
analyzed: gos sngags kyis 'debs pa'i tshe pha rol gyi yin par bsams shing brtags mod kyi bdag spyod cing 'chang du dbang ngo //
translated: When the robe is enchanted, one thinks of the other person as the owner, but one has the power to use and keep it for oneself.

original: btang ba bdag gir mi bya /
analyzed: btang ba bdag gir mi bya /
translated: One should not take back what has been given.

original: gos spang ba lhug pa byin pa las pha rol pos thal byung mi bskur /
analyzed: gos spang ba lhug pa byin pa las pha rol pos thal byung mi bskur /
translated: When a robe is given to a layperson, the other person should not give it back immediately.

original: dge slong la gtad /
analyzed: dge slong la gtad /
translated: It is entrusted to a monk.

original: gos spang la ltung ba byung ba dge slong tshul shes pa gcig la sbyin /
analyzed: gos spang la ltung ba byung ba dge slong tshul shes pa gcig la sbyin /
translated: When a monk has committed an offense of abandoning a robe, he should give it to a monk who knows the rules.

original: dge 'dun gyi la ma yin /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi la ma yin /
translated: It is not for the Saṅgha.

original: gos spangs pa ni dge 'dun la mi sbyin gyi dge slong gang zag gcig la sbyin /
analyzed: gos spangs pa ni dge 'dun la mi sbyin gyi dge slong gang zag gcig la sbyin /
translated: A monk who has abandoned a robe should not give it to the Saṅgha, but to an individual monk.

original: blun po la ma yin /
analyzed: blun po la ma yin /
translated: It is not for a fool.

original: dge slong gang la spang ba'ang blun @265a * //
analyzed: dge slong gang la spang ba'ang blun @265a * //
translated: A robe that is to be abandoned should not be given to a monk who is a fool.

original: zhing tshul mi shes pa mi sbyin gyi zin po tshul shes pa la spang /
analyzed: zhing tshul mi shes pa mi sbyin gyi zin po tshul shes pa la spang /
translated: Do not give to those who do not know the proper way to use it, but give to those who do.

original: mi ster bslang /
analyzed: mi ster bslang /
translated: Do not give to those who do not ask, but give to those who do.

original: gos spangs pa las pha rol po des ma byin na mthol ba ga sos kyi 'og tu bdag gos kyis brel to zhes bslang /
analyzed: gos spangs pa las pha rol po des ma byin na mthol ba ga sos kyi 'og tu bdag gos kyis brel to zhes bslang /
translated: If you have given up wearing clothes, and the other person does not give you any, ask for them, saying, “I am in need of clothes.”

original: mthu yis blang /
analyzed: mthu yis blang /
translated: Take them by force.

original: gos spangs pa bdag gis bslangs kyang ma ster na grogs po bzlog la dbrog go //
analyzed: gos spangs pa bdag gis bslangs kyang ma ster na grogs po bzlog la dbrog go //
translated: If you ask for clothes but the other person does not give you any, get them from a friend or by theft.

original: gos la bsung gis reg na bkrus te spyad /
analyzed: gos la bsung gis reg na bkrus te spyad /
translated: If your clothes come into contact with a bad smell, wash them and use them.

original: bdag gi gos la sogs pa bsung gis reg na ma brtags pa'i phyir spu bkru /
analyzed: bdag gi gos la sogs pa bsung gis reg na ma brtags pa'i phyir spu bkru /
translated: If your clothes and so forth come into contact with a bad smell, wash the fibers because you have not examined them.

original: phye ma na sprug / bsung gi phye mas reg na sprug / snum gyis na dag par ro //
analyzed: phye ma na sprug / bsung gi phye mas reg na sprug / snum gyis na dag par ro //
translated: If they come into contact with a fine powder, shake them out; if they come into contact with scented powder, shake them out; if they come into contact with oil, clean them.

original: gos la snum gyis reg na bkru /🔽char pa bab na bla gab med pa la dge 'dun gyi ma yin /
analyzed: gos la snum gyis reg na bkru / char pa bab na bla gab med pa la dge 'dun gyi ma yin /
translated: If your clothes come into contact with oil, wash them.🔽If it is raining, do not wear the Saṅgha’s robes in the open air.

original: char pa bab pa'i khrod du dge 'dun gyi gos gyon te mi 'gro /
analyzed: char pa bab pa'i khrod du dge 'dun gyi gos gyon te mi 'gro /
translated: Do not walk in the rain wearing the Saṅgha’s robes.

original: bkru ba dang 'tshed pa dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing gshags pa la sogs pa'i byed par ma yin /
analyzed: bkru ba dang 'tshed pa dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing gshags pa la sogs pa'i byed par ma yin /
translated: It is not to be done by one who is washing, cooking, working with the begging bowl, or cutting wood.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gos gyon te mi bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gos gyon te mi bya /
translated: When one is doing any of these things mentioned by name, one should not be wearing the robes of the community.

original: bzhag pa las lhan cig na'o zhes ma smras na gzhan med kyang sbyin te yang dag par bgrang /🔽mi gsum gyis bdag la rdzas zhig gtams te ded gsum ma tshogs kyi bar du ma sbyin cig ces zer ba las gcig gam gnyis len du 'ongs na'ang mi sbyin no //
analyzed: bzhag pa las lhan cig na'o zhes ma smras na gzhan med kyang sbyin te yang dag par bgrang / mi gsum gyis bdag la rdzas zhig gtams te ded gsum ma tshogs kyi bar du ma sbyin cig ces zer ba las gcig gam gnyis len du 'ongs na'ang mi sbyin no //
translated: If one is not told, “Do not give it away while I am present,” one may give it away even if no one else is present.🔽If three people entrust one with some goods, saying, “Do not give them until three of us have gathered,” one should not give them if only one or two come to take them.

original: nged gsum ma tshogs kyi bar du ma sbyin cig ces mi zer bar gtams pa ni gcig gam gnyis len du 'ongs te sbyin kyang nyes med /
analyzed: nged gsum ma tshogs kyi bar du ma sbyin cig ces mi zer bar gtams pa ni gcig gam gnyis len du 'ongs te sbyin kyang nyes med /
translated: If they entrust one with goods, saying, “Do not give them until all three of us have gathered,” one may give them if one or two come to take them, even though it is not the full complement.

original: gzhog pa dang ma 'grogs par ma yin /
analyzed: gzhog pa dang ma 'grogs par ma yin /
translated: It is not to be done without the presence of a companion.

original: nor gzhog pa'i tshe nor bdag dang 'grogs pa ma yin pa zhig len du 'ongs te dan rtags yod kyang mi sbyin /
analyzed: nor gzhog pa'i tshe nor bdag dang 'grogs pa ma yin pa zhig len du 'ongs te dan rtags yod kyang mi sbyin /
translated: If one is counting money, one should not give it to someone who comes to take it away without the presence of the owner of the money, even if he has a note.

original: gnyen dang bdag gi khyim ma yin pa smyon pa las mi blang /
analyzed: gnyen dang bdag gi khyim ma yin pa smyon pa las mi blang /
translated: It is not to be taken from a friend or from one’s own house, except from a madman.

original: mi smyon pa zhig gis kho bdag gi khyim dang pha ma'i khyim nas blangs te bdag la byin na blangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mi smyon pa zhig gis kho bdag gi khyim dang pha ma'i khyim nas blangs te bdag la byin na blangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If a madman takes it from his own house or from his parents’ house and gives it to you, it is not a downfall to accept it.

original: bu bskrad pa las blangs /
analyzed: bu bskrad pa las blangs /
translated: It is not to be taken from a disowned son.

original: pha mas bu bskrad pa las bu des pha ma'i khyim nas nor zhig blangs te byin na 'ang blangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: pha mas bu bskrad pa las bu des pha ma'i khyim nas nor zhig blangs te byin na 'ang blangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If a son has been disowned by his parents and he takes some wealth from his parents’ house and gives it to you, it is not a downfall to accept it.

original: dur khrod nas slar bzlog pa las yang ngo //
analyzed: dur khrod nas slar bzlog pa las yang ngo //
translated: It is not to be taken from a charnel ground, except if one is turning back.

original: dur khrod kyi ro'i rdzas zhig blangs te bdag la byin na blangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ro'i rdzas zhig blangs te bdag la byin na blangs kyang nyes med /
translated: If someone takes some substance from a corpse in a charnel ground and gives it to you, it is not a downfall to accept it.

original: de slar slong na sbyin /🔽mdo ltag ma ltar ro'i rdzas byin pa slar 'dod ces zer na 'ang byin cig / slar 'thom na 'ang @265b blangs /
analyzed: de slar slong na sbyin / mdo ltag ma ltar ro'i rdzas byin pa slar 'dod ces zer na 'ang byin cig / slar 'thom na 'ang @265b blangs /
translated: If the giver asks for it back, give it back.🔽If the giver says, “I want back what I gave you,” give it back.🔽If the giver asks for it back again, take it back.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar slar slong ste byin pa las yang slar 'bul na ma khro bar long zhig / mchod rten gyi dkor /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar slar slong ste byin pa las yang slar 'bul na ma khro bar long zhig / mchod rten gyi dkor /
translated: If the giver asks for it back again and again, take it back without getting angry.🔽It is not to be taken from a stūpa or from the Saṅgha.

original: mchod rten la phul ba'i dkor rnams ni dge 'dun gyis bgo zhing spyad par mi bya'o //🔽rtsva dang bu ram shing dag las /
analyzed: mchod rten la phul ba'i dkor rnams ni dge 'dun gyis bgo zhing spyad par mi bya'o // rtsva dang bu ram shing dag las /
translated: The property offered to a stupa should not be divided and used by the Sangha.🔽If grass and sugarcane are offered to the Sangha,

original: rtsva ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bcad pa zhig dge 'dun la phul na bgos shing so sor sbyin no //
analyzed: rtsva ba dang 'bras bu la sogs pa bcad pa zhig dge 'dun la phul na bgos shing so sor sbyin no //
translated: the grass and fruit and so on may be divided and given to each member of the Sangha.

original: gzhan zas kyi phyir bsngos pa /
analyzed: gzhan zas kyi phyir bsngos pa /
translated: If food is offered to the Sangha,

original: bca' ba la ma gtogs pa mar dang bag phye la sogs pa phul ba ni mi bgo bar g-yos su byas te spyir brim mo //🔽nye bar 'tsho ba dang nad pa la brtags pa bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo //
analyzed: bca' ba la ma gtogs pa mar dang bag phye la sogs pa phul ba ni mi bgo bar g-yos su byas te spyir brim mo // nye bar 'tsho ba dang nad pa la brtags pa bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bgo //
translated: it should not be divided. The butter, flour, and so on should be used to make food and distributed to all.🔽If bedding and medicine are offered, they should be divided and used by the Sangha because they are for the benefit of all and for the sick.

original: mal cha dang khri stan la sogs pa dang sman la sogs pa phul ba ni spyis spyad dgos pa'i phyir mi bgo bar gzhag go //
analyzed: mal cha dang khri stan la sogs pa dang sman la sogs pa phul ba ni spyis spyad dgos pa'i phyir mi bgo bar gzhag go //
translated: If beds, seats, and so on, and medicine are offered, they should not be divided but kept for general use.🔽If one finds a place for the rainy season retreat, one should enter it.

original: dbyar gyi mtshams rnyed na 'jug / dbyar tshul du zhugs pas ni tshul gyi yon skal gyi nang du 'jug cing blang /
analyzed: dbyar gyi mtshams rnyed na 'jug / dbyar tshul du zhugs pas ni tshul gyi yon skal gyi nang du 'jug cing blang /
translated: If one has entered the rainy season retreat, one should enter and accept the benefits of the retreat.

original: ma zhugs na mi blang /
analyzed: ma zhugs na mi blang /
translated: If one has not entered the rainy season retreat, one should not accept the benefits.

original: dbyar chad pa la yang mi rigs pa ma yin /
analyzed: dbyar chad pa la yang mi rigs pa ma yin /
translated: It is not unreasonable to divide the rainy season.🔽The rainy season is divided into three parts:

original: dbyar tshul dral ba ni zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du tshul bsrungs pa ni yon skal dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbyar tshul dral ba ni zhag bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar du tshul bsrungs pa ni yon skal dbang ngo //
translated: One who has observed the rainy season for forty-nine days is entitled to a share of the offerings.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa lnga bsrungs pa ni phyed dbang ngo //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa lnga bsrungs pa ni phyed dbang ngo //
translated: One who has observed it for forty-five days is entitled to half.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bsrungs pa ni mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi bsrungs pa ni mi dbang ngo //
translated: One who has observed it for forty-four days is not entitled.

original: bskrad pa ni ma yin //
analyzed: bskrad pa ni ma yin //
translated: It is not expelled.

original: dge slong chad pas bcad de bskrad pa ni tshul gyis yon skal mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong chad pas bcad de bskrad pa ni tshul gyis yon skal mi dbang ngo //
translated: A monk who has been punished and expelled is not entitled to a share of the offerings due to his observance.

original: rdzas kyis non par dbyar gnas pa la cha gcig go //
analyzed: rdzas kyis non par dbyar gnas pa la cha gcig go //
translated: One who has stayed in the rainy season retreat with material possessions is entitled to one part.

original: gtsug lag khang mang po zhig kun gyi mtshams su re lde lta bus mnan te tshul du zhugs pa ni gtsug lag khang kun gyi yon skal mi dbang gi gtsug lag khang re re nas kyang cha re re dbang ste ci ltar dbang ba 'og nas 'chad der
analyzed: gtsug lag khang mang po zhig kun gyi mtshams su re lde lta bus mnan te tshul du zhugs pa ni gtsug lag khang kun gyi yon skal mi dbang gi gtsug lag khang re re nas kyang cha re re dbang ste ci ltar dbang ba 'og nas 'chad der
translated: If one enters the rainy season retreat in many temples, having covered the boundaries of all of them with a fence, one is not entitled to a share of the offerings of all the temples, but is entitled to a share from each individual temple.

original: bdag gis bgrangs te ma non pa'i skal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bgrangs te ma non pa'i skal ba'o //
translated: This is the share that is not determined by counting.

original: gtsug lag khang gcig nas cha re re dbang ba ni gtsug lag khang du yod pa'i grangs las gtsug lag khang de gcig gi dge slong mi gcig gi skal ba ci thob pa las lha khang lnga yod na ni mi gcig gi skal ba'i lnga cha gcig sbyin
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcig nas cha re re dbang ba ni gtsug lag khang du yod pa'i grangs las gtsug lag khang de gcig gi dge slong mi gcig gi skal ba ci thob pa las lha khang lnga yod na ni mi gcig gi skal ba'i lnga cha gcig sbyin
translated: If a monk has a share in one temple, he has a share in all temples.🔽If there are five temples, he has a share in one fifth of the property of each temple.

original: no // drug yod na'ang drug cha re re sbyin no //
analyzed: no // drug yod na'ang drug cha re re sbyin no //
translated: If there are six temples, he has a share in one sixth of the property of each temple.

original: gzhan du du mar tshul du zhugs na ring du gnas pa der chos so //🔽ltag ma ltar gtsug lag khang du ma zhig gi mtshams su mnan te tshul du zhugs pa las gtsug lag khang du zan za ba gcig tu zan gyi @266a * //
analyzed: gzhan du du mar tshul du zhugs na ring du gnas pa der chos so // ltag ma ltar gtsug lag khang du ma zhig gi mtshams su mnan te tshul du zhugs pa las gtsug lag khang du zan za ba gcig tu zan gyi @266a * //
translated: If he enters the order in many places, he should remain in the place where he stayed the longest.🔽If he enters the order in many temples, he should remain in the temple where he stayed the longest.

original: phyir yang 'dug rnyed pa'i yon che ba gcig tu yang yon 'dod pa'i phyir gnas pa na gang du ring du gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang de'i yon skal la dbang ngo //
analyzed: phyir yang 'dug rnyed pa'i yon che ba gcig tu yang yon 'dod pa'i phyir gnas pa na gang du ring du gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang de'i yon skal la dbang ngo //
translated: If he stays in one temple for the sake of food and in another for the sake of offerings, he should take his share of the offerings from the temple where he stayed the longest.

original: dge sbyong pha dang dge spyong ma'i rnyed pa ni sum cha ma gtogs pa las so //
analyzed: dge sbyong pha dang dge spyong ma'i rnyed pa ni sum cha ma gtogs pa las so //
translated: The property of a male or female novice is given to the community of monks or nuns.

original: gtsug lag khang du rtag par nar mar yon 'bul ba zhig las 'god pa ni dge slong pha dang dge slong mas gsum thob na dge sbyong pha dang dge sbyong ma gnyis sbyin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du rtag par nar mar yon 'bul ba zhig las 'god pa ni dge slong pha dang dge slong mas gsum thob na dge sbyong pha dang dge sbyong ma gnyis sbyin no //
translated: If a monk or nun obtains three, he or she is given the gifts of both a male and female ascetic.

original: yon bdag gis 'phral du phul ba ni dge slong dang mnyam par sbyin no //
analyzed: yon bdag gis 'phral du phul ba ni dge slong dang mnyam par sbyin no //
translated: If a patron offers a gift immediately, it is given equally to the monks.

original: zas ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: zas ni mnyam mo //
translated: The food is equal.

original: dge 'dun sbyin spyir zas lta bu zhig yon du phul ba las 'god pa ni dge slong dang dge sbyong mnyam par bgo / bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slong ma yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun sbyin spyir zas lta bu zhig yon du phul ba las 'god pa ni dge slong dang dge sbyong mnyam par bgo / bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slong ma yang ngo //
translated: If a gift such as food is offered to the Saṅgha in general, it is distributed equally to the monks and nuns.

original: dge sbyong lo nyi shu tshang ba dang dge slong lo gnyis spyad zin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong lo nyi shu tshang ba dang dge slong lo gnyis spyad zin te /
translated: If a male or female novice who is twenty years old and a monk who has practiced for two years

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa rung ba zhig na yon la sogs pa bgo'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa rung ba zhig na yon la sogs pa bgo'o //
translated: are suitable for full ordination, they should be given the gifts and so on equally.

original: cog mnyam par bya /
analyzed: cog mnyam par bya /
translated: The gifts should be equal.

original: dge slong dang dge slong mar na cha blang ba ni dge 'dun gyis ma yin te gang zag tu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong mar na cha blang ba ni dge 'dun gyis ma yin te gang zag tu'o //
translated: The robes of a monk and nun are not obtained from the Saṅgha, but from an individual.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun spyir yon zhig phul ba las 'god pa ni dge 'dun sde mnyam par mi bgo'i grangs su bgo / ma bsngos par mchod ston gyi rjes su rnyed pa la dge slong mas kyang zos na ma gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun spyir yon zhig phul ba las 'god pa ni dge 'dun sde mnyam par mi bgo'i grangs su bgo / ma bsngos par mchod ston gyi rjes su rnyed pa la dge slong mas kyang zos na ma gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The nuns are not to be included in the number of monks when the distribution is made to the monks in general.🔽If the nuns eat the food of the feast after it has been dedicated to the Sangha, they are not guilty.

original: dge 'dun spyan drangs te dge slong bshos gsol zin pa'i rjes la dge slong mas slebs na dge slong phyis shos mi dbang ba ma yin te dge slong dang mnyam par dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyan drangs te dge slong bshos gsol zin pa'i rjes la dge slong mas slebs na dge slong phyis shos mi dbang ba ma yin te dge slong dang mnyam par dbang ngo //
translated: If the nuns arrive after the monks have eaten the food offered to the Sangha, the monks who arrive later are not deprived of their share.

original: stan dang chu dang bsod snyoms la dge slong dge slong ma bas thu bo ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stan dang chu dang bsod snyoms la dge slong dge slong ma bas thu bo ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: The nuns are not to be considered as junior to the monks in regard to seats, water, or alms.

original: dge slong gsar du khrims rdzogs na dge slong ma rdzogs nas lo nyi shu lon kyang stan dang lag chu 'drim pa dge slong las sngar brim mo //
analyzed: dge slong gsar du khrims rdzogs na dge slong ma rdzogs nas lo nyi shu lon kyang stan dang lag chu 'drim pa dge slong las sngar brim mo //
translated: If a monk has just completed his novitiate, even if a nun has completed hers twenty years previously, she must yield her seat and water to him.

original: dge slong ma 'khod na rgan rims nas stan dor //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'khod na rgan rims nas stan dor //
translated: If a nun is already seated, the monk should not push her off her seat.

original: dge slong ma 'ba' zhig spyan drangs te la shas gsol ba'i tshe phyis dge slong pha 'ong gis dogs pa'i phyir dge slong pha'i stan gong du gnyis gsum tsam gzhag dge slong pa de dag gis sbyin pa las 'chags pa byed mi nus na dge slong ma dag
analyzed: dge slong ma 'ba' zhig spyan drangs te la shas gsol ba'i tshe phyis dge slong pha 'ong gis dogs pa'i phyir dge slong pha'i stan gong du gnyis gsum tsam gzhag dge slong pa de dag gis sbyin pa las 'chags pa byed mi nus na dge slong ma dag
translated: If the monks are unable to perform the confession ceremony, the nuns🔽should do it.

original: gis so // gtsug lag khang du yon bdag gis dge slong pa dang dge slong ma bshos gsol ba'i 'og tu @266b tshigs bcad dge slong phas klog mi nus na dge slong ma mkhas pas kyang rung /🔽zas 'drim pa mngon par 'dug na zas snyoms par brims shig ces dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis thog mar bsgo //
analyzed: gis so // gtsug lag khang du yon bdag gis dge slong pa dang dge slong ma bshos gsol ba'i 'og tu @266b tshigs bcad dge slong phas klog mi nus na dge slong ma mkhas pas kyang rung / zas 'drim pa mngon par 'dug na zas snyoms par brims shig ces dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis thog mar bsgo //
translated: If the benefactor offers food to the monks and nuns in the temple, after the monks have eaten, if the monks are unable to recite the verses, then a learned nun may do so.🔽If the food is being distributed unevenly, the most senior monk in the community should say, “Distribute the food evenly.”

original: dge 'dun bshos gsol ba'i tshe phyag tshang dang thong ngan gyis 'byor tshogs zhes smras na gnas brtan gyis snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo //
analyzed: dge 'dun bshos gsol ba'i tshe phyag tshang dang thong ngan gyis 'byor tshogs zhes smras na gnas brtan gyis snyoms par brims shig ces bsgo //
translated: If, when the community is eating, the kitchen helpers say, “There is a shortage,” the most senior monk should say, “Distribute the food evenly.”

original: 'khor du bltas te mang la zas nyung na ci 'byor du'o zhes thog mar ro //
analyzed: 'khor du bltas te mang la zas nyung na ci 'byor du'o zhes thog mar ro //
translated: If the assembly is large and the food is little, one should say, “Eat as much as you can.”

original: gtsug lag khang ngam yon bdag gi gnas su dge 'dun bshos gsol ba'i tshe gnas brtan gyis dge slong grangs las lhag par 'ongs na yon bdag la sbran nas dge slong bshos bshugs te thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir brims shig ces bsgo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ngam yon bdag gi gnas su dge 'dun bshos gsol ba'i tshe gnas brtan gyis dge slong grangs las lhag par 'ongs na yon bdag la sbran nas dge slong bshos bshugs te thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir brims shig ces bsgo //
translated: If, when the Saṅgha is being fed in a monastery or in the house of a patron, the sthavira finds that the number of monks has increased, he should inform the patron and say, “Distribute the food so that everyone gets some.”

original: gzhan du na ci nus pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na ci nus pas so //
translated: Otherwise, do what you can.

original: dge slong grangs bcad de bshos sbyar ba las de'i nang nas kha cig gud du spyan drangs te dong nas zas lhag par gyur na dge 'dun khong rtag tu bcing ba der brims zhes gnas brtan gyis bsgo //
analyzed: dge slong grangs bcad de bshos sbyar ba las de'i nang nas kha cig gud du spyan drangs te dong nas zas lhag par gyur na dge 'dun khong rtag tu bcing ba der brims zhes gnas brtan gyis bsgo //
translated: If the food is prepared for a limited number of monks, but some of them are invited elsewhere and do not get any, the sthavira should say, “Distribute the food that is left to the Saṅgha.”

original: sam pra ta zhes rgan rims la ma brjod pa'i sngon rol du mi blang /
analyzed: sam pra ta zhes rgan rims la ma brjod pa'i sngon rol du mi blang /
translated: One should not say “sampra” before the elders.

original: bshos 'drim pa'i tshe thong ngan gyi 'byor tshogs zhes ma smras par bshos blangs na gnas brtan la 'byor nyes byas pa'i phyir gnas brtan gyis thod ngan las 'byor tshogs zhes smros shig ces bsgo //
analyzed: bshos 'drim pa'i tshe thong ngan gyi 'byor tshogs zhes ma smras par bshos blangs na gnas brtan la 'byor nyes byas pa'i phyir gnas brtan gyis thod ngan las 'byor tshogs zhes smros shig ces bsgo //
translated: If, when the food is being served, the elder does not say, “May you have an excellent feast,” but says, “May you have an excellent collection of wealth,” then the elder has committed an offense.

original: zas sta gon byas te spyan drangs pa las gzhan 'ongs te de la sbran /
analyzed: zas sta gon byas te spyan drangs pa las gzhan 'ongs te de la sbran /
translated: If someone comes to invite the monks to a meal that has already been arranged, the elder should inform the other monks.

original: yon bdag gcig gis grangs bcad de spyan drangs pa las yan man nas dge slong lhag ma zhig 'ongs na /
analyzed: yon bdag gcig gis grangs bcad de spyan drangs pa las yan man nas dge slong lhag ma zhig 'ongs na /
translated: If a certain number of monks have been invited by a patron, but more or less monks come than were invited,

original: yon bdag la dge slong 'di snyed cig 'ongs so zhes gnas brtan gyis bsgo /
analyzed: yon bdag la dge slong 'di snyed cig 'ongs so zhes gnas brtan gyis bsgo /
translated: the elder should inform the patron.

original: chos gos gsum byin cig ces dge slong la mi bskyur /
analyzed: chos gos gsum byin cig ces dge slong la mi bskyur /
translated: The elder should not tell the monks, “Give this to the three Dharma robes.”

original: dge slong na ba la dge slong grogs kyis chos gos gsum bsngos pa khyod sang ngam nam shi tol med na chos gos dge 'dun la dbul ba'i rigs so zhes mi bsgo /
analyzed: dge slong na ba la dge slong grogs kyis chos gos gsum bsngos pa khyod sang ngam nam shi tol med na chos gos dge 'dun la dbul ba'i rigs so zhes mi bsgo /
translated: If a sick monk has designated his three Dharma robes to a fellow monk, the elder should not tell him, “When you die, you should offer your Dharma robes to the saṅgha.”

original: bdag ma shi na zhag re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ma shi na zhag re nyes byas re rer 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the sick monk does not die, he commits an offense of wrong conduct every day.

original: dge 'dun gyis blangs na 'di sos na slar sbyin no zhes yid de dag las gzhan du ma yin /🔽mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong nad pas chos gos bsngos pa dge 'dun la yon du phul ba dge 'dun gyis @267a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis blangs na 'di sos na slar sbyin no zhes yid de dag las gzhan du ma yin / mdo ltag ma ltar dge slong nad pas chos gos bsngos pa dge 'dun la yon du phul ba dge 'dun gyis @267a * //
translated: If the Saṅgha takes it, if he recovers, it should be returned to him.🔽The sutra states:🔽If a sick bhikṣu donates a robe to the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha should think, “If he recovers, we will return this robe.”

original: kyang kho sos na gos 'di slar sbyin no snyam du bsams te blangs na gos slar sbyin /
analyzed: kyang kho sos na gos 'di slar sbyin no snyam du bsams te blangs na gos slar sbyin /
translated: If he recovers, the robe should be returned.

original: shi nas bla 'og tu bca' bar ro //
analyzed: shi nas bla 'og tu bca' bar ro //
translated: If he dies, it should be spread over the corpse.

original: dge slong shin 'og tu gding ba'i ras yug gcig dang steng du g-yogs pa'i ras yug gcig gis g-yogs la dor /
analyzed: dge slong shin 'og tu gding ba'i ras yug gcig dang steng du g-yogs pa'i ras yug gcig gis g-yogs la dor /
translated: The corpse of a bhikṣu should be covered with a single cloth spread over the top and a single cloth spread underneath.

original: 'bring po ltag ma ltar ro la g-yogs pa'i gos ni bzang po yang ma yin te 'bring po g-yog / ltag ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bring po ltag ma ltar ro la g-yogs pa'i gos ni bzang po yang ma yin te 'bring po g-yog / ltag ma ni ma yin no //
translated: The corpse of a bhikṣu of medium status should be covered with a single cloth spread over the top, but not with a cloth spread underneath.

original: dge slong phyug po shi na dge slong grogs kyis gos bzang po mang po zhig gis g-yogs te dor zhes zer na'ang ci ran par dkris te dor ro //
analyzed: dge slong phyug po shi na dge slong grogs kyis gos bzang po mang po zhig gis g-yogs te dor zhes zer na'ang ci ran par dkris te dor ro //
translated: If a wealthy bhikṣu dies, his friends should cover the corpse with many fine cloths and then bury it.

original: dri ba dang bcas pa phran tshegs la sogs par chud pa ste gos kyi dngos po'o //🔽dris pa dang phran tshegs la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba ste gos kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
analyzed: dri ba dang bcas pa phran tshegs la sogs par chud pa ste gos kyi dngos po'o // dris pa dang phran tshegs la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba ste gos kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: The matter of robes is concluded.🔽The matter of robes is concluded.

original: // / gos kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: // / gos kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The matter of robes is concluded.

original: 'di man chad pags pa'i dngos po la 'chad de /
analyzed: 'di man chad pags pa'i dngos po la 'chad de /
translated: From here on, the matter of skin is explained.

original: yul dbus ma'i mtshams ni /
analyzed: yul dbus ma'i mtshams ni /
translated: The border of the central region:

original: yul gyi dbus ni sangs rgyas snga rabs kyang gnas de nas 'das phyis 'da' bar 'gyur ba'ang ma h'a bo de nas 'das pas na rdo rje'i gdan bzhugs te yul gyi dbus bya ste /
analyzed: yul gyi dbus ni sangs rgyas snga rabs kyang gnas de nas 'das phyis 'da' bar 'gyur ba'ang ma h'a bo de nas 'das pas na rdo rje'i gdan bzhugs te yul gyi dbus bya ste /
translated: The central region is the place where the previous Buddhas resided, and where the future Buddhas will reside. Since the present Buddha also resides there, it is called the central region.

original: gang tshun chad dbus su brtsi ba 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: gang tshun chad dbus su brtsi ba 'og nas 'chad /
translated: The extent of the central region will be explained later.

original: shar phyogs kyi mtshams nas phun tra brta na'i mdun gyi tshal bu 'da' ka zhes bya'o //🔽pun tra brtan zhes bya ba'i mtshams tshun chad dbus su brtsi /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi mtshams nas phun tra brta na'i mdun gyi tshal bu 'da' ka zhes bya'o // pun tra brtan zhes bya ba'i mtshams tshun chad dbus su brtsi /
translated: The eastern border is called the forest of Pundravardhana.🔽Up to the border called Pundravardhana is considered the central region.

original: pun tra brta na zhes bya ba nyid ni mtha' 'khob tu brtsi /
analyzed: pun tra brta na zhes bya ba nyid ni mtha' 'khob tu brtsi /
translated: Pundravardhana itself is considered a border region.

original: de'i mdun na tshal bu 'da' ka zhes bya ba tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi ste /
analyzed: de'i mdun na tshal bu 'da' ka zhes bya ba tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi ste /
translated: The area up to the forest called Adakavastu is considered the center of the country.

original: lho phyogs kyi ni sha ra ba ti zhes bya ba'i chu bo de'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi ni sha ra ba ti zhes bya ba'i chu bo de'o //
translated: The southern border is the river Sharavati.

original: lho phyogs kyi mtshams ni sha ra ba ti gtsang po chen po tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi mtshams ni sha ra ba ti gtsang po chen po tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi /
translated: The area up to the great river Sharavati is considered the center of the country.

original: nub phyogs kyi ni bram ze'i grong tu na dang au pa tu na'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi ni bram ze'i grong tu na dang au pa tu na'o //
translated: The western border is the brahmin villages of Tunna and Upanata.

original: nub phyogs kyi bram ze spun gnyis tu na dang au pa tu na dang gnyis kyi grong khyer tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi bram ze spun gnyis tu na dang au pa tu na dang gnyis kyi grong khyer tshun chad yul gyi dbus su brtsi /
translated: The area up to the two brahmin villages of Tunna and Upanata is considered the center of the country.

original: byang phyogs kyi ni au shi ra'i ri'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi ni au shi ra'i ri'o //
translated: The northern border is the Ushira mountain.

original: byang phyogs kyi ni au shir zhes bya ba'i yul de na rtsa man ma zhim po zhig skye ba'i yul de tshun chad dbus su brtsi /🔽mtha' 'khob tu lham bol med bcang /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi ni au shir zhes bya ba'i yul de na rtsa man ma zhim po zhig skye ba'i yul de tshun chad dbus su brtsi / mtha' 'khob tu lham bol med bcang /
translated: The area up to the country called Ushira, where a foul-smelling root grows, is considered the center.🔽In the border regions, one may wear shoes without a forepart.

original: lhag ma'i phyogs bzhi'i mtshams phan chad ni lham bol med gyon du dbang /
analyzed: lhag ma'i phyogs bzhi'i mtshams phan chad ni lham bol med gyon du dbang /
translated: In the border regions beyond the above boundaries, one may wear shoes without a forepart.

original: mal stan sba pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: mal stan sba pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Also, in order to protect the bedding.

original: yul gyi dbus na mal stan la rdul @267b mi gos par bya ba'i phyir lham bol med bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: yul gyi dbus na mal stan la rdul @267b mi gos par bya ba'i phyir lham bol med bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: In the middle country, it is not a fault to wear shoes without felt soles in order to protect the bedding from dust.

original: tshig rim mo //🔽ltag ma ltar dbus su lham gyon du dbang ba ni chig rim du bya /
analyzed: tshig rim mo // ltag ma ltar dbus su lham gyon du dbang ba ni chig rim du bya /
translated: The order of the words is different.🔽The order of the words in the verse is different from the order in the root text.

original: lhan pa sbyin pas bcos lham rdol na lhan pa glan /
analyzed: lhan pa sbyin pas bcos lham rdol na lhan pa glan /
translated: If a patched robe is torn, it is permissible to patch it.

original: rim pa gzhan du mi bya /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan du mi bya /
translated: But it is not permissible to make another robe.

original: rting pa 'am brang ba gang du rdol bar glan gyi cher ni mi glan no ;
analyzed: rting pa 'am brang ba gang du rdol bar glan gyi cher ni mi glan no ;
translated: It is permissible to patch it on the heel or the front, but not on the sides.

original: khyim pas gom pa bdun tsam du spyod spyod na rim mang po yang ngo //
analyzed: khyim pas gom pa bdun tsam du spyod spyod na rim mang po yang ngo //
translated: If a householder wears it for seven steps, it is permissible to make many layers.

original: lham mthil rim pa bdun tsam du stug po'ang khyim pas gom pa drug bdun tsam bgos pas rnyings par chud de gyon du dbang /
analyzed: lham mthil rim pa bdun tsam du stug po'ang khyim pas gom pa drug bdun tsam bgos pas rnyings par chud de gyon du dbang /
translated: If a householder wears it for six or seven steps, it is permissible to wear it even if it is worn out, because it is thick with seven layers.

original: brtags pa tsam gyi phyir de'i dbang gis sbyar bar blangs ni ma brtags par blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa tsam gyi phyir de'i dbang gis sbyar bar blangs ni ma brtags par blangs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one takes it after making it for the purpose of examining it, it is not taken without examining it.

original: bdag la lham sar pa ko ba rim pa mang po can yod na rim pa gcig gtogs pas brtags par chud yang gcig tu na khyim pa la gom pa drug bdun tsam gyon du 'ang brtags par chud de gyon du dbang /
analyzed: bdag la lham sar pa ko ba rim pa mang po can yod na rim pa gcig gtogs pas brtags par chud yang gcig tu na khyim pa la gom pa drug bdun tsam gyon du 'ang brtags par chud de gyon du dbang /
translated: If you have a new pair of boots with many layers of leather, it is permissible to wear them after removing one layer. Alternatively, it is permissible to wear them for six or seven steps in front of a layperson.

original: ri mo dang nye ba'i ri mo ma yin pa /
analyzed: ri mo dang nye ba'i ri mo ma yin pa /
translated: They should not have patterns or designs.

original: lham mda' tshon kyis bris pa'i ri mo can gyon du mi dbang /
analyzed: lham mda' tshon kyis bris pa'i ri mo can gyon du mi dbang /
translated: It is not permissible to wear boots with patterns or designs painted on them with colored dyes.

original: lug ru lta bur ma yin /
analyzed: lug ru lta bur ma yin /
translated: They should not be like a ram’s horns.

original: lham gyi bol la ste 'dzom gyi gong ras 'dra bas brgyan pa'i lham mi dbang /
analyzed: lham gyi bol la ste 'dzom gyi gong ras 'dra bas brgyan pa'i lham mi dbang /
translated: It is not permissible to wear boots decorated with a patch on the toe like a piece of cloth from the upper part of the boot.

original: shu ba ta dang ka ri bya'i lo ma lta bu ma yin /
analyzed: shu ba ta dang ka ri bya'i lo ma lta bu ma yin /
translated: They should not be like a shubha or kari bird’s feathers.

original: lham gyi bol la shid bo de'i lo ma dang 'dra ba dang gong nan tan gyi ri mo 'dra brta bag tu 'dug pas brgyan pa'i lham mi bgo //
analyzed: lham gyi bol la shid bo de'i lo ma dang 'dra ba dang gong nan tan gyi ri mo 'dra brta bag tu 'dug pas brgyan pa'i lham mi bgo //
translated: It is not permissible to wear boots decorated with a patch on the toe like a piece of shubha or kari bird’s feathers and a patch on the upper part like a piece of cloth from the upper part of the boot.

original: gser dngul gyis spras pa ma yin /
analyzed: gser dngul gyis spras pa ma yin /
translated: They should not be decorated with gold or silver.

original: gser dngul dang rin po ches brgyan pa'i lham mi bgo //
analyzed: gser dngul dang rin po ches brgyan pa'i lham mi bgo //
translated: It is not permissible to wear boots decorated with gold, silver, or precious stones.

original: tsi gi tsi ki ma yin /
analyzed: tsi gi tsi ki ma yin /
translated: They should not be like the cīrikī bird.

original: 'di skad ces zer ba'i lham mi bgo / ki ni ki nir ma yin /
analyzed: 'di skad ces zer ba'i lham mi bgo / ki ni ki nir ma yin /
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: 'di skad sgra 'byung ba'i lham mi bgo / khi ni khi nir ma yin /
analyzed: 'di skad sgra 'byung ba'i lham mi bgo / khi ni khi nir ma yin /
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: 'di skad du zer ba'i lham mi bgo /🔽dzi ni dzi nir ma yin /
analyzed: 'di skad du zer ba'i lham mi bgo / dzi ni dzi nir ma yin /
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: de skad zer ba la sogs pa'i lham gyon na nyes byas /
analyzed: de skad zer ba la sogs pa'i lham gyon na nyes byas /
translated: If you wear shoes that make such sounds and so forth, it is a minor fault.🔽Moreover, do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: gzhan yang trog trog por skye ba ma yin /🔽lham sgrog por 'gyur ba'i lham mi bgo //
analyzed: gzhan yang trog trog por skye ba ma yin / lham sgrog por 'gyur ba'i lham mi bgo //
