translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: zhing du bres pa ma brtags pa ma yin /
analyzed: zhing du bres pa ma brtags pa ma yin /
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: lham gyi bol 'bring bus chu zheng du bres pa bgo dbang de mdun dang rting bar rim pa can bcang /
analyzed: lham gyi bol 'bring bus chu zheng du bres pa bgo dbang de mdun dang rting bar rim pa can bcang /
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: lham sor mo'i steng g-yogs pa dang rting pa ko ba 'khyud pa ni bya rgod kyi phung po la 'dzeg pa'i tshe gyen bu la 'gro ba'i tshe mi 'byin pa dang thur bu la mi snad pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽@268a * // la la'i chu las skyes pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: lham sor mo'i steng g-yogs pa dang rting pa ko ba 'khyud pa ni bya rgod kyi phung po la 'dzeg pa'i tshe gyen bu la 'gro ba'i tshe mi 'byin pa dang thur bu la mi snad pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽@268a * // la la'i chu las skyes pa'i yang ngo //
translated: Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.🔽Do not wear shoes that make a sound like this.

original: sbrul yan man du song ba'i mchil ma dang kha chus sam rtsva la reg pa la rkang pa la reg na gdug par 'gyur ba'i phyir bol can gyi lham bcangs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: sbrul yan man du song ba'i mchil ma dang kha chus sam rtsva la reg pa la rkang pa la reg na gdug par 'gyur ba'i phyir bol can gyi lham bcangs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one touches the saliva or the excrement of a snake, or if one touches the grass which it has touched, or if one touches the foot of one who has touched it, one becomes poisoned. Therefore, it is not a transgression to carry a shoe with a heel.

original: lham yu rdum yang ngo //
analyzed: lham yu rdum yang ngo //
translated: Shoes with upturned toes are also permitted.

original: lham yu rdum gyon du dbang ngo ;🔽/ chab brom du 'gyur ba'i yul du zhva dang yu rings kyang ngo /
analyzed: lham yu rdum gyon du dbang ngo ; / chab brom du 'gyur ba'i yul du zhva dang yu rings kyang ngo /
translated: One is permitted to wear shoes with upturned toes.🔽In countries where there are many thorns, shoes with heels and long toes are also permitted.

original: yul lhag pa che ste chab brom yod pa'i yul du zhva dang lham yu rings bgor gnang ngo //
analyzed: yul lhag pa che ste chab brom yod pa'i yul du zhva dang lham yu rings bgor gnang ngo //
translated: In countries where there are many thorns, shoes with heels and long toes are permitted.

original: dge slong ma yul gyi dbus su na na zhva dang lham dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma yul gyi dbus su na na zhva dang lham dbang ngo //
translated: In the middle countries, nuns are permitted to wear shoes.

original: mtha' 'khob chab brom yod pa'i yul du ni zhva dang lham gyon du dbang /🔽mchod pa'i drung du lham bgos te mi spyad /
analyzed: mtha' 'khob chab brom yod pa'i yul du ni zhva dang lham gyon du dbang / mchod pa'i drung du lham bgos te mi spyad /
translated: In the border countries where there are many thorns, shoes are permitted.🔽One should not walk about in the presence of the Three Jewels, the preceptor, or the master wearing shoes.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang mkhan po dang slob dpon lnga la phyag 'tshal zhing mchod pa'i tshe gan du lham gyon te mi 'gro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang mkhan po dang slob dpon lnga la phyag 'tshal zhing mchod pa'i tshe gan du lham gyon te mi 'gro //
translated: One should not go in the presence of the Three Jewels, the preceptor, or the master wearing shoes.

original: seng ge dang stag dang gzig dang ba glang cang shes kyi yan lag las cung zad kyang lus la mi thogs /
analyzed: seng ge dang stag dang gzig dang ba glang cang shes kyi yan lag las cung zad kyang lus la mi thogs /
translated: Do not wear on your body even the slightest part of a lion, tiger, leopard, or kṣatriṇa’s🔽limbs.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi pags pa dang so dang rus pa dang sder mo la sogs pa lus la bgo ba'am lham la brgyan par mi bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi pags pa dang so dang rus pa dang sder mo la sogs pa lus la bgo ba'am lham la brgyan par mi bya /
translated: Do not wear the skin, teeth, bones, claws, and so forth of those mentioned by name as ornaments on your body or shoes.

original: ba glang phal dang rta ma rung ba dang de las gzhan ri dags khra bo dag kyang chud do //
analyzed: ba glang phal dang rta ma rung ba dang de las gzhan ri dags khra bo dag kyang chud do //
translated: Also include ordinary cows, bad horses, and other spotted animals.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang mdo steng ma dang 'dra bar bgo ba dang spyad cing gdags par mi bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang mdo steng ma dang 'dra bar bgo ba dang spyad cing gdags par mi bya /
translated: Also, like the previous sūtra, do not wear, use, or display those mentioned by name.

original: lham mi sprug / lham rdul can la la brdabs pa'am nang mi drud mi brdab /
analyzed: lham mi sprug / lham rdul can la la brdabs pa'am nang mi drud mi brdab /
translated: Do not beat your shoes. Do not beat or drag your dusty shoes inside.

original: ras ma la chus brlan te 'di la rdul dbyung ba'i phyir bcangs ltag ma ltar rdul can mi brdeb par ras ma la chus brlan te lham phyi zhing 'dar ba'i phyir ras ma des phyis kyang dgos pa'i phyir sbas te gzhag / de btsem /
analyzed: ras ma la chus brlan te 'di la rdul dbyung ba'i phyir bcangs ltag ma ltar rdul can mi brdeb par ras ma la chus brlan te lham phyi zhing 'dar ba'i phyir ras ma des phyis kyang dgos pa'i phyir sbas te gzhag / de btsem /
translated: In order to remove dust from the leather, it is moistened with water and then dried in the sun. In order to clean the leather, it is moistened with water and then wiped with a cloth. In order to keep the leather from drying out, it is hidden away.

original: lham ral na btsem ste thabs 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: lham ral na btsem ste thabs 'og nas 'chad /
translated: If the sandals are torn, they are sewn.

original: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po byed na phyogs dben par ro //
analyzed: mi mdzes pa'i dngos po byed na phyogs dben par ro //
translated: If one is going to do something that is not attractive, one should do it in a secluded place.

original: lham btsem pa mi mang pos mi mthong ba'i phyir lkog dben par ro //
analyzed: lham btsem pa mi mang pos mi mthong ba'i phyir lkog dben par ro //
translated: If one is going to sew sandals, one should do it in a secluded place where many people will not see it.

original: de'i phyir bsnyung bu dang gla rgyun bcangs yan man yul rgyu ba'am gnas na 'dug pa 'ang rung lham ral na btsem pa'i phyir gla rgyun dang bsnyung bu bcang bzo gri ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsnyung bu dang gla rgyun bcangs yan man yul rgyu ba'am gnas na 'dug pa 'ang rung lham ral na btsem pa'i phyir gla rgyun dang bsnyung bu bcang bzo gri ma yin /
translated: Therefore, whether one is traveling in the country or staying in one place, if the sandals are torn, one should sew them in order to keep the needles and thread.

original: bzo gri ltag dgye dge slong gis mi bcang /
analyzed: bzo gri ltag dgye dge slong gis mi bcang /
translated: A monk should not carry a sewing kit.

original: shing lham mi gon /
analyzed: shing lham mi gon /
translated: He should not wear wooden shoes.

original: dge slong shing lham gyon du mi gnang ste gnang ba'i skabs 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: dge slong shing lham gyon du mi gnang ste gnang ba'i skabs 'og nas 'chad /
translated: It is not permitted for a monk to wear wooden shoes. The occasion for wearing them will be explained later.

original: grong mi gtsang ba'i @268b gnas las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: grong mi gtsang ba'i @268b gnas las gzhan du'o //
translated: In a place other than a village or an impure place.

original: grong bar du 'dam yod par grong du zhag lon pa la khyim pas mal stan bsrung ba'i phyir lham gyon cig ces bgo ba dang / bshang sa che chung du 'gro ba'i tshe gyon du dbang /
analyzed: grong bar du 'dam yod par grong du zhag lon pa la khyim pas mal stan bsrung ba'i phyir lham gyon cig ces bgo ba dang / bshang sa che chung du 'gro ba'i tshe gyon du dbang /
translated: If there is mud in the village, one should put on shoes in the village when staying overnight, in order to protect the bedding of the householder.

original: smyig ma'i lo ma dang mun dza dang si ri dang 'dar ba las ma yin /
analyzed: smyig ma'i lo ma dang mun dza dang si ri dang 'dar ba las ma yin /
translated: One should not wear shoes made of bamboo leaves, muñja grass, siri trees, or bark.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi rgyu las lham byas te mi bgo / skud pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi rgyu las lham byas te mi bgo / skud pa'i yang ngo //
translated: One should not wear shoes made of these named materials, nor of their thread.

original: rtsva las skud par bkal ba'i ltam mi bgo / trag yod na ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsva las skud par bkal ba'i ltam mi bgo / trag yod na ma yin no //
translated: One should not wear shoes made of grass thread, nor if there is a mat.

original: trag can gyis gong ma ming gis smos pa rnams kyis rtsva las lham byas te gyon du gnang ba ni trag can gyi cho ga bya ba'i phyir dro bar rkang pa dang bcas te gzhug pa'i phyir gnang ngo //
analyzed: trag can gyis gong ma ming gis smos pa rnams kyis rtsva las lham byas te gyon du gnang ba ni trag can gyi cho ga bya ba'i phyir dro bar rkang pa dang bcas te gzhug pa'i phyir gnang ngo //
translated: If one has a mat, one is allowed to wear shoes made of grass by the named materials above, in order to warm the feet and enter with them, for the sake of the ritual of the mat.

original: grong du gzhan med na pags pa la 'dug / grong du spyan drangs te pags pa stan du bting na stan gzhan med dam zhes smros te stan gzhan med ces zer na pags stan la 'dug kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: grong du gzhan med na pags pa la 'dug / grong du spyan drangs te pags pa stan du bting na stan gzhan med dam zhes smros te stan gzhan med ces zer na pags stan la 'dug kyang nyes med do //
translated: If he is invited to the village and the skin is spread out as a seat, then if there is no other seat, he should say, “Is there no other seat?” If he says there is no other seat, then there is no fault in sitting on the skin seat.

original: der yang de la 'di lta bu'i rkyen yang mi 'dug gtsug lag khang na ni rkyen yod kyang pags stan la 'dug pa'am nyal du dbang /
analyzed: der yang de la 'di lta bu'i rkyen yang mi 'dug gtsug lag khang na ni rkyen yod kyang pags stan la 'dug pa'am nyal du dbang /
translated: If there is no such condition there, but there is a condition in the monastery, then he should not sit or lie on the skin seat.

original: mig gi phyir dom lpags bcang /
analyzed: mig gi phyir dom lpags bcang /
translated: He may carry the bear skin for the sake of his eyes.

original: mig la phan pa'i phyir dom lpags bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽rkang pa'i gnas su gding /
analyzed: mig la phan pa'i phyir dom lpags bcangs kyang nyes med / rkang pa'i gnas su gding /
translated: He may carry the bear skin for the sake of his eyes, but there is no fault.🔽He should spread it out as a foot mat.

original: ltag ma ltar bcang ba ni stan dang rkang pa phyi bar bya /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bcang ba ni stan dang rkang pa phyi bar bya /
translated: He should carry it like a turban, using it as a seat and for cleaning his feet.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni dri gtsang khang gi sgor ro //
translated: The Buddha’s is at the door of the Fragrant Chamber.

original: sangs rgyas la dom lpags yon du phul na dri gtsang khang gi sgor bzhag ste yan man du dong ba'i mig la phan pa'i rkang pa phyis te 'gro / lham bol med bgo / dom lpags kyi lham mig la phan pa'i phyir bgos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dom lpags yon du phul na dri gtsang khang gi sgor bzhag ste yan man du dong ba'i mig la phan pa'i rkang pa phyis te 'gro / lham bol med bgo / dom lpags kyi lham mig la phan pa'i phyir bgos kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to wear shoes made of bear skin to protect the eyes.

original: rlung gis ni 'dug cing nyal /
analyzed: rlung gis ni 'dug cing nyal /
translated: One may sit or lie down in the wind.

original: rlung nang can dom lpags kyi steng nyal lam 'dug kyang phan pa'i phyir dbang ngo //
analyzed: rlung nang can dom lpags kyi steng nyal lam 'dug kyang phan pa'i phyir dbang ngo //
translated: It is permissible to lie or sit on a bear skin in the wind to protect one’s health.

original: mkhyen pas brtags pa thams cad la 'di mkho /
analyzed: mkhyen pas brtags pa thams cad la 'di mkho /
translated: This is necessary for all investigations by the wise.

original: dom lpags kyi steng na 'dug na mkhyen pas brtags pa bad kan byung bar phan pa'i phyir bcang /
analyzed: dom lpags kyi steng na 'dug na mkhyen pas brtags pa bad kan byung bar phan pa'i phyir bcang /
translated: If one sits on a bear skin, the wise should carry it to protect against the arising of phlegm.

original: spus reg na phan par shes par bya /
analyzed: spus reg na phan par shes par bya /
translated: One should know that touching the fur is beneficial.

original: ltag ma ltar dom lpags bcangs pa ni sha la reg pa ni ma yin gyi spu la reg pa ni phan /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar dom lpags bcangs pa ni sha la reg pa ni ma yin gyi spu la reg pa ni phan /
translated: One should carry a bear skin like a pillow, not touching the flesh, but touching the fur is beneficial.

original: lham bol med rim pa mang po na yang ngo //
analyzed: lham bol med rim pa mang po na yang ngo //
translated: One should not wear shoes without felt soles, even if one has many layers of clothing.

original: lham bol med ko ba rim pa mang du byas kyang rkang pa 'byar ba'i rim gcig / dom lpags spu yang bstan te byas na rim pa mang yang nyes med /
analyzed: lham bol med ko ba rim pa mang du byas kyang rkang pa 'byar ba'i rim gcig / dom lpags spu yang bstan te byas na rim pa mang yang nyes med /
translated: If one makes a bear skin with the fur showing, there is no fault even if there are many layers.

original: mdo 'og ma'i ti ka'o //🔽du ma'i steng du gcig bzhag @269a * //
analyzed: mdo 'og ma'i ti ka'o // du ma'i steng du gcig bzhag @269a * //
translated: This is the tika of the lower Sutra.

original: na yang ngo //
analyzed: na yang ngo //
translated: If one puts one on top of many, it is also so.

original: dom lpags 'ba' zhig las lham rim pa mang po zhig byas te gyon kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dom lpags 'ba' zhig las lham rim pa mang po zhig byas te gyon kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one makes many layers of shoes from only a bear skin and wears them, there is no fault.

original: mdo steng ma'i ti ka'o //
analyzed: mdo steng ma'i ti ka'o //
translated: This is the tika of the upper Sutra.

original: aa sma ba randa ka las gzhan du mi bcang /
analyzed: aa sma ba randa ka las gzhan du mi bcang /
translated: One should not carry anything other than an asmabhaṇḍa.

original: yul aa sma ba randa ka zhes bya ba ni stag gzig la sogs pa ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad pags pa bcang du dbang ngo //
analyzed: yul aa sma ba randa ka zhes bya ba ni stag gzig la sogs pa ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad pags pa bcang du dbang ngo //
translated: In the country called asmabhaṇḍa, one is allowed to carry the skins of all animals except tigers, leopards, and so forth.

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i yang ma yin /
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i yang ma yin /
translated: Also not of lions and so forth.

original: yul aa sma pa randa ka na seng ge dang stag dang gzig gi pags pa gyon du mi dbang /
analyzed: yul aa sma pa randa ka na seng ge dang stag dang gzig gi pags pa gyon du mi dbang /
translated: In the country of asmabhaṇḍa, one is not allowed to wear the skins of lions, tigers, and leopards.

original: rgyus pa dang rus pa dang so dang sha dang tshil dag kyang gang gi pags pa ma brtags pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: rgyus pa dang rus pa dang so dang sha dang tshil dag kyang gang gi pags pa ma brtags pa de'i 'o //
translated: Also the sinews, bones, teeth, flesh, and fat of those whose skins are not examined.

original: ltag ma ltar pags pa bcad du mi gnang ba rnams kyi ming gis smos pa 'di rnams mi bcang /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar pags pa bcad du mi gnang ba rnams kyi ming gis smos pa 'di rnams mi bcang /
translated: It is not permitted to wear any of the following, which are named here, unless they are made from the skin of a dead animal.

original: rkyal pa bcang /
analyzed: rkyal pa bcang /
translated: You may carry a float.

original: rgyal pa bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: rgyal pa bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: Even if you carry a royal float, there is no fault.

original: ngur smrig gam sngon por yang ngo //
analyzed: ngur smrig gam sngon por yang ngo //
translated: It may be either saffron-colored or blue.

original: rkyal pa'i kha dog 'di 'dra bar bya /
analyzed: rkyal pa'i kha dog 'di 'dra bar bya /
translated: The float should be this color.

original: ri mo dang ri mor nye ba ma yin /
analyzed: ri mo dang ri mor nye ba ma yin /
translated: It should not have pictures or anything similar to pictures.

original: rkyal pa ri mo can mi bcang /
analyzed: rkyal pa ri mo can mi bcang /
translated: Do not carry a float with pictures.

original: rgyal mi shes pa thams cad ma sbyangs par chu zab mor mi 'jug / bdag rkyal mi shes par gru'am gzings sam shing leb lta bu'i thabs ma sbyar bar chu chen por mi 'jug / dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal bslab /
analyzed: rgyal mi shes pa thams cad ma sbyangs par chu zab mor mi 'jug / bdag rkyal mi shes par gru'am gzings sam shing leb lta bu'i thabs ma sbyar bar chu chen por mi 'jug / dben pa'i phyogs su rkyal bslab /
translated: Do not enter deep water without a means of support, such as a boat, a raft, or a plank, unless you are a trained swimmer who knows the water well.🔽Train in swimming in a secluded place.

original: dge slong dben par rkyal slobs shig / gting zab la glang po ma gtogs te ba las mi 'jug chu chen po la ba 'a ma glang bu ma gtogs par glang po chen po'i mjug ma la 'jus te 'gro pa'i mjug ma la 'jus na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong dben par rkyal slobs shig / gting zab la glang po ma gtogs te ba las mi 'jug chu chen po la ba 'a ma glang bu ma gtogs par glang po chen po'i mjug ma la 'jus te 'gro pa'i mjug ma la 'jus na nyes byas /
translated: Train in swimming in a secluded place, but do not enter deep water unless you are an elephant.

original: glang bu la 'jus na stobs chung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: glang bu la 'jus na stobs chung ba'i phyir /
translated: If he holds on to a calf, he will be weak.

original: 'ju ba ni ba glang dang rta dang ma he dang g-yag las so //
analyzed: 'ju ba ni ba glang dang rta dang ma he dang g-yag las so //
translated: He should hold on to a cow, a horse, a buffalo, or a yak.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ma yin pa'i mjug ma la mi 'ju /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ma yin pa'i mjug ma la mi 'ju /
translated: He should not hold on to the tail of any of these animals, except as mentioned.

original: pags pa'i dngos po'o /
analyzed: pags pa'i dngos po'o /
translated: It is the nature of the skin.

original: // /'di man chad sman dpyad la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'di man chad sman dpyad la 'chad de /
translated: From here on, it explains medical treatment.

original: sman spyad / dge slong nad pas sman bza' bar spyad pa dang dge ba'i bar chad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir spyad do //
analyzed: sman spyad / dge slong nad pas sman bza' bar spyad pa dang dge ba'i bar chad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir spyad do //
translated: A monk who is sick should use medicine and practice in order to avoid obstacles to virtue.

original: 'di la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of this.

original: zas kyi sman rnam pa bzhi la skad cig pa dang phyi dro ba dang zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig pa'o //🔽skad cig pa ni skya rengs byung nas dro'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zas kyi sman rnam pa bzhi la skad cig pa dang phyi dro ba dang zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig pa'o // skad cig pa ni skya rengs byung nas dro'i bar du'o //
translated: The four types of medicinal food are momentary, afternoon, seven-day, and lifetime.🔽The momentary is from sunrise to noon.

original: thun gyi skya rengs byung nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du 'o //
analyzed: thun gyi skya rengs byung nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du 'o //
translated: The afternoon is from the afternoon sunrise to sunset.

original: zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig pa ni dngos su zad do //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig pa ni dngos su zad do //
translated: The seven-day and lifetime are actually exhausted.

original: nad pa la dang po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa la dang po ma yin pa'o //
translated: For the sick, it is not the first.

original: skad cig pa'i zas ni na ba dang mi na ba dang @269b mi na ba 'dra ste bzar rung ste nad pas zas zhag tu bzhag ni mi dbang /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i zas ni na ba dang mi na ba dang @269b mi na ba 'dra ste bzar rung ste nad pas zas zhag tu bzhag ni mi dbang /
translated: The momentary foods are suitable to be eaten by the sick, the healthy and those like the healthy. The sick are not allowed to keep food for a day.

original: gzhan gsum ni nad pas bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: gzhan gsum ni nad pas bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: The other three are without fault if kept by the sick.

original: tsho tsa dang mo tsa ta ko la dang ka shud ta'i dang au dum ba'i ra dang pa ru sha ka dang rgun 'brum dang kha zu ra'i chu ni thams cad la'o //
analyzed: tsho tsa dang mo tsa ta ko la dang ka shud ta'i dang au dum ba'i ra dang pa ru sha ka dang rgun 'brum dang kha zu ra'i chu ni thams cad la'o //
translated: The juice of the tsotsa, mo tsa, takola, kashoda, udumbara, parusha, grapes and kashmari is for all.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu'i khu ba pa btsags te na ba'ang rung mi na'ang rung btsags te 'thung du dbang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu'i khu ba pa btsags te na ba'ang rung mi na'ang rung btsags te 'thung du dbang ngo //
translated: The juice of the fruits mentioned by name is allowed to be drunk by the sick or the healthy if it is strained.

original: snga dro'ang 'thung du dbang ngo //
analyzed: snga dro'ang 'thung du dbang ngo //
translated: It is also allowed to drink it in the morning.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu'i tsha dang / tshva dang zho khu dang tshur khu dang rtsva ba mo dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu'i tsha dang / tshva dang zho khu dang tshur khu dang rtsva ba mo dag go //
translated: Likewise, the juice of the fruit, the juice of the grain, the juice of curd and the juice of molasses and the juice of fresh grass.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams btsags te na'ang rung min 'ang rung phyi dro'ang 'thung du dbang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams btsags te na'ang rung min 'ang rung phyi dro'ang 'thung du dbang ngo //
translated: The juice of these mentioned by name is allowed to be drunk by the sick or the healthy if it is strained, even in the afternoon.

original: 'di rnams chus brtags dgos so //
analyzed: 'di rnams chus brtags dgos so //
translated: These must be strained with water.

original: chu dbye snam bur btsags te dang ba bzhin snang ba shar ba de'i kha dog lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu dbye snam bur btsags te dang ba bzhin snang ba shar ba de'i kha dog lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the color of the appearance of clarity when water is filtered and strained.

original: mdo ltag ma'i btung ba rnams tshags su btsags te dang par byas la bzhin snang la chus brtags la btung du dbang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i btung ba rnams tshags su btsags te dang par byas la bzhin snang la chus brtags la btung du dbang ngo //
translated: One should filter and strain the water for drinking from the upper part of the river, and make it clear. One should then examine it with water and drink it.

original: de'i phyir sngon du bsnyen par rdzogs par reg pa mi rigs te mtshan mtshungs pas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon du bsnyen par rdzogs par reg pa mi rigs te mtshan mtshungs pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to drink water that has not been filtered and strained by a fully ordained monk, because the characteristics are the same.

original: mdo lhag ma ltar btung ba rnam pa bcu gsum snga dro dge slong bdag gis btsir zhing btsags na btung du rung /
analyzed: mdo lhag ma ltar btung ba rnam pa bcu gsum snga dro dge slong bdag gis btsir zhing btsags na btung du rung /
translated: As for the remaining water, if a monk filters and strains the thirteen types of water in the morning, it is suitable to drink.

original: phyi dro ni byin len byas kyang dge slong gis btsir zhing btsags kyang 'thung du mi dbang gi / dge sbyong ngam khyim pa zhig gis btsir btsags la chus brtags te byin len byas nas 'thungs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: phyi dro ni byin len byas kyang dge slong gis btsir zhing btsags kyang 'thung du mi dbang gi / dge sbyong ngam khyim pa zhig gis btsir btsags la chus brtags te byin len byas nas 'thungs pa ni nyes med /
translated: In the afternoon, even if it has been consecrated, a monk is not permitted to drink it if he has not filtered and strained it. However, if a renunciant or a layperson filters and strains it, examines it with water, and consecrates it, it is permissible to drink it.

original: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo //
analyzed: aa ru ra la sogs pa lnga yang ngo //
translated: The five, such as myrobalan, are also like this.

original: aa ru ra dang re'u ra dang aa ma li dang / pi pi ling dang na le sham dang lnga ni dge slong na'ang rung snga dro 'ang rung zar dbang ngo //
analyzed: aa ru ra dang re'u ra dang aa ma li dang / pi pi ling dang na le sham dang lnga ni dge slong na'ang rung snga dro 'ang rung zar dbang ngo //
translated: The five, namely, the myrobalan fruit, the fruit of the tree Feronia elephantum, the fruit of the tree Tamarindus indica, long pepper, and ginger, are permitted to the monk, even if he is not sick, even if it is before noon.

original: bu ram yang ngo //
analyzed: bu ram yang ngo //
translated: Also molasses.

original: bu ram dang kha ra phyi dro'ang bzar rung /
analyzed: bu ram dang kha ra phyi dro'ang bzar rung /
translated: Molasses and sugar are permitted in the afternoon.

original: bu ram dang kha ra chus byas te btung du 'ang dbang /
analyzed: bu ram dang kha ra chus byas te btung du 'ang dbang /
translated: Molasses and sugar are permitted to be drunk as a beverage.

original: 'di bsngos pa las bza' ba nad pa bzhin pa ni lam pa dang rdzas 'tsho dang las sar pa pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di bsngos pa las bza' ba nad pa bzhin pa ni lam pa dang rdzas 'tsho dang las sar pa pa yang ngo //
translated: These are permitted to be eaten by the sick, by those traveling, by those who are caring for the sick, and by those who are on a journey.🔽Medicines that are permitted for seven days are permitted to be eaten by the sick, and also by others.

original: sman zhag bdun du bsngos te bzhag pa nad pa bdag kyang bza' grogs po gzhan yang bzar rung ba bzhin du lam ring po nas ngal chad de 'ongs pa dang / dge 'dun gyi mal stan rdzi la sogs pa dang gtsug lag khang gsar du brtsig par bsko ba'i dge slong dang 'di rnams bzar dbang ngo //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun du bsngos te bzhag pa nad pa bdag kyang bza' grogs po gzhan yang bzar rung ba bzhin du lam ring po nas ngal chad de 'ongs pa dang / dge 'dun gyi mal stan rdzi la sogs pa dang gtsug lag khang gsar du brtsig par bsko ba'i dge slong dang 'di rnams bzar dbang ngo //
translated: These are permitted to be eaten by those who have come from a long journey and are exhausted, by those who are assigned to care for the bedding and seats of the saṅgha, and by those monks who are assigned to build a new temple.

original: zan bcad pas dus ma yin ba'i 'di @270a * //
analyzed: zan bcad pas dus ma yin ba'i 'di @270a * //
translated: If one is fasting, these are permitted at the wrong time.

original: bza'/ dge slong dro yol te zan ma zos pa'ang /
analyzed: bza'/ dge slong dro yol te zan ma zos pa'ang /
translated: Food:

original: sman zhag bdun pa bzar rung /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa bzar rung /
translated: Even if a monk has eaten his main meal, he may eat the seven types of post-midday tonics.

original: skom ni thun du'o //
analyzed: skom ni thun du'o //
translated: Drinks:

original: phyi dro btung du dbang ba rnams nang par nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du btung du rung ba las bya /
analyzed: phyi dro btung du dbang ba rnams nang par nas nyi ma nub kyi bar du btung du rung ba las bya /
translated: Drinks that are permitted after midday may be drunk from the morning until sunset.🔽The first type of drink is clear and not turbid.

original: dang po'o // thun btung ba'i skom de rnyog ma can ma yin pa dang ba la bya /🔽der ma reg pa'i rdzas te 'on te dus kyi ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas mnye zhing snam bur btsag / ltag tu phyi dro btung ba rnam pa brgyad snga dro dge slong gis byin len blangs te snga dro bdag gis mnyes te btung du rung ba dang
analyzed: dang po'o // thun btung ba'i skom de rnyog ma can ma yin pa dang ba la bya / der ma reg pa'i rdzas te 'on te dus kyi ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas mnye zhing snam bur btsag / ltag tu phyi dro btung ba rnam pa brgyad snga dro dge slong gis byin len blangs te snga dro bdag gis mnyes te btung du rung ba dang
translated: The second type of drink is not one that has been stored by a layperson who is not fully ordained.🔽The third type of drink is not one that has been stored by a fully ordained monk.🔽The fourth type of drink is not one that has been stored by a layperson who is not fully ordained and then prepared by a fully ordained monk.🔽The fifth type of drink is not one that has been stored by a fully ordained monk and then prepared by a layperson who is not fully ordained.🔽The sixth type of drink is not one that has been stored by a layperson who is not fully ordained and then prepared by a fully ordained monk, and then stored again by the layperson.🔽The seventh type of drink is not one that has been stored by a fully ordained monk and then prepared by a layperson who is not fully ordained, and then stored again by the monk.🔽The eighth type of drink is not one that has been stored by a layperson who is not fully ordained and then prepared by a fully ordained monk, and then stored again by the layperson, and then prepared again by the monk.

original: phyi dro dge slong gis mnye zhing btsag tu mi rung zhing dge slong gis btsags shing byin len bya ba de bzhin du rnam pa brgyad po 'di la ma gtogs par sho gam la sogs pa gzhan yang brtsi /
analyzed: phyi dro dge slong gis mnye zhing btsag tu mi rung zhing dge slong gis btsags shing byin len bya ba de bzhin du rnam pa brgyad po 'di la ma gtogs par sho gam la sogs pa gzhan yang brtsi /
translated: The same applies to other types of drinks, such as those that are subject to customs duties.

original: 'og 'di dang 'dra /
analyzed: 'og 'di dang 'dra /
translated: The following is similar to the above.

original: bal po se'u dang pi zang su ra ga la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan yang 'dir ro //
analyzed: bal po se'u dang pi zang su ra ga la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan yang 'dir ro //
translated: Other substances such as pomegranate, peach, and so on are also like this.

original: 'di rnams kyang ltag tu brgyad ming gis smos pa'i brtsi 'og dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang ltag tu brgyad ming gis smos pa'i brtsi 'og dang 'dra ste /
translated: These are also like the eight mentioned above, which are not to be counted as medicine.

original: phyi dro dge slong gis btsag cing las byar mi rung ste dge sbyong gis bya /
analyzed: phyi dro dge slong gis btsag cing las byar mi rung ste dge sbyong gis bya /
translated: In the afternoon, it is not suitable for a fully ordained monk to cook or do work; a trainee should do it.

original: dus kyir na thun gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: dus kyir na thun gyi mthar ro //
translated: If it is medicine, it is at the end of the period.

original: lag tu rnam brgyad dang bal po se'u la sogs pa dro zos nas dmar thag ma chad tshun chad du dge sbyong gis mnyes btsags te ngo snang na dge slong 'thung du dbang ngo //
analyzed: lag tu rnam brgyad dang bal po se'u la sogs pa dro zos nas dmar thag ma chad tshun chad du dge sbyong gis mnyes btsags te ngo snang na dge slong 'thung du dbang ngo //
translated: If one eats warm food such as pomegranate in the hand, the trainee should grind it and if it is clear, the fully ordained monk is allowed to drink it before sunset.

original: dmar thag gi mtshams 'das te 'thung du mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dmar thag gi mtshams 'das te 'thung du mi dbang ngo //
translated: After sunset, he is not allowed to drink it.

original: gzhan yang de'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'o //
translated: It is also like that.

original: zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig gi sngags kyis brtags pa las skom du byas na'ang dmar thag ma chad tshun chad 'thung du rung /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang tshe gcig gi sngags kyis brtags pa las skom du byas na'ang dmar thag ma chad tshun chad 'thung du rung /
translated: If one drinks it after examining it with the mantra of seven days or for life, it is also suitable to drink it before sunset.

original: de ma gyur na steng gar du gyur na'ang der ro zhes 'ga' las so //
analyzed: de ma gyur na steng gar du gyur na'ang der ro zhes 'ga' las so //
translated: If it does not change, if it changes to the color of the sky, it is suitable to drink it.

original: skom du btung ba nyug por sbyar ba las skyur por gyur pa dang / dang bar byas pa las rnyog ma can du 'gyur ba thun ma 'das kyang btung du rung ngo zhes 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: skom du btung ba nyug por sbyar ba las skyur por gyur pa dang / dang bar byas pa las rnyog ma can du 'gyur ba thun ma 'das kyang btung du rung ngo zhes 'og nas 'chad /
translated: Some say: It is suitable to drink water that has become sour from being boiled too long, or that has become turbid from being stirred, or that has become sweet from being boiled too long, even though the period has not passed.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re skom btung ba'i rnams la da ltar ra mi ro 'ang de'u re ra ro bar 'gyur ba dang da ltar dang yang de'u re rnyog ma can du 'gyur ba dang / da ltar mngar kyang de 'u re skyur por 'gyur bas btung du mi rung zhes bshad /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re skom btung ba'i rnams la da ltar ra mi ro 'ang de'u re ra ro bar 'gyur ba dang da ltar dang yang de'u re rnyog ma can du 'gyur ba dang / da ltar mngar kyang de 'u re skyur por 'gyur bas btung du mi rung zhes bshad /
translated: Some say: It is not suitable to drink water that has become sour, turbid or sweet because it will become sour, turbid or sweet again.

original: de mi bzang ste dus las 'das par gnas na ni mi skye ba thob de yang 'ong ba na phal gyis mi chud pa'i phyir mi bsngos par 'thob @270b pas so //
analyzed: de mi bzang ste dus las 'das par gnas na ni mi skye ba thob de yang 'ong ba na phal gyis mi chud pa'i phyir mi bsngos par 'thob @270b pas so //
translated: That is not good, because if it does not arise again, it is obtained through obtaining the state of an arhat and it is obtained without being dedicated because it is not understood by ordinary beings.

original: ltag tu mngar po las skyur por gyur pa dangs ba las rnyog por 'gyur ba dang ra mi ro ba las ra ro bar gyur na thun pa 'das kyang btud du mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i gzhung btsan par byas te gzung gi ltag tu mkhan po'i
analyzed: ltag tu mngar po las skyur por gyur pa dangs ba las rnyog por 'gyur ba dang ra mi ro ba las ra ro bar gyur na thun pa 'das kyang btud du mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ba de'i gzhung btsan par byas te gzung gi ltag tu mkhan po'i
translated: If the taste changes from sweet to sour, clear to turbid or raw to rotten, it is unsuitable to drink it even if the session has not passed.

original: tshig phyis 'gyur zhes zer ba mi btsan te de'i tshig mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: tshig phyis 'gyur zhes zer ba mi btsan te de'i tshig mi gzung ngo //
translated: The words of the master are not authoritative.

original: 'dir ro zhugs pa'i phyir phye ba'i skom bu ram shing dang rgun 'brum la sogs pa chu ma blugs kyang khu ba rang 'byung bas thun ma 'das tshun chad btsags te 'thung du rung phye ma'i skom yang btung du rung ste gang yin pa ni sga dang pi
analyzed: 'dir ro zhugs pa'i phyir phye ba'i skom bu ram shing dang rgun 'brum la sogs pa chu ma blugs kyang khu ba rang 'byung bas thun ma 'das tshun chad btsags te 'thung du rung phye ma'i skom yang btung du rung ste gang yin pa ni sga dang pi
translated: Here, because it is infused with alcohol, if the sugar cane, grape and so on that is the basis of the alcohol is not mixed with water, the juice naturally arises and it is suitable to drink it after straining it within the session. Also, it is suitable to drink a powdered drink.

original: pi ling la sogs pa bur mar byas te glum gyi rlangs pa la bdugs te ro yod pa dang chu dang bsres te thun gyi bar du btung du dbang /
analyzed: pi ling la sogs pa bur mar byas te glum gyi rlangs pa la bdugs te ro yod pa dang chu dang bsres te thun gyi bar du btung du dbang /
translated: What is that? It is a drink made from sugar cane, pippali and so on, which is steamed with the vapor of barley and mixed with water and alcohol.

original: so bi ra'i yang dang ngo //
analyzed: so bi ra'i yang dang ngo //
translated: It is also suitable to drink a drink made from the root of the plant called sobira.

original: so bi ra gang yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad de /
analyzed: so bi ra gang yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad de /
translated: What is Sobhiṣa? It will be explained below.

original: so bi ras brla na pa'i khu ba 'ang btung du rung /
analyzed: so bi ras brla na pa'i khu ba 'ang btung du rung /
translated: The juice of Sobhiṣa is also suitable to drink.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sman brnyan nas skyur na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sman brnyan nas skyur na'o //
translated: This is the sour fruit medicine and so on.

original: so bi ra zhes bya ba ni chu ba ti da ma ti la sogs pa 'bras bu dang me tog las skyur ba gang yang rung ste chu bar sbyar na thun gyi bar du btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: so bi ra zhes bya ba ni chu ba ti da ma ti la sogs pa 'bras bu dang me tog las skyur ba gang yang rung ste chu bar sbyar na thun gyi bar du btung du rung ngo //
translated: What is called Sobhiṣa is any sour fruit or flower such as the fruit of the tree called Chubawa Damati, which is suitable to drink in the morning and evening when mixed with Chubawa.

original: 'di man chad ni skad cig ma dang thun gyi bar du chu las bshad /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni skad cig ma dang thun gyi bar du chu las bshad /
translated: From here on, it explains water for the duration of an instant and a session.

original: mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram ni zhag bdun pa'i /
analyzed: mar dang yungs mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram ni zhag bdun pa'i /
translated: Ghee, mustard oil, honey, and molasses are for seven days.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni zhag bdun pa'i sman no //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni zhag bdun pa'i sman no //
translated: These mentioned by name are seven-day medicines.

original: khanda dang bu ram dang sha kha ra la sogs thams cad kyang bu ram du chud do //
analyzed: khanda dang bu ram dang sha kha ra la sogs thams cad kyang bu ram du chud do //
translated: All of them, such as Khanda, molasses, and sugar, are included in molasses.

original: 'di rnams kyang sman bu ram zhes bya ba'i nang du gtogs te zhag bdun du 'chang du dbang ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang sman bu ram zhes bya ba'i nang du gtogs te zhag bdun du 'chang du dbang ngo //
translated: These are also included in the medicine called molasses and are allowed to be kept for seven days.

original: mdo yang mar du chud do //
analyzed: mdo yang mar du chud do //
translated: The sutra is also included in ghee.

original: mtho ris kyi khams na 'dug pa zhig ste 'di yang mar du gtogs te zhag bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi khams na 'dug pa zhig ste 'di yang mar du gtogs te zhag bdun pa'o //
translated: It is the fat of a being living in the higher realms. This is also included in the seven-day rule.

original: yungs mar du tshil las bzhus te btsags pa'ang chud do //
analyzed: yungs mar du tshil las bzhus te btsags pa'ang chud do //
translated: Also, sesame oil is made by boiling and straining the fat of sheep.

original: tshil dang chu gnyis bsres te bskol nas chu ni skams tshil gyi khu ba lus pa chogs kyis btsags nas zhag bdun pa'i mar gyi gor bcad du rung /
analyzed: tshil dang chu gnyis bsres te bskol nas chu ni skams tshil gyi khu ba lus pa chogs kyis btsags nas zhag bdun pa'i mar gyi gor bcad du rung /
translated: The two, fat and water, are mixed and boiled. The water dries up and the fat remains. The fat is strained and can be kept for seven days as clarified butter.

original: nya dang sbal pa dang dom dang phag pa'i'o //
analyzed: nya dang sbal pa dang dom dang phag pa'i'o //
translated: The fat of fish, frogs, bears, and pigs.

original: 'di rnams kyi tshil btsags pa'ang mar gyi gor zhag bdun par bcang /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi tshil btsags pa'ang mar gyi gor zhag bdun par bcang /
translated: The fat of these is also strained and can be kept for seven days as clarified butter.

original: 'di rnams ni nad pa mang po la mkho bas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni nad pa mang po la mkho bas so //
translated: These are necessary for many sick people.

original: mdo ltag ma'i tshil rnams nad pa la dgos pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med /🔽sos nas nad pa'i phyir 'di @271a * //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i tshil rnams nad pa la dgos pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med / sos nas nad pa'i phyir 'di @271a * //
translated: The fat of the neck of a sheep can be kept without fault for the sake of a sick person.

original: rnams las slong na sbyin no //
analyzed: rnams las slong na sbyin no //
translated: If one recovers and then begs for it, it should be given.

original: tshil 'di rnams nad pa'i yo byad du byas te gsos nas lhag na nad pa gzhan la sbyin kyang nyes med /
analyzed: tshil 'di rnams nad pa'i yo byad du byas te gsos nas lhag na nad pa gzhan la sbyin kyang nyes med /
translated: If one makes these fats into medicine for a sick person and then recovers, it is not a fault to give the remainder to another sick person.

original: med na nad kyi gsos pa la'o //🔽bdag nad sos nas tshil gyi sman dge slong nad pa med na /
analyzed: med na nad kyi gsos pa la'o // bdag nad sos nas tshil gyi sman dge slong nad pa med na /
translated: If not, then to the healer of the sick.🔽If I recover from the illness, the fat medicine should be given to the sick monk.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du rub pa la gtad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du rub pa la gtad do //
translated: If there is no sick monk, it should be given to the assembly's medicine house.

original: gdus pa dang bskul ba yang ngo //
analyzed: gdus pa dang bskul ba yang ngo //
translated: It should also be given to those who are cooking and stirring.

original: 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pa lta bu lcags kyi gzhong /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog la sogs pa lta bu lcags kyi gzhong /
translated: Like fruits, flowers, etc., the iron bowl

original: kun du nad kyi cho ga bya ba dang / mig nag por bsku ba'i rtsi'ang nad sos nas dge slong nad pa la byin /
analyzed: kun du nad kyi cho ga bya ba dang / mig nag por bsku ba'i rtsi'ang nad sos nas dge slong nad pa la byin /
translated: and the ointment for blackening the eyes should be given to the sick monk after he recovers from the illness.

original: grogs nad pa med na sman khang du dbul /
analyzed: grogs nad pa med na sman khang du dbul /
translated: If there is no sick companion, it should be offered to the medicine house.

original: 'di yan chad zhag bdun pa'i sman bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yan chad zhag bdun pa'i sman bshad pa /
translated: Up to this point, the seven-day medicine is explained.

original: nam 'tsho bar du ba ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nam 'tsho bar du ba ni rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: For as long as one lives, the root, stem, leaf, flower, and fruit.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di lnga tshe gcig gi bar du bcang du dung ba'i sman yin te nad pas brtags te bcang du rung gnang ste 'og nas ming gis smos pa rnams yin zas kyi don du mi chog pa las so //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di lnga tshe gcig gi bar du bcang du dung ba'i sman yin te nad pas brtags te bcang du rung gnang ste 'og nas ming gis smos pa rnams yin zas kyi don du mi chog pa las so //
translated: These five mentioned by name are medicines that are allowed to be kept for life. The sick should examine and keep them. They are allowed below, but the named ones are not suitable for food purposes.

original: mdo ltag ma lta bur rnam pa lnga zas kyi gor mi chog pa ni tshe gcig gi bar du bcang du gnang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma lta bur rnam pa lnga zas kyi gor mi chog pa ni tshe gcig gi bar du bcang du gnang ngo //
translated: The five types of medicines that are not allowed to be used as food, such as the head of a fish, are permitted to be kept for life.

original: 'di lta ste mu sta dang ha ri bra dang shu ba dag dang sge'u gsher dad bong nga'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mu sta dang ha ri bra dang shu ba dag dang sge'u gsher dad bong nga'o //
translated: They are mustard, harītakī, śubha, and wheat.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni rtsa ba'i sman yin no //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni rtsa ba'i sman yin no //
translated: These mentioned by name are root medicines.

original: tsan dan dang rtsi byi ka dang thang shing dang skyer pa 'di rnams ni sdong bu'i sman te tshe gcig tu bcang du rung ngo //
analyzed: tsan dan dang rtsi byi ka dang thang shing dang skyer pa 'di rnams ni sdong bu'i sman te tshe gcig tu bcang du rung ngo //
translated: Candana, tsikaka, pine, and buckler-thorn are trunk medicines, suitable to be kept for life.

original: ba sha ka dang ko sha ta gi dang pa to la dang ni ma pa dang 'dab ma bdun pa'i lo ma'o //
analyzed: ba sha ka dang ko sha ta gi dang pa to la dang ni ma pa dang 'dab ma bdun pa'i lo ma'o //
translated: Vāsaka, kośataki, patola, nimba, and the leaves of the seven-leaved nimba.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni lo ma'i sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni lo ma'i sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: These mentioned by name are leaf medicines, and it is permissible for the sick to keep them for life.

original: me tog ni pa sha ka'i dang nim pa'i dang 'da' ka'i dang na ga'i pad ta mo'i snying po dang ngo //
analyzed: me tog ni pa sha ka'i dang nim pa'i dang 'da' ka'i dang na ga'i pad ta mo'i snying po dang ngo //
translated: The flowers are of the vāsaka, nimba, āḍhaka, and nāgakesara.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni me tog gi sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni me tog gi sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcang ngo //
translated: These named ones are flower medicines, which the sick should keep for life.

original: aa ru ra'i dang aam la'i dang byi byi ta ka'i dang na le sham dang pi pi ling ngo //
analyzed: aa ru ra'i dang aam la'i dang byi byi ta ka'i dang na le sham dang pi pi ling ngo //
translated: They are: Haritaki, Amlaki, Vibhitaka, Nala, and Pippali.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni 'bras bu'i sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcang du rung ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni 'bras bu'i sman yin te nad pas tshe gcig tu bcang du rung ngo //
translated: These named ones are fruit medicines, which the sick may keep for life.

original: dza tu dza tu zhes bya ba ni sman spyi'i ming yin te 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnams so //
analyzed: dza tu dza tu zhes bya ba ni sman spyi'i ming yin te 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnams so //
translated: The word jatujatu is a general name for medicines, which will appear below.

original: 'di lta ste shing kun dang sar bra ras dang rgya skyegs dang pra tshil dang sta pa ka ra'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shing kun dang sar bra ras dang rgya skyegs dang pra tshil dang sta pa ka ra'o //
translated: They are: Kushtha, Sarjarasa, Lac, Beeswax, and Tagara.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi sman kyang @271b tshe gcig tu bcang du dbang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi sman kyang @271b tshe gcig tu bcang du dbang ngo //
translated: These named ones are also medicines that may be kept for life.

original: dza tu ni 'di yan chad do //
analyzed: dza tu ni 'di yan chad do //
translated: Jatu is from here on.

original: thal ba'o // 'di yang 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i ming ste 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: thal ba'o // 'di yang 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i ming ste 'og nas 'chad /
translated: It is ash. This is also a general name for those that will appear below, which will be explained below.

original: 'di lta ste til dang pa la sha dang sa rdzi ka dang nas dang gra ma dang ba sha ka dang thal ba'i thal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste til dang pa la sha dang sa rdzi ka dang nas dang gra ma dang ba sha ka dang thal ba'i thal ba'o //
translated: These are sesame, palasha, sarshapa, barley, mustard, vishva, and ash.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi thal ba'ang sman du 'gyur te tshe gcig tu 'chang du gnang thal ba'i sman 'di yan chad do //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi thal ba'ang sman du 'gyur te tshe gcig tu 'chang du gnang thal ba'i sman 'di yan chad do //
translated: The ashes of these mentioned by name are also medicines, permitted to be kept for life. These are the ash medicines.

original: lan tshva'o // 'di 'ang 'og nas 'byung ba'i spyi'i ming ngo //
analyzed: lan tshva'o // 'di 'ang 'og nas 'byung ba'i spyi'i ming ngo //
translated: Salt. This is also a general name for those that will be mentioned below.

original: 'di lta ste sen ta pa dang lan tshva nag po dang byi lda dang / rgya mtsho mching rnams kyi dang ro ma kha'i'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sen ta pa dang lan tshva nag po dang byi lda dang / rgya mtsho mching rnams kyi dang ro ma kha'i'o //
translated: These are sendha, black salt, bida, ocean salt, and romakha.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang tshe gcig gi sman du bcang ngo //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyang tshe gcig gi sman du bcang ngo //
translated: These mentioned by name are also to be kept as medicines for life.

original: 'dus pa'o // 'di 'ang 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i ming /
analyzed: 'dus pa'o // 'di 'ang 'og nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i ming /
translated: Compound. This is also a general name for those that will be mentioned below.

original: 'di lta ste aa pra dang nim pa dang ko sham pa dang shi ri sha dang 'dzam bu dag go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste aa pra dang nim pa dang ko sham pa dang shi ri sha dang 'dzam bu dag go //
translated: These are apra, nimba, koshampa, shirisha, and jambus.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi lo ma'ang sman du rung ste tshe gcig tu bcang du gnang ngo ;
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi lo ma'ang sman du rung ste tshe gcig tu bcang du gnang ngo ;
translated: The leaves of these mentioned by name are also suitable as medicine and are permitted to be kept for one year.

original: / mchog gi bar du sbyin /
analyzed: / mchog gi bar du sbyin /
translated: Give up to the best.

original: sman steng ma rnams kyi lo ma gdus pa'i khu ba nam sros kyi bar du lan dus bkrus kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: sman steng ma rnams kyi lo ma gdus pa'i khu ba nam sros kyi bar du lan dus bkrus kyang rung ngo //
translated: The juice of the boiled leaves of the upper medicines is suitable to be washed with for as long as it is not dark.

original: bkrus te yang ngo //
analyzed: bkrus te yang ngo //
translated: Wash and again.

original: ltag ma'i sman gyis bkrus pa'i 'og tu yang chu tha mal pas kyang bkru /
analyzed: ltag ma'i sman gyis bkrus pa'i 'og tu yang chu tha mal pas kyang bkru /
translated: After washing with the upper medicine, also wash with ordinary water.

original: ma reg par bkru ba gcig go //
analyzed: ma reg par bkru ba gcig go //
translated: One wash without touching.

original: ltag ma ltar 'dus /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar 'dus /
translated: Like the upper.

original: pa'i sman gyis bkru ba nad kha cig la bsrub cing mnye ste sman gyi chus bkrus na'ang phan /
analyzed: pa'i sman gyis bkru ba nad kha cig la bsrub cing mnye ste sman gyi chus bkrus na'ang phan /
translated: Washing with the medicine that is collected like that is beneficial for some illnesses if rubbed and massaged and washed with medicinal water.

original: gcig tu nad pa kha cig la ma mnyes par spyi bo nas blugs na'ang phan /
analyzed: gcig tu nad pa kha cig la ma mnyes par spyi bo nas blugs na'ang phan /
translated: For some patients, it is beneficial if poured on the head without being rubbed.

original: 'di ltar 'dus pa sbyin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus pa sbyin /
translated: Give like this when collected.

original: ltag ma lta bu sman gdus pas rngo dang g-yan pa la sogs pa la phan pa'i phyir rtag par bkru /
analyzed: ltag ma lta bu sman gdus pas rngo dang g-yan pa la sogs pa la phan pa'i phyir rtag par bkru /
translated: Wash with the boiled medicine that is collected like the upper for the benefit of boils, scabies, and so forth.

original: zas thal ba dang blangs na ma blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zas thal ba dang blangs na ma blangs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the food is taken with ashes, it is not not taken.

original: zas ngan pa'i sman ches bya ba yang 'og nas 'chad pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: zas ngan pa'i sman ches bya ba yang 'og nas 'chad pa rnams yin no //
translated: The medicine of bad food is the following.

original: 'di dag nam 'tsho ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nam 'tsho ba'i bar du'o //
translated: They are to be kept as long as one lives.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sman de'ang tshe gcig tu bcang du gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sman de'ang tshe gcig tu bcang du gnang ngo //
translated: The medicine mentioned below is also permitted to be kept for life.

original: der gsungs pa ni yang bshad pa dang bcings pa dang bshangs te nu mas 'tsho ba'i'o //
analyzed: der gsungs pa ni yang bshad pa dang bcings pa dang bshangs te nu mas 'tsho ba'i'o //
translated: What is said there is for the purpose of binding and expelling, and is for those who live on milk.

original: sman du bsrungs pa ni be'u nu ma 'thung ba'i gcin dang lci ba ni dug la phan pa'i phyir bcang du gnang ngo //
analyzed: sman du bsrungs pa ni be'u nu ma 'thung ba'i gcin dang lci ba ni dug la phan pa'i phyir bcang du gnang ngo //
translated: The urine and dung of a calf that is suckling its mother is permitted to be kept as medicine because it is beneficial for poison.

original: 'di ni dug la phan no //
analyzed: 'di ni dug la phan no //
translated: This is beneficial for poison.

original: ltag ma'i be'u'i lci ba dang gcin dug 'thungs ma thag tu de 'thungs na slar skyug pa'i phyir bcang ngo //
analyzed: ltag ma'i be'u'i lci ba dang gcin dug 'thungs ma thag tu de 'thungs na slar skyug pa'i phyir bcang ngo //
translated: The dung and urine of a calf whose mother has just calved is to be kept because if one drinks it immediately after drinking poison, it causes vomiting.

original: @272a * // thal ba dang shing kan tsan dang ka byi ta la dang / aa shva ta dang au dum b'a ra dang n+ya gro dha dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: @272a * // thal ba dang shing kan tsan dang ka byi ta la dang / aa shva ta dang au dum b'a ra dang n+ya gro dha dag kyang ngo //
translated: The ashes of kṛṣṇa, kañcana, kabīta, aśvattha, udumbara, and nyagrodha trees.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi thal ba dag kyang dug la phan pa'i phyir tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi thal ba dag kyang dug la phan pa'i phyir tshe gcig tu bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: Also, it is not a fault to keep the ashes of these mentioned for life in order to cure poison.

original: de la'o // ltag ma'i thal ba rnams dug 'thungs ma thag tu 'thung na 'tsho ba'i phyir bcang ngo //
analyzed: de la'o // ltag ma'i thal ba rnams dug 'thungs ma thag tu 'thung na 'tsho ba'i phyir bcang ngo //
translated: The ashes of the head are to be kept in order to drink them immediately after drinking poison.

original: sa sor bzhi'i 'og gi sa la dge'o //
analyzed: sa sor bzhi'i 'og gi sa la dge'o //
translated: The earth four fingerbreadths below is wholesome.

original: bshang gci la sogs pas ma 'babs pa'i sa gtsang ma zab tu sor bzhi brkos pa'i 'og man chad kyis dug la phan pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bshang gci la sogs pas ma 'babs pa'i sa gtsang ma zab tu sor bzhi brkos pa'i 'og man chad kyis dug la phan pa'i phyir bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to keep the clean earth that is not contaminated by feces, urine, and so on, four fingerbreadths deep, because it is beneficial for poison.

original: 'di dad pa'i dge bsnyen las blangs /
analyzed: 'di dad pa'i dge bsnyen las blangs /
translated: This is to be taken from a lay practitioner with faith.

original: mdo ltag ma'i be'u'i bshang gci dang sa'i sman ni dad pa'i dge bsnyen phyir mi nur ba las blang /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i be'u'i bshang gci dang sa'i sman ni dad pa'i dge bsnyen phyir mi nur ba las blang /
translated: The medicine of the calf of the head, the feces and urine, and the earth are to be taken from a lay practitioner with faith who is irreversible.

original: len du gzhug / byin len bya /
analyzed: len du gzhug / byin len bya /
translated: Make them take it, and do the giving and taking.

original: ltag ma'i sman dad pa'i dge bsnyen las byin len byas te blang /
analyzed: ltag ma'i sman dad pa'i dge bsnyen las byin len byas te blang /
translated: The medicine of the head is to be taken after doing the giving and taking from a lay practitioner with faith.

original: sha rlon pa'i sman kyang ngo //
analyzed: sha rlon pa'i sman kyang ngo //
translated: The medicine of raw flesh is also like that.

original: dge slong na na sman du dad pa'i dge bsnyen gyis 'bul na len du dbang ngo ;
analyzed: dge slong na na sman du dad pa'i dge bsnyen gyis 'bul na len du dbang ngo ;
translated: If a monk is ill, he may accept medicine offered by a lay practitioner of faith.

original: / dad pa'i dge bsnyen med na dge slong na ba shas mi gsor mi rung na ma dad pa las kyang blang /
analyzed: / dad pa'i dge bsnyen med na dge slong na ba shas mi gsor mi rung na ma dad pa las kyang blang /
translated: If there is no lay practitioner of faith, and the monk’s illness is such that he cannot be cured without meat, he may accept it even from someone who is not a lay practitioner of faith.

original: sha 'tshong dag kyang thams cad blang /
analyzed: sha 'tshong dag kyang thams cad blang /
translated: He may accept meat from all but those who have taken a vow not to eat meat.

original: dge slong nad pa sha'i sman gyis mi gsor mi rung par gyur na dge bsnyen dad pa sha 'tshong la nyor btang ste nyos la zos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa sha'i sman gyis mi gsor mi rung par gyur na dge bsnyen dad pa sha 'tshong la nyor btang ste nyos la zos kyang nyes med /
translated: If a monk is ill and cannot be cured without meat, he may have a lay practitioner of faith who is not a butcher buy meat for him. If he eats it, he is not at fault.

original: 'di dgos so ;
analyzed: 'di dgos so ;
translated: This is necessary.

original: / bdag na ba'i sman du sha dgos na ltag ma ltar nyo ba'ang mi rigs pa ma yin te rigs so //
analyzed: / bdag na ba'i sman du sha dgos na ltag ma ltar nyo ba'ang mi rigs pa ma yin te rigs so //
translated: If I need meat as medicine for my illness, it is not wrong to buy it from a butcher. It is right.

original: de ste dus ma yin par mkho na ba lang rgan pa'i bshang ba las nas kyis bya ba'i sman de'i phyir bya ste gzhan mi bza'/
analyzed: de ste dus ma yin par mkho na ba lang rgan pa'i bshang ba las nas kyis bya ba'i sman de'i phyir bya ste gzhan mi bza'/
translated: If it is needed at an inappropriate time, he should make medicine from the grain of an old cow’s dung and eat that, not anything else.

original: glang rgan nas zar bcug ste ma choms pa lci ba'i nang nas btus te phyir btab la nad pa phyi dro zan nam thug ma byas te bza' zhing btung du gnang ngo //
analyzed: glang rgan nas zar bcug ste ma choms pa lci ba'i nang nas btus te phyir btab la nad pa phyi dro zan nam thug ma byas te bza' zhing btung du gnang ngo //
translated: The patient should be made to drink the juice of old bull’s urine, and if he cannot drink it, he should be given other food and drink.

original: 'di lta bu'i sman nad pas bza' mi nus na zan dang thug pa gzhan 'thung du 'ang dbang ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sman nad pas bza' mi nus na zan dang thug pa gzhan 'thung du 'ang dbang ngo //
translated: If the patient cannot eat this medicine, he may eat other food and drink.

original: de za nus na gzhan mi bza'/
analyzed: de za nus na gzhan mi bza'/
translated: If he can eat it, he should not eat anything else.

original: de ste skyon snam bur btsags te gzhan du ma yin /
analyzed: de ste skyon snam bur btsags te gzhan du ma yin /
translated: If he cannot drink it, it should be strained through a cloth, not through anything else.

original: ba glang gi lto nas byung ba'i nas de brngos de btags la skyo mar byas nas snam bus btsags pa'i khu ba nad pa la blud /
analyzed: ba glang gi lto nas byung ba'i nas de brngos de btags la skyo mar byas nas snam bus btsags pa'i khu ba nad pa la blud /
translated: The rice that comes from a bull’s stomach should be cooked, ground, and made into a soup. The liquid strained through a cloth should be given to the patient to drink.

original: des ma ngoms sam ma 'drangs na skyo ma nyid kyang blud /
analyzed: des ma ngoms sam ma 'drangs na skyo ma nyid kyang blud /
translated: If he is not satisfied or not nourished by that, he may also drink the soup itself.

original: de ste sha'i sman ko kas bshangs pa'i gzhan du ma yin /
analyzed: de ste sha'i sman ko kas bshangs pa'i gzhan du ma yin /
translated: If he cannot drink the meat soup, it should be strained through a cloth, not through anything else.

original: nad pa'i sman du sman pas sha btsos pa'i khu ba 'thungs na phan par @272b bsgo na phyi dro sha khu 'thungs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: nad pa'i sman du sman pas sha btsos pa'i khu ba 'thungs na phan par @272b bsgo na phyi dro sha khu 'thungs kyang nyes med /
translated: If the doctor prescribes that the patient should drink the soup of cooked meat as medicine, it is not a fault to drink meat soup in the evening.

original: sha khus snying ma tshim na sha gzhan zos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: sha khus snying ma tshim na sha gzhan zos kyang nyes med /
translated: If the broth does not satisfy your hunger, it is not wrong to eat the meat.
